Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: jlabate216
Reviews.Content: def a very business oriented hotel, but it still good for anyone heading on vacation to san fran. the hotel is in a business district, but also not very far from any attractions. the rooms are beautiful, well kept, and the staff is amazing. we stayed here for part of our honeymoon, and they upgraded us to one of the suites! great hotel and def recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Love this hotel”
Reviews.Author: Milo3056
Reviews.Content: I was pleasantly suprised by my beautiful room upon arrival. Very spacious and furnished with high standards.The staff go out of their way to please and make you fell very welcome. I love having breakfast in the restarant every monring during my stay...as it filled me up until dinner. It's close to all great sigh seeing locations and is a step away from the famous cable car. I would definately stay here again and highly recommend it to others.

Reviews.Title: “Hard to improve on perfection!”
Reviews.Author: Thomas F
Reviews.Content: My partner and I throughly enjoyed our recent stay at the OMNI Hotel San Francisco. The service, ambiance, staff consideration, and feeling of welcomeness, certainly enhanced our six day visit. This is our second OMNI, we stay at the OMNI Royal Orleans when ever in New Orleans and have never been disappointed there either. It's hard to go home after spending a week at an OMNI! Thanks to all for a great week!

Reviews.Title: “At the Omni San Francisco, incredible is normal”
Reviews.Author: William P
Reviews.Content: We've been staying at the Omni San Francisco every time we have visited that beautiful city, beginning right after it opened. It is incredible, and never disappoints. The rooms are beautifully furnished and decorated, and have just been completely redone. But the staff,and the services they provide, are what makes a stay at the Omni truly incredible. Whether it is the manager, the desk clerk, the bellman, the maid, the room service waiter, or the concierge -- all of them are wonderfully friendly and helpful. They remember and recognize you, typically greet you by (last) name, and offer to assist. And they are incredibly informative as well. For example, during our most recent trip we consulted the concierge about new nearby restaurants (we are quite familiar with the older ones), and he not only displayed incredibly detailed knowledge of the nearby culinary delights but, since I was in no hurry and was interested, also gave me some wonderful background information about each establishment he mentioned, its owner, and its principal chef. My parting thought was simple: "Wow, this guy really knows his stuff!" Finally, I should mention that the Omni's location, at California and Montgomery Streets, is close to financial firms (on Montgomery), not far from Union Square (for shopping), just a block from a cluster of outdoor restaurants at Belden Place, about thirty feet from one of the main streetcar stops, and just a brief taxi ride from literally hundreds of wonderful restaurants (in addition to having one on its premises). We've stayed elsewhere when the Omni has been fully booked, but have never found a rival hotel that can match the Omni.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome as Usual”
Reviews.Author: Brian L
Reviews.Content: Checked into the Omni this weekend for a quick business meeting and brought my wife along. At first impression she absolutely loved it. The warm tea to cut through the cold SF weather was perfect service. The ambiance, the cleanliness, all up to usual Omni standards. You just cannot ask for much more than what the Omni provides. SF has a lot of hotel options for those in town for a quick getaway or for work purposes, but I would not hesitate to stay at the Omni!

Reviews.Title: “Superb Hotel and Wonderful Staff. Very Highly Recommended.”
Reviews.Author: ST1951
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the San Francisco Omni from 17th to 24th March. This was my second stay at the hotel and I am pleased to say that I found it as excellent as my first visit. Firstly, I have to thank Sarah Crown for her assistance in dealing with my room request prior to my stay. She gave first class customer service and it was an absolute pleasure to deal with her. Secondly I would like to comment on a couple of reviews below which I believe are unfair to the housekeeping staff. My experience at the Omni is that the same high standard of cleaning is carried out irrespective of whether a tip is left or not and housekeepers are certainly not noisy. I stayed for five nights on my first visit and seven nights this time. On each occasion I cannot fault anything about the way in which my room was maintained. As far as I am concerned the housekeepers are friendly, hard working and meticulous. I certainly did not hear any door slamming by them and I was in and out of my room at various times during the day. The only door slamming I heard was in the early hours of the morning by guests returning to their rooms. I very much doubt that the housekeepers are cleaning rooms at 02.47! As an aside, I fail to understand why some guests have no consideration for other people and seem incapable of shutting a door quietly rather than attempting to remove it from itâ€™s hinges. Perhaps they live in door less houses and have not fully grasped the concept of how a door should be closed! OK, having gotten that off my chest, I will get to the review. Although I have previously reviewed this hotel it is a real pleasure to spend time preparing another review as the standard of the hotel warrants it. The location is great. An easy transfer from SFO by BART and short (flat) walk up Montgomery. It is only a short distance to Union Sq and an equally short distance to North Beach and my favourite bars! An excellent welcome and speedy check in from staff who really seem to want to go that extra mile to be helpful. All the staff I encountered were, in fact, first class in all respects. Rooms are a good size and, as aforementioned, well maintained. Beds are comfortable and there is a good selection of pillows. The Wi Fi signal is strong and I suggest joining the (free) Select Guest programme to avoid a $9.95 daily charge. Other benefits of the programme include complimentary water, beverages and turn down service. It is well worth spending the short time it takes to join. There are tea and coffee making facilities in the room and also a mini bar. The large comfortable chair and footrest were particularly beneficial after a day negotiating the hills of San Francisco. I canâ€™t comment on the bar or Bobâ€™s Steak and Chop House as I havenâ€™t used either. To be quite honest there are so many great places to eat and drink in this wonderful city it seems a shame not to get out and enjoy them. I have seriously lost count of the number of hotels I have stayed in over the years both for business and leisure. I have a lot of experience of the good and the bad and, take it from me, I am not easily pleased especially as regards noise and cleanliness. The San Francisco Omni is, without any shadow of doubt, one of the best hotels I have stayed in and ticks all the boxes. My next stay is already booked for September and I fully intend to return in 2013. My advice is to give it a try. I am certain you will not be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: ZodiacHalifax
Reviews.Content: This hotel is very well located and we could walk to all the main sights. Fisherman's Wharf is about a half hour walk, Chinatown is right next door, Union Square about 15 minutes, the Ferry terminal 10 minutes and market Street shops about 20 minutes. The hotel is quiet, the rooms are very comfortable and the service is excellent. The restaurant and bar are not cheap but we enjoyed a good breakfast and friendly service in the bar. Would definitely recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Good location”
Reviews.Author: Michael L
Reviews.Content: For the price this hotel is a good value. The rooms definitely need remodeling.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location!”
Reviews.Author: docbroker
Reviews.Content: This is a great location! We were able to walk to Union Square, Ferry Terminal Building, shopping malls and more. The cable car is right out front as well!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, beautiful (yet chilly) city”
Reviews.Author: Astrobeemer
Reviews.Content: The hotel was amazing. Check in was a breeze, although we were checked in online and were supposed to have the keys on the board waiting for us, but they were not, but that was not a big problem as the check in at the desk was fast. Vallet was decently fast every time we called the car. The staff in general was exeptionally friendly and smiling. The room was clean and sifficiently spacious for the two of us.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel for families”
Reviews.Author: TN_Traveller_12
Reviews.Content: Our family recently spent a week in SF and stayed at the Omni. We had the Kids Fantasy Suite, which is a pair of adjoining rooms. The adult room is a pretty typical hotel room. The kids' room is decorated with Pottery Barn Kids items and looks like the catalog. There are bunkbeds, beanbag chairs, lots of stuffed animals, and milk/cookies delivered every night. The hotel was very comfortable. We found the concierge and front desk staff to be extremely helpful in arranging things or making suggestions. The hotel's location, between the Financial District and Chinatown, was very convenient. We could easily walk to the Ferry Building along the Embarcadero. The California line cable car goes right in front of the hotel. There are many, many restaurants within easy walking distance. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice”
Reviews.Author: Susan O
Reviews.Content: The OMNI is always clean, comfortable, and the staff provides great service. Great location. The restaurant on site is good but there are some outstanding ones in walking distance. The rooms are quiet at night, many other hotels in SF have a lot of street noise at night.

Reviews.Title: “Quality and convenient”
Reviews.Author: Emurray910
Reviews.Content: The Omni is right across the street from 555 California Avenue, which is one of the tallest buildings in SF. It is extremely convenient to the cable cars and you can purchase Muni passes at the hotel. There are several quality restaurants nearby and it is a short cable car ride away from the shopping district at Union Square. The rooms are spacious and clean with decent views. Hotel staff is friendly and knowledgable of the city.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding service”
Reviews.Author: Jeff T
Reviews.Content: The property was very nicely furnished and spotless, but you can find that at any of a number of fine hotels in the area. What makes the Omni worth coming back to is the staff - every one of them was fantastic and went out of their way to make our stay enjoyable.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing staff”
Reviews.Author: Hollymount97
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Omni just before Christmas and really enjoyed the experience. The rooms are nice, decor not to my taste but ticked all the boxes. The location was great although the immediate area was a bit dead at the weekend. One complaint was that you had to pay for WiFi, annoying when you get it free in most budget hotels! Luckily there are lots of coffee shops nearby to get it for free. By far the best bit of the stay was the staff - so friendly & attentive. One guy in particular stood out as an amazing ambassador for the hotel, Taen, who worked at the front desk/gave out champagne/escorted us to our room/acted as a tour guide.

Reviews.Title: “Clean and Comfy.”
Reviews.Author: Allan S
Reviews.Content: good rooms and clean and comfy. Good services and great restaurant.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel in good location”
Reviews.Author: sleepy38
Reviews.Content: Very pleasant hotel in good downtown location. Really nice old building, excellent staff and service (especially John who checked us in). Up to date and clean rooms and very good value compared to other hotels of the same class in the city. Would definitely go back.

Reviews.Title: “Omni has style and grace”
Reviews.Author: DonTomas333
Reviews.Content: This hotel is located in San Franciscos financial district with China town and the Italian North side in its backyard. The service is first class and the rooms are large, clean and comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Everything was great!”
Reviews.Author: mobie0309
Reviews.Content: We will be back. Fantastic room (they upgraded us to a huge suite) and service. Easy walk to Chinatown, Union Square and the Embarcadero. Nice touch with the Nespresso machines in the room.

Reviews.Title: “So noisy”
Reviews.Author: djh2601
Reviews.Content: I will start at the beginning I had booked a limo through the hotel i thought it would be a nice way to arrive at the hotel maybe not the car was over 20 minutes late it would have been much quicker not to mention cheaper to have got a cab I and my PA call the hotel who said it was 5 minutes away it took another call to figure out that the limo was at the limo stand even after telling the hotel that I was waiting at the international arrivals entrance. I located the driver who made no attempt to help me over the roads with my luggage and then was very sullen all the way into the city. Upon arriving I went to the front desk where a lady clerk had just finished with a guest and then started tapping on the computer she said one minute and then with out looking up said my collegue can help you. I checked in with no problems and had been upgraded ( all this meant was a higher floor ) the room that they gave me was in a quiet location at the rear of the hotel and I must say that there was no noise at all from outside. The same cannot be said for the floor staff who went in and out slamming doors the maids were the worst the noise started at around 7.00am and literally went on all day long, it is just laziness not to close a door quietly especially early in the morning. The majority of the staff are very very pleasant and efficient apart from two front desk clerks the first I have already mentioned the second was when I asked for a slightly later check out and was told I can tell you on the morning that you leave well that's no help when packing is it after a few more words he eventually agreed why not have just said yes no problem the good points are the location and on the whole the service.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay at the Omni!”
Reviews.Author: jeanniedc
Reviews.Content: My husband and I recently stayed at the Omni for 4 nights. I was at a business meeting a few blocks from the hotel, and he was sightseeing. We both felt this was an excellent hotel. The service was very efficient from a very friendly staff who went out of their way to please. The room was well designed with plenty of desk and drawer space, and a very comfortable bed. (only complaint was suboptimal shower pressure; not a big problem). My husband used the fitness center several times and said it was great. Being a member of the Omni rewards program was a big benefit, as others have described. Getting coffee and o.j. brought to the room in the morning with the NY Times was very nice! (as was free wifi). A comment about location. Yes, this hotel is not right at Union Square or near Fisherman's Wharf. But we found it very easy to walk everywhere from the hotel: close to the Ferry building at the Embarcadero, close to the Yerba Buena Gardens area/MOMA, very close to Chinatown. We walked to North Beach for dinner in 10 minutes. I agree that the area does get quiet on the weekend, but there are plenty of good restaurants nearby for dinner. (Tadich Grill, Boulevard, etc.) We would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great hotel”
Reviews.Author: Jakob V
Reviews.Content: Nice location, nice staff and a very nice room. I even got a really good deal on a 5 night stay, so I have no complaints what so ever.

Reviews.Title: “A true treat to stay here... great service!!”
Reviews.Author: CentralCoastTravelr
Reviews.Content: This was our second stay at the Omni, and it did not disappoint. When it comes to customer service, the entire staff is phenomenal. We received consistently good service from valet, bell service, front desk and housekeeping... everyone worked together seamlessly to make our stay a pleasant one. I arrived a bit stressed after a challenging drive, but the valet and bell staff quickly brought me back down to a peaceful calm with a kind welcome, prompt assistance with our bags and huge smiles. Our check-in was warm, quick and welcoming, and the desk agent offered great suggestions for dinner ideas without us even asking. A few moments later, our bellman welcomed us to our room where there were cold milks and cookies already waiting for our kids (that was SUPER impressive given we were not in the check-in area very long and gave no warning of arrival prior to walking in the door). Our room was clean and the furniture and carpeting was in great shape. We found the beds to be very comfortable (although because we are four to a room, queen beds would be very nice to have instead of just doubles). The second day of our stay we made a big oops and left the privacy sign on the door as we went out to explore the City. When we returned around dinner time, our room hadn't been cleaned, but we had a message from housekeeping explaining why. We requested our room be "freshened up" while we went out to dinner if possible, and it was cleaned and ready to go when we returned about an hour and a half later. We have stayed in the City many times before, and we love to walk and use public transportation, so we don't mind that much of the Financial District is quiet and closed on the weekends, but if you want something very close by, you should be aware that it can be a challenge. We love to walk and take public transportation -- we find that both are very easy to do from this location, even with kids. Chinatown is literally three blocks away, and Union Square and the Embarcadero are also quite easy to walk to. The cable car picks up right out front the hotel, and the front desk often has muni tickets for sale, which is super nice!!! We really do love the Omni and will be back again!

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant hotel, but location leaves a lot to be desired for tourists”
Reviews.Author: yaneh
Reviews.Content: The staff at this hotel are very pleasant, and the rooms, while not particularly exciting, are comfortable enough and quite clean. However, the mattress could have been replaced, or at least flipped, a few months ago, and the location is not ideal for sightseeing. It's true that the cable car right outside, and Chinatown is a 5-minute walk away, but the rest of the tourist destinations are a bit of a trek, and on nights and weekends, the immediate surroundings feel abandoned, with few businesses open. If stepping out into the hustle and bustle is your thing, there are better located properties, including the W in the SOMA area and the hotels around Union Square. This is a very good location for a business traveler.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding Service”
Reviews.Author: ribbaz
Reviews.Content: Highly recommend this hotel. Great location; even though it was near the financial district it was still close to everything. The cable car is literally right out the front door. It was fabulous - like an 'E" ride at Disneyland (okay so I'm giving away my age). The service/staff were excellent - always polite and helpful. And the rooms very nice, plus the beds had 'fitted sheets'. Your bed doesn't come apart when you get in it. You are right below Nob Hill - took the cable car up and stopped at the Mark Hopkins and the Fairmont. Two outstanding properties in SF; but we liked the Omni better - beautiful lobby and comfortable; homey even.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Value & Service”
Reviews.Author: Remgirl1
Reviews.Content: We booked the Omni via a conference group rate for $175/night, two nights, Sat-Mon. While booking, there was an option to enroll in the hotel loyalty program, which I did because it was free. Laura, at the front desk checked us in and was wonderful. We anticipated not being able to check in because it was around noon, and leaving our luggage for a few hours. However, Laura explained to us that by joining the loyalty program we were awarded with early check-in, free in-room wi-fi, complementary pressing and shoe shine, and breakfast beverage service for each of us every morning of our stay. She tipped us off that if we order one coffee, there was enough in the pot for three cups, so it would be wise to order one coffee, and one juice to share. Made perfect sense to me and was probably not something I would think of myself, so that was nice of her (its the little things like that, that make me happy). We were given room #1108, which is a standard King. The hotel is in the financial district, so our room looked out immediately to other office buildings. Good location if you want a better chance of less night life street noise. I was a bit disappointed that the windows were not well sound-proofed, and what little street noise there was, we heard clearly. Unfortunately, the same could be said of the walls. For both nights of our stay we were sandwiched between guests with small children. We could tell exactly when the guests were in their rooms with the children playing, crying, whining, and the age-old argument between a wife complaining to her husband about not being able to shower because she had to watch the kids. The bed was very comfortable, even when we were shaken awake by the small earthquake that Monday morning :) The wi-fi was actually decent!!! Both my husband and I were able to go wi-fi only at the same time, a rarity it seems at hotels. Although I don't use it, I liked that the hotel provided spray starch for ironing. Good business hotel touch. The bathroom was spacious for a standard size room, the products were customized via Sysco but still nice, the shower pressure good, and well lit. I always appreciate it when hotels provide robes. The cons: Few. Aside from the "thin" walls and windows, if you stay on the weekend, all the really close-by breakfast food places are closed. I'm not a big breakfast eater, but I do like to be able to quickly run out, grab a pastry, and then come back to the hotel to get ready for the day. On weekdays this isn't a problem because there are many cafes that cater to the business crowd. La Boulange is right across the street and is probably the best option. Overall, a very pleasant experience and I would recommend the Omni easily for the business traveler. I was immediately impressed by the loyalty program providing exceptional perks on only the first stay. A free pot of coffee is definitely a cheap way for a hotel to make a good impression.

Reviews.Title: “My favourite SF hotel so far”
Reviews.Author: errant
Reviews.Content: I've stayed in many hotels in San Francisco and so far I think this is my favourite. At first I was a little leery of staying in the financial district but when I realized how close I was to everything (my preferred mode of transportation is walking), I was thrilled. It's easy to walk to the Ferry Building (Farmers' Market on Saturday), to Chinatown & North Beach and even to SOMA. Our room was large and the king size bed was very comfortable with great pilllows and sheets. Two robes were provided (hotels that only provide one drive me nuts). There is nothing trendy about the decor but it's inobtrusive and very comfortable. The bathroom was very large with a separate and spacious shower and nice amenities. Maid service was sympathetic and inobtrusive. The concierge and front desk staff were very helpful, with the exception of one person (who helped lose the fifth star in this review). All in a all, a great stay and I can easily recommend this hotel. Why did it lose a star? The gentleman who checked us in was okay at first but when he found out where we were from, not that pleasant. I guess he didn't like a city in our country. Wow. That was WEIRD, dude! When we asked him for restaurant recommendations for lunch (we had just flown in and were tired) he just vaguely waved his arms and said "there are hundreds around here, take your pick". Unhelpful. However, subsequent front desk staff were lovely. Low battery in our in-room safe. Lodgenet was terrible quality. I don't like paying for Wi-Fi. I find it cheap on the hotel's part. Overall however, I like the hotel and I'll stay there again for sure.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Experience!”
Reviews.Author: dc4Vermont
Reviews.Content: Omni Hotels are always my favorite hotels - and the San Francisco Omni in Union Square area did not disappoint! From check in to check out, it was an outstanding experience. A special thank you to Laura, at the front desk, who made our stay extra special. She greeted us at arrival with a warm and welcoming smile. When she heard we were celebrating our 30th anniversary, she sent a wonderful treat to our room to help us celebrate. In fact, every staff person we came in contact with had a smile while asking if we were enjoying our stay. The room was classic, spotlessly clean, with extremely comfortable beds. The Omni's Select Guest membership provides free beverages at a time of your choosing in the mornings - would definitely recommend joining for this benefit.

Reviews.Title: “Great location. Very nice hotel.”
Reviews.Author: samjust08
Reviews.Content: I stay here every year on business trips and love it. The service is great, and the rooms are very nice. The cable car runs right outside the front door and Chinatown is just 2 blocks up the hill. One of my favorites in SF.

Reviews.Title: “Solid business hotel”
Reviews.Author: Intl_trvler
Reviews.Content: Stayed for two nights. Very good location (near financial district, but also walking distance to great shopping -- speaking of which, Westfields shopping centre on Market has the most plentiful shops, plus the Embarcadero has good shopping as well). My room on the 7th floor appeared to have been recently renovated. Was a little loud, though, with the window open as the cable car was right outside. I thought the front desk staff were great. My air conditioning wouldn't work and as a result I had a poor night's sleep, but I should have let the hotel know and asked them to fix it.

Reviews.Title: “Great location!”
Reviews.Author: PippaJA
Reviews.Content: We've been to San Francisco before and this was our first stay at the Omni. The location is great, loads of things to do and see within walking distance. The hotel service is exceptional and the rooms clean and nicely furnished. We'll definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Just another 4 star hotel”
Reviews.Author: andersonclwj
Reviews.Content: The level of service was typical for a 3.5 and 4 star hotel. The rooms were a little smaller than expected but they were nice. They do have free internet if you sign up for their loyalty program also included in the loyalty program is turn down service and a couple free waters (the waters are normally $9 each). Valet parking is half as much on Fridays and Saturdays, also nice. They have a courtesy luxury car service. But it only operates around breakfast and dinner times and within a 5 block radius on a first come first serves basis so I was unable to take advantage of it.

Reviews.Title: “Stayed for the weekend, would stay again”
Reviews.Author: Melina619
Reviews.Content: Staff extremely helpful and positive. The hotel was beautiful, especially the lobby. Didn't spend much time at the hotel but would go there again, the convenient location in the Financial District is great! Just a few blocks away from Montgomery BART station. Hardly slept at all because the neighbors were having a porn fest or something, but I guess that isn't really the hotels fault. :/

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel.....great location”
Reviews.Author: TerriK55
Reviews.Content: My husband and I only stayed here for one night, but would have been very happy to stay longer. We were pleased from the minute we pulled up in front of the hotel until the moment we left. We were greeted by a very helpful and eager doorman who immediately helped us with our luggage. The lobby is large and elegant with a magnificent floral arrangement sitting on a table front and center. The staff was very gracious and helpful. The rooms are a little larger than average and the bathroom was marble with nice amenities. The cable car stops right in front of the hotel to take you to all the main attractions. The hotel is also within a short walk to Chinatown, although I believe its location would be considered in the financial district. We did not eat at the hotel restaurant, but it was quite crowded, so I'm guessing that it must be good. When we checked out, we asked the doorman to call us a cab, but instead, he escorted us to a Lincoln town car that was sitting right in front of the hotel, which took us to the airport for the same cost as a cab, but a much more comfortable ride. We would absolutely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Carmelcpl
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Omni Hotel on a Saturday evening in February. Valet parking was efficient, and check-in was quite efficient as well. The room we got was nicely appointed, and very comfortable. While we did not have a view of anything other than into the windows of office buildings behind the hotel, it was definitely quiet, with no hint of street noise. We had a formal event to attend, and when we indicated that we wanted to get a cab, the doorman put us in the hotel limo. That was very nice, although the driver was not familiar enough with other hotels in the city, and had to ask directions twice for a 4-block ride from the OMNI to the Ritz Carlton. He was mortified, and very apologetic, and we basically giggled about it after we got to the Ritz. We did not use any of the restaurants, but did have a cocktail at the bar. Drinks had the expected hefty price tag, but the bartender provided hefty pours for the price. Check-out was smooth, and the staff very efficient. Valet parking advertises a 15-minute lead time for retreival of the car, but ours was up in about 5 minutes. Valet parking on the weekend was only $27, which is a decent deal in downtown San Francisco. We were very pleased with the OMNI, and would definitely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Quick Weekend to SF...Omni Takes Care of Us”
Reviews.Author: TravelGal2Anywhere
Reviews.Content: I can always count on the Omni for excellent service, cleanliness, comfort, and excellent value. We've stayed at the Omni in downtown San Diego, downtown Los Angeles, downtown Chicago and now downtown San Francisco. They know hospitality. Compared to other places I've stayed, the Omni is consistent. Of all the hotels in a city, they're often in the top ten if not the top five. Rates are usually better than less favorably reviewed hotels. Hands down, I recommend the Omni for a well-rested stay. They will not disappoint.

Reviews.Title: “upscale”
Reviews.Author: ITA_And_RE_a
Reviews.Content: Classically appointed hotel within walking distance of union square. Only a few blocks from the Saturday farmer's market in the Ferry Building - a must do weekend experience. The room was beautifully furnished with a super comfortable mattress

Reviews.Title: “great hotel and incredible service”
Reviews.Author: Elaine T
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Omni Hotel to celebrate our wedding anniversary and to see the Chinese New Year's Parade. The location was perfect for walking to Chinatown and North Beach. Our room was spacious and so comfortable; very quiet too. We were pleasantly surprised when the staff delivered 6 chocolate covered strawberries and a large bottle of champagne to help us celebrate our anniversary. Everyone was so helpful and friendly. I would highly recommend a visit to the Omni.

Reviews.Title: “Class act in the Financial Center”
Reviews.Author: zarkmud
Reviews.Content: I found this hotel via Hotwire.com. It was discounted as a 4-Star and if anything, it was a five star. It was impossible to find any dirt...ANYWHERE and I looked. The rooms were perfect, the staff helpful and to be so close to the financial center, B O A Building, Transamerica Building and so many great restaurants not to mention the nearby cable cars...well, try it. Remember, San Franciscans try to ignore the fare collector on the cable cars-locals believe tourists should pay. Sometimes they get away with it but it is fun to watch them hide from the cable car operator.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, location and value”
Reviews.Author: Joseph M
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Omni San Francisco the weekend of February 11-13. It lived up to the high Tripadvisor ratings that it has received. It's an easy (flat, not hilly) four-block walk from BART'S Montgomery Street stop. The hotel is in a converted bank building that has been retrofitted nicely. The reception-lobby areas fit the vintage of the building which appears to have been built in the 1920s. Bob's Steak House is the hotel's restaurant and while that means that food there is pricey, it's high quality. Bob's also serves somewhat less expensive fare in the Bar which is a nice space. The rooms are nicely furnished in an elegant style that fits the hotel's architectural heritage. The bathrooms are marble and elegant and very well lighted. The only drawback we found was that our low-floor room fronting on California Street (which was nice for viewing the cable cars and the Bank of America Plaza across the street) was noisier than we would have expected a retrofitted room to have been. More sound insulation should have been included in the building's rehabilitation. If you want a quieter experience, you should probably request a higher floor or one off California Street. We are glad we joined Omni's Select Guest program because it provided some welcome amenities.

Reviews.Title: “Big Rooms, Great Staff, Good Location for Car”
Reviews.Author: Meenanall
Reviews.Content: Stayed here on the spur of the moment due to a funeral. Huge rooms and bath. Great welcome, great valet (taught me how to turn off and start new Volvo S80!). Great access to restaurants across street, wharf and minutes from Union Square. Their breakfast was one of the best I have ever eaten. Would stay again for leisure.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic service”
Reviews.Author: 321Trainfan321
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in the financial district, not in one of the most trendy or touristy spots but that makes it very liveable especially on the weekends. The cable car is right outside the door (worth the wait), the farmer's market 5 minutes away is a must-see and then a historic streetcar will take you to Fishermans' Wharf (if you must go). The hotel is very clean and in excellent condition, we were given a nice upgrade without asking. It's the staff that makes it such a great spot, from the door staff to the front desk and housekeeping, it seems they couldn't do enough for us. Our concierge Juan deserves an extra mention, he was very helpful to first time visitors. Don't underestimate the value of helpful people.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect dependablility”
Reviews.Author: Martha Jane S
Reviews.Content: The Omni is our choice when we visit our son in San Francisco. The higher floors are so wonderfully quite. The location is perfect for us on lower California Street. The Omni has never been a disappointment.

Reviews.Title: “No complaints”
Reviews.Author: G0happy
Reviews.Content: Great customer service and friendly staff. Love the hot apple cider. Very enjoyable stay.

Reviews.Title: “large hotel with personal service”
Reviews.Author: Eric451
Reviews.Content: Living in the Bay Area it is fun to spend the occasional weekend in the City. Checking tripadvisor I first learned of the existence of the Omni Hotel and noted the positive write-ups. Just back from a three-day stay, I am impressed in the way this hotel is run and must give kudos to the hotel manager. It is smaller than the usual four-star chain hotel and the experience of staying there is much more personal. The hotel is very well run as all the staff greets you with a smile and a pleasantry - from the door man, to the front desk, to the security guard and to the housekeeping. The employees seemed to enjoy working at the hotel and with each other and appeared to be pleased to see me there as a guest. This was very different than the anonymous feeling one gets at the larger hotels. The hotel itself is what one would expect for this category of a hotel - rooms were larger than normal size, smartly decorated with a flat-screen television. If you are a tourist the negative of the hotel is its location, as it is in the financial area, where very few restaurants and shops are open other than during the weekdays and also there are few amenities in the hotel for families with young children. Although the location in the financial area has its advantage, with the absence of what seems to be the ever-present panhandlers in the Union Square area.

Reviews.Title: “Omni staff made our stay even more memorable”
Reviews.Author: vacationmom103
Reviews.Content: We have many memories from our 4-day getaway to Frisco, yes, the city is everything you expect and more, that is for another review. However, this one is for the hotel, which was a glorious surprise. We booked an expedia travel deal, hotel/flight and car - all in one. The hotel staff made our stay a very special one; they greeted us by name upon each door opening. Let us start by saying this property is beautiful, the wood paneling, crystal chandeliers and grandeur on a scale that you would expect from bank building in the twenties. We booked a suite, which was quite spacious and very well appointed. I always pay extra for the upgrade, it's your vacation, why go cheap?The walk-in closet was room in itself. Our bathroom was designed for luxury, with marble from floor to its high 1920's + height ceiling. Our room was immaculate, extremely clean, with a kind welcome note upon entry. Proximity to Chinatown is just two or three blocks. The waterfront restaurants (the non-touristy high-end, interesting and delicious ones) are a short 3 to 4 block walk. Being a hotel-snob, with very high expectations, this hotel is on my A list for Frisco. We will return, and next time, with our adult children.

Reviews.Title: “Great family fun”
Reviews.Author: EskimoAbroad
Reviews.Content: While this hotel is in the financial district, don't let that stop you from bringing your family here... For us, it was a great central location to try a lot of what San Francisco has to offer! We had the kids sensory suite on the 10th floor and thought it was so incredible! My kids could not have been happier. They loved all of the stuffed animals, toys and books, and we loved the privacy of getting our own adjoining room! Easy access to the California street cable car, walking distance to China Town and Market Street, to catch other public transportation and away from the hustle and bustle of the wharf... A little pricey, but it was worth it! The Select guest beverage service and free wifi were great too! Everyone was very helpful at the front desk as well as housekeeping and room service...

Reviews.Title: “Always a worthwhile stay...”
Reviews.Author: CARLSBADtraveler59
Reviews.Content: Of many hotels that I've stayed at in SF over the years, I can highly recommend the Omni. It's always at the top of my list, along with most of the Kimpton properties. The best thing was the deal that I snagged thru Omni's website for $119/night for a premier King...can't beat that. The room, the staff, and the hotel are way above expectations. If you have the opportunity, consider a stay here.

Reviews.Title: “The best so far”
Reviews.Author: ukjingai
Reviews.Content: I selected this hotel based on the reviews and I am glad that I did so. The location is very good, with access to public transport and taxi any time. The desk and bell staff are extremely polite and gentle compared to many hotels I have been to in the US. The rooms are sufficiently spacious and greatly decorated. Everything looked new as of early 2012. The lobby is clean and shiny, and guests receive a personal attention. The room keeping staff would leave you hand written messages of greetings everyday, which is an excellent idea to make you feel at home.I didn't have a chance to eat at the restaurant but I think I wish there were more restaurants inside the hotel. Of course many bars and restaurants are within walking distance.Overall I had a pleasing experience.

Reviews.Title: “Romantic getaway”
Reviews.Author: gmjpeach
Reviews.Content: Got an amazing deal here over president's weekend, and stayed with the husband. He has so enjoyed his time at the San Diego Omni, that we went here the following year. In my opinion, this place was even better. First, it has a grand and really impressive lobby that makes you think of the 1920s. The rooms were nice, and large by San Fran standards. Some of the decor was a little dated, but I felt this lent to its old world charm. The concierge was AMAZING! We talked to them several times for directions, food recommendations, and more! The other great thing is that this hotel offers free walking tours. We took a free walking tour of Chinatown that was one of the highlights of our trip. The location was...interesting. Close to Chinatown, with great shopping and food, it is far from Union Square and Fisherman's Warf. The Omni is in the financial district, and what is nice about that is that on the weekends its really quiet and empty. We walked to Fisherman's Warf and after 20 minutes, so we gave up and hailed a cab. Not a big deal, but be aware. I wouldn't necessarily want to stay by the Warf beacuse its loud and dirty. Staying by Union Square would have been nice, but for the price, the nice large rooms and GREAT service, I would choose the Omni. There is also a trolly stop RIGHT in fromt of the hotel, so you can use this for transportation.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice centrally located hotel”
Reviews.Author: am5
Reviews.Content: We stayed here 2 days after Xmas and had a nice spacious room! Good view out our window of one of the Christmas trees in a plaza next door. The Omni was very decently priced and conveniently located. The staff were attentive and fast (much better than the Kimpton chain staff)! I liked the free hot apple cider in the lobby, the free breakfast drinks, and the inexpensive town car ride to the SFO airport. Free Wifi if you join their free guest club. We would definitely stay here again if the price was similar!

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous location & hospitality!”
Reviews.Author: susan m
Reviews.Content: This past weekend my daughter (25) and I spent the night in San Francisco - dinner & a show. I got a very good rate at the Omni for one night ($170). It is smack in the middle of the financial district so there wasn't much open after Friday evening but the locations was terrific. We were able to walk to North Beach for dinner & Beach Blanket Babylon and then Saturday morning we walked to the Ferry Building as their Farmer's Mkt was open. The hotel was clean, accomodations great and everyone there couldn't have been nicer. We had drinks @ their bar when we got back Friday evening and I have to say, they were delicious! a bit on the pricey side, but at least they were a fairly good size. I have stayed at several hotels throughout the city and I will return to the Omni. Great hotel centrally located.

Reviews.Title: “Watch your bill - they may cheat you”
Reviews.Author: Kendmv
Reviews.Content: Stayed the weekend for the NFC championship game. The room was nice. The staff at the hotel are great. Valet parking charge is high, food and drinks at Bob's are overly priced. Watch your bill. I bought two rounds of drinks at the bar for my wife and NY giants fans we met at the bar. Charged the bill to my room. When I viewed my account from the room TV, saw three charges from the bar. I called the front desk, they checked and told me someone did not fill out the charge slip for their drinks, so they charged it to my room. They were knowingly trying to cheat me. Later my wife had soup, $9, and tea, $6, and they charged her $11 for the soup. They did not correct this mistake. They do not give customer copies of the bills at the bar or restaurant. Really read your bills if you are charging to your room.

Reviews.Title: “San Francisc Omni”
Reviews.Author: Diane_Freyne
Reviews.Content: Late spring saw my wife and I arrive in San Francisco and we joined the roll call of those people who chose the Omni for our place to stay and felt very pleased with ourselves for doing so. The location was perfect for what we were doing on our stay. From the moment we arrived we were made incredibly welcome by the reception team. Our room was always very clean The maid service was excellent and I would have to be extermely picky to find anything to fault (apart from a certain restaurant manager). Apat from him, the staff were a pleasure to speak to, the service was always excellent and It goes without saying that I would certainly use this charming hotel again if in San Francisco.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Average Rooms”
Reviews.Author: TripTex
Reviews.Content: The Omni San Francisco is located in the heart of the financial district in San Francisco right on the cable car line and easy walking distance to Nob Hill. The lobby speaks of a stately, luxury hotel but the rooms don't. I would classify the rooms as fairly avearge both in terms of size as well as decor. The bathroom in my room was on the small side. Generally speaking, I found the hotel and rooms very clean, loved the location but glad that my stay was not extended.

Reviews.Title: “Excellence all round”
Reviews.Author: Mark F
Reviews.Content: We spent Christmas and New Year in San Francisco and chose the Omni for our place to stay. From the moment we arrived (before we got out of the taxi) we were made incredibly welcome by Daryl the doorman. Our experience at check in was really personal and we were given our Select Guest beverage vouchers for our morning drink. My daughter was really pleased to see a Birthday cake in our room when we opened the door. This was arranged by the hotel and no charge made. The room was very clean an plenty of room for the three of us. The room service was always on time, and one time when it wasn't we were given some muffins as an apology! The maid service could not have been better either. The bar was cosy and friendly and like the restaurant a little pricy but quality food and drink. There is not one thing I can genuinely say I could remotely think about in a negative way. All the staff were a pleasure to speak to, the service was always excellent and the decor of the hotel was very seasonal. The Christmas tree and decorations and Christmas music in the lobby were welcoming and cosy. Frequent warm apple cider, apples and ginger cookies were a welcome treat each evening. We were made welcome and felt part of the family during our stay away from home over Christmas. I stay in many hotels in the UK as part of my work and I can honestly say that the Omni has been the most pleasurable hotel stay I have ever experienced. This may sound over the top but it's true. I would certainly use this hotel again if in San Francisco.

Reviews.Title: “Concierge Lex excellent!”
Reviews.Author: trojanlili
Reviews.Content: I will be staying at the Omni in February, and I called just now to ask about tours in the wine country. The concierge, Lex, is very knowledgeable and courteous. He spent about 10 min on the phone with me to help me plan the perfect trip. The hotel is about a 15min walk to the Ferry Landing Building which has a delicious Farmer's Market on Saturday with food trucks too! I am excited to be staying at the Omni because I know the service will be stellar!

Reviews.Title: “Extraordinary San Francisco Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: GinnyAlamo
Reviews.Content: My husband and I spent one short night at the Omni San Francisco Hotel. We're locals but attended a wine tasting dinner in the city and decided to spend the night. After reading many reviews on tripadvisor, we decided to give the Omni San Francisco a try and couldn't have been more pleased. Check in went smoothly. We had a very nice room on the 16th floor with one of the most comfortable hotel beds we'd ever had the pleasure of sleeping in. Prior to making our reservation, we joined their Select Guest program. What a great thing to do! Because we were members (membership is free) we were given a beverage of our choice (coffee, tea, juice or milk) delivered to our room at our preferred time in the morning along with two newspapers--all complimentary! We had breakfast at the hotel's on-site restaurant and were pleased with our breakfast. We also had an appetizer and drinks in the hotel's bar. Internet access is also complimentary. The only negative is that the valet parking rate is steep--$55! We walked a half block to a local garage and paid $39 for the night. Next time we'll take BART into the city. Great hotel! Great staff! We'll definitely be back! Thanks Omni San Francisco!

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed”
Reviews.Author: Dxhastie
Reviews.Content: Having read all the reviews I was expecting first class service, sadly this was not the case. The after service support is not great either. Rooms good, hotel clean, location pretty good, front desk pushy, food average. If you are a select member make sure they know on arrival or else like me you will see your card picking up charges up to 4 days after you thought you had settled your final bill! I would recommend the Galleria Park Hotel every time over the Omni. Feel a little disappointed with the experience of the Omni.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful service & great hotel”
Reviews.Author: Shasta H
Reviews.Content: My husband and I were 1st timers to the Bay area. We could not have picked a better place to stay. David, the Doorman, great personality,very nice and gave great advice on the places we should go during the day and night. Lex and Juan, the Concierge, very knowledgeable of the the different transit systems, and had additional information on getting NFL tickets for 49ers vs. Cowboys game. Go Cowboys. The hotel and room was very clean. I would not have changed a thing.

Reviews.Title: “I Keep Coming Back”
Reviews.Author: Eric1004
Reviews.Content: I like this hotel. I'm in SF on business 3/4 times a year. I've stayed at the JW Marriott, the Renaissance (I'm a Marriott Elite Status), the Mandarin. I haven't liked the Marriott/Renaissance as much as I like the Omni. The Mandarin is lovely, but pricier and stuffier. The staff at the Omni couldn't be nicer. Rooms are pretty much all the same. "Courtyard" views are quieter but unattractive. Higher floors are quiet enough for me. Rooms are a bit uninspired, but comfortable and sufficiently spacious. Beds/linens are all quite comfortable. Amenities/robes are also quite nice. Complimentary beverage delivery in the a.m. is a nice touch. If the location works for you (it does for me), then you won't be disappointed with this property. Rates fluctuate a lot, but you get a real value comapred to other top-tier hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Great trip.”
Reviews.Author: travelchicks
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at the Omni twice in the last year. Both times it has exceeded our expectations. The service is awesome,it is quiet and in a great central location. A little pricey but well worth it. Enjoy!

Reviews.Title: “Holiday Delight with Kids”
Reviews.Author: emeraldhillstraveler
Reviews.Content: Magnificent stay. Service is incredible. Myself and my 3 kids ages 6,8 and10 for a stay in the city for fun. So welcoming with cider, great room on top floor, gave kids fun activity backpacks filled with fun things to do. Great room with view of transamerica building. Not ridiculous price for city (approx $200 a night) but add on valet parking and taxes and it was over $300. We ordered room service for breakfast and it was delicious. They sent up different cookies each night for kids with milk. Very grand decorated lobby. Walked to union square to shop and see lights and no problems walking back late at night (10). We took cab to pier 39 and fishermans wharf the next day for more sightseeing and fun. Great trip. Highly recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Mitch S
Reviews.Content: Was worth every penny. Great hotel, great service, great room.

Reviews.Title: “great stay for 2 nights to enjoy San Francisco”
Reviews.Author: anya672
Reviews.Content: Everything was great, including the friendly service. Hotel was beautifully decorated for Christmas. My only complaint is that the room temp. was set at about 72, so we had to open the windows when we were in the room. Trolley noise not an issue on the 14th floor. Great location for Chinatown, Union Square, even walked to Fisherman's Wharf and back seeing Lombard St. on our return. Used Montgomery St. trains to get to Haight Ashbury area and SFO. Tripadvisor recommends some great local restaurants - don't miss Sotto 'Mare Oysteria & Seafood and Sanraku Japanese Restaurant - picked up car and headed to Marin Headlands.

Reviews.Title: “One of the best places we've stayed in the USA”
Reviews.Author: Kat05g
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel after following a bad stay in the Warwick San Francisco last minute. Following reviews from tripadvisor we booked this hotel from their website and received a 25% discount. The staff is extremely helpful, we came straight from another hotel and were able to book in 3 hrs before check in. The rooms are clean, have a great range of products and facilities and the service 1st class. The omni is in the business district and we found it easy to get to the harbour and union square. Following the bad experience we had at the Warwick we welcome the safety of the Omni and the helpfulness and knowledge of the staff. I will recommend this hotel to anyone I k ow going to San Fran in the future.

Reviews.Title: “pleasant experience during ORACLE WORLD”
Reviews.Author: dennis u
Reviews.Content: Front desk personnel and bellhops (special mention to FERNANDO) made this short stay quite memorable. It was drizzling during our stay, and the hotel provided much needed umbrellas and assistance during the wet days.

Reviews.Title: “Good comfortable hotel”
Reviews.Author: londrepyramid
Reviews.Content: Excellent service, really helpful staff. Very convinently located as almost everything was located within walking distance. Slightly old fashioned in a good way would definately stay here again

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: ItsATrip5
Reviews.Content: Great location with a cable car stop right outside. The staff is excellent and the historic feel is very San Francisco. The rooms are extremely clean and large, for a city hotel Our kids LOVED the attention from the staff and the cookies, cider and milk was a great touch. Price was right, we will stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “A satisfactory experience”
Reviews.Author: Orugco
Reviews.Content: If you are looking for a mid price range hotel with adequate but not great accomodations, this may be what you are looking for. The room I stayed in was small and oddly narrow and long with a window that provided a very limited view of the outside world. In fact I would call it a "room without a view". Two double beds were requsted and were provided but the beds did not seem to be truly double beds. They looked and felt to be smaller. The best part however,was the bath room which was large and, even though tubless, had a large shower stall with nice tile work, a good shower head and a great drain. I emphasize the drain because we all have had some bad experience with a slow drain. Other good points about accomodations in this hotel include cleanliness and great service. Every one is extremely friendly and all issues are resolved immidiately. Case in point was my disappointment with an out of order safe. Upon complaining a repair man was sent to my room who fixed the problem in no time. Hotel laundry is quick and professional even though expensive. The restaurant is not great and the service only adequate. Breakfast was good but expensive. Fitness center was clean with equipment that, even though not new, were in good working condition. Hotel location is excellent, close to many great restaurants, few walking minutes to embarcoder, the ferry building, union square, north beach, cable cars and the BART.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely wonderful.”
Reviews.Author: Elaine W
Reviews.Content: The Omni was a great find for our short stay in San Francisco. Being in the business area, the parking was cheaper. Staff were very friendly and helpful in recommending us somewhere to eat. They also told us about the market down on the pier which we were glad we didn't miss. They made our room special as we'd told them we were on our honeymoon - coming straight from the Bellagio where they'd done nothing special, it was really, really sweet. Location was good; a short walk to the market on the pier. They also gave us a room with a view (there can't have been many of those rooms given where the hotel was situated). Would definitely stay with Omni again.

Reviews.Title: “The BEST in San Francisco.”
Reviews.Author: sebewtf
Reviews.Content: Third stay at the Omni SF. Beautiful property, very nice rooms. The staff goes out of their way to be helpful. The customer service is second to none. The kids love the Hot Cider and apples in the lobby. The location cant be beat, short walks to Chinatown, Union Square, North Beach. Had a problem with the Ace Parking Valet, but it was solved by a manager. This is no reflection on the Omni however.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent down-town SF Hotel”
Reviews.Author: donch47
Reviews.Content: Among the many choices to stay in San Francisco, the Omni stood out in the reviews. That prompted me to book a night there for a quick trip my wife and I had planned. Upon arrival, we were greeted warmly by every single hotel staff person we encountered, with offers of help and welcome. This was not done in any overbearing way and felt quite genuine. Our room was on the 14th floor. The room was very nice, clean, and very quiet. We hadn't opted for a view and indeed were given the opportunity to look into office windows of the three buildings surrounding the alley courtyard behind our side of the hotel. The TransAmerica Building could be seen soaring high above one of them. It was sunny and well-lit, so we weren't disappointed by that. A little background: Our last hotel, two weeks earlier, had been in Beijing, China. The contrast couldn't have been greater. A 4-star hotel, it looked very fancy at first glance (and from 20 feet away). A closer inspection was almost horrifying. The place was absolutely filthy. In the 8 days we stayed there, our sheets were never changed, the bathroom always smelled like a sewer, and our clean fingernails at night were dirty upon getting up in the morning. The bed must have been made of concrete, and the lock on the entry door didn't work. So by contrast, the Omni was absolutely a wonderful place. Mind you, this comparison is quite unfair, in that the Omni should not be described with any association with the other hotel. The Omni stands in its own right as a fine hotel, a world-class hotel, with a staff that went out of its way at every opportunity to serve us with a smile and no hesitation. Location-wise, it is terrific. Sited at the intersection of Montgomery and California, it is about 6-blocks from the Ferry Building, next door to China Town, the California Cable Car runs by the front door, and Nob Hill is just to the west, up the street. All the major cultural and performance centers are within easy walking access and restaurants are all over the place. We slept soundly, enjoyed the lovely clean, nicely scented bathroom, and comfortable clean (did I say clean?) bed. There was a large safe in the closet and a locking refrigerator where we kept snacks bought at a nearby deli. I highly recommend the Omni and will stay there again if I have the chance.

Reviews.Title: “Good option in SF”
Reviews.Author: elderc
Reviews.Content: The hotel is old but good. Great location, next to Market Street, Chinatown, Financial District and the Ferry Building. It's an easy walk to the cable car or the BART. Service is helpful and the people at the frontdesk were nice. There's no free wifi, which is a downside.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Location and Unbeatable Customer Service”
Reviews.Author: Melissa C
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Omni San Francisco in September for our honeymoon and it was fantastic!! We upgraded to the Omni Select which allowed for daily morning beverage selection delivered to the room which was a great way to start the day! It also allowed for WiFi access in the room. The rooms are very clean and comfortable. All staff went out of their way to make us feel at home, helped us find great places to eat and even booked our trip to Alcatraz for us! Location is unbeatable!! Public transportation is accessible from right in front of the hotel or within a block away. We would not hesitate to recommended this hotel to anyone! We plan on staying here when we return to San Francisco!

Reviews.Title: “Customer Service and Pampering at it's best”
Reviews.Author: lk2getaway
Reviews.Content: This hotel has mastered making the guests feel pampered. The valet, bell staff, front desk -- all superior. From the cookies and milk each afternoon in our room, to the concierge who walked us outside to show us the wells fargo building and give us some background history on it, before pointing out the cable car stop to us. Anything we asked for arrived in moments. I cannot think of a hotel that provides this high of a level of customer service with no pretense better than the Omni SF. I am comparing to top hotels such as the Four Seasons Beverly Hills, the Fairmont Plaza NY - customer service at the Omni was superior to hotels in the highest class. The Cable Cars stop just out front, making the location ideal. Restaurants and chinatown within a very easy walk from this hotel. My only complaints are very minor ones, and just an FYI for other guests. They will not stop me from booking a room at the Omni every time we travel to San Francisco. I wouldn't even look elsewhere- they were that great! The small downsides: The heat/air conditioning was outdated (I think) and loud in it's on and off cycle. Not smooth at all. The first morning at 8am we could hear the housekeeping knocking on the door next to ours. Over and over. There is little to no soundproofing from the door to the room and this woke us all up unnecessarily. The parking costs are ridiculously high. This seems to be fairly consistent across the SF hotels, yet doesn't make it more acceptable or palatable. If you are looking for a great SF experience then look no further than the Omni.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!”
Reviews.Author: SandraMom
Reviews.Content: Great place to stay ... great location ... great for families.

Reviews.Title: “Great location with exceptional customer services.”
Reviews.Author: barruca
Reviews.Content: The hotel location was perfect and the room was very nice. The best thing about the Omni is the customer service. They are so great. Everyone goes out of their way to be helpful and friendly. My daughter was given a backpack with lots of great treats. Cookies and milk were waiting in the room for her. I cant say enough how helpful they were. It was great! I would recomend this hotel to anyone staying in SF. Parking is expensive but that is SF. We are select guest members and were already checked in when we arrived. We got free wifi and free beverage service every morning.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly service, comfortable surrounds, and a touch of elegance”
Reviews.Author: taotei
Reviews.Content: Nothing is over the top except the service at the Omni Hotel. We had a very clean, very comfortable room - nice linens, flat screen, plenty of fluffy towels...everything you'd need for a restful base. Room service is tasty and prompt. Even the housekeepers are super friendly - and they have a turn down service with nice local chocolates for your pillow. We'll be back.

Reviews.Title: “GOOD place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Lindsay M
Reviews.Content: I was happy with my stay at Omni SF. I think location was pretty good...our room was clean, comfy bathrobes (bought as soon as I got home), nice bathrooms and a really fab gym. Hotel staff was helpful, however they had a $ charge just to use the business center which is something I have never heard of and felt was a little rediculous. Other than that, good place to stay in SF.

Reviews.Title: “Classy without being over the top”
Reviews.Author: chrissytina
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a quick trip before a business trip in Pleasanton. Staff was extremely friendly and helpful with whatever I needed and were happy to keep my bags before and after my "official" stay (while I wandered the city). Felt like I was in the middle of everything- literally walked everywhere (though definitely a bit of a treck, most people will probably want to take a taxi to get around). The room was extremely comfortable and "ornate" while still being warm. Lots of room- didn't feel claustrophobic (like some city hotel rooms can be). Overall, very happy with the Omni and would stay here again in a heartbeat.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel, in convenient location”
Reviews.Author: Palman13
Reviews.Content: Was planning a trip for wife's "big" birthday so we decided on San Francisco and other parts of Northern California. Looked on TripAdvisor and other sites for good reviews and good value. Always like staying in in Omni's and price was reasonable (for San Francisco). Made reservations and was all set. Staff was very friendly and accommodating upon arrival and throughout the stay. When we got in delivered a cake plate other items in recognition of her birthday. Room was a little small but well appointed and very nice. Location turned out to be very good neutral site, in the heart of the financial district with easy walking access to Union Square, Chinatown, North Beach, Ferry Building and transportation around other parts of Bay Area. Fun time, nice place and highly recommend for nice luxury hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Elegant Grand Dame”
Reviews.Author: CaliforniaHarmony
Reviews.Content: Hubby likes it! When we checked in we were offered Gingerbread Men Cookies and hot apple cider! The staff was pleasant and very efficient. Our room was kind of old-fashioned, but elegant with 9 foot high ceilings. Very clean and very quiet even though we faced the street. There was a letter on the desk explaining that they were undergoing renovation and re-decorating that would be completed in Feb 2012. Nice robes, great location, and good coffee. We would definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “One of the best hotels I've stayed in (anywhere)”
Reviews.Author: PipsM
Reviews.Content: I can't recommend this hotel enough. The staff are genuinely friendly and helpful without being over the top or "fake friendly" (unlike the staff in many other comparable hotels). This is the standard of service that all other hotels in the USA need to aspire to. Well done Omni. The hotel itself is also very beautiful. The rooms are elegantly appointed and the lobby is one of the finest I've seen.

Reviews.Title: “Refinement+Humility”
Reviews.Author: travelin_runner
Reviews.Content: The usual hotel that I stay at for business was sold out, so I stayed at the Omni San Francisco instead. And now this is where I'll be staying when I come in the future. As other reviewers mention, the staff is not just friendly and helpful but competent. When checking in, I asked about where the local markets were. The front desk person proceeded to show me in great detail on the map exactly where each of them were - Safeway, Trader Joes, Whole foods. Wow! When I needed to mail something out after checking out, the front desk person got me the forms and hunted around for a suitable sized box that I could use. There was no subtle sense that I was "imposing" on them which I have experienced at other hotels. On to the rooms: they were super clean and shiny and the lighting was really nice. Nothing in the room seemed worn out or run down. The bathroom amenities were products that I would actually use outside of the hotel. They have turndown service with great chocolates. I was able to use the refrigerator to store some leftovers and food items without any hassle (there's no sensor-type system which automatically charges you) so I didn't have to order a refrigerator. When I needed a cab, the door man efficiently called one right away. All these small details really add up to a pleasant stay. The staff is attentive and the accomodations are elegant, but there's never a sense of it being over-the-top or ostentatious. The place has just the right combination of refinement and humility. The one thing that wasn't quite up to the high standard was the fitness center. The cardio machines were good and the room had windows, so that's a plus. But only one of the TVs worked and the sound system on the machines didn't work well at all. The treadmills had individual screens but I could not for the life of me find a headphone jack. And there were no magazines provided. So if you work out there, be prepared to bring your own entertainment. All in all, the Omni gets two thumbs up and I would highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Everything everyone said it was...”
Reviews.Author: Leah217
Reviews.Content: Everyone working at the Omni were extremely friendly and helpful, just as the reviews said they were. The rooms were very nice and plush and clean and comfortable. We first were going to stay in a room facing the courtyard, as was recommended for the noise but we found it somewhat closterphobic and noisy from the vents as well as not private and lacking a view... so we switched to a room with a view and did not find the noise from the trolleys a problem at all. It was in a great central location and we walked from North Beach back to the hotel and then on to Union Sqare all in one night. The Cafe La Presse, which was recommended by the hotel staff was an excellent place for breakfast and was within walking distance as well.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice business hotel”
Reviews.Author: ExpeditionDaddy
Reviews.Content: I recently spent a weekend at the Omni on business. This is a very well located hotel right in the heart of the financial district. It is also well located to access Union Square and other tourist locations. The staff seemed very on top of things from check in right to the end of the stay. The entire hotel is designed in a pretty traditional style - think Ritz Carlton, early American revival type furnishings and you've got it. So if you want comfort, quiet and good food, this is your place. If you want a happening scene, you may want to look elsewhere. Over all I was very impressed and would put it up there with the more well known brands in the city. There is evidently a renovation underway which will be a good thing as some of the furniture is looking a little worn. However, this did not detract from the experience.

Reviews.Title: “TA Right Again”
Reviews.Author: AZ-Traveler85253
Reviews.Content: TA rarely lets me down, and once again the ratings lived up to hype. I won't bore you repeating all the great things about this hotel, but number one has to be the staff. From the time you pull up to the time you check out, the staff is there to help you with whatever you need and greet you like a friend. I really appreciated Mark in valet for even asking how my wife was doing after an unexpected trip to urgent care. Every time you come back...they welcome you back. We needed some minor repairs in the room...no problem..quickly fixed and with a smile. Cookies and milk at night...a big hit. The room was beautiful and clean and the beds soft and comfy. Not much noise, even on the California street side. Coffee in room and downstairs. Fitness room free and very nicely equipped. The Westin wanted to charge daily for their fitness center. Location was very good...just minutes from everything and walkable or trolley friendly. Only negative was the lack of family friendly option for breakfast. I know they have Bob's in the lobby for "breakfast", but at $18 for pancakes, not sure that is what I was hoping for with three kids. Room service was actually a better option and had more selections...plus the kids always like breakfast in bed. Excellent stay and I will put this on my repeat list should we return.

Reviews.Title: “Long Weekend in SF”
Reviews.Author: ColoradoTravelors
Reviews.Content: Superb hotel, excellent staff, great location. We walked mostly and took cabs home in the evening. The staff got us all set up with reservations and day trips. Top notch stay.

Reviews.Title: “My favorite hotel”
Reviews.Author: MaxLittleton
Reviews.Content: We stayed 2 nights at the Omni Hotel in San Francisco. The staff I give 5 stars to and would give more if I could. They were all amazing. I loved the bed and the bedding. Walked to Embarcadero and then on to Pier 39. This is by far my favorite hotel. I stayed in the Hyatt Embarcadero last year to see Peter Pan at the 360 theather. Which is a great hotel too. Really nothing bad to say about that hotel, but with this hotel customer service is really what stood out. They were so good to us. Thank you!

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: JAEA-Family
Reviews.Content: I was really looking forward to staying here and seeing SF again after 11 years - back then I was 20 now I'm with my kids. This hotel was fantastic, the friendliest most helpful and kid friendly I have ever encountered in such a nice hotel. The rooms are nice, food in the resturant was great- especially the steak. Hot apple cider daily in the lobby with gingerbread and apples was enjoyed by my kids 3 & 4 and us parents also. Milk and cookies every night when we got back to our room was such a nice touch.

Reviews.Title: “Elegant hotel, exceptional service”
Reviews.Author: DianaNewYorkNY
Reviews.Content: It was an absolute pleasure to stay at the Omni. Not only was the property strikingly beautiful, well maintained, and spotless, but all staff (Cameron at the front desk, bellmen, valet parking guys, housekeeping, and even the bartender) went out of their way to provide a level of service that totally "WOWed" us. I would stay here again in a minute!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Hotel”
Reviews.Author: likecomfy
Reviews.Content: Impressive lobby and nice staff welcome you with friendly, quick check-in. Gingerbread cookies and cider (it was near Christmas) are also in the lobby. Although we were upgraded to a higher level room, it was small. The decor was very nice and upscale, and the room was clean. The bed was very comfortable. There was a nice desk in the room well equipped for working. The bathroom was also clean, lots of marble and high end finishes. Our room faced the street, so we did have some street noise which made it a little difficult for me to sleep, my husband had no problem. Checkout was equally as quick, and the valets for parking were quick and friendly as well. They had complimentary tea and coffee in the lobby in the morning with paper cups for take-away. Overall a very nice stay. We got free internet by signing up for their frequent customer program.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, but...”
Reviews.Author: Homan K
Reviews.Content: I wanted so much to like this hotel, the staff was very friendly/accommodating, rooms were nice/clean, great rewards program (complimentary water on arrival, free water, instant check-in/out), however as other people have noted there are two issues for my poor rating. One which is understandable and nothing can be done and the other is just unacceptable for a hotel of this quality. The first, as others have noted, there are no good views from any room as the hotel is on the smaller side and it is surrounded by much larger buildings. This only accounts for .5 of my negative rating because it should be fairly obvious prior to booking what you are getting into. The other 1.5 of my negative review, is completely unacceptable. The morning maid service is extremely loud, between door slamming and hallway chatter (I mean seriously?), this has to be managed better. I left a poor review on this very item after check out, and management replied the next day with an apology/promise to improve, but after reading many posts on this exact issue (dating back years), I will not be returning any time soon.

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful experience”
Reviews.Author: Isobelsophia
Reviews.Content: We loved this hotel. We are Omni members and enjoyed all the treats like coffee delivered in the morning (and it's GOOD coffee) and cookies for the kids. The apple cider and gingerbread men in the foyer were a lovely touch. The reception and valet parking staff were friendly and efficient. We had the kids fantasy suite and our room adjoined theirs - highly recommend this, our kids loved it and so did we.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding hotel in the financial district”
Reviews.Author: Darleensun
Reviews.Content: Second stay at this lovely property in the city. It's beautiful, friendly and centrally located. Every employee we encountered was delightful. How nice it was to have hot cider and gingerbread men waiting for us in the lobby! And if you join there frequent user club (free) you'll enjoy other great perks like coffee delivered to your room and cookies and milk in the afternoon. The lobby and our room were pleasantly elegant. Walk to Union Square, the Ferry Building and Chinatown. Watch for weekend specials especially at holiday time. This is when they are least busy. It's also when you can get find free street parking nearby. We'll stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Great service!”
Reviews.Author: Cave66man
Reviews.Content: Great service and very nice rooms. The decor was formal but nice. The bed was comfortable and the room was clean. Great location and very close to many great restaurants. The view was a standard city view. The service was just great. Every person I came in contact with was nice and willing to help.

Reviews.Title: “Good for business trips”
Reviews.Author: Tkyrnr
Reviews.Content: Check in process was very smooth and fast. Rooms are decent sized but decor is bland and didn't have a view. Bathroom was bright and well appointed. Overall room was clean. Location is great for business.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Lobby & Walking Tour.”
Reviews.Author: SMorovich
Reviews.Content: Booked this room for our 5th anniversary through Hotels.com & got a smoking deal. Lobby was beautiful when we walked in. The room was nice as well; however, there was construction happening outside our window across the street. Guess that was reason for the low price. The hotel provided a free walking tour of China Town in conjunction with a local non-profit historical society. Was informative and worth going on. Few negatives: 1. Slowest...elevators...ever. 2. Location was in the middle of business district. While it was walking distance to most points of interest (china town, pier, etc.), there were limited places to eat nearby. 3. Service was good; however, a few of their front desk people were a little full of themselves. We requested a place for lunch after our arrival. One desk employee called a friend a nearby eatery stating he was sending two over for lunch. He told us they were saving a table for us and would make food available upon our arrival.
