We arrived and spoke with the same employee at the eatery, who had no idea we were coming or who the person at the Omni was. Weird. And dissappointing. 4. WiFi costs money, except for airline check-in. Just reread my review and noticed it comes off as very negative. The hotel overall was nice, and I wouldn't have a problem staying there again. Just wanted to point out some negatives I had not read previous to our stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great Service”
Reviews.Author: Big_BroLeuven
Reviews.Content: Never had any more personal service than at this place ! We were greeted by name on arrival by the doorman (perfectly pronunciated Dutch name, which is not evident at all in the US), and we were lead to the reception desk where our keys were already at hand for us. Steve, the receptionist, made us feel more than welcome and gave us great info on the city and the public transport and he handed his business card to our kids (in case they got lost, they had to show it at a policeman to get back to the hotel). We really appreciated this concern and attention to detail. The rooms weren't overly large but very nicely appointed without being stuffed (we had a Queen-Queen room and the Qn beds are rather small to accomodate 2 persons). If we knew beforehand, we would have booked 2 rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing!”
Reviews.Author: fivethreezero
Reviews.Content: Rooms is very spacious and comfortable. Service is excellent! All the staff were amazing. We have the fastest check in, in less than 2 minutes. Literally, keys are ready already once you mention your name. They would suggest place to eat, shop and they even have estimated taxi fare of each location you'll be visiting. Love their breakfast. Everything taste so good. Only negative is their price, a little bit pricey considing the location. You still need to take around15-20 minute walk to the shopping center.

Reviews.Title: “Great experience - highly recommended!”
Reviews.Author: murray9000
Reviews.Content: I just returned from a 3-night stay at the Omni SF with my family, and the entire experience was way beyond our expectations. Not that I've had any bad stays in Omnis elsewhere, but the SF location was the nicest one I've been in by far. The vibe overall is very homey, classic without being stuffy, and a pleasant contrast to the many too-hip trendy boutique hotels around the city. Every employee we encountered at the Omni was genuinely friendly and accommodating, and the service was great in all respects. I understand the floor we stayed in was subjected to a recent remodel, which was done very tastefully. The rooms were decent sized and very comfortable once we got the A/C dialed in. The location is great - being in the Financial District, it is a bit removed from the tourist hubbub, a positive or negative depending on your point of view. It is only a couple of blocks from the eastern edge of Chinatown, an easy walk to North Beach, the Moscone Center and Union Square, and more ambitious walking distance to the Embarcadero, Nob Hill and SOMA. Since the Omni is in a fairly busy area, street noise would be hard to avoid. We were on the top floor on the California St. side and it was fairly noticeable but livable - with the exception of a very annoying and constant clacking sound from the cable car tracks on California just west of Montgomery. If possible, I would ask for a room facing another direction, where I imagine it wouldn't be as much of an issue. Thankfully, it goes away during the hours that the cable cars are not operating.

Reviews.Title: “Just terrific!”
Reviews.Author: sweetnneka
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Omni over the Thanksgiving holiday for a total of four nights. From check-in, the service was exceptional. All of our preferences were noted and attended to. Our room was tidy and spacious, the gym was outfitted quite well with the newest equipment. We enjoyed the nice touches, like gingerbread cookies and hot cider in the evenings. The location is in excellent proximity to downtown and Chinatown, which worked well for us. It is also directly on the California cablecar line, for those who are interested in taking in a view of Nob Hill at the top. Overall, we would gladly stay at the Omni again during a visit to San Francisco.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: 86EC
Reviews.Content: The Omni San Fancisco is a great hotel and located perfectly for Union Square and Chinatown. There are a plethora of good restaurants nearby and a good variety of different cuisines. Couldn't fault the service, all the staff were very friendly and helpful. We had our own car which we left with the valet at the hotel but as understand that there are very good transport links from the hotel to get down to the wharf and other neighbourhoods.

Reviews.Title: “Elegant, beautiful hotel”
Reviews.Author: citetapirep
Reviews.Content: We travel to SF several times a year and stay in different venues from rental of homes/apartments, to boutique hotels to large chains. This was our first time to the Omni and we loved it. Quiet, elegant hotel with excellent service from friendly staff, bellhops, and maid service. Every greeting was with a smile. We were travelling with 6 girls, all eleven years old, and they were very well treated. The milk and cookies in the evening were a big hit. The beds are a bit soft but comfortable. Occasionally, the late evening noise or a loud passing party of "happy" people would filter thru the windows from the streets but that was rare. Every effort was made to accomodate our needs. When something didn't go according to plan (sometimes a door key didn't work, or the check out was delayed because of a computer glitch) the staff made every effort to rectify it. Depending on your preferences, it might be a bit of a walk to some places (such as Union Square, ACT Theater, Golden Gate Theater) but China Town, the Ferry Building, Embarcadero Center, restaurants such as Taddich Grill, Perbacco, Barbacco, Boulevard, R&G Lounge ( and of course Bob's Steak House) were all near by with easy, quick walks. The California Cable Car line was in front of the hotel and we used it to get to Van Ness for the movies. I will definitely fit this hotel into my list of return places. By the way, the hotel was scented from the lobby to the elevator to the hallways and it was heavenly.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel - Great Location!”
Reviews.Author: nunce1
Reviews.Content: My husband and I recently stayed at this hotel and it's stunning! Our room was beautiful, though the view wasn't much because of all the other tall buildings around it. But it's within a short walk of the water and there are tons of great restaurants right near the hotel. Breakfast was the only meal we had at the restaurant on site, but it was great (though like most/all Omni's it's rather expensive). The concierge was outstanding with a thorough knowledge of the area and great recommendations on dinner options. The whole place is very up-to-date with a modern luxurious feel to it. We have come to really enjoy Omni properties and this one did not disappoint! The customer service was excellent as well!

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice - Great Location”
Reviews.Author: hollybelle210
Reviews.Content: I thought the hotel was lovely. We had a 5 night stay, and it was very comfortable. The room decor is a little tired, but they are beginning renovations. Housekeeping did a great job. The staff was awesome, and very helpful. I don't know if anything was over the top memorable, but you wouldn't go wrong staying here.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for us”
Reviews.Author: rainsoaked
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from two nights at the Omni and our stay could not have been better. I don't think I've ever stayed at a friendlier, more welcoming place. The concierge went out of his way to help with every question I had, and everything from check in to check out went smoothly. Our room was spacious and very comfortable, and our teenage daughter loved the milk and cookies left in our room every afternoon. There is hot cider available all afternoon and evening, perfect when coming in from the cold, and gingerbread cookies in the evenings. The location was perfect as we could walk to Chinatown, North Beach, and the Embarcadero. We were near Union Square but away from the crowds. We loved our stay at the Omni, Of the many places I've stayed in San Francisco this was by far the most enjoyable.

Reviews.Title: “Best Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Babara W
Reviews.Content: Stayed there for four night and got a fantastic room in a fantastic hotel placed in the middle of some of the most peaceful tranquil and fascinating you can imagine. Great staff, great service, all the best of San Francisco just outside the hotel door. The hotel maintains a very good standard. This is my new San Francisco home in the future.....

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel...with a little room for improvement”
Reviews.Author: ataylor1215
Reviews.Content: We just spent 1 night at The Omni in their Kids Fantasy Suite. It is a gorgeous King suite attached to a fun room with bunkbeds, bean bag chairs, toys and books. I need to start by saying that we really enjoyed this hotel and would stay here again. However there is a little room for improvement. When we made the reservation we asked if we could get an early check-in at noon. The reservations assistant said they would put in the request. We got there later than expected at 2pm, and the room wasn't ready and that was kind of a bummer. They said they would put a rush on it, but I wish they had done this earlier. When we got into the rooms we were very impressed. My kids loved that the room was catered to them. Now here come my small complaints. The movies were like $11 to rent, the video games were $6.95/hour, and they had a little fridge and basket in the room with outrageously priced snacks. Snacks that were VERY tempting to my kids. Bags of skittles, cookies, M&M's, etc. In the fridge they had yogurts, drinks, etc. Actually, some of the snacks weren't exorbitant, but I still didn't want my kids drooling over them. The snacks in our room (the King bed side) had insane prices. A candy bar was $5. A large bottle of water was $7. Needless to say we didn't partake in any of these foods. More than the foods though, the kids were really bummed they couldn't play the video games. It seemed like such a tease to have a game controller there that they had to pay to play. So my biggest suggestion would be to include the use of the video games (and if possible some kid movies too) in the cost of the $350/night room. Also, maybe bring the prices down a bit on the snacks. I thought we were going to receive a newspaper and juice/coffee in the morning as being Select Members, but they did not come. Maybe we were supposed to request them? Now back to the good. The rooms were really quiet, clean, tastefully decorated, and spacious. The bed was soooo comfortable. All the staff was exceptionally nice and attentive. They did give the kids little backpacks upon arrival with a few coloring items and small toys. They did also bring them cookies and milk in the evening which was really sweet. Overall I thought this was a quality hotel in a great location. We easily walked to China Town and jumped on the cable car line for lots of other destinations. We will go back to The Omni, maybe without kids next time for a romantic getaway.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderfull place!”
Reviews.Author: fionita
Reviews.Content: I like very much this hotel, is a wonderfull place to stay in SF! Despite this is a 4 star hotel, all the amenities, personal, meals, position are for a 5 star plus hotel. The rooms are various dimensions, at 17th floor are smallest than the others floor, but this is not a problem! This is a very clean hotel, all the people from the staff are very friendly and helpfull, and the breakfast are delicious. Every day, in the lobby, the cakes, apples and apple cider expect us to return at home! Delicious and familiar! If is possibile, I advise you to stay, maybe only for a day, at this special hotel!

Reviews.Title: “The love affair continues - And CARMEN SERRA rocks!!”
Reviews.Author: Jsilverheart77
Reviews.Content: And so my love affair with this hotel continues. We stopped in SF for one night on our way back from Seattle to Los Angeles. We arrived late at night, the kids were tired. We were tired. The bellman and front desk quickly moved us and our luggage out of our car and into a relaxing, clean, luxurious hotel room. WITH fun backpacks as well as cookies and milk waiting for the little ones. The beds are delightful. The room was a good size and clean. And I just have to give a shout out to the managers - Carmen Serra and Debora Tjandra. AWESOME. They deserve a raise and some sort of recognition from the hotel. They take care of me every single time I come calling, and that is why I keep going back again to Omni Hotels across the country. They are amazing and attentive and pleasant. They go above and beyond -- and it is GREATLY appreciated. I notice the little details and this Omni has always delivered. Ps: Hi Carmen, its me Jaclyne Breault : )

Reviews.Title: “Weekend in San Francisco”
Reviews.Author: BridgeGal1947
Reviews.Content: Great location. Great service. Concierge was incredibly helpful. We walked everywhere.

Reviews.Title: “Very expensive, small rooms for the price”
Reviews.Author: gmcc127
Reviews.Content: Good location on the edge of Chinatown and 10 minute walk to downtown. I stayed while at a conference and after taxes the room rate was almost $500 a night for a 7 night stay. Smaller rooms than most american hotels and toiletries were never added to over the 7 nights

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location for a trip to SF”
Reviews.Author: Destination360
Reviews.Content: This hotel was a great choice: Centrally located with easy access to Union Square, Market Street, the Embarcadero ... the list goes on. You're also very close to bus stops and right by the BART, which goes out to the airport and across the bay to Oakland. (Skip the rental car on a trip here, if you can.) The Omni was a lovely hotel and very comfortable, and we spent a couple of evenings relaxing in the bar after a busy day and were very pleased with the food & atmosphere. One thing that's especially great about the Omni's location is that it's in the financial district, meaning it's clean and quiet, and we felt very safe in the neighborhood. SF is so compact that it's easy to get anywhere, so you can stay in this area without feeling isolated; even if you're not on a business trip, this neighborhood is a great place to go for hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Classy!”
Reviews.Author: fun-happy-traveller
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Omni for 3 nights. The most impressive quality of this hotel is its *impeccable* service. For such a classy hotel, I was expecting the staff to be a bit stuffy or snooty. However, to our pleasant surprise, staff were incredibly friendly, helpful, and willing to go the extra mile for you. And when I say staff, I literally mean everyone we encountered. Room was clean & spacious. Expensive room service but more tasty than other hotels. Pears & tea offered in the lobby daily - great for a midday snack. Great location - walking distance to Union Square, Chinatown, North Beach, Embarcadero. If leaving from hotel to airport, use their car service. It ended up being cheaper than the cab ride we took from the airport to the hotel. Only con - bed was not as comfortable. Overall, a grand, classy experience, and I wouldn't hesitate to stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: jbtraveler63
Reviews.Content: My husband and I liked the Omni. It was a great location and the staff were helpful. Our room was clean, had an ok view but we weren't in the room much. There was a letter in the room saying that they would be updating the rooms (I think beginning in February.) Although, the room was comfortable, updating is a good idea. Carpet, drapes needed a lift. One gripe, the guests next to us had a dog. I knew this because it barked a couple times. In the morning when my husband and I left, it barked several times. It was early and I thought that was rude for other people who may have still been sleeping.

Reviews.Title: “Yeah, this is the place you want to stay!”
Reviews.Author: RonboNJ
Reviews.Content: Been to San Francisco twice over the course of two weeks. The first was a business trip that was picked up through our company. I was placed at the Mark Hopkins Intercontinental a few blocks up California street from the Omni. What a boring hotel. Seemed everyone there was very snobby and that if you didn't conform to a certain dress code you were frowned upon. So, imagine my surprise when I came back to San Francisco on a pleasure trip and stayed at the Omni. What a totally different animal this place is compared to the "stiffs" at Mark Hopkins. I have always loved the Omni brand. I stay at their hotels across the country often during business conventions. Every single Omni hotel I have stayed at has been a class-act from the staff, to the rooms and the food. Coming to San Francisco was reward travel for being a member of their loyalty program. When I built up enough credits for 2 free nights, I decided to come out to my favorite city in the United States. From the moment I arrived, I felt like family. The rental company upgraded me to a huge Lincoln Town Car. So, when I arrive in front of the hotel, the valet ignored me thinking I was car service dropping off passengers. It took a while, but the doorman recognized that I was just sitting there waiting and he came over and made certain I was taken care of. I don't know who the portly doorman was, but he as incredibly charming and funny. You could not have been wanted to be met by anyone more personable than this guy and I wish I had the opportunity to have talked to him more. He was gone by the end of Friday afternoon,and I am guessing off for the weekend I was there. When I got inside I was also greeted very warmly by the gentleman at the front desk who asked me where I was from. When I told him I was from New Jersey, he told me a story of a sub shop he remembers from Princeton, a town not too far from where I lived. Just one of those really nice exchanges that makes you feel welcomed. And, even though the hotel was sold out the day before and rooms were scarce at the point of my early check-in, the clerk went out of his way to get me into a room. I had a room on the 8th floor, facing the middle of the hotel center. This means it didn't have a view of the street. That was fine. The room was actually very quiet. That evening, I got a knock on the door from room service and was handed a bottle of water and a bag of vegetarian granola (which was really good), as a loyalty program "welcome back" gift. In addition, as a loyalty member, I get free WiFi and my choice of free beverage delivered to my door every morning. And you know what? All it takes to become a loyalty member is to sign up on the Omni website prior to your stay. I think Omni has the best loyalty benefits of any hotel I have stayed with. Free Internet and beverages? How can you not be happy staying at the Omni. And, for the two days I spent at the hotel, you couldn't walk inside without a staff member smiling at you with a "hello" or "welcome back." Step in the lobby and there is this faint perfume smell that really warmes the senses. ....and, while valet parking is about expensive as any other hotel in the city (at least $50 per night), there is a substantial discount on Friday and Saturday nights. Valet Parking only cost me $30 each night which I thought was great. By the way, the valets did a superb job in getting me my vehicle in a short timeframe. I don't think I have anything negative to say about this hotel. I don't think I'll ever stay at another hotel when travling to San Francisco. The people here seem much happier than they do at the Mark Hopkins. Much more smiling and the sounds of "hello" in the elevator. Clean, comfortable, inviting. This is the place you want to stay and where you will return again and again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, Luxurious accommodation, Wonderful staff”
Reviews.Author: tomszack
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Omni SF for two nights on the way to our Napa Valley wine expedition and found this hotel to be just lovely. From the incredibly friendly greeting we received when checking in, to the immaculately clean and extremely comfortable room, to the terrific breakfast in the Omni's restaurant, we simply could not have had a better stay. The Omni is in a great spot as well, situated in a central location for exploring pretty much all of the eastern San Francisco neighborhoods: North Beach, Chinatown, FiDi, Union Square, Tenderloin, and SoMa. Even Fishermanâ€™s Wharf is walk-able from the Omni along the Embarcadero. We would definitely stay again, and most likely would not stay any place else!

Reviews.Title: “Posh hotel in business district of San Francisco”
Reviews.Author: KitweTraveller
Reviews.Content: Quality hotel all round. Nice rooms, good food, excellent service. Well equipped gym. Decorations are very old style, Victorian, which is not to everyone's taste.

Reviews.Title: “Simply loved everything about it!”
Reviews.Author: California_momofsix
Reviews.Content: I spent a week here, accompanying my husband on a business trip. The hotel was in a great central location, the room was large and very clean. Our room overlooked California street and was still remarkably quiet (I could hear the faintest ringing of the bells from the streetcars which I actually loved). The bed was huge and so, so comfortable. But what made this hotel an amazing experience was the customer service. I have never stayed in a hotel where everyone on the staff was so friendly and helpful. When we checked in, and the desk clerk found out I was traveling with my husband to take a rare break from my 6 kids at home, he instantly upgraded our room and offered me shopping coupons and spa services. Sitting in the lobby, it looked like everyone asking a question received great service and advice. The clerk also sent beverages up to our room also. Every employee we passed would greet us, starting with the doorman and even when we returned to the hotel in the middle of the night. We loved the many small touches, like the fresh fruit in bowls in the lobby and the handwritten notes from the maids. If you are a member or sign up for their select club (not sure exactly what it is called), you can get free internet.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: Jinxy17
Reviews.Content: I stayed 5nights at Omni Hotel . Check-in was very rapid and without problems, the room was very clean and cosy with excellent service. I had breackfast at Bob's steak house - the restaurant inside the hotel- and I dislike the fact that was not open buffet. It was a la carte and just some american dishes all of them too heavy for breackfast and consist minimum 3eggs. Fresh juice was very good, and a very special remark for the bowl with fresh berries; like everywhere in America coffee was owfull. I could recommend this hotel for all travelers in San Francisco but, eat otherwhere.

Reviews.Title: “Omni is always a nice place to stay in SFO”
Reviews.Author: DaveCalgary
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the omni for 4 nites in October 2011. We find the service at the hotel to be very good. Also they have the most comfortable beds anywhere.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, good location”
Reviews.Author: Kylie H
Reviews.Content: First time in San Francisco, would highly recommend the Omni, it is in a great location, is very homely and the staff are very helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Great Service”
Reviews.Author: Temuka
Reviews.Content: Stayed one night in the hotel and there was roadworks close by, the hotel did everything they could to keep the inconvenience of the roadworks noise away from the hotel guests. The location is perfect, close to where all the restaurants and bars, but far enough away to not to be too noisy!

Reviews.Title: “Great Service, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Sandbuilder
Reviews.Content: We arrived very late our first night, and after having dinner, we went to our room. Our first impression wasn't good. It was obvious that some stains had been removed from the carpet, leaving discolorations in the fabric. As it was late we decided to just go to bed and address it in the morning. However, we actually didn't even bring it up to the staff until our fourth day because we were overwhelmed with the quality of the service we received. We experienced the best room service ever based on the accuracy of the order, quality of the food and the delightful delivery. It was obvious they were always trying to provide little surprises with each order. From the muffins at breakfast to the imported bottled water at dinner they always "went the extra mile" to satisfy. Housekeeping was also outstanding. Our room was spotless every day. So when we finally did mention our first impression it wasn't such a big deal to us. Of course the manager assured us they would have moved us that first night if we had told them, but we were glad we didn't move. We loved the spaciousness and location of our room overlooking the Cable Car line on California St. We stayed 8 nights at the hotel and had a wonderful experience. The location is outstanding and the staff makes the experience exceptional. We will definitely stay at the Omni when we return.

Reviews.Title: “Gorgeous financial district setting”
Reviews.Author: italygoodness
Reviews.Content: The SFO Omni is more beautiful than most I've seen. Rooms are large and regal. Bathrooms feel spacious and lovely. Lobby is posh, feels opulent. We could tell that the doormen were shocked when we said we were taking the BART to the airport upon check out...probably not their typical clientele. Ryan Hurd in Catering/Events is amazing! I would send any of my friends or business affiliates to him for a wedding or special event. Front desk team all very friendly, helpful, and happy. Bell team - on it, fast, friendly, and very eager to please. The Champagne upon arrival was a delightful surprise, but my husband felt even more excited with the warm cider & gingerbread men cookies.

Reviews.Title: “Luxury?? How about ersatz”
Reviews.Author: KJO_11
Reviews.Content: Thankfully, this room didn't cost much as I won it through a website; now I see why. We checked out of the Westin St. Regis (std. room) to stay in the Presedential Suite at the Omni. What a mistake!!! They're out of everything you happen to need and we're not picky - how about coke and root beer???? No sheets for the crib, pulling teeth to get an on-time check-in and their food is average for a small mid-western city, let alone SF. Overall, I feel for some of the employees who do their best to make this otherwise, dressed-up 2-3 star, establishment running. Definitely would not recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay in SF”
Reviews.Author: AYinEP
Reviews.Content: We stayed here while attending a wedding and were very pleased with the choice. As others have said, this is a terrific location for seeing the city. We parked our car and never took it out. It's an easy walk to the places you'll want to see: Chinatown, Nob Hill, Union Square, North Beach, Coit Tower, etc. The staff is unfailingly friendly and helpful. The beds are very comfortable and the linens are crisp. Our room was bright and sunny and, though it faced California, I was never bothered by any noise, inside or out. In fact, it was hard to imagine that anyone else was in the hotel. The only negative that I can find is that, because it's in the Financial District, a lot of places are closed on the weekend. But, that's a very minor issue with this wonderful hotel. One hint is to join their loyalty club. It doesn't cost anything and affords you advantages like free wi-fi in your room and free newspapers delivered to your door.

Reviews.Title: “Best is SF”
Reviews.Author: JHFIII
Reviews.Content: I stay regularly at this Omni because of it's great central location and keep coming back because of the friendly service. If you want a particularly restful stay, ask for a room facing the back of the property, away from California and Montgomery. The cable cars running up and down California can make quite a racket at all hours.

Reviews.Title: “Nice rooms, attentive staff, good location”
Reviews.Author: SF94597
Reviews.Content: While the hotel is considered to be in the financial district, it is convenient to key tourist sites -with the added benefit of being in a less crowded area. I personally think walkable to key sites, however, public transportation readily available if desired. For me, location is key & I prefer this area to right in the middle of Union Square or Fisherman's Wharf area. Rooms are nice with expected amenities for a hotel of this class. Service is above par - everyone I encountered couldn't do enough to help.

Reviews.Title: “A reliable choice”
Reviews.Author: pierre d
Reviews.Content: Stayed there one week. Great services except sloppy doormen on arrival ( "Do you need some help?").Finally, we carried our luggages to the front desk. No problem but unexpected when you pay $ 300 a night. Front desk personnel is charming. Breakfast prices, tough in line with SF prices, are ridiculous : 50 to 60 dollars for 2 persons. Room service is cheaper...Great bar with huge windows on the street. Room was perfectly maintained, housekeeping is flawless. Classic decoration.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: Jan R
Reviews.Content: What a great find! This hotel has it all. Rooms are quiet, comfortable and very clean. All the staff were courteous and efficient. The desk staff were especially helpful with directions for getting around San Francisco. Hotel location is good with transport handy. It was easy to get transport to the world famous Fisherman's Wharf. Everything about the Omni says high quality for a reasonable price.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in Financial District”
Reviews.Author: Buckwilli
Reviews.Content: Spent a long weekend here and had a great time. Easy walk to Union Square and Chinatown. I read where people said they walked to Fisherman's Wharf. I believe it, but I didn't walk that far. Trolley car runs right in front of the hotel. Be sure to sign up for the Omni Select thing before you go so you get free wi-fi and complimentary morning beverages brought to your room. Rooms were very nice, but in an "older people" type of way: wallpaper, flat screen television in an old-school looking entertainment center, etc. Everyone we encountered was very helpful, especially doorman/bellman/concierge Darryl. Just FYI, for some reason, it is difficult to hail a cab in San Francisco. There is no "line-up runway" for taxis in front of the hotel, so it was occasionally hard to get a cab.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic !”
Reviews.Author: Hong_Kong_Star
Reviews.Content: Wow, we are very impressed !!! - highly efficient and extremely kind service (reservation, front desk, door men). These people are working hard to please the guests in a relaxed atmosphere, - the rooms (we had 2 rooms), very clean & comfy and so quiet, - easy late check-out, - loved the location (close to Chinatown and the cable car right there + plenty of restaurants and small cafes and shops), - delicious and healthy "a la carte" breafast. Quality and quantity.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, friendly and luxurious!”
Reviews.Author: nick22
Reviews.Content: Gorgeous hotel with an extremely friendly and attentive staff. Stayed here for Oracle OpenWorld and they were very helpful in directing me to restaurants, shopping, etc. Rooms were standard size with windows that opened (only 5 or 6 inches, but better than nothing!), but had very nice furnishings and decorations. I would definitely stay here again for business or pleasure.

Reviews.Title: “solid hotel - good location”
Reviews.Author: fsublume
Reviews.Content: The service was excellent and the rooms clean. Very nice bathroom/shower. 4/5.

Reviews.Title: “Trying hard, nice location”
Reviews.Author: nako51
Reviews.Content: Nice, but small rooms. Attendant and friendly staff...very service oriented and helpful. Their parking during the week is close to $50/day!!! Suggest parking across the street at Bank of America. Didn't appreciate the tall doorman ogling my daughter as we walked out. Overall, a nice place, but nothing spectacular.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel, not cheap tho”
Reviews.Author: Luke R
Reviews.Content: Me and my missus stayed here for 3 nights in October this year Here are my comments: great service, friendly staff clean hotel, well polished very comfy beds quite expensive at over Â£300 per night good location right next to a tram stop and chinatown just up the hill nice gym shame it has no pool the breakfast is good but should be at $30 per person I would definately go back

Reviews.Title: “Caution-Does it live up to its name?”
Reviews.Author: Clinton1
Reviews.Content: This is the type of hotel in the downtown area that as soon as you pull up we had a registration person, a luggage person and a valet all coming to us at one time asking questions. It was annoying. There was no teamwork. The check in was good and the bed was comfortable. We had trouble controlling the room temperature. The bathroom amenities were very nice. The concierge was helpful with restaurant recommendations. Bellman was very pleasant. The valet parking was very prompt and the guy was very nice. Upon checking out we brought to the front desk person's attention the trouble with the room temperature and all she said was "oh". Even when we got the request in the email or feedback, we mentioned the room temperature and got no basic response. Some staff was very friendly and some staff was very snippy. That is a training and follow up problem for management.

Reviews.Title: “Super Nice Hotel... Just has the best smell”
Reviews.Author: Bee2979
Reviews.Content: Hey travelers...first timer to San Fran and this was a great place to stay. The room was super nice and clean. I could have gotten a better view, but not complaining. The shower WAS TO DIE FOR... OMG. I spent most of my time in it. The Bed slept like heaven...better than my own. I had an accident the second day (fell off my bike). It still did not change how good I slept in that bed...and I had scrapped up my hands. Oh and speaking of...the hotel gave me a ton of bandaids and was super nice about my injuries. It was close to a ton of stuff. I ended up walking around to a lot of spots just by going a few blocks. Anytime I asked directions the people were happy to help and oh the smell. I am not sure what they clean that place with, but I swear, it was the best smelling hotel I have ever been in. I mean a Hotel, smelled like obsessively clean. I mean talk about sparkle and shine. I love it, go there, nice folks, clean spot, great bathrooms, nice smell, If you want fresh and clean and high standards without breaking the bank. Stay here!

Reviews.Title: “Very nice”
Reviews.Author: MacGIlligorilla
Reviews.Content: Stayed with our family of four and enjoyed the hotel very much. Ideally located - 3 blocks to shopping district, 1 block to china town, 3 blocks to italian restaurants on Columbus. Felt very safe in area which is mostly business people during the weekdays. Nice to be a bit away from crowds at Union Square area. Staff was very friendly, especially doormen who always had a smile and welcome back for our kids. Cookies and milk were delivered nightly to our room for our kids which they also loved. Room was very comfortable with complementary coffee in morning and bottled water in evening. Our room overlooked California street and cable cars but we didn't hear the traffic at all. Did not eat at the restaurant downstairs as was too fancy and pricey. Lots of other choices around the hotel for food.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: MJMJONCape
Reviews.Content: Tough to tell what the "right" location is, but this is as good as it gets. The OMNI is right on the cable car route...just step outside. It's also walkable to Union Square and even the Embarcardero (maybe 20 minutes). Plenty of eating options in the area as well. If you are a AAA member, they offer some great deals well below listed prices. First stop after checking in should be to see Lex, the concierge. He knows everything there is to know about SF...period, and is fun to listen to. He made a big difference in our visit ! This hotel provides first class luxury at less than half the price of the Fairmont.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel in a great location!”
Reviews.Author: FamfromVancouver
Reviews.Content: We've stayed in San Francisco a few times prior to this trip, and the Omni is definitely the best hotel experience we've had. We generally come to SF every year around the same time on account of a cycling event in Santa Rosa. This year, the hotel prices were exceptionally high due to a few events that coincided (a big Oracle convention along with Fleet Week), so we waited to book. The Omni ended up having a reasonable rate, and given the high Trip Advisor ranking, it seemed like a sure bet. We were not disappointed! The location of the Omni is perfect - a stone's throw from the Ferry Building and Chinatown, and a short walk to Union Square. It is a very safe area, not nearly as hectic as Union Square, which is sometimes a good thing! The bellman Adam was very helpful upon arrival and offered immediately to store the bike box and car seat for us. The room was on the smaller side, but very well appointed and clean. The linens were of high quality and the bed really comfortable. They provided our four year old with a back pack of activities, and also sent up milk and cookies each night, which was a really nice touch. The Nespresso machine was fabulous. As others have indicated, sign up for the loyalty program for free wi-fi and a complimentary beverage service in the morning. The fitness centre is clean and spacious. We didn't eat at the restaurant, but the hotel's concierge, John, was very helpful in making lots of suggestions, based on our wishes. Top notch service! We ended up dining at Webster's around the corner (the best meal we had all week in SF...) as well as the Tyler Florence restaurant just next to it...reservations are a must there! We will definitely be returning!

Reviews.Title: “Simply Excellent”
Reviews.Author: A_and_B_from_PA
Reviews.Content: Please note that we were fortunate to be able to stay here at a pretty reduced rate, so I am reviewing this as a bit of a bargain given the location. If I had paid $500/night, I might be thinking a bit differently. But with that said, we thoroughly enjoyed the extremely clean, quiet and comfortable environment at the Omni and the service was even better. Rainy day? They can't wait to provide an umbrella. Want directions? They can't wait to bring them. Need a restaurant that delivers late at night? No problem! The coffee, tea and newspaper service was right on time. This is not the place for those seeking a Residence Inn-type free breakfast or separate dining area, so keep that in mind. But for a couple seeking a great stay in a terrific location - it would be tough to beat. We are very veteran San Francisco travelers and this was at the top of our list.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great price, great location”
Reviews.Author: Shey07
Reviews.Content: This hotel is clean, central and a decent price. Fisherman's Wharf is a 20 min walk. Coit tower and lombard street are all within walking distance. The staff are friendly and helpful. I would stay at this hotel again. There are a couple of nice cafes for breakfast near the hotel, however note that on the weekends these are all closed.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay @ the Omni SF”
Reviews.Author: FamilyGuy2000
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Omni San Francisco Hotel for 2 nights in early Oct 2011. Originally this hotel was outside our price range though after a rather unpleasant night at another hotel near Fisherman's Wharf I called to see if they had a room. They did (and at a great price) so 30 minutes later the four of use (me, wife, 9yo & 5yo) were moving in. Our room was ready at 11am which was great, we had two double bed which worked for us. Our stay was over a Friday & Saturday, I suspect their less busy nights. The rooms were a good size and quite reflective of what was advertised on their website. The hotel is in what they call the Financial District which is a ghost town on the weekend for 1km in any direction. That said Union Square and Chinatown are within easy walking distance - 10 to 15 min. The restaurant was very expensive so we ate at a great steakhouse just down the road Tadish Grill (they claim to be SF oldest restaurant) which was excellent. We had breakfast included in our package which was 4 x $30 vouchers which easily fed the four of us. I can recommend at stay at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous and welcoming”
Reviews.Author: Robin G
Reviews.Content: This is the most accommodating hotel as far as service. The concierge knows anything and everything about Downtown San Francisco! Our room was a corner suite on the fifth floor, with a lot of traffic noise, but it was spacious and clean. Only complaint is I made a reservation for a room on a higher floor not on the street side and that is not what we were given. Would have enjoyed a more quiet room for the little bit of time we were in it. The location was perfect for us as well. Must say though the street cars run on their own time. We walked 36 blocks along the street car line around 3 PM, hoping to jump on, and only saw one go by that was packed. We bought a day pass and could only use it once...though no reflection on the Omni.

Reviews.Title: “concierge is the best”
Reviews.Author: calendergirl
Reviews.Content: Concierge is the best. Lex, Head of Concierge is a legend.We hadn't planned this part of our trip very well but we needn't of worried as he was a mined of information. Bit of advice, if you want to go to Alcatraz book before you go. The trips were booked up for three weeks in advance. The location is excellent with the street cars going straight past this lovely hotel. Some stop on the corner opposite. The staff at the Omni were some of the friendliest we have ever encountered from one of the 'big chains' of hotels. Great comfortable base.

Reviews.Title: “Super location in downtown San Francisco”
Reviews.Author: Scroggie
Reviews.Content: A gracious hotel that went out of their way to see to our needs during our stay in San Francisco. Staff was outstanding- quite helpful for our 1st SF visit of places to see & dine. Always had fresh fruit & drink in the lobby. Enjoyed the bar where they made excellent mixed drinks. Trolley line was right outside the door, F line at waterfront was only several blocks and the BART was only 2 blocks away. Buy their 3-day pass to save money on transportation.

Reviews.Title: “San Fransisco in the fall!”
Reviews.Author: Robinkennedyoshio
Reviews.Content: One o fthe best weekens of my life! Began our journey on an overnight floght from Hawaii forgetting that asking for an early check in might have been a good idea. The staff at The Omni were so gracious and accomodating! They gave is a room by ten am and what a room it was. Beautiful bathrooms, bedding and decor. The hotel lobby and restaurant were very nice as well. The bar was a good time any tme of the day. The hotel is centrally located just blocks a way frm Chinatown and Little Italy. The hotel even knows the restaurants that will deliver! You can get anywhere with pubic transportation. Suggest buying the three day mini pass that allows you to jump on the Bart, The Muni, The Cable cars or the Bus. No rental car needed. Parking is expensive and hard to come by. I would stay at this hotel every time. Enjoy!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location and service”
Reviews.Author: dyrhan
Reviews.Content: A friend of mine and I stayed here from 28.07. - 01.08.2011. The location is excellent, and service is outstanding. Location in middle of town, very close to Chinatown. Highly recommended!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel with great service!”
Reviews.Author: ajpickard
Reviews.Content: I really enjoyed the Omni it is a first class place. Bob's is a great spot especially the bar. We got special treatment because it was our anniversary! They sent up chocolate covered strawberries and a special turn down service with a rose. It is also is a great location you can jump on the cable car right in front of the hotel. Short walk to several great spots including China Town and the Ferry building. We ate at Wayfare Tavern and Bix both within a short walk. Also great views of the Transamerican Pyramid. Only down side was I couldn't get good wireless on the 17th floor.

Reviews.Title: “Honeymoon couple from Scotland”
Reviews.Author: jane p
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 2 nights in this hotel as part of out honeymoon. After a 3hr delay at the airport it was great to arrive at our room to bottles of water and Strawberries covered in chocolate. Hotel staff couldnt do enough for you. Hotel was amazing would definatley stay here again if we are back in San Fran.

Reviews.Title: “Best Service and Amazing Staff”
Reviews.Author: JudyJudyJudyH
Reviews.Content: I knew of the Omni from "Oprah". "Guests on the Oprah show stay at the Omni". I stayed her with my husband for three nights. The front desk staff were amazing and ZAW was especially helpful and made us feel right away we chose the right place. The concierge LEX was so helpful in finding a restaurant for us for our anniversary as well as getting theater tickets. We just asked and he delivered. I don't know the name of the maids but they were so meticulous and left everything spotless and they even wrote us a personal note wishing us well. I would highly recommend The OMNI for those visiting San Francisco on business or leisure. I have stayed at the W, the Fairmont and the Palace. The Omni wins for service and the total package.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing service from beginning to end!”
Reviews.Author: rphmama
Reviews.Content: We usually stay at boutique hotels... but this time we were travelling with our 2 children (5 and 2)... and were looking for a reasonably priced hotel. After researching tripadvisor and cross-referencing with other websites such as raveable.com (which is good at calulating bang for the bug and a good source of bedbug reports), I decided to book this hotel. Not only I was not dissapointed, I was so pleased with this place. I called the hotel directly for a reservation and I got a lower rate than all of the websites I checked. The person who made the reservation was so nice and accomodating, it made me feel like it was going to be a nice stay. I have to say this hotel's costumer service and the staff's friendliness has been one of the best I have ever encountered. The doorman had opened the door as we approached the hotel from several feet away. As we entered the lobby the receptionist had a huge smile on his face and had little gifts for the kids as we checked in. The room was immaculately clean as well as the bathroom. I believe the hotel recently underwent a soft renovation. I only wish they had changed the carpet to something else.. nevertheless, it was kept very clean. The hotel has a florentine style, with a beautiful lobby and a great restaurant downstairs. The location was also wonderful, equidistant from union square to embarcadero, and north beach. and chinatown. We walked everywhere from there and loved it.! We were very happy with our stay here and would definitely return again.

Reviews.Title: “An Outstanding Hotel with A Great Location and Staff”
Reviews.Author: sscroggs311
Reviews.Content: My stay at The Omni was first rate all the way. Easy check in and express check out made the business end a breeze. The room was top flight, yet California Street is a busy street so expect some noise, it wasn't distracting. Right next to the trolley, movement around town was easy and it was only five blocks to the Embarcadaro and Bart was even closer. Most impressive was the staff. The front desk was helpful to a fault. There was no request to small, either Muni passes or tours, I just had to ask and it was done. The room was spotless and kept that way. The Ferry market is walkable as is the "F" line is to Fishermans Wharf. The Front Desk even had the tree day passport that works on the trolley, "F" line and all the buses. Bob's Steakhouse and Bob's Bar are also first rate. weekend rates are a steal. Put this place on your bucket list, you won't be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel, superb location!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Olatina
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Omni on aug 4th for 3 nights, and our choice couldnt be better!!! amazing staff, family friendly and spotless, chic, great location(close to Chinatown, montgomery subway st. and to the ferry building), and particularly great service! My daughter received a backpack with toys and amenities and she loved feeling welcome, we got cookies and milk every evening, and the turndown service every evening is brilliant, you feel pampered and treated like a queen. The rooms are bit small, althouth we booked for a deluxe room, the decorations are classic and european style, we got a room with an amazing view,at the top of the hotel. They have complementary tea and fruits at the lobby, and the hotel is very silent, the beds are ultracomfy and thepillows and bedding are so clean and divine. The only cons i founded in this hotel is the restaurant,the food is very good but ultra expensive, no worthy to throw the money that way in only breakfast, there are many places around that are cheaper, but yet,not that cheap, its always San Francisco,an expensive city. anyway, we loved it and it's really close to the Ferry building and tourist attractions, also to chinatown and its colorful life and good restaurants. I recommend it to families because its totally suitalbe for childrens, not easy to find in the city!!! We miss you Omni!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Every hotel staff member is extremely helpful”
Reviews.Author: Julie S
Reviews.Content: We decided on July 3rd to fly to San Francisco on July 6th for an eight day trip down the California coast leaving out of Los Angeles. There was no time to plan for anything, other than a rental car and a hotel for the first couple of nights. Randomly chose the Omni after reading some reviews and what a great choice. Yes, this is more of a business hotel because of the location, but honestly, staying down by the piers would just be too touristy for us. The hotel has a very helpful and knowledgeable concierge, but honestly, every staff member knows their "stuff" and is more than willing to spend time informing you. The doorman would ask "where are you headed? Do you need directions? Ideas?" etc. Perfect for us Floridians who had no idea other than the Frommers book I read on the plane there. The hotel is spotless, the rooms are very nice, the decorations (fresh flowers huge bouquets, chandelier, etc.) are wonderful. Took the train from the airport, and with their help via phone, walked the two blocks at nine p.m. and found the hotel. Called before hand asking for a roll away bed for my daughter and they had the bed all set up and room waiting for us. Starving, the front desk recommended Tadich Grill which is a half block to your left out the front door. Wonderful historical restaurant with great seafood. You are very close to China Town here, but better than that, get up at 7 a.m. Saturday morning and head left out the door to the Farmers Market before the crowds show up. Best market I've been to in a long time, and bring your camera! Fresh flowers, produce, types of tomatoes I've never heard of, seafood, organic poultry, crafts, muscisians, breakfast and all right on the water. On the way, past hundreds of women in pink for a breast cancer walk along with a bike cop assisting the walk. He wore his cop uniform with a pink tutu and pink rabbit ears! Only in San Francisco. It was great. The cable car runs right outside the hotel and there is a public parking garage for the church on the corner to park at that is much cheaper than the hotel parking. Great start for a wonderful last minute vacation before we sent our daughter off to college! Highly recommend the Omni and would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Exceptional...”
Reviews.Author: ckf62
Reviews.Content: This location is perfect, as well as the service. It's a beautiful hotel and Bob's Steakhouse was excellent. Room service was quick and the food was the right temperature. A must stay while in San Francisco.

Reviews.Title: “Best Hotel I've stayed at”
Reviews.Author: Damian D
Reviews.Content: What a fantastic hotel. Every member of staff we encountered from the doorman and reception staff were incredibly friendly and helpful. Laura Campi, who was on Reception upon our arrival gave excellent service, including giving advice on local restaurants, printing off some menus and also handing over a business card to our 4 yr old son and informing him to hand it over to a Policeman if he ever got separated from us. This hotel also provided our 4 yr old son with a welcome backpack full of goodies. Our son wore the backpack contstantly until we got back home from our trip and the items in the pack kept him entertained. The hotel also sent up each night a couple of cookies and a glass of milk for him and it is touches like this which will forever make this hotel a standout. Nothing was too much trouble for any of the staff. The location was excellent, near the Ferry Building and the BART station + also being able to pick up a cable car.

Reviews.Title: “Staff reflects customer-centric focus. Rooms and beds are comfortable.”
Reviews.Author: TravelingAllCreation
Reviews.Content: The Omni San Francisco represents an ideal choice for business travelers who happen to have a meeting or a satellite office in the financial district. Focused on providing responsive customer service, the Omni staff is friendly and pro-active in addressing the needs of guests. You will find the rooms are sufficiently large and the beds are of high quality - with thick, soft comforters. The bathrooms are more than adequate in size and quality. From a location perspective, the Omni is well situated in the heart of downtown and within easy walking distance to Chinatown, the Bay, and Pac Bell Park (the San Francisco Giants stadium). One recommendation for those wanting to save a few $. The subway (BART) runs from the airport to Montgomery station for $8, which is only about 5 blocks from the hotel (a comfortable walk). This is much cheaper than the $40 you will pay for a cab, for those who cannot expense their travel. While I can offer no drawbacks to the rooms or staff, there is some street noise that filters into the rooms, esp when sirens go off or horns are used. This is not unique to the Omni, but since it is situated on a busy corner of downtown, you get a lot of traffic - even in the evening. I will also point out that the rooms do not have particularly nice views. You can see other tall buildings and the streets of the city, but not the Bay nor the broader skyline. Not a big deal, but definitely not a romantic setting. Speaking of romance, this is not the hotel to bring your spouse for that special occassion. While a perfect stay, in many ways, for the business traveler, there is nothing about this hotel that lends itself to romance or having a memorable experience with your true-love. A steak restaurant is housed on the main floor of the hotel, and provides a solid, though not spectacular, dining option for those who arrive late and do not want to go out for dinner. The steaks come with side dishes (do not need to purchase ala carte), and are offered at a reasonable price. Other dining options include several high quality and authentic Asian restaurants in nearby Chinatown.

Reviews.Title: “Great base for a city visit”
Reviews.Author: LesleyLu
Reviews.Content: Friendly staff greeted us and the hotel is very impressive when you arrive. We were given an upgraded room but it had a view of the side of a building and the sink was cracked. Overall we were very pleased, but it was let down by the small details

Reviews.Title: “Lives up to it's reputation for service excellence”
Reviews.Author: Englishrobs
Reviews.Content: Stayed here with my wife and niece at the end of our US trip. Had read good things about Omni before and our visit did not disappoint. All staff excellent. Great location, enjoyed Bob's. Milk and cookies for my niece every night was an excellent touch.

Reviews.Title: “Unparalleled Service”
Reviews.Author: ysuindy
Reviews.Content: My 16 year-old son and I spent four nights in early August at the Omni on our summer baseball trip. The Omni was easily the favorite of our five hotel, 12 night trip. The customer service at The Omni was unparalleled and sets it apart from other hotels, both on this trip and in my overall travel. It was nice to show my son what world class hotel service looks like. Reservations staff, front desk personnel, the bell staff and most prominently the concierges were all great to work with. The excellent customer service started even before we checked in. I had been checking various websites for several months before we left on our trip, looking for bargains and good deals. When I saw a reference to a $199 per night rate for The Omni, with full cancellation rights up until the day before check-in, I immediately made the reservation, recognizing this was a great price for a highly rated hotel in San Francisco. I was quite surprised when my credit card bill arrived about 7 weeks later with a charge for the full four night cost of my reservation. I made a call to the hotel and left a message with the reservations staff. Within an hour they had called back to tell me that the rate I had booked was a full prepayment rate with no cancellation rights. They immediately told me that I had apparently booked the first day the rate was on the website and that it originally had been erroneously set up without prepayment requirements. The offer was corrected the day after I made my reservation and an automated billing program searching for the package I bought without a charge, billed me for it. I was told that a full credit had already been issued to my account and the package name was changed to keep me from being charged again, but the price and all other components of my package would be honored. I had expected a fight, but The Omni clearly recognized my reservation did not state prepayment and they immediately admitted it. It was nice to not only receive information that my credit was issued, but to also be told how it happened and what was done to make sure it did not happen again - for me that is very important and is a sign of good policies. We flew in to SFO around Noon on a Saturday. We foolishly took BART from the airport in to The City. I say foolishly simply because we spent too much time getting to the BART station and then waiting for the train. We should have taken a cab. We lost an hour of sight-seeing opportunities. Having said that, the walk from the Montgomery Street BART/Muni station was easy, even with our 12 days of luggage. The walk was generally flat. The Omni sits at the base of the climb up California Street that eventually reaches Nob Hill. Our request was for a room on a high floor away from the elevator. Because we arrived prior to check-in time, not all rooms had been cleaned. We were offerered and took a room on the 9th floor, near the elevator. Our concerns about noise near the elevator were unfounded. The room was very quiet and we enjoyed the convenience of being close to the elevators. We joined the Select Guest program when I made the reservation. Members receive free wireless internet in the room as well as free morning beverages. We had orange juice delivered each morning â€“ very nice to have. Cookies and milk were brought each evening â€“ a nice touch although we were rarely in the room when they were delivered. Maintaining a comfortable temperature in the room was easy, the beds were very comfortable. The bathroom was appropriately sized, towels were plush, toiletries were very nice. The in room safe was large enough for my netbook and my sonâ€™s Mac. As I noted above the concierges were incredible to work with. All of the concierges were very helpful with directions (to the Golden Gate Bridge, AT&T Park, Alcatraz Cruise, etc) and dining recommendations. We want to single out Juan in particular for his assistance and interest in what we were doing. Juan even recognized us on the street and called to us by name as we were returning to the hotel and he was heading home for the night. After a poor experience with a concierge in San Diego, it was nice to deal with competent, engaging staff at The Omni. We enjoyed the location of The Omni â€“ an easy walk from BART/Muni, right on the California line cable car and within a few blocks of many bus routes. You can buy a Muni pass in the baggage claim areas at SFO - we used the passes often. We walked to Union Square as well as to the Ferry Building. The primary purpose of our trip was baseball â€“ we saw three Giants games. AT&T Park was about a 20 minute walk from the hotel. We took the Muni to the games, walked back. The area around the hotel was not busy late night after the games. We did not feel threatened at all, but we did have our wits about us â€“ paying attention to where we were going, watching who else was out and on at least one occasion crossing the street to the other side just to be safe. There are not many restaurants near the hotel â€“ ask for recommendations from the concierge staff. We did not do this the first few nights we were there, we wish we did. Consider the Royal Exchange, a few blocks away. We had an excellent early dinner before a Giants game there. We rented a car at the Budget counter in the Hyatt Embarcadero after checking out of the hotel. The bell staff held our bags until we could get back with the car â€“ we loaded up in front of the hotel and set off for Santa Cruz. I really do not have anything negative to say about our stay. I have stayed in more luxurious hotels and in larger rooms and suites â€“ some may stay the physical plant of The Omni is not a five star hotel and I donâ€™t think I could argue the point. But the service is most assuredly five star quality. I would absolutely try to stay at The Omni if I returned to San Francisco â€“ but price would be a consideration. I am not sure how much I would pay to stay here â€“ I would pay more to stay here â€“ but I canâ€™t say for sure how much more.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay!”
Reviews.Author: TxTxAustin
Reviews.Content: This is an absolutely fabulous location in the city. The room was clean and the concierge was always spot-on with recommendations for restaurants and museums. The only problem I had was my card was charged too much, but the mistake was promptly corrected. Everyone from the doormen, front desk staff, to the housekeeping dept. were incredibly friendly and helpful! Will return for sure!!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: lana2004
Reviews.Content: The hotel is centrally located, but pretty walkable to many points of interest. It's also a few blocs from the BART, so you can get anywhere in the City pretty quickly. Beds were so comfortable! The staff was extremely helpful and polite. It's not a boutique hotel, so it doesn't feel terribly unique, but it's an Omni, so what can you expect? Overall, I loved it!

Reviews.Title: “The hotel has it all: great location, service, and facilities”
Reviews.Author: greetingsfromdenver
Reviews.Content: When I booked our stay at the Omni, I did so because of its location and trip advisor reviews. It may have been the best hotel decision I have ever made. The price was very competitive with the same class hotels in the Union Square area. The location was perfect-an easy walk to Union Square shopping, the Ferry Building, Embarcadero, public transportation, great restaurants, etc. Despite an abundance of homeless people in San Francisco's downtown area, the area by the hotel did not seem to have that problem. The hotel lobby and the room were exquisite. Our room was on the 15th floor and had a partial view of the city. The bed was very comfortable. The room had a desk and a chair with an ottoman. The closet was fairly large and included a safe and bathrobes. Everything was very clean. The staff was great. They brought in cookies and milk every afternoon for my son. We requested a cot for my son because there was only 1 king size bed in the room (my mistake when booking). The cot was almost like a rolling twin size bed so my son slept very comfortably. On a Sunday night, when we asked the front desk staff for dining suggestion, instead of steering us to the hotel restaurant, they recommended a nearby tavern that was great (Wayfare Tavern, owned by Tyler Florence). I suppose that, had I rented a car, I would have complained about the parking fees. However, it is like that everywhere in downtown San Francisco. You really do not need a car there. The public transportation can take you pretty much anywhere.

Reviews.Title: “Great service with comfort”
Reviews.Author: RitaTS
Reviews.Content: Nice place to stay right at edge of financial district. Hotel staff was quite friendly and helpful. Room clean and bed quite comfortable. Trolley service right outside door, though you might be waiting awhile for it to arrive. Location is on California Ave. which is convenient to Union Square & short walk to BART and F-line. No need for taxi service.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing service and location”
Reviews.Author: MYF1007
Reviews.Content: I took my 9-yr-old son there for a weekend getaway and the staff treated him like a VIP. He received an Omni Kid's Pack upon arrival and they delivered milk and cookies to our room that evening. He was so excited! The staff, especially the concierge, spent extra time giving us pointers on places to visit and drew everything out on a map, including how to use the trains and trolleys. We probably would have been lost without it! The hotel is beautiful and centrally located in the downtown area, just a short ride away from Fisherman's Wharf and Ghiradelli Square. It was perfect so that we weren't around all the crowds and traffic. We'll definitely be back!

Reviews.Title: “Great staff and big room. Watch out for parking charges”
Reviews.Author: MPTO
Reviews.Content: Great location, big room and friendly staff (thanks to Lex for the history lesson). However, if you are parking the costs are high, $48 per day during the week.

Reviews.Title: “Magnificent!!”
Reviews.Author: JackieBarnet
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Omni as part of a wedding party. The facilities were very good, the hotel well situated, food good, no complaints at all. However, the customer care from everyone we dealt with was exemplary. One of our party was taken ill and we received fantastic personal attention and kindness from all the staff, especially the reception staff, doorman, security and room service staff. Everyone, without exception was friendly and went out of their way to be helpful, way beyond the call of duty! This is a lovely hotel - all our wedding guests in the party commented on how much they enjoyed staying there. We will certainly return.

Reviews.Title: “Delivered”
Reviews.Author: grimes921
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located in the financial district and we were able to get a $290/night room for $200/night due to a " Labor Day Weekend " sale. The hotel staff was exceptional from the maids to the concierge. The famed cable cars run right in front of the hotel and add a nice touch to the atmosphere. My wife and I walked everywhere. Be sure to wear comfortable shoes. Chinatown and the North Beach Italian sections are a short walk away and the restaurant options are great.

Reviews.Title: “Satisfied Guest”
Reviews.Author: 1CrazyTraveler
Reviews.Content: I want to start of by saying we have stayed at the Omni in San Diego (newer) so I was a little (a lot) weary of staying at this location. I am a complete germaphobe and typically travel with my own sheets and towel, but I didn't this time around. We stayed in room 1305, no view of anything interesting (unless you want to stare into offices) but overall the room was clean (which is very important). The only exception were a few things I didn't notice until the last day (strange dripping on wall by desk, dirty lamp shade and mold on shower curtain). On the upside, housekeeping was very good during our stay and we love the little perks of being Omni Select Guests ie. free internet, coffee/juice in AM, local paper! Overall a pleasant trip and staff was really friendly, we would stay again (just request a room with a view)! Additional side note: don't go to bar, very expensive and bartender did not know how to make drinks listed in menu! At least not well!

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding service”
Reviews.Author: irina089
Reviews.Content: Chose this hotel based on good reviews from trip advisor. Stayed for 2 nights with toddler. On our 2nd night they brought complimentary milk & cookies for my daughter, this was a very nice touch. Overall a nice place to stay. Highly recommended. The only drawback are very small windows.

Reviews.Title: “not quite a 5 star by my standards”
Reviews.Author: kikivancouver
Reviews.Content: We just got back from a long weekend at the Omni. I will start by saying that I spend many hours deliberating TA- reading reviews on what hotels to choose and so far every one we have picked over the last few years based on recommendations from all you travellers out there from Prague to Chicago to Seattle has been pretty accurate. Thanks! So that leaves me without words on the Omni as I am not quite sure how to review this hotel. I suppose I am feeling a bit guilty about not being totally blown away. I think I was expecting much more considering its status on TA in the top 5 hotels in SF. We have stayed at many 5 star hotels and this was not one of them. First the service was very good- i commend them highly on this. Everyone from the doorman, to wait staff, to front desk and to housekeeping was very good- almost over the top. If this is what you are looking for then you will be happy. Also the location is pretty central too. If this is your first time to SF it will be good for a jumping off point. Now the tough part- the rooms were very small and a bit tired looking. I appreciate they are going for a Victorian Theme- but it need a bit of updating/refresh to make take it from dowdy to posh....what I would expect of 5 star. There was nothing about the room that spoke of a 5 star or set it apart- for example size, over the top bed, nice bath, view, or a great lobby bar, that kind of stuff. If i was traveling on business and needed to be in downtown SF I would stay again. But I would not return for a weekend getaway destination. I have a feeling that the Omni is one of those hotels that has been coasting on a long reputation of being good- but not great. i will give it a 4 but not a 5.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful!”
Reviews.Author: italnbull
Reviews.Content: We were welcomed with chocolate covered strawberries, a yellow rose on the bed and a nice note welcoming us! That being said the customer service was fabulous! Welcoming, friendly, very accommodating! The only drawback was trying to eat after 8-9, and the room service charges. But I DO recommend the Greek yogurt with honey in the morning. If you are a loyalty member you will get free wifi and a free morning beverage.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: IrishPaddy123
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Omni for a few nights as part of our trip in August 2011. All in all, this is a wonderful hotel. We got upgraded to a suite on checkin, which was very pleasant and the Nespresso machine in the room was a nice touch. Every staff member gave impeccable service, from the front desk, to the valet parker, to the restaurant and bar staff. I have only ever seen such a cohesive bunch of hotel workers in one hotel proir to this. We had dinner in both Bob's steak and chop house and the bar on different nights. Again, the food and service were superb. The Omni is not cheap, but then again, you certainly get what you pay for. One disappointment is the rather pokey business centre (Yes they do offer free boarding card printing) but the cost of using the internet borders on extortion.

Reviews.Title: “I couldn't give it an 'average,' but very good isn't quite right, either!”
Reviews.Author: ASM1962
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Omni a total of five nights. We were traveling with young children, and had requested a connecting room. As always, we would not have booked there if this wasn't a possibility. During our first leg of the journey, there was no problem. We had two lovely, connecting rooms, and the service was genial. We were struck by how expensive the restaurant was; we decided right away not to eat there if we could avoid it (and with the culinary delights of San Fran beckoning, didn't mind that too much). However, the one breakfast we did eat there was no fun. It took a while just to get water, and even longer to place our order (and even longer to get the food!). Our sweet waitress apologized profusely, and even management admitted to being very busy. (Please remember this was the week Hurricane Irene was traveling up the E. Coast, and many people were stranded.) When the food did arrive, it was wrong--my daughter's order was completely different, and mine was not what I'd been told it would be, even after very specific questioning. We also had a dinner there after being delayed one night, and it was okay. If you DO go to the restaurant (and you probably shouldn't), stick with the steaks, which are very good. Anyway, we had plans to check back in to the Omni on our return leg--like our initial reservations, these had been made two months in advance. Because of the hurricane (we live in NJ), we had to add another night to our reservation. That was all done with no problem. But when we checked back in, we were informed (after a lot of hemming and hawing) that we did not have connecting rooms. I asked why, and was told that it was OUR fault, that when we'd extended our stay, we'd forfeited our rooms--though no one told us this upfront, and it seemed really weird, like we were somehow being penalized for booking an extra night!!! At any rate, they offered to pay for one of the room, and told us we'd be moved to connecting rooms the next day (after having to pack and repack for our trip so often, by then, I could barely imagine doing it again). So, while i was far from happy, I took that as a gesture of good will... Then we got into our non-connecting rooms (meaning one adult would, of course, have to stay with one child). And guess what? One of those rooms had only a King bed--meaning an adult would have to sleep with one of the kids. Not only that, but the room we were given was pretty bad--right above the street, right above the entrance to the restaurant, dirty carpeting, cramped, etc. (NOTE: If you stay here, request high floors. Though the financial district is pretty dead at night and on weekends, it sits at the intersection of two very busy streets.) Again, after the manager did initially blame us for the problem, the hotel in general did try to make it up to us. They even paid for that regrettable breakfast mentioned above. But it felt pretty bad to be spending so much money there, to have done all OUR homework, and to be treated so badly. Furthermore, there wasn't a lot of value-added to this hotel. It would have been nice to have, for instance, an alternative, more casual, LESS expensive dining alternative (and forget about room service--it was absurd). I see they are trying to lure more families with the cookies and milk at night and the little backpacks (which, frankly, were kind of babyish for my 7 and 10 year old).

Reviews.Title: “SF Gem!!”
Reviews.Author: tifferst
Reviews.Content: From the morning coffee/tea/juice in your room to the apples in the lobby in the mid-afternoon it is all of the extras at make this hotel a true joy and respite in the middle of a bustling city. Excellent walkable and safe location in SF. I will stay nowhere else if possible next time in San Francisco.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, hard on the chequebook if you have a family”
Reviews.Author: Calgaryfamily65
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a three night stay here. The service was outstanding, perhaps the friendliest non-obsequious staff we have ever encountered. Without exception, they were pleasant to deal with.The rooms are clean, quiet and nicely appointed. Free internet and the usual trappings if you join their customer loyalty program. We have three children and had to get two rooms which made for an expensive trip. It would have been nice to have a family option that was a little cheaper. Otherwise it is an elegant hotel, well located, with exceptional service.

Reviews.Title: “Helpful, friendly people”
Reviews.Author: WildcatNZ
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Omni because of past trip advisor reviews. Everything was correct the location was near to Union Square, near to the Ferry Buildings right in the cente of the city. We had a room on the upper floors and it was very quiet, a great size and very comfortable bed. 5 out of 5 stars for me and we would definitely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, great location, amazing staff!”
Reviews.Author: TO-ski-mom
Reviews.Content: My family and I stayed at the Omni for 6 nights in August 2011. The hotel staff was attentive, VERY friendly and quite helpful. The location could not be better! It is a much better location than staying in Union Square where the construction during the day makes it noisy and the crowds at night make it noisy. That being said, the OMNI (and our room) was directly across the street from buildings doing MAJOR construction and jackhammering very early in the morning...and on a SATURDAY morning (like 6am!!!|). But other than a few early morning wake-ups we had a lovely time. Just try and ask for a room on a high floor or not facing the construction. Also, bar fridge is very small and in inconvenient place -- makes it difficult to have your own water bottles, etc, Also, if you are travelling with a few other family members, drawer space is limited. **Suggestion: If you need a cab they are sometimes hard to find as SF is definitely NOT NYC!! But the nice OMNI doormen are amazing at getting one for you! Never met such friendly staff!!

Reviews.Title: “Definitely made a right choice!”
Reviews.Author: finn1194
Reviews.Content: Stayed here after reading the great reviews and im glad to say that we made the right choice! Our room was fantastic.. they were clean, well kept and had great comfortable beds! All the hotel staff were great.. they were all ready to help and advise with anything we needed which made our stay that much better! Booked at tigerhotels.co.uk. The hotel was in a great location which was a definate plus for us! we were able to leave our hotel and have a number of restaurants etc within walking distance, and anything too far to walk was only a short cab ride away! We really enjoyed our stay here and I would definately recommend others to stay here!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location, would definitely stay again!”
Reviews.Author: PattiS108
