Reviews.Content: I went with my husband to spend s quick weekend with my husband. I had never been to SF and did a lot of research on hotels. I finally decided on the Omni based mostly on the reviews here. We were not disappointed. I did request an upper level room, which did cut down on potential street noise, but don't open the windows at night! The street cleaners are still very loud, but with the windows closed it was completely quiet and we slept well. The room was clean and completely adequate for our short weekend. We werent going to spend much tine there anyway. We arrived late on were hungry and dressed very casually from our flight. The concierge was able to help us with a fantastic local place to eat just a block away. The little alley is filled with restaurants, a real hidden gem! We were able to walk to the train, the bus, Chinatown, and Union Square. There may not have been as much right at the front door, versus staying right in Union Square, but we found we were happy with the quiet location, and everything was still easy accessible. The hotel restaurant, Bob's Steak and Chop House, is very good. You can't go wrong there. If we ever return to SF I won't have to do all that research, we will stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “good location and services”
Reviews.Author: Em70
Reviews.Content: We spent 3 nights in San Francisco Omni Hotel. The location is only 3 blocks from Union Square and the shopping area, and just in front the business.financial district. Room was spacious but a bit "old" and probably will need to renovate rooms . Concierge was very supportive. Wifi is complimentary if you become "omni selected guest" member. For breakfast, there are several starbucks around the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: SouthwestFans
Reviews.Content: Very nice stay in a fun part of town. I received a great rate for a Friday night stay through jetsetter.com. The door men and desk personnel were quite friendly. Rooms were clean and warmly decorated. Comfortable bed. The only thing I didn't have was a guest book or menu in the room that describes the amenities of the hotel, in-room dining, etc. So, I wasn't sure if they even offered room service, until I called the front desk - which they did. It was delivered within 30 minutes - their guarantee. I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Incredible service, good accommodations”
Reviews.Author: muttger
Reviews.Content: The service here was incredible. All the staff worked very hard to be helpful and went beyond expectations in many cases. I left my laptop computer charger behind in the room when we checked out and it was sent to me within a couple of days. The concierge and other front desk staff were always eager to answer any questions and to provide thorough information (although a couple of times it was not entirely correct). Staff greets you by name. The rooms were plush and furnishings somewhat traditional with a luxury feel. . There are a few issues with noise - the voices from the hallway carry quite a bit and you can quite clearly hear discussions and kids playing in the hallway. This was the only thing close to a deal breaker. The in room safe did not accommodate my 13 inch Mac Laptop The bathroom was a nice size but our sliding door was noisy so using this early in the morning or late at night disturbed others in the room. The shower water pressure was low and it was iffy to get hot water. The select guest program (which is free) was amazing - complimentary breakfast beverage, newspaper and wireless internet. Unlike a lot of other hotels there were no unexpected charges/costs - really refreshing! Fitness room had good quality cardio and a few weight machines and a free weight area. The location is good. Walking distance to Union Square, Ferry Building, Chinatown and North Beach also close to public transportation. I would highly recommend this hotel if the above few issues are not an issue for you.

Reviews.Title: “Not as perfect as expected”
Reviews.Author: ks_bazhenova
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel in SF for the 2-night stay after Hawaii getaway, before flying home. It was rated as Best Luxury hotel by Tripadvisor at this time, so I expected something special. The location of the hotel is very good - close to the center and main attractions, but the hotel itself is not as perfect. The interior does not look brand new & fresh, the room was quite small (compared to Fairmont Heritage hotel we stayed in before the trip to Hawaii = for the same price we got 5 times more space there). The view we got from the room - was a brick wall. There were no slippers & bathrobes (in a 5-star hotel!) in our room and it took ages for the staff to bring them, when we asked. We were waken up at 7am every morning, because the cleaning staff was talking loudly in the corridor outside our room in chinese - there is very bad noise isolation. But the thing we liked least is the service: not personalized, not attentive, long queues. The concierge was gone each day at 6 or 7 pm - and there was no one to help us with the restaurant booking, etc. in the eve. And finally, when we asked the staff to check us in for our flight - they've sent us to the PC in the corner of the lobby with a queue. no comments. I would recommend to choose Fairmont hotel instead - for almost the same price you will surely get a better room & service.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient and welcoming hotel in the heart of San Francisco”
Reviews.Author: Glucan
Reviews.Content: My travels have taken me to San Francisco many times in the past, but this is the first time that I stayed in the Omni. Tripadviser reviews for the Omni pretty much say it all. It's an excellent hotel, ideally located in the heart of San Francisco. The hotel staff are warm and welcoming. Juan was particularly helpful. All of his recommendations were spot on. The room was spotless and well appointed. I particularly liked the convenience of the Omni. It's a short walk from the Omni to Chinatown or Union Square with easy access to just about any place in San Francisco via taxi or cable car. There's not much more to say other than I'll stay at the Omni on my next trip to Frisco.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay, very comfrotable rooms"”
Reviews.Author: Buckeye37
Reviews.Content: I had two rooms for a weekend trip with some friends for my 40th birthday. Rooms are very clean, updated, and stylish. Average size rooms, but quite and comfy. The staff was great and very helpful. Bob's Steakhouse has a nice bar if you want to catch a couple innings of your favorite team or grab a snack. Location is perfect. Right in the middle of all the areas. No complaints at all.

Reviews.Title: “Surprisingly friendly for a large hotel”
Reviews.Author: Travel4105
Reviews.Content: Stayed 4 nights in mid july with my family. I expected the normal 4 star hotel in a downtown area, but I was surprised of the level of friendliness and service. It started already when we checked-in and continued throughout our stay. The concierge was very knowledgable and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Fabulous Service”
Reviews.Author: Explrjunkie
Reviews.Content: My husband and I tend to prefer staying at Omni Hotels because they genrally offer comfortable accomodations and, most importantly, spectacular service. The Omni San Fran was no exception: the friendliness of the staff is what made this stay such a special one, particularly as we celebrated our anniversary. The hotel rooms are pretty standard, though extremely comfortable and clean. The location of the hotel (in the Financial District) was excellent as we could walk to many of the popular neighborhoods: we could get to the Embarcadero (and the all the yummy foods and the Ferry Building and awesome chocolates at Tcho on Pier 17), AT&T Park, North Beach (for Beach Blanket Babylon and TONS of coffee-a caffeine addict's paradise!), and Chinatown, no need for a car! What made this Omni so great (and why we continue to return to Omni Hotels) was the incredible service. The bellhops, front desk staff, and housekeeping were all so friendly. They answered tons of questions for us, directed us to restaurants, had nice treats for us at turndown, and even held our luggage for us on the day we checked out. We were even treated to a walking tour through Chinatown! My husband was trying to track down an old friend who he thought lived in the area and the front desk staff worked so hard to help him get phonebooks, do online searches, and call for information. We truly enjoyed our time in San Francisco and whenever we travel, one of the first things we research is whether or not an Omni hotel is located nearby!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel - Just as many others on Trip Advisor have stated!”
Reviews.Author: sunspotman
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the the Omni for an overnight stay in San Francisco. As many others have mentioned, this is a great place to stay in the City. It is right in the Financial District of San Francisco, in a nice part of town. The cable cars go up the hills of San Francisco on California St., right in front of the hotel. BART, the "F-line", and other mass transit are four blocks away at Market St. and Montgomery St.. We stayed to enjoy one of the "off-Broadway" shows on Market St., took the "F-line", ($2.00 each way), and felt very comfortable. We observed no security or rough passenger issues and the show ended at 11:00 PM. All the staff at the Omni are very helpful and all had great positive personalities. One just needs to ask the Concierge, or Clerk behind the front desk what your plans are, and you will be giving a map, informed how to get to where you want to go, and informed of the best ways to get there. Restaurants, coffee shops, and interesting sites are all walking distance from the Omni. At $48/night, (plus $6.25 tax), parking is costly on a weekday, but parking in S.F is limited. One does not have to be concerned about ones vehicle using their valet parking. I would highly recommend this hotel to friends and family and would stay again myself.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding service and location.”
Reviews.Author: Horizon3
Reviews.Content: Although it's a fairly big hotel, it felt very cozy and warm. Everyone at the front desk were so helpful with restaurant and tours suggestions, listen to them they know what they're talking about! I loved the complementary morning coffee, they also have a nice selection of newspapers, but we felt breakfast was pricey. This hotel has the best location; especially for families! Walking distance to Union Square, Chinatown, Ferry Building Marketplace, great restaurants, etc. Also you can take the cable cars that run on california st. We're definitively confident recommending the Omni Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding”
Reviews.Author: REtraveler
Reviews.Content: Unbelievable customer service. No "snobby" attitudes here; just an honest desire to be as helpful as possible. Lobby - classy, elegant. Room - very clean and quiet. Bed was very comfortable. Misc - wifi worked great. Location is really good- cable car stop nearby, lots of sites in walking distance.

Reviews.Title: “Would stay there again next time back in SF”
Reviews.Author: Ssleepy
Reviews.Content: Nothing negative to relate back to readers during our 3 day stay at the Omni! We did online check -in the day before our arrival, which worked out well.....having arrived at midnight it was nice to see an envelope with our name on it beside the front desk. inside was our room key and all other pertinent need-to-know info....we simply took the envelope and went straight up to our room. A huge slice of delicious Chocolate Birthday Cake with card, was waiting for us in the room.....nice touch. Hotel staff and service here at the Omni are professional, helpful and friendly. Rooms are very clean and all furnishings are in great shape with no signs of wear. Bathroom had more than enought towels and amenities, as well as good shower pressure. Internet (wired & wireless) works well and easy to connect. We were on the 16th floor which was quiet. Location was great for us. 5 min walk to Chinatown, 15 min walk to Ferry Building, 20 min walk to Union Square. We discovered some nice little cafe's and pubs hidden in the alleyways (Belden Place) between the office buildings extemely close to the hotel. Tadich Grill, Michael Mina, Perbacco, One Market restaurants all within 5-15 min walk from hotel. It's true what others have said about the Financial District being a bit dead at night but there are still people milling about and we felt quite safe waliking late at night. Would definitely stay here again when in SF. This hotel had what we needed, good location, clean, great service, and a reasonable price for a great quality hotel in San Francisco.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Place”
Reviews.Author: scheevers
Reviews.Content: Our room was nice and have everything you need. The lobby is pretty and the staff is helpful. The best thing is the location! You are a hop, skip and a jump from anything you would want to see. Would stay again. None of us had any complaints.

Reviews.Title: “we loved the hospitality”
Reviews.Author: saeedfakh
Reviews.Content: Our family stayed at the Omni during the July 4th weekend. We weree immediately impressed by the hospitality of the staff. As a fisrt time Select members we were offered amenities that other luxury chains charge. Complimentary morning coffee and wi-fi is always a bonus.The concierge was exceptonally helpful. The entire staff went out of their way to make guests feel comfrtable. I would highly recommend this hotel. Saeed Fakhruddin MD

Reviews.Title: “Amazing hotel”
Reviews.Author: Paulo61_10
Reviews.Content: What a luxury!! This is THE hotel. We will always come back. Simply the best! Price unbelievably cheap for the service!

Reviews.Title: “Great service!”
Reviews.Author: lrtague
Reviews.Content: Beautiful hotel, great service, fantastic location. We had a great time here. Our room was lovely with the exception of a dirty ottoman. It had several large what seemed to be grease spots on it. Maybe someone put a greasy pizza box on it??? When I called the front desk they seemed legitimately horrified and apologized profusely. Overall, our stay was wonderful and the staff was fantastic. We will stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely experience, terrific location in downtown SF”
Reviews.Author: CabinJohners
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed 3 nights at the Omni in early August. Lovely and comfortable hotel; extremely helpful and un-rushed service from front desk and concierges; all staff friendly; great facilities - spacious, clean, luxurious bedroom and full fitness center. Easy walk to Chinatown, Little Italy, Embarcadero, Market St and Union Square;and just a little farther walk to Fisherman's Wharf. Safe even at night. We took Bart from airport and just walked 4 blocks with luggage to Omni. I did a lot of research to pick hotel - less than 2 weeks notice, so many rooms already booked - but the price per night at the Omni was best value around! Well worth the price; we're very glad we stayed there. (As Omni Select member - membership is free - we had complimentary hi-speed internet access and morning beverages)

Reviews.Title: “Front Desk Fantastic”
Reviews.Author: SHADDACalifornia
Reviews.Content: Lovely hotel in the heart of San Francisco. Beautiful posh room with comfy robes without the truly posh price. The front desk is so efficient that they anticipate your question and virtually finish your sentence for you! During our 1-night stay, a security guard or a chambermaid greeted us upon each exit from our room, inquiring of our satisfaction with the room/hotel. On Sunday morning the restaurant was set to close at 10:30. At 10:25, 24 of us were greeted with a smile, tables were aligned and we were seated! The mere fly in the proverbial ointment was valet parking. Street parking is very difficult so you do need to leave your car with the valet. Car retrieval on that Sunday was terribly slow; some waited almost an hour. But the front desk came to the rescue! Customer Service walked about the crowd apologizing and noting room numbers. The $25 overnight stay was removed from our bills before we even pulled away from the curb heading home. Plus an email arrived the following morning apologizing once again for the inconvenience of waiting for our cars, and asking for feedback regarding any aspect of our stay. The OMNI management know how to run a hotel - and certainly realize the happiness of their fan base is more important than lost revenue from valet parking.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, Great staff!”
Reviews.Author: A_Gabor
Reviews.Content: The hotel is well located and quite nice. The rooms are spacious if a bit traditional in the decor. There is free wifi if you sign up to the hotel's loyalty program. The fitness center is nice though a bit small. What really makes this hotel stand out is the staff. They are very helpful and friendly. They recommended some great restaurants and made all our reservations for us. They also provided maps and directions for any destination we inquired about. Chances are I'll be staying here nest time also.

Reviews.Title: “OMNI- LOVE.”
Reviews.Author: Marlena88
Reviews.Content: I loved this hotel- it was not just a hotel, it was an experience. The staff went out of their way to be helpful. The rooms were roomy and very comfortable. I had a big comfortable chair right by the window to relax in. They brought complimentary hot coffe every am and set it outside my door without having to deal with payment, tips, etc. and the coffee was very good. I was there on business, but felt like I was on vacation. The bed was very comfortable, the room and bathroom were very clean. It was in a great location- the waterfront is within walking distance- great restaurants everywhere. I would definitely go back, and am now interested in staying at other OMNI's if they are half as nice as this one!

Reviews.Title: “Inner City Gem”
Reviews.Author: maspeek
Reviews.Content: Who says that city hotels have to be small and overpriced? This hotel has a beautiful lobby AND beautiful, spacious rooms at a great price. The conceirge is delightful and will fill you in on any and everything doing in San Francisco. The only drawback to its central location is some middle of the night street noise. But after a day hiking the hills and a night partying, who cares?

Reviews.Title: “Best place to stay in SFO”
Reviews.Author: HermanG
Reviews.Content: This was our first time in SFO, and the front desk and concierge could not be any nicer. Very informative and accomodating. They even upgraded us to the top foloor for a better view. Would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Day of Fun”
Reviews.Author: atoni5
Reviews.Content: Had a great stay there. The beds were so soft and the pillows were so comfy. The only thing I thought was odd was that there was no lock for the bathroom door. The room was beautiful and the staff was very friendly. I would love to stay again. It was just a treat that was given to me by my cousin.

Reviews.Title: “I'll be back...”
Reviews.Author: meo
Reviews.Content: Had a great time at the Omni San Francisco! Service was excellent, location convenient, rooms and amenities were to be expected from an Omniâ€¦first rate. Traveling with a 10 and 7 yr old can be daunting, but the attention paid to us by the attentive staff made theirs and our stay memorable. They were greeted with Kid backpacks filled with fun activities and milk and cookies every evening. Be prepared to pay for parking, it can get pricey. If youâ€™re the type to exercise during vacation, the gym is clean, easily accessible and has the latest cardio and gym equipment. I would definitely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly and honest staff”
Reviews.Author: JFrancesShreveport
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed two nights at this wonderful Omni. The staff was very friendly and always willing to give personalized advice about the city. The room was clean and comfortable. The bed was also comfortable as was a roll a way. I had lost a sapphire earring and housekeeping had it when I called two days later. WOW! Great location also, on cable car line downtown. It is close enough to the tourist destinations but not too close.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: jj9598
Reviews.Content: This hotel was not what I expected.The location was great.You're close to China Town,The Embarcadero and the Financial District.Other then that,I thought it was very over priced.They comped us a piece of cake for my birthday,but that was the only free thing there.Our view was of the back of a building.The room was ok,but I've stayed at nicer hotels in Reno and Las Vegas for way less.There are price tags on every beverage and bag of chips in the room.Not really a family hotel.My fiance got lost looking for the fitness room.The staff wasn't very helpful.I wouldn't stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: NewYorkerX2
Reviews.Content: We got a great deal through AAA and were very happy with our stay. I think it was the best big name hotel in the city (and not $400+ a night!) Everything was very clean and fresh, and the staff was super friendly. We arrived at 10:30pm and they welcomed us and gave us some great late night food recos. Location was good . The immediate area was quiet (financial district) but nd easy to get around the city from there including walking. Valet was expensive and slow but had in and out privileges. Overall would recommend highly.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place To Stay”
Reviews.Author: Dwayner
Reviews.Content: Highly recommend the Omni in San Francisco. Well situated in the Financial District --Service was great -- staff was very helpful. Would stay again in a heart beat !!

Reviews.Title: “Would definitely stay here again”
Reviews.Author: SSLtravel
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here recently for the first leg of our delayed honeymoon. The hotel itself is located in a great part of San Fran - very convenient to many attractions. The room was very nice and super clean, and the lobby was attractive. The hotel staff could not have been more pleasant - very helpful and friendly. We ran into some bad weather on the way out to California and they were very accommodating with our travel plans. When we arrived there were chocolate covered strawberries and roses in our room. We are preferred members at this hotel and as a result, received complimentary beverages each morning, among other perks. In sum, great location, great place. My husband and I will definitely be returning to the Omni.

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel ever!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Blairbeth
Reviews.Content: My family and I looked forward to our trip to San Francisco but we never expected that one of the best parts of our trip was the hotel where we stayed. The service was impeccable and they responded to our every need. Even little things like the remote in our room not working, they had someone at our door within five minutes from when I called. We have just returned home but for the first time we felt must write a review to say thanks too.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel. Excellent Location. Wonderful Service. Glad I stayed here.”
Reviews.Author: FishPicnic
Reviews.Content: Went to visit my honey who moved to San Francisco. First trip out in years but loved it! Walking San Francisco is wonderful and having a great location like the Omni makes it even that much more special. The rooms were clean and nice and well decorated. Loved the shampoo - want to find out where to get some. My only complaint is that our room was near some sort of elevator or engine - just make a humming noise every once in a while and we could hear it but that was no big deal. I love the water in the lobby with lemons - very refreshing. They also had tea that was delicious. Great spot to stay and we got a great deal.

Reviews.Title: “Great value, excellent location, and made up for their service errors.”
Reviews.Author: offshore8
Reviews.Content: Stayed here over Christmas Eve as part of a family anniversary celebration. Rooms awesome (of a $250/night calibre), nice lobby, excellent location. Easily would get 5 stars if not for numerous surprising mistakes handling the treatment of the anniversary couple whose room was to be charged to us. Put wrong name on welcome card in room, delivered comp food and gifts to wrong room, couldn't correct it, forgot to provide treats to pet dog even though they were included in the pet charge and we were charged for them. Concierge was mixed with excellent guidance on sightseeing, but couldn't call a house car or taxi for us in less than 30 min. In the end, they made up for all this by apologizing repeatedly, comp'ing parking, and comp'ing a large Christmas brunch for 8 family members, which was very nice of them. All those gestures brought them back to 4 stars even though all the mistakes were annoying at the time. Given everything, I would try them again and go back there because of their efforts and the otherwise great property.

Reviews.Title: “Surprised by this older hotel...had a great stay!”
Reviews.Author: OldDogsRule
Reviews.Content: I travel to San Francisco frequently and had not stayed at the Omni before, though I had attended business meetings there. I was genuinely surprised at my experience there. I was expecting an older, slightly rundown/dated hotel with noisy, small rooms (as the older hotels tend to have). Instead, I found a well-kept/maintained room with plenty of room, and some very nice amenities. I was also able to get a very quiet room (if you are a light sleeper like me), ask for a room that does not face California (cable cars, doormen calling taxis) and slept very well during my stay because the drapes were very effective in keeping the light out. In the mornings, I would have to check my phone to figure out if it was light outside. I only ate room service while there and it was very good. Great location, very courteous/accommodating staff (especially the doormen/valets)...I will stay there again. P.S. their breakfast burrito is fantastic.

Reviews.Title: “Always a pleasure”
Reviews.Author: Planettraveler
Reviews.Content: I have stayed here several times. It is a lovely, historic hotel, very comfortable lobby. The lobby was decorated for Christmas. It is a good central location, easy to walk to many sights and fantastic restaurants. Of course, parking is always a nightmare in a major city.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: javajeninga
Reviews.Content: This was a great hotel. They had fresh fruit and cold tea everyday. The breakfast was delicious. The location was very handy - right by China Town and easy access to the Cable Car. You could walk to great shopping. The room was clean and nice.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing hotel, amazing staff”
Reviews.Author: canadianvisi2r
Reviews.Content: Would highly recommend this hotel. Reasonable walk to everything. You gotta walk in San Fran. Financial district so short walk to north beach, market street etc. Staff wonderful, especially Joey who booked all our tours. Short walk to restaurants. Will go again and stay there

Reviews.Title: “Children's Fantasy Suite”
Reviews.Author: edcsmpmom
Reviews.Content: We loved, loved, loved our stay at the Omni San Francisco from the moment we arrived. The bell hops were so friendly & welcoming. Our 2 children received back packs with toys (explorer type stuff). We had the adjoining room next to the children's fantasy suite, which was adorable and had bunk beds, child sized robes, step stool & rubber duckys in the bathroom, stuffed animals, games, books, toys, a "mini fridge" filled with milk, choc milk & yogurt. The snacks were above the fridge (just high enough to be out of sight of our little ones) and included cereal, skittles, m&ms. The drinks were 50 cents & the snacks $1.00. That was a pleasant surprise. Each afternoon, fresh cookies & milk were also delivered to our room. The kids loved the stay too & it took some coaxing to even get them to leave so we could explore the city. Fantastic stay & highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Old elegance, attention to the little details, great staff”
Reviews.Author: beasttraveler
Reviews.Content: Amazing location, just a block away from Chinatown. Our three year old was treated to milk and cookies minutes after being taken to our very cute room. Beautiful old-world elegance without the stuffiness. Smaller rooms, very nicely appointed. Marble tops in the bathroom, huge tub and nice fixtures, where's the vent though? Some construction going on next door, only in the afternoon though, and not in the morning, as I had feared. If we had stayed longer, a successful naptime might have been an issue for our toddler. Without fail, every single person on the staff was friendly and took extra time to chat, give tips, and make us feel like our comfort was very important to them, from the front desk reception, to the bellhop, to the valet, to the manager, to the host at the restaurant as we were walking through to access the entrance from the east side! If you're not an Omni member, join immediately, and get free internet and other perks. It's free, so why not?

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service and rooms”
Reviews.Author: mchernysh
Reviews.Content: The Omni San Francisco was perfect for our stay from June 30 - July 4 . The rooms were quite large and very nicely appointed. The front desk staff was very helpful and welcoming. All of our needs were taken care of immediately, such as providing a crib for our baby. The location of the hotel is not located next to any main tourist attractions in SF, however the location is very central. The California St. Cable Car line is in front of the hotel. The Ferry Building is a short 10 minute walk. Alcatraz Cruises is a 20 minute walk. Chinatown is within 5 minutes and Union Square is 10 minutes. There is also a MUNI Subway station 5 minutes away. Just keep in mind that since the hotel is located in the Financial District very little remains open on the weekends or in the evening, however this wasn't much of a problem for us. Make sure you sign up for their frequent guest program, it entitles you to a free morning beverage and free wi-fi.

Reviews.Title: “Mostly Excellent”
Reviews.Author: allblacks99
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 5 nights. Good location for easy walking to Ferry Building, Chinatown, North Beach, Union Square. Amazingly good and friendly service. Room nice. Minor negatives: lifts slow, wifi slow, not very good and expensive breakfast (go elsewhere).

Reviews.Title: “There is a reason this is ranked so high on TripAdvisor! Customer Service!”
Reviews.Author: TravellinTexans
Reviews.Content: This hotel know how to treat their guests! We stayed here in July of 2011 and were treated like family. The front desk is great. The concierge is excellent. If it looked like I even thought about asking a question someone was there to help. The guys at the front door were super friendly too! We were here on a family vacation and we would stay here again. I love the location on California St. The cable cars come right by so you can hop on them and go. My kids were impressed with the hill and before stopping at the hotel we had to drive up California to the top of Nob Hill. Super steep and I was a little scared at first but after a while the streets didn't seem so bad. My husband drove them like an expert even though we are from the Dallas area and there is nothing like that here! I really liked the area. I had been looking at hotels in the Union Square area but after we settled in at our hotel we drove by there and it was so congested I was happy to be where we were. Stay here and you will love it!

Reviews.Title: “The only place I stay in San Francisco”
Reviews.Author: omarvomdakota
Reviews.Content: I travel on business to San Francisco about twice a month. I have stayed at other hotels, but I truly prefer the Omni. The charm, the great loyalty program, and the excellent service make it the place that I prefer to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing hotel with unbelievable service!”
Reviews.Author: minimeg714
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Omni for our first wedding anniversary using gift certificates we had received as a wedding gift. I booked two nights with the AAA rate which covered a room on the sixth floor or lower. Upon check-in, we learned that we had been upgraded to a bigger room on the 16th floor since it was our anniversary. When we walked into the room, they had laid out bathrobes for us on the bed along with two roses and had some light jazz playing on the radio. It was so sweet! The first night we asked the concierge for a recommendation on an Indian restaurant. The girl that we spoke with was so helpful and made us reservations for later that evening at Amber India, which was exactly what we were looking for - upscale, delicious food, a classy bar - and within walking distance from the Omni. We used the concierge's recommendation for a Chinese restaurant for lunch on our last day as well, and they did not disappoint us - we went to Brandy Ho's which was on the way to our next sightseeing destination (Coit Tower) and had a fantastic meal. I would absolutely recommend the Omni hotel to anyone. I loved the room and the service, and even if we didn't have the gift certificates, I thought that the rates were very reasonable.

Reviews.Title: “HOW DO I LOVE THEE, LET ME COUNT THE WAYS”
Reviews.Author: NMTaosena
Reviews.Content: Absolutely fabulous hotel! (1) great staff - wonderfully friendly, very attentive (2)rooms immaculately clean (3) wonderful location - can walk to North Beach, China Town, Union Square, Market St. (4)bathroom has a lot of room for toiletries (5) big soft towels (6) fresh fruit & ice tea in the lobby (7) it was my birthday, and they brought up a piece of yummy chocolate cake & strawberries & grapes to my room. I've stayed in a lot of hotels in San Francisco (usually dependent on which is offering the best deal) but I'll never stay anywhere else in San Francisco, and I go once or twice a year.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it. Hated to leave.”
Reviews.Author: awhitesides
Reviews.Content: The Omni San Francisco treated us so nice. I am a light sleeper and I slept like a baby. Bathrooms are so clean. After a long day of walking the city, it was nice to come back to the bar and have a light supper with good wine. They also had coffee at the bar for those of us who get up early and need more than one cup of coffee. The bellmen were oh so special giving us directions and getting us transportation. The hotel is in a good location as the street car runs right in front. All of the staff were professional but not stuffy. Will stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful stay, highly recommend this place!”
Reviews.Author: foodtrekker34
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with a friend for a "girls' weekend" and it was perfect. The hotel staff are the friendliest and most helpful I have seen yet and the hotel was beautiful. I recommend signing up for the hote'ls preferred guest program (it is free) and you get free morning beverage service, a paper, evening turn-down, free bottled water, wi-fi, and clothes pressing. There is a high-end steak house in the hotel (we did not try but should have) and a great ally about 1 block up that houses several local restaurants.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding stay!”
Reviews.Author: KBC94
Reviews.Content: We've never been disappointed in an Omni, and San Francisco was no exception. The staff was extremely competent and friendly; doormen, front desk, bartenders, waiters, housekeeping. No question, we'll be back.

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel for customer service and families.”
Reviews.Author: Jetsetter-wannabee
Reviews.Content: Debated over if to stay here or the Renaissance and Omni won over with all the great reviews. Stayed for 3 nts with husband and kids ages 13, 11, and 3. Everyone from doormen, to front desk, to maids were all so happy and delighted to help throughout our stay. Kids loved the goody bags(even gave them another round of bags next day cause they had a new and improved version). The cookies and milk waiting for us when we came back each night after a day of adventure was just pure perfect! Drinks each morning waiting outside our door was another extra. Kids loved all these lil' surprises! Location was great. Away from all the nightlife noise but centrally located between Union Square, China Town, Fishermans Wharf, and Ferry Bldg. Kids loved taking the trollies up and down all the slopes. Felt very safe in the area. Our last evening we ventured out a lil' too far and think we ended up in the Tenderloin area. Heard about this "do not go" area and let me just say...we made a u-turn quickly. Lol Overall, GREAT say. Will definitely stay again. Best customer service we have ever encountered.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: castlefan
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at the Omni for 5 nights. The hotel staff were extremely friendly and helpful. The location is great for walking to Chinatown, North Beach, Ferry Bldg., and Union Square. One day we took a cab to the marina, walked to fishermans wharf and then walked back to the hotel. The only thing I did not like was that the room service meals would sit outside guest rooms for hours. Once, we even called the front desk to have a tray with half eaten food that was in the hall between our door and the room next door to be picked up. When we checked into the hotel, there was a tray of leftover food in the hall outside our door and I had to ask the maid service to remove it. This definitely needs to be take care of.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic value”
Reviews.Author: Rebecca60745
Reviews.Content: We loved the Omni Hotel in San Francisco. We were there over July 4th weekend. The service was outstanding and the price was very reasonable for a downtown hotel. Not only was wireless internet included, but there was a lovely bowl of free fruit and ice tea in the lobby in the afternoons. The bed was comfortable, and the room was very quiet. The bathroom was quite nice. The location was very convenient. My only criticism was the cost of parking, which I felt was very high. I would definitely recommend the hotel to business and pleasure travelers.

Reviews.Title: “Another Great Omni”
Reviews.Author: Tink1Boston
Reviews.Content: Beautiful, clean room with a very comfortable bed. Great location for exploring the city or staying nearby. Very helpful, attentive staff who made several great dining suggestions. Would come back for another stay without question.

Reviews.Title: “If you don't mind a 30 min walk to anywhere...*”
Reviews.Author: Shazzarinski
Reviews.Content: Would deffo recommend this hotel. We loved the location in the very quiet financial district esp over the holiday weekend. We really like exploring cities and everywhere bar perhaps the Castro area was easily walkable and easy to find. Made our stay in San Fran super easy*

Reviews.Title: “Top Class Hotel”
Reviews.Author: nantucketdreamer
Reviews.Content: No worries about staying here--this is a small luxury hotel that treats it's customers in a grand way. Rooms are clean, updated and roomy enough. Bathrooms are fine. Smallish fitness center, but adequate with new equipment. Good, fast room service, and Bob's restaurant served a good, if pricey, breakfast. The key to it's greatness is the staff--always smiling and seeking to please, Iced Tea and fruit always in the lobby. Lex, the concierge, is one of the best we have dealt with. No question or request is too mundane, and his suggestions were always on point for restaurants, day trips, etc.

Reviews.Title: “A Splendid Hotel With Faultless Service”
Reviews.Author: ST1951
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Omni for five nights and without the slightest hesitation will certainly return there next time I am in San Francisco. I only write a review for Tripadvisor if I feel a hotel merits five stars. I know this is probably totally wrong as I should also review those of poorer quality. The problem is that I simply donâ€™t have the time! Without any shadow of doubt the Omni merits five stars. It raises the bar in terms of customer service. From the moment I walked in to the moment I left I felt totally at home. I arrived after an eleven hour flight and transferred to the hotel from SFO by BART. The hotel is an easy and flat five block walk up Montgomery St from the BART station. Check in was very smooth and I was quickly in my room. It was spotlessly clean with a welcome note and complimentary bottle of water as I joined the Select Guest programme. I suggest that anyone staying at an Omni joins this. Complimentary Wi Fi, newspapers and morning beverages are just some of the benefits. It costs nothing to join and is well worth it. I had emailed ahead to request a quiet room and was allocated one overlooking the courtyard without any traffic noise at all. Not a great view but who cares? A quiet nights sleep is more important to me. The room did, however, back onto the elevator shafts so I was woken early whilst they were being used more frequently. The noise was not, however, that loud and most people would have taken absolutely no notice at all but I am obsessive about noise and a difficult person to please. The term â€œGrumpy Old Manâ€� fits me perfectly or so my wife says! I asked at reception if the elevator noise always started around 6.00 and without me even asking I was immediately offered another room. The second room again overlooked the back and was so unbelievably quiet that I slept like a log for the next four nights. Facilities in the room were excellent. The bed and pillows were extremely comfortable. A big armchair and footrest were welcome after a day of San Francisco hill climbing! Wi Fi was fast and easy to connect. I was quite impressed with the workstation which had plug sockets built into it. Little things please little minds! All too often in other hotels I have had to scrabble round the floor looking for them. One thing that really impressed me was that the maid left a handwritten note to thank me for the tip I left her. I think it was a really nice touch. I always tip maids and this is the first time I have been thanked for it. I very much appreciated it. The hotel is located in the financial district which was very quiet over the weekend. Just a short walk to North Beach, Market Street and Embarcadero. I didnâ€™t eat or drink in the hotel so canâ€™t comment on that side of things. There are plenty of great bars and restaurants nearby especially North Beach. Finally, I cannot complete the review without mentioning the standard of customer service again. This was exceptional in all respects. I have stayed in countless hotels over the years and the Omni is in a league of itâ€™s own. All the staff I encountered had a smile on their face and were amazingly polite. I never had to open the front entrance door or call for the elevator as one of the staff always rushed to do these. I originally planned to stay for ten nights but couldnâ€™t make the first five nights in view of illness in the family. It was such a delight to stay there that I really wish I could have made the full ten nights. Will I be back? Without any shadow of doubt. I am planning my next SF trip now. Would I recommend a friend? Certainly not. This place is way way too good for them!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent stay but beware of the bed”
Reviews.Author: mmb617
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a few nights and had a terrific time. The staff is outstanding - friendly, quick and efficient. They allowed us to store our bags before we were able to check in and provided us with a room with a gorgeous bathroom and well furnished room. The concierge was helpful and a request to the front desk for more pillows was fulfilled within two minutes. The only two downsides are that parking is exceptionally expensive ($48 a day) and the beds are not very comfortable, particularly for this kind of otherwise great hotel. We were planning on parking in one of the cheaper lots near the hotel but when we arrived we found out that they're all closed on the weekend were left with no other option. (The bellhop told us that other hotels nearby charge even more and that they were "reasonable".) The other disappointment was the uncomfortable bed - you literally feel and hear the springs moving underneath you (and I'm not even overweight!). Otherwise it was a great stay. I'd strongly suggest joining their membership program for free beverages each morning along with complimentary water when you arrive. Also, in the lobby upon arrival, were the largest lillies I'd ever seen and refreshing tea and fruit.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed our stay at the lovely Omni Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Bils81
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Omni at the end of May 2011 for 3 nights and really enjoyed our stay! The room was a good size and very clean and all the staff we friendly and helpful. The location was good also and we were able to walk to most attractions. Would highly recommend and would defintely book again if we return to San Francisco.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel for Visiting Families”
Reviews.Author: ChrisandGina
Reviews.Content: Just spent three nights at the Omni with our two children. Straddling Chinatown and the Financial district, Omni's location is also located on the California St. cable car line. Friendly, helpful, readily available staff. Concierge and desk personnel are well-trained, and had excellent local restaurant recommendations. Though our reserved room was not yet available upon our arrival (we had been emailed that an early arrival was possible) desk staff immediately upgraded us to an available and very roomy suite. No wait for the better room was an awesome surprise after travelling across the country with two children! Complimentary iced tea in lobby is a welcome touch when returning from a day of touring. Ample bath supplies for the entire family. Quick and efficient (though pricey!) valet car service. Would definitely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel in financial district”
Reviews.Author: long4travel
Reviews.Content: The Omni is a posh hotel in the financial district, very near Chinatown and the Embarcadero. The lobby is beautiful and smelled wonderful. The staff, from the doormen to the front desk, were friendly and very accomodating. The beds were very comfortable, and room service was very quick.

Reviews.Title: “We'll be back!”
Reviews.Author: Pumpkin_Cupcakes
Reviews.Content: We actually stayed at the Grand Hyatt for one night before staying at the Omni, and I absolutely loved the Omni more. While the Grand Hyatt isn't bad at all, I prefer the Omni because of their friendly service. The housekeeper left a welcome note and a thank you note! The room is also bigger than the Grand Hyatt. Although I do prefer the bathroom at the Grand Hyatt more (mini bathtub style sink and removable shower head), the Omni's bathroom was spacious and comfortable, too. If you're a gold+ member, you'll receive complimentary coffee and laundry services, which weren't offered at the Grand Hyatt. Both hotels are conveniently located near the Union Square, so when we return again, we'll definitely stay at the Omni! This hotel, similar to the Grand Hyatt, is near a public parking lot, which is cheaper than parking at the hotel or valet service, so you don't have to worry too much about where to park!

Reviews.Title: “Really happy with our choice!”
Reviews.Author: CONLNPPR
Reviews.Content: Super friendly and attentive, clean and quiet. Walk down to the lobby for some complimentary Starbuck's coffee in the morning and whoever is at the front desk will greet you with more than just a smile. They will spend tons of time with you and help you in whatever way they can. Love the sheets, the shower curtain looked brand new, and the drinking glasses in the bathroom were actually clean. (I always look and I'm disgusted when they are wiped, usually still with lip marks and lint.). Loved our stay and will return.

Reviews.Title: “Best experience of my USA trip”
Reviews.Author: Mongkut
Reviews.Content: Everything was so good that there is not so much to say but ... STAY THERE !!! The welcoming is perfect from the doorman to the reception. The hotel is beautiful, clean, the amenities are great (just try on a bathrobe, they are fantastic !), there is a big TV, internet (not free unfortunately), the location is perfect, the check-out quick and efficient. I just regret not to have stayed in SFO longer. Such a nice experience. I will be back, sure ! :)

Reviews.Title: “An elegant hotel with excellent service”
Reviews.Author: kievit
Reviews.Content: I selected this hotel because of the excellent reviews in Trip Advisor and was not disappointed. My family and I were visiting San Francisco for the first time on our way back to the east coast from Yosemite. The location is excellent , walking distance from china town and the Ferry building. The Hotel is elegantly decorated, sort of "old world" european style, but by far the best part of the experience at the hotel was the helpful and friendly staff. Truly, I have never been at a hotel where the staff really went out of their way to be so pleasant and knowledgeable about the local area. Everyone ,from the doorman who serenaded my 8 year old daughter with Sinatra ballads to the concierge, was wonderful. I would especially recommend this hotel to families, the hotel goes out of its way to make the kids feel welcome, which is unusual for a 4 or 5 star hotel...we will definitely be coming back.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay”
Reviews.Author: TXnatives
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our stay at the Omni. The staff was very nice. Room service was very good. The only problem with the location is that the few restaurants near by do not stay open late and some are not open on the weekend. We were able to walk to all of the local attractions and when we got back the room it was always clean and the towels and toiletries were stocked daily.

Reviews.Title: “The hotel was beautiful and wonderfully located!”
Reviews.Author: EPgirl6
Reviews.Content: The hotel was a great location and beautiful. We were able to walk to everything or take the trolley. The views were wonderful too and the staff was friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Great service, tiny room...awesome location”
Reviews.Author: OtisNC
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Omni June 25-27, and will be back July 4-7. We arrived at midnight and got what I guess was one of the last rooms left...right next to the elevators and facing the street. We were worried about noise, but it was surprisingly quiet. The beds were very comfy, and the room and amenities were nice. We stopped at the front desk on out way out our first morning and were absolutely blesses to have met Stephen...he was SO helpful with breakfast and sight seeing recommendations. He was patient and took plenty of time to answer our questions and draw all over our map to help us figure out where to go. Thank you! Because of Stephen, we are very much looking forward to our return tom the Omni next week! Julie and Peter Hans

Reviews.Title: “Fanstastic service and a great location”
Reviews.Author: AndyTheGameInventor
Reviews.Content: We stayed two nights at this hotel and were not disappointed. The very well-trained staff provided exemplary service from the moment we walked in to when we left, and even after we checked out. You couldn't open the front door without someone rushing ahead to open it for you. The room is fairly spacious - not huge but ample for two people. Room decor was upscale - not top-end luxury but at $245 a night in San Francisco, very good value. Bed was very comfortable, and they provide robes and slippers. Bathroom was quite nice, not super luxury but very comfortable. The one flaw has been mentioned in other reviews: a single switch turns on the fairly bright lighting, which is not pleasant if you get up at night to use the bathroom. Hint: the lighted make-up mirror works great for that. The hotel is 2 block from Chinatown and a 10-minute walk from the Ferry Building - very good location. Parking, like everywhere in SF, is terribly expensive, but you can save a few bucks by parking across the street in the Bank of America garage. I would happily stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: jewls74
Reviews.Content: Great hotel, Check-in went quickly. Staff was very friendly, offered good suggestions on nearby restaurants. Room was fabulous, larger then I expected and the bathroom was great. Beds were comfy. Tip to other travelers, you can signup at checkin for the Omni Select Rewards program (Free) you'll get free internet, you also get a complimentary beverage in the morning.

Reviews.Title: “Expense account property”
Reviews.Author: DandCCharleston_SC
Reviews.Content: The staff at this hotel were very polite and helpful; however, the management seems to have borrowed a page from the airlines playbook. Reasonable room prices (for San Francisco) were offset by $7 water, $28/hour internet access when using the hotel computer, and restraurant prices that were over the top. Fortunately, there were other food options nearby. The room was clean and of adequate size, but it's a shame that so-called high end hotels have to charge for things that a free in many of the lower priced properties.

Reviews.Title: “Highly recommended. Faultless for our stay.”
Reviews.Author: relatedtothequeen
Reviews.Content: The Omni Hotel is in a superb location. Extremely welcoming and helpful staff. Pleasant surroundings. Clean and spacious room. Quiet at night. The only possible improvement we could suggest would be free Wi-Fi. Highly recommended and if we were staying in San Francisco again we would happily go back.

Reviews.Title: “Impeccable!”
Reviews.Author: ChloderosLaclos
Reviews.Content: Service was impeccable. The hotel was spotlessly clean and beautifully decorated. Room very spacious (13th floor) and bathroom was lovely. Stayed for 7 nights. The hotel is ideally located to the Embarcadero, muni stations, Chinatown, shopping, and restaurants. We even walked from Fisherman's Wharf and Ghiradelli Square one evening. Would definitely stay again for business and pleasure. The San Francisco CityPass represents an amazing deal/value.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel and Outstanding service”
Reviews.Author: davuda
Reviews.Content: Hotel was excellent. It was clean and very comfortable. Recently remodelled. The service was truly outstanding. The staff were very well trained and were very helpful. It was easily within walking distance to Chinatown and access to public transportation was close by. Lots of very good resturaunts within walking distance. We'll definitely be back. Parking on Friday, Saturday less expensive than Sunday-Thursday. Parking not cheap, well maybe relatively cheap for SF.

Reviews.Title: “Quality hotel & excellent location”
Reviews.Author: Rob_Sue88
Reviews.Content: Chose this hotel after seeing the reviews on Trip Advisor and we were not disappointed. A very warm welcome on arrival by the doormen and the reception staff also made you feel special by being very attentive without being over the top, we did get the immediate feeling that if there was anything you needed they would be more than glad to help. We had requested a quiet room with a view if available as this was a trip for our wedding anniversary and they certainly matched our request with a great room on the 17th floor. This is a city where a couple of the main features (as there are many parts to San Francisco) are a fantastic bay area & many steep slopes, but if you can cope with the slopes you get the payoff of great views. This is a great city, I love New York & I love Boston, but this is right up there and I'm still deciding if this has just gone to the top of the list. We stayed for 6 nights and in all honesty could have stayed more. If you are a tourist coming here you just have to do Alcatraz which we thought was brilliant, but be warned you need to book this before you get to the city as the trip is very busy and you cannot guarantee getting on a trip by just turning up on the day. We also did a Napa Valley tour (through Viator) which was also a great trip. The people in this city, and seemingley in California as a whole are warm, friendly and welcoming people who are glad to help and have a chat with you. The location of this hotel we felt was excellent. Nice area & turn left out of the main front door (not up the hill) and you are heading to the Ferry Building / Embarcadero & the many piers of the bay. Approx 10 minute flat stroll and you are at the Ferry Building & turn left when you get there and you are heading towards Pier 39 / Fishermans Wharf and the sea lions etc. This hotel is also only short walk to Union Square and the shops that are there. If you are up to it, biking over the Golden Gate Bridge to Sausalito is well worth the effort. My wife and I (45 & 50 years old) managed it and the it will be a memory that stays forever as to view this iconic structure from such a close up and personal viewpoint is just awesome. We stopped frequently to take hundreds of photos, had lunch in Sausalito and then caught the ferry back which is really easy, as through Blazing Saddles they give you a ferry ticket ready for use in the morning, which you can either use or not. You pay for the bikes at the end of the trip & hence if you don't come back on the ferry you don't get charged for the ticket so long as you return it in full. We will definately return to San Francisco.

Reviews.Title: “So children-friendly!!! we loved it!!”
Reviews.Author: Alexey_Barinov
Reviews.Content: everybody at this hotel made our 4-night stay pleasant! Children received gifts from the hotel and the whole backpack with books and toys to play. the hotel is very conveniently located close to all the sites. The room was nicely decorated, with modern bath facilities. Stay at this hotel if you have children - you will love it!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: lftexas
Reviews.Content: Stayed here June 9 - 12. Great accomodations. Staff was fabulous, rooms very spacious. Very close to China Town and Ferry Building. Not very close to Union Square. Trolley directly in front on California.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient to shopping and transportation”
Reviews.Author: aerobicpt
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Omni over the Memorial Day weekend. Had a special on room rates which enabled us to get a suite. Hotel staff extremely friendly and eager to please from the valet to the bell staff to the maid service. Within walking distance of Union Square, trolleys within walking distance as well. The biggest disappointment was the cost of weekday valet parking, outrageous at $48 plus tax. On the weekend, goes down to $24 a day with tax. Also thought that Bob's steak house was pricey for the quality although service was good. Would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Gorgeous Hotel”
Reviews.Author: macsydney
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at the Omni on three separate occasions now and would definitely stay again. Old world style and charm is so under rated these days. Great service from housekeeping, doormen, valets and bar staff. The Omni has become a home away from home for us.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding”
Reviews.Author: GilbertMontreal
Reviews.Content: This hotel is perfect in many ways and it has been said in previous reviews but the employees make the difference here whatever their job is. They are just amazing - after 5 nights you don't want to quit this hotel. They make you feel so good.They must have terrefic managers for being so engaged and happy. If only we could get a breakfast for a reasonnable price!

Reviews.Title: “Business traveler and kid-friendly alike”
Reviews.Author: iron_monkey_fist666
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 6 nights. I enjoyed the great service by staff. When I checked in there was a problem with my door. An engineer was upstairs to fix it very quickly. The staff at the front desk is very courteous and efficient. I needed to borrow an umbrella-- they handed me one with a smile. The wifi in the room is free if you're an Omni Select Guest (which I am), otherwise, it's about $10 per night. The bathroom is nice, but the water pressure in the shower was not as great as I would have preferred for the rate charged for this hotel. The room was adequately sized. Note that some rooms have city views, and others have "courtyard" views. Courtyard views look directly across into an office building. I would strongly recommend avoiding this! The gym is good-- they have free weights, about 6 treadmills and 4 elliptical machines. It is crowded in the mornings, but well-maintained and clean. One other slight negative-- there are only 2 elevators for the whole hotel. They are slow. In busy times, one can spend a lot of time waiting for an elevator. Lastly-- go to Baladie while you're there and order a "Sultan's Iron Bowl." Awesome lunch or dinner option!

Reviews.Title: “A luxurious bargain!!”
Reviews.Author: AmyMcGowen
Reviews.Content: My other favorite hotel in San Fran is the Omni!! Wonderful people, great rooms, large bathroom, richly decorated, and even a view (from the 17th floor). Bob's bar has a great wine list, and the restaurant was good, too!! I'll return, for sure!!! The rates are very reasonable for the quality hotel you get here!!!

Reviews.Title: “First class reception”
Reviews.Author: Bendbiz
Reviews.Content: On a side trip during our annual spring break drive to Southern California we decided to detour to San Fran. On our way across the Bay Bridge we checked on-line reviews (via Trip Advisor) and decided to make a reservation. Upon arrival we were warmly greeted by the Valet who went out of his way to make our 3 daughter feel welcomed. Upon entering the Hotel lobby the doorman announced - "Girl's welcome to the Omni Hotel" - the girls received applause from guests and staff members a like and our daughters felt like royalty. The rest of the staff was extremely accommodating and we had an awesome stay. The location is great - walked to Farmers Market at the Embarcadero Center - great Italian Restaurant (Perbacco) down the street. Well done Omni.

Reviews.Title: “Central Location and Great Staff”
Reviews.Author: MIZZOU1986
Reviews.Content: Great location for our two nights in San Francisco. Chinatown and Union Square are very close. Gorgeous common area and the staff was very helpful and super friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Glad I Tried It"”
Reviews.Author: akoser
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Omni San Francisco for one night while on business. I usually stay elsewhere when in town but thought I would try the Omni as the location was very close to my business appointments for the next day. Turned out to be an excellent location for business travel. Very, very nice. Public areas are nothing short of beautiful. My king bed room and bathroom were absolutely spotless. The desk in the room had really handy outlets right on the front of the desk, no crawling aroung looking for an outlet! Bed was comfortable, but just two flimsy pillows on the bed just doesn't cut it. I like a bed with lots of comfy pillows great for propping up to watch TV. That's really the only thing here that was anything but superlative. Not a deal killer. Front desk staff were very pleasant and aimed to please. Bob's Steakhouse located in the hotel was so good I ate there twice in 24 hours. The bar looked like a fun place to watch a game with colleagues. It's safe to say I will be back at the Omni San Francisco!

Reviews.Title: “The Place 2 B”
Reviews.Author: saipandiver
Reviews.Content: Perfectly located on California Street, blocks away from Union Square and two blocks from Chinatown, the Omni provided a comfortable stay when visiting this fabulous city on business. Over the last 30+ years, I've been to San Francisco hundreds of times and had never stayed in the city. My next visit will definitely be in the city and at the Omni. This reviewer totally enjoyed the stay!

Reviews.Title: “Excellence”
Reviews.Author: JLM73TX
Reviews.Content: I must say that staying at the Omni San Francisco is quite comfortable for a business traveler. The hotel feels small and intimate not in the way that a country inn is small and intimate but in that you can come downstairs at 7:00 AM and get a seat at Bob's Steak and Chop House for breakfast without having a reservation. The staff is perfectly professional, correct and helpful as if you were staying at your sister's house. Of course, San Francisco is quite a setting. The only complaint? The $7 bottled water --- not complaining about the concept of bottled water but the price. I would drink swamp water before I would pay that much for a single bottle of water. That is a ridiculous price and shows a complete disconnect w/ the times. But then , I adore their tap water, so who really cares? I like the Omni San Francisco.

Reviews.Title: “The Service Stands Out”
Reviews.Author: therlp
Reviews.Content: The staff at the Omni is exceptional. I've stayed here a few times on business trips. The hotel, itself, is ornate, in a Shaker Heights, early century palatial kind of way. The rooms are large and quiet, the bathrooms are huge and well-appointed, the furnishings are well-maintained and, again, ornate, the TVs are new and the wireless Internet is quick and always seems to work. But it is the staff here that stands out. This has to be part of their training, but everyone you speak with is exceptionally patient, never scoffs at a question or inquiry and goes out of the way to make sure guests are taken care of. Whether that means stowing luggage themselves, giving restaurant suggestions or literally running down the street to get you a cab, the staff hearkens back to what I assume - or what is purveyed as the standards of luxury travel in the 1950s. In a way, this hotel feels like a time capsule back to a more refined era of travel - and I mean that in the best way.

Reviews.Title: “Exceptional Service, Exceptional Staff”
Reviews.Author: skhs
Reviews.Content: This is the 2nd Omni property I've stayed in, and again its the staff that make the hotel. We were staying here for 3 nights of which 2 were free due to the omni loyalty scheme. The rooms are pretty spacious, beds are exceptionally comfy, I wish they had proper baths in the bathroom though! the hotel is spotlessly clean, my only slight complaint that the hotel itself was freezing!! I know we came during freak weather conditions but the aircon was blasting out in every public area!!!! I was slightly confused with our package as I thought I'd included breakfast as part of our rate, so I went and asked the manager, who informed me that breakfast was not part of our complimentary nights, however as a goodwill gesture for returning guests he comped us breakfast for these nights, which I thought was amazing I didn't even need to ask! Concierge were fantastic for restaurant recommendations and got it right everytime. Whenever we left the hotel to get cabs if we were not going to far they allowed us to use the town car service that they have outside the hotel. I can not rate the service at this hotel highly enough, you really are treated like an important guest. What the Omni seem to get right where other hotels fail, is that they realise problems can happen, but it's how they are dealt with that matters. I will return to this hotel again in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Four Seasons service without the price and attitude”
Reviews.Author: mstolper
Reviews.Content: Staff was helpful,pleasant,and efficient.I was offered a choice of rooms. The rooms are quiet and comfortable,nice, not opulent. Turn down service, complimentary coffee left outside your room at a designated time, free wi-fi. You feel like a guest instead of a taget of opportunity. The downtown L.A. Omni ie equally well- run.

Reviews.Title: “Better than most hotels in its price range!”
Reviews.Author: IsmaelA12
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend was in town so i decided to splurge a little and stay at this hotel and wasn't really too sure how nice it was really going to be. I knew it had good reviews, but i wasn't sure how nice the rooms were going to be. Once I arrived there, all my negative thoughts were gone because the rooms were amazing, from the bathroom to the beds-very comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel with professional staff and lovely rooms!”
Reviews.Author: Mide
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for two nights, having previously spent 3 nights at the Orchard Hotel on Bush Street, as we fancied trying somewhere else. I have to say that this hotel is the epitomy of professionalism. The door staff are polite and helpful, and the reception staff even more so. The room we had was probably the best we stayed in during our trip to Vegas and SF. It's got a very distinct touch of class about it (though not austentatious or showy like some hotels). The bed was large and comfortable, with a large flat screen TV and coffee machine (which didn't work properly). It had a nice big desk in the room as well as sofa chair and foot stool, and the bathroom was perfectly nice enough. We didn't see hide nor hair of the cleaners which was a complete contrast to the other hotel we stayed in where we were woken up early. It seemed as if they were invisible until the time when you left your room and came back and everything has been cleaned to perfection! The only slight annoyance (if you can call it that) was the turn down service, where they fold a corner of the bed and angle your pillows to face the window. Seemed a bit odd to me and rather pointless. If someone needs the corner of the bed to be folded down in order for them to get in, they probably need a psychiatric home and not a hotel! We got a really good deal through Expedia and paid less than Â£100 per night, which I thought was good value for the quality of the hotel. We didn't eat in the Steak House restaurant as it was a tad pricey, and also be aware that room service can be expensive as well. It's fine if you arrive late and need some food, but there are plenty of other places to eat and it is within 5 minutes of Chinatown. The hotel location was good but not excellent. It's near to Market Street, but is a good 10 minute walk to Union Square as it is located in the Financial District. This also means that there aren't a lot of eateries nearby or shops like Walgreen's if you need to dash out for something. You'd be surprised how early things shut in SF! Also worth noting, if you want to get on the internet (i.e. you don't have a laptop in your room) there are several computers in the lobby you can use but you have to pay $5.95 for 15 mins to use them via credit card, but they are perfectly secure and delete all your web history on exiting.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel with great everything”
Reviews.Author: Thereza_B
Reviews.Content: The hotel is a wonderful home away from home. The staff is very professional, friendly and go out of their way to be helpful. The rooms are spacious and well appointed. Walking distance from the waterfront. The bar serves wonderful food and a mean martini. I can recommend this hotel to all.

Reviews.Title: “Thank you Omni”
Reviews.Author: willowMelbourne
Reviews.Content: From the time we arrived, staff were professional, cheerful and knowledgeable. There presence quickly put us at ease, nothing was to trivial or unimportant. The door was grubby and i was anxious about it but they listened, understood and cleaned everything i needed to reassure me. Everything inside the room was immaculate, bedding, bathroom, all the bits you want to be sure are clean were. A special vote of thanks goes to the Bell and Valet Staff, and the wonderful woman who bought our Room Service with a smile and florish, and i'm sure added to the flavour of some much appreciated very late night meals we orded when we discovered there was nothing open when we returned on the last boat from Alcatraz Island. Our stay was very pleasant thanks to the staff, the decor and especially the cleanliness of the room. If you are going this month May 2011, just be aware that there is work on the cable line outside the front door. But don't let that put you off trying the comfort of the Omni for yourself.

Reviews.Title: “Another great Omni hotel..”
Reviews.Author: Gayle32
Reviews.Content: This was the last stop of our honeymoon & we booked this hotel as we'd styed in the Omni Shoreham in DC & loved it & we were certainly not disappointed with this one either. The hotel was lovely & the staff are extremely helpful. Its in a great location - 10 minutes walk to Union Square, 5 minutes walk to Chinatown & short tram ride to Fishermans Wharf. I really rate the Omni chain & would not hesitate in staying in one of their hotels again. Top tip - join the select guest programme & you get complimentary WiFi & free coffee & juice delivered to your room but if you want your drink at 8am mark 8.30am on the card as it was always early! :-)

Reviews.Title: “Perhaps the best hotel I ever stayed at”
Reviews.Author: Davo_Fido
Reviews.Content: You now how some good looking girls have terrible personalities because they don't have to try hard? Well the Omni SFO is the stunning looking girl with the terrific, friendly personality. In short, it's great. I can't imagine staff trying harder to please in such a friendly, unobtrusive manner. The hotel itself is very luxurious - everything, and I mean everything, is top notch. It's also well located, just ten minutes walk to Union Square, the Ferry terminal and little Italy. We even walked to Fisherman's Wharf (20 minutes). And you have to have a steak from Bob's - the one I had was easily the best I've ever had anywhere in the world.

Reviews.Title: “Charged Credit Card Twice the Amount of One Night's Stay”
Reviews.Author: simbalarue
Reviews.Content: When I called the Omni hotel in SF to say they charged my credit card over twice the amount for a one night's stay, they said I would have to contact my bank and work it out with them to find out what happened. I said that was not covenient for me and that they should correct it from their end. The money has already been taken out of my account and they said I would have to wait 5 days before the charge will be corrected. I am NOT happy with this place and will never stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel with outstanding services!”
Reviews.Author: woody4buzz
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at Omni San Francisco for 2 nights during our west coast trip. We picked this one based on the good feedback on TripAdvisor. So glad it's the right one:) We really enjoyed our stay at the hotel. Everything about this place is good from value for money, spacious room, cleanness, and the location. However, the most impressive aspect of this place is the staff. They are so friendly, patent and helpful from the very first moment we stepped into the front door! I would go as far as to say they have the best staff/customer services among all the hotels I have stayed (that's a lot of hotels since I've been a regular business traveler for a long time). So much impressed we also suggested my cousins to join us by staying in the same hotel. They were impressed too :) The only reason why I give 4 star instead of 5 is the carpet in the room. It's clean but a bit tired. I'd be happy to give them a 5+ star if they put new carpet in the hotel rooms. As many reviewers mentioned at TripAdvisor, this hotel can do so much better with a bit refresh.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Service”
Reviews.Author: GN&CB
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 3 nights on the 16th floor. The room was very comfortable and had everything we could have needed - even a view ! We were very impressed by how helpful and friendly the hotel staff were. Answering questions, and then anticipating the next question. Happy to chat and make sure that there was nothing further you needed. Very refreshing for a city centre hotel. There was a wedding going on when we arrived, but we got plenty of attention, and our room was made ready. The hotel has a restaurant and a separate bar. The location is very central to the main areas, and its easy to take the cable car to Fishermans Wharf if you need to. Excellent choice for a 4 star hotel. For a romantic evening, try BIX, which is a short walk away and has live music. Michael Mina is also worth a visit and close by on California. Neither rush you through your meal ! If youre from the UK, avoid House of Prime Rib. If you have time, go to Napa Valley - wonderful!

Reviews.Title: “Impecible customer service, and friendly staff!”
Reviews.Author: mrsbrieon
Reviews.Content: Initial welcome was great, and did'nt disapoint our expectations. Location was great to explore all areas of Frisco, tram stop directly outside the hotel. City line, buses & bart also located in all areas close to hotel. Tram line currently being improved outside hotel but this did not spoil our stay. Did'nt eat at hotel as it was quite pridcey. But again this did not spoil ourstay in anyway as the choices of eatery are in abundance.Chinatown very close, and Northbeach. Always light refreshments; warm cider or iced tea and fruit in reception. Sign in to guessed services, it takes to minutes, and is free. You can have tea, coffee, or hot chocolate for free delivered to your room, plus internet access. Would go back to the Omni again. All were welcomed, from business people to families :)

Reviews.Title: “Omni Review”
Reviews.Author: CTTraveller12345
Reviews.Content: Very nice, clean, well maintained, centrally located business hotel. Staff were very friendly and helpful. There were no unpleasant surprises during my stay except for the $50 breakfast for 2 in their restaurant.

Reviews.Title: “Superb!”
Reviews.Author: OzzieOnTheGo
Reviews.Content: Was a little hesitant, given the room rates but i splurged on a nice hotel for my SF holiday and really enjoyed it. * Concierge desk was very knowledgeable and helpful with my questions. *Rooms were very generous and beautifully finished and furnished. * Complimentary wifi in the lobby is a godsend. *Snacks (fruit and juice) are complementary for guests upon arrival. Awesome for the afternoon munchies when you duck back to hotel before dinner; and to revive yourself after check in; and much healthier. *Private limo service to the airport is also an option * No electric kettle to boil water in your room for tea. Have to make do with the lukewarm water from new fangled coffee percolator thing. The machine appears to be the norm in most American hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: GonzoTheGreatLondon
Reviews.Content: We stayed a couple of days in SF in this hotel. Just excellent. We also got a good price through Expedia. Super friendly staff. Great location. Walking distance to BART. 10 min walk to Union square and 2 min walk to china town. 30 minutes stroll along the water to pier 33 for Alkatraz. If you can stay in this hotel, just do. We will do again next time! We signed up with the loyalty scheme over the internet as someone here suggested. This was great, we got free internet and 2 drinks per person free in the morning delivered to the room. Try their orange and tomato juice! ;-)

Reviews.Title: “Solid choice for downtown San Francisco”
Reviews.Author: mess0277
Reviews.Content: Great staff. Very good choice for downtown. A few blocks from the Ferry building, Union Square, Nob Hill & North Beach. Neighborhood is quieter than Union Square, although you can hear every noise from nearby rooms.
