Complimentary coffee with steamed milk and various newspapers are a nice touch, and the workout room is better than at most similarly-priced hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty nice hotel and attentive staff”
Reviews.Author: tognir
Reviews.Content: This was the last hotel we stayed at on our recent trip to the USA. We booked based on the good reviews, location and low price. Our room was ready when we arrived and we were given lots of helpful information by reception for our stay in San Francisco. The rooms are nice, not massive but big enough for two people. The hotel has an old fashioned luxurious feeling to it, different to the usual chains we have stayed at. We were disappointed slightly that the cable car was not running on California Street right outside the hotel, closed for refurbishment of the line. We would have liked to seen them running instead of the roadworks, but this was not the hotels fault. I do think Thomas Cook could have let us know about this before booking though. It was only a small inconvenience to our stay with there being trams a short walk away or another cable car at the top of the steep hill. We went all over in San Francisco and bought a 3 day travel pass from reception. We also went to see a Giants game which was good fun, concierge were very helpful sorting out the tickets for us. The hotel is in a good location in the financial district and a short walk to Union Square and all the shops, although being in the financial district did mean a few coffee shops and restaurants were closed over the weekend. We ate nearby at restaurants recommended by concierge and also in the hotel for lunch and dinner. The onion rings in the hotel restaurant show as a starter ($12) and look amazing. Be warned, the portions are massive and we struggled to eat them all, along with steaks for main course. My only small complaint is that I struggled to get english tea. There is fruit and earl grey tea in the rooms and free coffee downstairs for guests in the morning. They did get me english tea in the morning when I asked but made a point of saying I should really be charged as only coffee is free. The maid did her best to get me english tea for the room but I ended up with more earl grey! On our last day, they kindly stored the luggage for us until the afternoon when we left and then arranged for a hotel car to take us to the airport in style, rather than a taxi. We would happily recommend the hotel to others and stay again on our next visit to San Francisco.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel and Staff”
Reviews.Author: hotelguest1982
Reviews.Content: I got a good deal at this hotel through expedia, and I couldn't have been happier. From the moment I checked in, until they arranged a private car to take me to airport I had a great time. Check in was easy, and because I joined there free club, I got free wifi and two free beverages each morning. (non alcohal) Rooms were clean, and staff came by for turndown service each evening. Washrooms were nice, and hotel smelled great too. Free apples and some sort of either cyder or juice in the lobby. Would def stay here again if I could.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing staff - what a lovely hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Cuttingblade
Reviews.Content: We absolutely loved this hotel. From the very first moment everyone we met was so welcoming. Stephen on reception took at least 15 minutes to go over the map with us, recommending places to visit/eat/transport tips etc. all of which we found to be excellent. Every time we came back to the hotel the staff met us with a sincere and friendly "Welcome back!". It was raining during our stay but umbrellas were handed out as we went out and there was always someone on the door to help you in with bags/relieve you of wet umbrellas etc. The warm cider in reception and the bowl of shiny apples was a homely touch. The hotel's location is perfect - near Chinatown and Little Italy - and a pleasant walk from the Ferry building - with good transport options nearby if you don't walk. We spent a month touring Australia and this was our stopover on the way home - what a lovely way to end a perfect trip! Thanks to all at the Omni for a delightful stay!

Reviews.Title: “Great Trip/ Great Staff”
Reviews.Author: nrzermd
Reviews.Content: We traveled to SF for delayed anniversary. Initial room was nice but problems with TV. John from Engineering tried for hours but was unable to resolve issue. We were promptly moved to another room, but again with TV issues. Zaw at front desk personally upgraded and came to move us with John . As it turns out, the TV issues were a result of the service not the hotel. The staff went above and beyond what is expected to ensure customer satisfaction. The hotel itself is very good, but it is the sincere effort of staff that we encountered made it a great experience. From the outstanding directions/guidance from the concierge, to the attentiveness and service recovery of John and Zaw.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel at a great value.”
Reviews.Author: ace8726872
Reviews.Content: When I was looking for a hotel in San Francisco, I noticed that the hotels were expensive and parking at the hotel was outrageously expensive as well. I didn't even look at Omni at first because I figured that I would not be able to afford it, Omni being a 4 star hotel and all. To my surprise, Omni rate was very reasonable even the parking included. The room was small but that is the only complain I have about Omni. Everything else exceeded our expectations. The staff was extremely helpful and nice. The room was very clean and well furnished. Upon chech-in, the hotel gave my kids goodie-bags full of neat toys. As turn-down service, they gave us cookies and milk for the kids every night. The location was unbeatable as well, situated in the heart of financial district with the cable car right in front of the hotel @ California street. This is a great hotel with exceptional service at a extraordinary value. Thank you Omni for a great stay.

Reviews.Title: “Not all it's cracked up to be”
Reviews.Author: WebBrown
Reviews.Content: This hotel is very reasonably priced and is in a great location. The bathroom was also nicely updated in the room. However, the carpet was badly in need of replacing with stains pretty much every where. But the biggest problem I had was the mattress. I have never slept on a mattress as bad as the one in room 1004. And I had two mattresses in this room and both were horrible. Every time I moved in the bed, I heard and felt the springs in the mattress. The hotel attempted to remedy the problem by flipping the mattress which did nothing. For that reason I can not recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable Stay and Extremely Friendly Staff”
Reviews.Author: DB41
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Omini for 3 nights. We had 2 rooms - one for us with a king bed, the other for our adult children - 2 queens (or double) beds. The hotel was good enough to give us adjoining rooms. We paid $175 and $185 for each room and the rate included breakfast. (Breakfast was served at Bob's Steak House on the ground floor of the hotel. Each guest is given a $30 credit and there is full service.) The room was modern (flat screen tv, marble bathroom, climate controlled), quiet, and comfortable. (Hint: Join their club before you stay. It's free and you'll get free Wi-FI, a daily newspaper, and morning beverage service.) The hotel is centrally located - convenient to all parts of San Francisco, The staff is extremely friendly and knowledgable.

Reviews.Title: “Impressive for the price, but no Four Seasons or Mandarin Oriental, but good for Business.”
Reviews.Author: ChetX5150
Reviews.Content: Great location in downtown San Francisco with lots of do and see nearby. Bob's Steak and Chophouse is a restaurant off the lobby and the hotel is upscale. Rooms are adequate, nothing fancy, but service basic needs well. In-room mini-bar is key if you want a beverage! Room service was solid, both for breakfast and dinner. Internet was a bit slow, but worked well ($10 a day). Hotel staff is above average, pleasant, all over and helpful. For about $200 a night, this is a VERY GOOD hotel for the business traveler who has expense limits. SF is EXPENSIVE when you get to the nicer hotels like Ritz, Four Seasons and Mandarin, which run $400-$650 a night. For $200 you have what you need and have a great location. If you are looking for first class, consider one of the other three mentioned, but I think the Omni is a good option on a moderate budget. Also, consider the Fairmount and Westin St. Francis, similar rates and scale. Here's why Omni is no Four Seasons/Ritz: Space under door meant I could hear way too much of hallway noise, both EARLY AM and Late Night. Light in 2X mirror in bathroom burnt out. Nobody checks it. Wireless phone in room was dead--nobody checks this. Mini-bar not re-filled each day. Took a while to get room service tray removed.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!”
Reviews.Author: mrscorrad
Reviews.Content: From the moment we checked in to the time we left, everyone was so nice, helpful, pleasant. The lobby is gorgeous and the rooms/beds/pillows are extremely comfortable. We are in their rewards program (it's free) so we got free wireless and beverages at our door each morning. The hotel is well located - 2 blocks from the TransAmerica building, 4 blocks from Market Street, short walk to Chinatown, the Italian section, Union Square and the Ferry building. Very convenient.

Reviews.Title: “Homely with extras”
Reviews.Author: Fran75_11
Reviews.Content: I had read great reviews about this hotel so I was looking forward to my stay. Unfortunalty due to some cancelled flights I didn't arrive until midnight. But there was still a friendly face to greet me on my arrival which was great. The select guest program is a great one to join, no fees, just extras to make your stay better. My 2 tests when staying at a hotel are to have a good bed and an awesome shower. All staff were very friendly and attentive. Definatley recommend this hotel. Only downer very expensive internet.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing service from ALL staff...from the doorman, to the cleaners, to the concierge! GREAT!”
Reviews.Author: travellerofplaces
Reviews.Content: We had a wonderful time in San Francisco, but the hotel staff made the experience. They were all very helpful with anything we needed. Front desk staff gave us the best places to eat in the city...their local favorites. The hotel was in the financial district which was a quick walk to everything...it was busy with people, but not too busy like the main touristy area. I would stay there again in an instant!

Reviews.Title: “A very enjoyable, relaxing stay.”
Reviews.Author: lyssSydney
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Omni for 4 nights with our 2 children, ages 4 and 1. We booked the Omni because they offered a Kids Fantasy Suite, enabling us to have much more space than a standard hotel room. The kids room was fantastic! It was essentially a room connected to ours, but decked out with bunk beds, toys and bean bags. Both the kids loved it. They also provided milk and cookies at night, which our 4 year old thought was just brilliant. The staff at the hotel were extremely friendly and willing to help. There was a restaurant downstairs which was child friendly and had a very good kids menu. The hotel also has very good room service, which can often be needed with small children.

Reviews.Title: “Best staff ever!”
Reviews.Author: KFM9275
Reviews.Content: Since my husband is a member of Omni's selectguest program, we choose Omni if at all possible. We were certainly not disappointed with our weekend in San Francisco. From the doorman, to the valet parking staff, to the Concierge, Lex, everyone is top notch. Unfortunately my husband got food poisoning from a local restaurant, which ruined our stay. But the kitchen staff was nice enough to send up chicken borth and crackers (neither on the menu, of course) when he was up to eating.

Reviews.Title: “Comfy Hotel”
Reviews.Author: radsman
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a week on business. Rooms were clean and the bed comfortable. Everything was in good repair. The staff was extremely friendly and helpful. Would return here again. Gym was a bit lacking.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointment”
Reviews.Author: luvsgolf71
Reviews.Content: Booked this hotel due to the top ratings from Trip advisor and others. Spent extra for a breakfast package and upper floor to have a good view. Had to ask for the breakfast vouchers at check-in and nothing was explained. We got ready to have breakfast on our only day to sightsee we saw they were for a room service breakfast. We received a nice breakfast but it took 1 hour for the food to arrive. I am not a fan of eating in a hotel room. I asked could we eat in the restaurant for our 2nd day and was told ABSOLUTELY NOT! We were packing to leave that morning and on a 2 week journey so had a mess everywhere, making the room breakfast even more undesirable. Our 15th floor view was of a roof top and taller buildings. Be sure you are not on the California Street side of the building, if you want a view. I spent a lot of time picking the right hotel because it has been 28 years since I had a chance to visit San Francisco. The Omni did not live up to the high expectations from all the 5.0 reviews. The staff was friendly and doormen and Valet were helpful. The room was small and disappointing. I had to dry my hair in the hall while my husband showered due to the only sink area being in the bathroom. This is not my idea of what a 4.5 STAR Hotel should be

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel, everything we expected”
Reviews.Author: jcmadrid
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 2 nights on route to LA and had a near perfect stay. Very comfortable rooms, with all the extras youÂ´d expect. Excellent reception staff very willing to help and lovely breakfasts with fast and efficient service. Recommended! One note: The valeting does not apply to motorbikes, and as we were on a hired Harley we had to find our own parking.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay in great location”
Reviews.Author: ryanrovesrions
Reviews.Content: The Omni was a pleasant stay for us. On Fridays and Saturdays the valet parking is half the price at I believe $23, which for San Fran is a good deal! Check in went smooth and room was very nice and luxurious. There is a mini bar in the room, with prices exactly where you would expect. The hotel is in a great location but our room faced the interior facing side of the building not the street, so we saw only into other people's offices. The room was very basic, but small details are what separate Omni rooms from other hotel chains. The crown molding, wallpaper, service phone in bathroom, silk lined robes, sliding bathroom door, etc..Nonetheless it was great and the Omni is always a classic.

Reviews.Title: “"a fine hotel with excellent staff"”
Reviews.Author: savetheworld123
Reviews.Content: Stayed four nights and found from the moment we arrived an ambience of service that really set a tone. The staff was exceptionally accomodating, and all the little perks like coffee and juice delivered to your am door, internet access, fruit and beverage in lobby, and smling and helpful faces was so upbeat in this fabulous and dynamic city. Sign up for the Omin program, it's free. There is a nice bakery around the corner on Pine Street. The Ferry Building, Chinatown, Union Square are just minutes away, aong with the cable car and bart services. The rooms are quiet and the beds are top notch. This hotel is a gem, nestled in a great location to tour, feel safe, enjoy quality and elegance, and make your San Fransisco stay a four star. Would come back in a heart beat.

Reviews.Title: “service, service, service”
Reviews.Author: chowc
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at many hotels in the past and I have to admit that the service provided by the staff at this hotel is top notch. Service - 5 stars I was greeted with my name and always got a smile and a greeting from every staff member. They always made an effort to connect with you. Even the maids left personalized note in your room, nice touch. Requested a birthday celebration for my sister during the stay and it was accommodated. The staff sent a slice of beautiful chocolate cake and a small bottle of champagne to my sister's room on her birthday! Got good recommendation for restaurant. The staff are just wonderful! Rooms - 5 stars Just like all other Omni hotels, it is beautiful, clean and comfortable. Location - 5 stars walkable distance to Chinatown, cable car stops in front of the hotel I have stayed at Le Meridien and Grand Hyatt in San Francisco and Omni is the best.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Stay”
Reviews.Author: BarnaD
Reviews.Content: This is one of the few hotels in San Fransisco that let us stay with our 3 kids in a Deluxe room with 2 double beds. At check in the staff provided the kids with backpacks full of fun stuff. We were already enrolled in their loyalty program (which is free)-so we got free wifi , complimentary water, complimentary hot beverage in the morning and milk-cookies for the kids at night. The staff were always friendly. The room and the bathroom were both celan and spacious. We were on the 17th floor but still could hear some street noise but that is part of staying in the city. Loved Omni and will recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel with the best staff”
Reviews.Author: awey33388
Reviews.Content: We loved our getaway to the Omni San Francisco. Great location, wonderful rooms but the staff sets the hotel apart. The hotel has a true guest service culture. We will return.

Reviews.Title: “Very enjoyable stay”
Reviews.Author: MishB
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Omni last week for 4 nights in a suite. It was extremely good value, the room was large, comfortable, the bed was heavenly, the bathroom spacious with plentiful hot water and water pressure. Large towels. The location of the hotel is great, close to transport, Union Square, Chinatown etc. I had injured my leg earlier in our trip and was on crutches. The hotel staff did everything they could to help make my stay easier and more comfortable, but besides this everyone we encountered was very helpful and friendly. I would definitely stay here again the next time we return to San Francisco.

Reviews.Title: “We stay no where else in SF”
Reviews.Author: CarmelDoug
Reviews.Content: We went to the Omni SF to celebrate my wife's birthday. I paid the lowest posted price on line and asked for an upgrade. We got a suite! Plus they gave my wife a big slice of birthday cake with "Happy Birthday" with her name on the plate. As usual, the staff was the best. We stay here every time we visit SF. The biggest surprise: They held two bags while we ate lunch and waited for check in. I wanted to tip the front desk guy a couple bucks for getting the bags out of storage. He refused and said it was unnecessary. Every time we come to the Omni we get a perfect experience. Very consistent.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful!!! felt like we mattered and important. LOVELY”
Reviews.Author: Kereni
Reviews.Content: VERY fency (though the rooms are a bit too "old fasion" great location and great serivce They took care of everything for us. VERY kids friendly despite it is a more business like hotle. they got us a kids activity pack and kids' menu - expensive, but worth it - very tasty If you have some money to spare and want to be spolit - go there Register as a member before booking as you will get some nice treats :)

Reviews.Title: “Great locaton, great atmosphere, great service, great hotel!!!”
Reviews.Author: jlrb07
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Omni and really enjoyed it. It is in a geat location near Chinatown, Nob Hill, the Embarcadero, and the Wharf. A cable car line runs right in front of hotel and can get you around easily. The hotel has a luxurious feel and the staff was very accommodating. Surprisingly quiet given the location. Definitely would stay here again!!!

Reviews.Title: “Nothing but good things to say about the Omni....”
Reviews.Author: munchkins1966
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our stay immensely at the Omni. Lovely, clean and accomodating in every sense. The staff was incredible - not once did we encounter an indifferent, unhelpful employee. Everyone was personable, attentive and extremely helpful. Be aware of parking fees, but they're expected in the city....ENJOY!

Reviews.Title: “One of the Best Hotels”
Reviews.Author: NYBuddy33
Reviews.Content: The Omni hotel is, quite simply, one of the best places I've ever stayed. From the time you arrive you are treated with tremendous service. There is no line to wait on when you arrive and no lengthy check-in process...simply tell the front desk your name and your key is waiting for you. Once in your room, a warm note awaits along with a bucket full of ice and two complimentary bottled waters. For Omni awards members (free to sign up), wi-fi is free, as are two complimetary beverages each morning (I chose a pot of coffee and an OJ). These two conveniences alone saved me over $50 over the course of my four days there. As mentioned at the outset, customer service could not be better. The staff is attentive to your every need. I booked tow tours through the concierge and both were great. As for location, the Omni is located downtown, about 4 blocks north or Market Street and about eight blocks from the Embarcadro. It is about two blocks from the TransAmerica Building. Needless to say, this is an excellent location to explore virtually any part of the city. Union Square is probably a slightly better location, but this is a close second. I will look to stay at the Omni every time I'm in SF in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Service, Great Location & Value”
Reviews.Author: RobiWa
Reviews.Content: From the moment you get to the hotel you are greeted with the best service I have ever experienced. Check-in was perfect, my kids got their own back-packs with games and chocolate chip cookies with milk every night. Little touches like having morning drinks delivered to your door every morning completed the experience. Location is very central to Chinatown, North Beach, Union Square, etc.

Reviews.Title: “Omni SFO Service is still ouystanding.”
Reviews.Author: willy77055
Reviews.Content: Front desk staff went out of their way to be of assistance with many small details and local reservations. They gave us excellent choices and advice.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty, historic hotel with great service”
Reviews.Author: erink_pgh
Reviews.Content: Stayed 2 nights over a weekend in January. The lobby & exterior were beautiful and the staff was super helpful. The hotel is very conveniently located on the edge of the financial district and about 2 blocks from Chinatown. We walked to the Ferry Building and many other tourist destinations. Also, the hotel gives a free guided walking tour on Saturday mornings. When we checked in the desk staff offered us maps and some recommendations for what to do in the neighborhood. They were also very helpful and pleasant when I had questions and when I reported that the cordless phone in our room wasn't working. Also there are doormen! The room (king bed) was nice, not as super-new as the Marriotts we often stay in (because of a corporate travel deal) but very nice, especially the large bathroom with marble sink. The one down side was there was no view from our 4th-floor room, which opened onto some sort of oubliette/internal ventilation shaft between the hotel and the office building on the rest of the block. Also the room was kind of stuffy but we opened the window (it only opens a few inches) and turned off the heating/cooling system (individual thermostat in the room) and that was perfect. The hotel is part of Historic Hotels of America, and they offer discounts for members, but we got a special weekend rate from Omni that was less. Reasonable price for downtown SF. There's a fee for wireless internet service, but it's waived if you join the Omni rewards program (which you can do at any time, even after checking in). Valet parking is only $26 on weekends, which was a nice surprise since I'd heard it was $48 - which is true during the week. We stayed over Friday and Saturday nights.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect choice in San Francisco”
Reviews.Author: saopaulo36
Reviews.Content: We chose to stay at the Omni because of the reviews we read in Trip Advisor. And I am so glad we did it! A perfect choice! The hotel is very nice and charming, the location is very good but most of all I have never stayed in a Hotel with such a friendly staff. From the doormen, the concierge, reception, every single employee is kind and always ready to help you with good tips and a friendly smile in their faces. The rooms are not that big, but are nicely decorated and very clean. They are a bit noisy though, internal noise from the corridors and also external from the street. The hotel is walking distance to Market Street and Union Square and the nice shops around. I definetly recommend this Hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Wonderful staff.”
Reviews.Author: Bluechip78
Reviews.Content: I stayed here over Christmas while on my honeymoon, I had mentioned the occasion on the booking form and there was a note delivered from the accommodation manger wishing us a lovely stay and some complementary strawberries following our arrival. The room was fairly large and comfortable. The hotel is well located close to most attractions and the California street cable car runs along outside the door. The only negative is the cost of Valet parking is quite high $48 plus taxes per night ut otherwise it's an excellent hotel. Don't forget to sign up to the Select guest program. It's free and provides complementary Wifi and a Coffee/Juice each morning of your stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel for a great value!”
Reviews.Author: PamEqualsCool
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Omni in SF back in May when we visited the Bay Area. It was an excellent hotel and we were surprised by the great value. It is also in a nice location. Not a whole lot happening at night, but walking distance to many nice restaurants and tourist spots.

Reviews.Title: “perfect”
Reviews.Author: Tito4
Reviews.Content: great hotel, very friendly staff!! Outstanding location. We walked to Union Square, Little Italy, ChinaTown, short walk for F route (bus) to fisherman's wharf. Be sure to sign for "select guest" is free and it provide free wifi, hot choc and/r coffee or juice in the morning.

Reviews.Title: “Classic hotel with the best service you could imagine”
Reviews.Author: Peppersita
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Omni for 3 nights whilst on our honeymoon. The first moment we walked into the hotel we knew that it would be special. The front desk staff were very courteous the concierge was extremely helpful in giving us directions to a restaurant we had a booking at and also giving us advice on good places to shop. The hotel room itself was clean and cosy, with the most comfortable, softest bed that I have ever slept on. Signing up to the hotel's Select Guest program we were provided with complimentary wifi in the room as well as 2 free bottles of water and 2 coffee/juice options each day. My husband and I found this wonderful, to wake up to find complimentary drinks at the door. What made this hotel more special was the fact that the housekeeping staff wrote a handwritten note to us on the first night wishing us a enjoyable stay. It's small touches like this that makes guests like us feel welcomed and at home. During our stay, the Omni Hotel had complimentary hot apple cider and Christmas cookies on offer near the lifts. The apple cider was simply delicious and Christmas cookies scrumptious. The hotel itself is about a 10 minute walk from the nearest underground metro station and a short stroll from Union Square. The hotel also offers walking tours around China Town which is a short stroll away. Overall, during our 5 week stay in the US (around various cities and hotels), my husband and I both agreed that the Omni Hotel in SF was the best and most memorable hotel that we stayed at. I would definitely recommend this hotel to anyone and would not hesitate to return here on my next trip back to SF.

Reviews.Title: “Love this place!!”
Reviews.Author: lorrie-n-john
Reviews.Content: This is a fabulous old hotel right on the trolley line, right next to Chinatown and within walking distance of many good spots. We signed up to be members of the Omni group, and as a perk to members they will bring you free coffee, tea and newspaper up to your room! It's elegant, clean, and lovely. The only place we stay in San Francisco nowadays.

Reviews.Title: “Reviews are Right ON”
Reviews.Author: luv2golfDenver
Reviews.Content: Very nice Hotel. Centrally located. Incredible friendly staff everywhere. Great rooms. Excellent value

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel! Great Location! Awesome Staff!”
Reviews.Author: Langsta5342
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here for the last few days of our honeymoon. "Wicked" was in town and my wife really wanted to see it. Without any prior planning and the day before we even arrived to San Francisco, I called the hotel and asked the desk clerk (Steven) if there would be any way that the hotel could get us last minute tickets. He made a phone call and called me right back. I gave him my credit card info and it was a done deal. He even went on his own time to pick up the tickets for us! The tickets were handed to us upon checked in. We were also upgraded to a suite (being that it was our honeymoon)! The rest of the staff was great too. Another man at the desk recommended some great bars nearby that were on-point with our style. Next time we visit San Fran, we will be staying here, without a doubt! I definitely recommend staying at this hotel! Thanks Steven!

Reviews.Title: “Best experience”
Reviews.Author: mtoon
Reviews.Content: Weâ€™ve travelled quite a bit but this has been the best hotel experience we have encountered. The hotel itself was clean with a warm and welcoming lobby, and cider is offered daily. Each staff member was very friendly and enthusiastic, from check-in until we got on the taxi for the airport. We were always greeted warmly and offered assistance. The front door staff members were always courteous and smiling. The front desk staff offered great information, sometimes even without our request. The only area for improvement is that perhaps concierge staff could be a bit more knowledgeable about the sightseeing areas. Joining the complimentary Select Guest program is a must. You get free wifi which would otherwise be a $10/day charge. Two bottled waters are delivered on your first day, and two beverages per guest are promptly delivered to your room each morning at your chosen time. There is the option that room service will knock at your door and leave the tray there. When we requested a 4am delivery due to an early flight (not included the hotelâ€™s given options), our tray was still delivered exactly when we needed it for a great start to the day. The room was spacious and clean. When we found a spot on the bed sheets and wanted them replaced, housekeeping came within minutes and was incredibly friendly, even giving us sightseeing advice. It was quiet, with no noise from the streets or the hallways during the nights. The location was great and within walking distance to Chinatown, North Beach, and Union Square. We felt safe walking around early morning and in the evenings. Breakfast places and convenience stores were nearby, which was handy. We will definitely return to this hotel should we visit San Francisco again. From this wonderful experience, we will be looking forward to staying in Omni hotels in other cities around the world in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Attentive to your every need”
Reviews.Author: cbmm
Reviews.Content: We live 1 hr. away from San Francisco, so when we get the opportunity for a getaway, I always check the recommendations here before I book a hotel. It's fun to try a new place each time. We were impressed with the level of attentiveness as soon as we pulled up to the curb. We were greeted with smiles and help at every turn. We walked to Union Square, Nob Hill, and the Embarcadero from the hotel. We would definitely stay here again, I wish we could of stayed more than one night.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely stay during the holidays”
Reviews.Author: tripleflip
Reviews.Content: The Omni San Francisco is excellent value for money, especially if you can get a great room rate. I cancelled my reservation at another hotel when I saw the Omni had a $99 rate over the Christmas holidays. From check-in to check-out, I had very friendly interactions with every staff member l encountered. I was especially impressed that the housekeeping staff communicated to me via the notepad on the writing desk on a daily basis. The room itself was nicely appointed and a good size. I had an interior courtyard "view", but I didn't mind as there was no traffic noise whatsoever. I didn't hear other guests through the walls either. This was my first time staying at an Omni hotel, so based on recommendations I signed up for their frequent guest program. This entitled me to free wifi during my stay, and a daily choice of newspaper delivered in the morning alongside two breakfast drinks. Overall, it was a wonderful stay and I would not hesitate in returning to the Omni.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value and location”
Reviews.Author: goldchevy
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Omni for our 20th anniversary. We booked a package deal which included free valet (otherwise parking is $50 a night), breakfast (a $30 value per person) and tickets to the Musee D'Orsay exhibit at the DeYoung. I definitely recommend using a package deal like ours. Hotel was extremely quiet, beds comfortable, bathrooms nicely decorated. But the best thing was the staff--everyone was incredibly friendly and helpful. And the location--a short walk to the Embarcadero, Union Square, China Town. On the cable car line. Short walk to street cars which will take you to Fisherman's Wharf. Very convenient. I will definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: Retrohippie
Reviews.Content: Pros: Lovely hotel. We didn't use room service and never had to call housekeeping, so I can't review that. Robes were provided, and the tub is extra deep, which I loved after getting caught in a downpour down at Fisherman's Wharf. The bathroom is all marble, with Kohler fixtures, but watch those sink handles! They unscrew easily after being turned on and off, and will drop off onto the counter, or if you're unlucky, onto the glass soap dish or q-tip holder. The handles are heavy, and it's possible something could be broken. The two windows only open about six inches, for safety purposes. Street noise is minimal as long as the windows are kept closed. The heating unit in the room worked great and was not loud at all. We didn't try the A/C, of course. The king-sized bed was very comfortable, but firmer than we're used to. A good quality blow dryer in a drawstring bag hung in the bathroom, and an iron and board in the closet and a 32-inch flat screen tv for bedside viewing. A small coffeepot with quality coffee is provided. There is also a small portable fridge in the television armoir, to which you are given a key at check-in. You can use the fridge to store your own stuff if you want, but don't try to store too much. The fridge has a small amount of liquor, beer, wine, soda and sparkling water that the maid checks every day to see if you've used anything. If you don't want her digging through all your stuff to find their stuff, don't cram it full of your stuff. Unless you want to pay top dollar, don't drink the bottled water they leave out for you and don't eat any of their candy or drink anything from their fridge. Bring your own snacks and keep a six-pack of your favorite soda in the fridge. The restaurant in the hotel, Bob's Steak and Chop House is a fine restaurant. A little pricey, but worth it. If you want breakfast, you must be there before 10 am. Not easy for late risers like us. But if you miss it, the Subway right across the street next to the Wells Fargo serves breakfast sandwiches and has fresh hot coffee. Also, I highly recommend the Wells Fargo History Museum, since it's right there. The very site of the very first Wells Fargo. The cable cars were not running on California Street. That's the main reason I chose a hotel on a cable car line, so we could step out the front door and catch one. I checked SFMTA's website, and it said that due to construction, the entire California line will be shut down from January 3rd, 2011 until June 2011, so it should have been running while we were there. The hotel staff did not know why it was not. The hotel is non-smoking, so you'll have to go outside the hotel to do that, if you smoke. The windows don't open far enough to be of any use, and although you can remove the plastic stops to open the window all the way, there is a very real chance you would fall if you leaned out even a little, so I do not recommend this to smoke, or for any other reason. No, we did not try this. Parking at the hotel is valet only, and costs $48 a day. Outrageous! Do yourself a favor and find another garage. There are a couple nearby on Kearney. You can find web coupons if you're really into saving extra money. Lastly, do yourself a favor and leave your car parked. Buy a 3 or 7-day muni pass at the hotel desk. It's good for all types of bus, cable car and trolley car transportation throughout the city. There's also a discount at the Ghirardeli square chocolate store and the SF Zoo if you show your muni pass.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay in San Francisco”
Reviews.Author: French_Australian
Reviews.Content: We just checked-out from the hotel where we stayed 3 nights in San Francisco, the Omni. The hotel was very comfortable and luxurious and all the staff were very friendly, extremely helpful and genuinely interested in making our stay a pleasant one. The beds were very comfortable, everything was clean. We highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “A fabulous hotel with great staff”
Reviews.Author: rwueste
Reviews.Content: Outstanding accommodations, friendly staff, and a great location. We really enjoyed our stay.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, central location”
Reviews.Author: bubu3
Reviews.Content: I agree with many of the positive comments on here. Stayed here for 3 nights while on a short vacation. Very friendly staff, clean, good rooms and a very central location. Also good value for money given alternatives.

Reviews.Title: “Cordial, classy, comfortable, convenient.”
Reviews.Author: sitesea
Reviews.Content: The Omni is on a quiet block of a busy neighborhood. Each member of the staff was 100% welcoming and helpful day and night. The hotel is an elegant and calm universe to enter after walking amidst the kinetic energy of downtown SF. The decor is understated and classic. The room was comfortable, meticulously clean and inviting. Our rate included breakfast which was served in a lovely white napkin restaurant. My croissant had perfect butter crunch and the segmented grapefruit was served with an orchid decor. The Omni makes a weekend getaway very special indeed.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, free apple cider, elegant hotel.”
Reviews.Author: dantebouchot
Reviews.Content: Recently I stayed one night in the Omni San Francisco Hotel. It is a very nice and elegant hotel located on the corner of California and Montgomery, in the financial district of San Francisco. The location is great because it is a five minute (flat) walk to the Montgomery BART station, and a ten minute (flat) walk to the Ferry Building. Also, the California Street cable car line runs right in front of the hotel. The other two cable car lines are just a short walk away (a steep uphill walk though). So overall, its very easy to get to most tourist attractions in the city using public transportation. And of course, you can always just take a cab, as it only costs around $10 to get to Fisherman's Wharf. The service was great, the hotel staff was always willing to give advice on how to get from one place to another, and they seemed very knowledgable. The rooms themselves were big and clean. We had a standard room, with a king size bed, two LCD TVs and a desk. One other thing my fiancee liked was that in the afternoon they offer free apple cider in the lobby, which she loves and thought it was really good (I can't personally vouch for it since I don't like apple cider in general). Overall, we were extremely satisfied with the Omni San Francisco.

Reviews.Title: “Omni could not have been any better!”
Reviews.Author: Tally42
Reviews.Content: This was our first stay in an Omni Hotel. From the moment that we arrived, we were welcomed and greeted by the most gracious hotel staff. The hotel is beautiful, the rooms are nice, quiet and well equipped. We would recommend this hotel to anyone staying downtown.

Reviews.Title: “The Omni Staff exceeded our expectations for a wedding”
Reviews.Author: JimandDot
Reviews.Content: We did not have a wedding planner for the wedding (tough economy, don'tcha know). We used the Omni Hotel as our base of operations as mother and step-father of the groom. The Thanksgiving Weekend was quiet in the financial district so we were afforded reasonable room rates for all the guests. The catering department suggested and prepared an excellent rehearsal dinner Mexican buffet in a beautiful room; helped coordinate the shuttle service to the church the next day; and, topped it off with an extraordinary brunch the day after the wedding for the guests staying at the hotel. The staff, from valet to bell, to front desk, to the catering department, were engaging and seemed very happy in their jobs. We can't wait to go back or stay at another Omni Hotel. Dot and Jim Schmidt, Gardnerville, Nevada

Reviews.Title: “Great staff, very nice stay”
Reviews.Author: z_portland
Reviews.Content: Went here because of the ratings here on Trip Advisor, and happy we did. We took Amtrak and it was within walking distance from the drop off. As many others have said, the location is great. We got a very good price on the room thru the Omni web site, better than the ones linked via this site. The staff was so friendly and kind to our kids and they accommodated a late check out, which was great. The room was fine. Nothing that made it exceptional, but it was a very good stay.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: supermom91
Reviews.Content: We stayed for a couple of days before Thanksgiving. The Hotel staff was very professional. Location was great and price was very good due to a holiday special from the Omni website. We look forward to visiting this hotel again on future visits. Only wishes are for rooms with 2 queen beds, (only doubles are available) and a quick service restaurant or gift shop for snacks.

Reviews.Title: “Favorite Hotel in San Francisco”
Reviews.Author: Hobiz2
Reviews.Content: We have been to quite a few SF hotels as our daughter went to USF. We always enjoy our stay at the Omni. Great Service, Great rooms, and all around great experience. It can be pricey, but deals can be had. There frequent guest program is one f the best we have found. No reservations in highly recommending this outstanding property

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: d_aussiegirl
Reviews.Content: Hotel was a bit pricey but very happy once we arrived. Great room, although bathroom was a bit small, and perfect location to walk to Union Square for serious shopping.

Reviews.Title: “OmniTASTIC IN the city”
Reviews.Author: traveljunkienj
Reviews.Content: !My preference is to book directly with the hotel, however, Expedia offered a deal I could not refuse. Airfare and hotel for 1200 (for two!!), we stayed three nights (not enough). This hotel is perfectly situated for the business traveler, surprisingly we enjoyed the location due to its proximity to Chinatown and shopping. Renting a car for the day gave us the freedom to tour wine country (lovely) and coast (WOW). Be sure to have lots of space on your camera; you could take a thousand pics in Frisco. Highlights were: dinner at Jacquelin's - souffle supreme, haunting the bookstores in the North side and steak dinner at Harris' (must do), the Japanese botanical My preference is to book directly with the hotel, however, Expedia offered a deal I could not refuse. Airfare and hotel for 1200 (for two!!), we stayed three nights (not enough). This hotel is perfectly situated for the business traveler, surprisingly we enjoyed the location due to its proximity to Chinatown and shopping. Renting a car for the day gave us the freedom to tour wine country (lovely) and coast (WOW). Be sure to have lots of space on your camera; you could take a thousand pics in Frisco. Highlights were: dinner at Jacquelin's - souffle supreme, haunting the bookstores in the North side and steak dinner at Harris' (must do), the Japanese botanical garden. Can't wait to return!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Hotel”
Reviews.Author: WtoCtoTO
Reviews.Content: We were in SF over a long weekend in August and couldn't have been happier with the Omni. The service was great from all staff and the hotel was in a very good location. While not directly in Union Square, it is just a short walk (10min). We enjoy walking, so this hotel was also perfect proximity to Chinatown (2min), Fisherman's Wharf (20min), and anywhere else you need to go. As with anywhere in SF, if you have trouble walking or with hills, it is difficult to walk everywhere, but we love it. There's also a cable car directly in front of the hotel. Omni is a nice, high end hotel without being stuck up like some others in the area. We will definitely stay there again whether for business or pleasure.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: mamaria
Reviews.Content: I was travelling on business, but it would also be convenient for a pleasure trip. It is walking distance to the Embarcadero, Union Square and Chinatown. It is convenient to the BART and the Muni Montgomery station. The room was spacious and clean. The staff was friendly. It is very beneficial to sign up for their rewards program - it's free and the perks are nice. The only minor complaints I had were that the wireless internet was a bit slow sometimes. All in all, a very nice place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Beware checking out procedures”
Reviews.Author: David_Hawkins
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stopped at the Omni for 5 nights and the service was very reasonable. Apart from a few little hiccups the stay was uneventful until the last morning. Without any consultation they charged the account to our credit card before we even got out of bed on the last morning. I had taken enough cash to pay for the stay. Due to the exchange rate this was much a better way of paying for it. They were very kind on the front desk by crediting the credit card with the cash. I realised we would have a problem with the credit card exchange rates and sure enough we did. I lost just over $120 because of the way this was done and complained once I had the figures. Although the Hotel admits that we should not have had the account charged they refuse to help any way towards the loss. We have travelled extensively and never has this happened. I also feel that with the Hotel admitting that it should not have been done this way that they should have been willing to pay for the loss.

Reviews.Title: “Superior and outstanding service”
Reviews.Author: Jeslynns
Reviews.Content: If you are planning a trip to San Francisco, I highly recommend the Omni, specifically if you are looking for a romantic getaway. The staff, from the valet to the maid service, is superior. The front desk personnel went out of their way to provide my spouse and I an amazing getaway. The Romance package provides the guest with champagne, robes, soft music, and rose petals across the bed. The trip was a surprise for my anniversary and my husband explained to me how helpful the staff was in setting up the perfect trip. Additionally, the location was perfect! It is an easy walk to Chinatown and North Beach, and only a trolley ride away from the piers. I highly recommend this hotel and its staff!

Reviews.Title: “Road Noise Kept Me Up All Night”
Reviews.Author: accidentaltrvlr
Reviews.Content: I stay more than 60 nights a year in hotels. I have the top frequent guest status at the Omni, Starwood and Hyatt. The Omni is an older hotel on a busy corner. The lobby is nice. The staff is helpful. The rooms themselves are the size of usual hotel rooms and are in B+ condition. The reason I checked out early and will not be staying at this Omni again is I did not get a good night's sleep because of the noise from the cars, buses, cable cars and sirens. I had a suite (which is just a very small sitting area connected to a standard-sized room). All of the suites have the same noise problem because all of them are on the corner of the hotel, overlooking the busy intersection. If you do not want a suite, the hotel (which footprint is shaped like the letter L), does have interior rooms that do not face either street. However, those rooms are small and have views of only the backs of neighboring buildings. I looked at an interior room on the highest floor; its view was of the massive air conditioning unit of a neighboring building. Finally, the hotel's restaurant and parking are overpriced. For example, the American Breakfast (2 eggs, bacon or sausage, hash browns, toast, coffee and juice) is $25.95; the Cobb Salad is $19.95; the burger is $18.95; dinner entrees start at $30.95 and do not include any side dishes. Add to those prices California sales tax, 18% service charge and a $3.00 "guest dining charge." The only parking is valet, which costs $48.00 per night.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to Stay!”
Reviews.Author: kcmrjm
Reviews.Content: Our stay at the hotel was great. The hotel and our was beautiful. The service at the front desk was very friendly and helpful. The doormen were very welcoming and the house keepers did a great job servicing our room. The hotel was very clean. The location is a bit off the most travelled paths but the cable car is a block away and we could get to most places via cable car, bus, trolley easily. We could easily walk to Chinatown and Union Square. We ate at the hotel restaurant for dinner and breakfast. We were very pleased with the breakfast. The quality of the food and prices were good. We were a bit disappointed with the dinner. We thought the food was average and the prices too high. But overall, we would definitely stay at the San Francisco Omni again.

Reviews.Title: “Good location”
Reviews.Author: LW54
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 4 nights at the end of a touring holiday. We were able to leave our hire car outside while we checked in and took our bags to our room and then we were able to drop off the hire car 2 blocks away. The staff were very friendly and helpful in everyway. We asked for recommendations for restaurants and were directed to 2 within 10 mins both of which we would have walked past if choosing ourself and at which we had excellent food at reasonable prices. The house of Nam King and an Italian one next to a sex shop! Also there was a street of little restaurants very near to the hotel. Go out the door and down Montgomery to PIne and turn right onto Pine. There on the left is a street with about 8 restaurants. We ate at 2 and they were very good. The hotel rooms were very comfortable and we joined the Omni loyalty club which meant free internet access. The situation is ideal as there is a tram stop outside. We bought a travel card which meant we were able to hop on and off all forms of transport. The trams get very busy and for ease the buses were better but not as exciting!Would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay at Omni”
Reviews.Author: barneybanana
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Omni for 6 nights for a business trip and the whole stay was great and seemless. The staff is really great and helpful, check-in and out was easy and quick. This hotel is decored in an older style (both lobby and rooms) and is in the heart of the financial district, while being about a 15 min walk to Union Square and 15 min to the Embarcadero. The cable is also outside the door, but it is not very frequent (comes around every 20 min or so). My room was an average size looking onto the Wells Fargo Museum on Montgomery Street (which is worth a quick visit). I has a hand written note waiting in my room from the housekeeping lady to welcome me, which I thought was a very nice and personal touch. I have never seen this an any other hotel before. The bathroom was very clean and with a full bathtub and plenty of towels (I find hotels can sometimes be a bit stingy with towels) and good toiletries (the shampoo and conditioner was great). The only downside I have to report is that the internet access is $10 a day, I really wish it was free everywhere nowadays. I realised on the last day that from my room I could actually connect to the wifi connection from the Subway across the street. Overall, an excellent stay - however the location may be better for business travellers than for tourists.

Reviews.Title: “2 Nights of luxury!”
Reviews.Author: snuggleybum
Reviews.Content: Arrived in San Fran after a long drive from Carmel! The dtaff were amazing, couldnt have been more helpful. Our room was massive and so comfy. We had a gorgeous bathroom. The hotel was for us where they had put us very quiet indeed. 2 nights was not long enough for San Fran, we made the most of it, we hired bikes and rode over the golden gate bridge, then rook the ferry back. I highly recommend the night tour of Alcatraz. We had a great meal in China town. Hotel was in a perfect location, easy to find. Very very happy with the OMNI!

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel for seeing San Francisco”
Reviews.Author: BBunbun
Reviews.Content: Spent first two night in US in San Francisco Omni, hotel was nice, clean and comfortable with helpful staff. The room itself looked over onto the tram line which was a slight issue with late night noise, but not a significant issue. Would have had 5 stars but spending the first two nights in a different country where lots of items seemed to have price tickets on (bottled water in bath room) although helpful was a little bugging. We would however stay here again if we visit San Francisco again and were very glad we didn't stay in Fishermans Wharf Area.

Reviews.Title: “Sorry we couldn't have stayed longer”
Reviews.Author: grannyfriday
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Omni in September. Sadly it was only for three nights. It's a fabulous hotel, location is great, the staff are helpful and very friendly and although we only stayed in a standard room, it was still luxurious. It's the third time we have visited San Francisco and the first time we have stayed at the Omni, what a shame, if only we had discovered it sooner.

Reviews.Title: “The Omni welcomed us like family”
Reviews.Author: bigcanoe2
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here for 2 days before beginning our Alaska cruise. It was the perfect beginning. Our room was large, clean and ready when we arrived. The staff remembered we were celebrating a birthday and generously provided us with treats and bubbly. The location is perfect for getting up and down the Nob Hill area ( do enjoy a cocktail at the Top Of The Mark ) the cable car is right out the door. We were provided with umbrellas as needed and always given good advice as to where we could dine, etc. We will always be glad to reccomend this great hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent from start to finish”
Reviews.Author: lovehotels_10
Reviews.Content: I booked a 2 night weekend stay at the Omni based on TA reviews for a getaway weekend with my family (kids 8,10) . I had high expectations given its TA ratings and was not disappointed- in fact, it exceeded my expectations. The hotel is well located - not right in the middle of the "action" but close to Chinatown, North Beach, Union Square and the Ferry Building. It also helps having the cable car line right outside. I have stayed at many nicer SF hotels and the Omni met or exceeded the service at any of them. They were especially nice to my kids - welcoming them by name, giving them backpacks, cookies at night, etc. Their service is clearly a differentiator for them at all levels - housekeepping, bellman, valet, front desk - all of it was exceptional. Rooms were clean and decent size (we had 2 double beds). We ordered the morning beverage service and it arrived moments before our selected time both mornings. I cannot think of anything I would change and will definitely stay here on return trips and recommend it to others as well.

Reviews.Title: “They made our 10th Wedding Anniversary so special!”
Reviews.Author: KweenBee74
Reviews.Content: My husband and I spent a week in northern California to celebrate our 10th wedding anniversary. The first half we were in Napa Valley. The last half we were in San Francisco where we stayed at the Omni. We had a great stay at this hotel! Upon check-in we were greeted by Jake who made us feel welcome immediately! He had us cracking up and offered us complimentary champagne! We were told that our room was being upgraded. We were on the top floor with an amazing view of San Francisco. Also, in our room were complimentary chocolate-covered strawberries, a bottle of champagne, and yellow roses on the bed, accompanied by a note from the hotel staff congratulating us on our anniversary. The location is great because there is a cable car stop right in front of the hotel. Plus we were able to walk just a couple of blocks in one direction to reach the Marketplace, and a couple of blocks in the other direction to reach Chinatown. The only complaint I have about the hotel is the bar and the restaurant. We were in each once, and on both occasions we felt the prices were WAY too high, and the service WAY too low! Other than that the hotel is a complete gem!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Stay at the Omni”
Reviews.Author: zalna
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Omni from October 2nd to October 4th. Our stay at the hotel was great and the hotel is near everything. As others have mentioned it is well worth joining the Omni Select Guest program. The only gripe about the hotel was that the internet was occasionally really slow. Not such a huge deal because I wasn't there to do work. Also the concierge Lex gave some fabulous suggestions for where to eat in San Francisco.

Reviews.Title: “Loved this Hotel”
Reviews.Author: CDinNI
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for three nights last month with my wife and adult daughter. We had selected it carefully following research on TA and were not disappointed. The staff were very helpful and friendly and the room was extremely comfortable. I liked having one of the 3 Cable Car routes right outside the front door but be sure to get a MUNI Visitors Pass ($20 for 3 days) as they are expensive. I joined the 'Select Guest' scheme with OMNI hotels so got free internet and the early morning beverage which was excellent. All in all a great experience.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: skintbint
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for three nights in August. A lovely hotel, friendliest and most helpful staff we have ever come across. They recommended restaurants which we tried two ( one in Chinatown) and had lovely meals at both- not cheap though ! We also ate at Bob's steak and Chop house in the hotel which was amazing. We both had fillet steak which just melted in our mouths, the best steaks ever, along with a huge loaf of warm bread. We were a bit worried that this hotel may have been too far out but there was a tram stop right across the road so was perfect

Reviews.Title: “Could not have been more pleased. Excellent.”
Reviews.Author: ESS_lover
Reviews.Content: Thanks to trip advisor, I booked our stay at the omni and was very glad that I did. Curb side assistance was easy, checking in at the front desk was a breeze, our rooms were spacious and clean and the layout was good. Room service was friendly and very prompt. They even gave us a small backpack full of toys for our little one and he was delighted. I recommend joining their "Select Guest" program when you book your room. It doesn't cost anything extra and provides you with nice perks. We especially liked the free morning beverage sevice delivered to our room since we had joined the program. Nothing starts a day better than caffeine! The hotel is also in a very good location. We were walking distance from union square, but not smack in the middle of it. Cannot say enough about how nice the staff at the hotel were. We've stayed at other hotels in San Francisco that weren't even half as nice and cost more. Now we know better.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, comfortable beds, great staff.”
Reviews.Author: Lulu0618
Reviews.Content: We stayed four nights for a family wedding. We were treated like VIPS the whole time. We stayed in a deluxe room, which is their basic, I think. The bed was the most comfortable I've been in. The hotel was quiet despite being two blocks from China town and about a 10 minute walk from the Embarcadero and Ferry Plaza market.

Reviews.Title: “sÃ¼per”
Reviews.Author: brgur
Reviews.Content: perfect location , perfect hotel ever been. perfect service, perfect king size bed,

Reviews.Title: “Omni San Francisco sets the bar high.”
Reviews.Author: destination55
Reviews.Content: This was not the first time I'd stayed at the Omni San Francisco, but I just had to repeat the experience. This hotel and the staff are a rare combination. Friendly, courteous, knowlegeable, attention to detail, excellent restaurant and bar; and walking distance to Market Street, Chinatown and the Ferry Building, even Pier 39 if you have on good walking shoes. There are several packages to choose from and since I was driving this trip, I was able to get a "park and play" package. This included valet parking and as a "select guest" I got free internet. The rooms are elegant and comfortable, room service is available. Very classy hotel and staff. Doors are opened for you and you are welcomed back every time you walk in the door. Beautiful lobby with a huge fresh flower arrangement. A complimentary selection of fresh fruit available near the elevators.

Reviews.Title: “Talk with the front desk staff”
Reviews.Author: fansmom
Reviews.Content: My daughter and I stayed at the Omni San Francisco for a week's vacation, and really enjoyed it. The location is excellent for culinary sightseeing; the Ferry Building and its magnificent farm market are a five minute walk, as are Chinatown and the Italian area of North Beach. The California Line streetcar (the easiest to get on, since it is not too popular with the tourists) runs in front of the building, but fortunately we didn't hear the clang-clang of the bells at night. The hotel had all the usual amenities (but breakfast was not included) plus a large bowl of fruit (pears, apples, plums) and a decanter of citrus water in the lobby. So refreshing after a day walking the hills of SF! If you stay more than a few days, make sure to enroll in their loyalty program, which entitles you to free wifi, plus coffee, juice, and a newspaper delivered to your door daily. The front desk staff was incredibly accomodating, with recommendations of what to see and do and eat throughout the city and beyond. I had done some internet research on tours of wine country and Muir Woods before I left home, but ended up deciding that the tour company recommended by the hotel offered a better deal, and was easier to book since the front desk clerk took care of it. The tour company picked us up at the front door. Downsides: Parking is very expensive (as it is in any city), and the plush bathrobes are too heavy to walk around the room in. They weigh a ton!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: pbonnett2000
Reviews.Content: We have visited San Francisco on many occasions but this was our first stay at the Omni. This will be our hotel of choice for all future visits. The customer service is the best of anywhere we have ever stayed. Everyone was so friendly and helpful. We asked for a restaurant recommendation that was close and they recommended the Trademark which is now a favorite! The rooms are layed out extremely well and the bed and pillows were so comfortable I wanted to take them home with me. The location is also very convenient. We have found noise to be a problem at other San Francisco hotels, but our room at the Omni was so quiet. There was nothing we didn't like about the Omni. And the hotel smelled great, I don't know what they use but it was lovely.

Reviews.Title: “My wife and I stayed on the 17th floor...”
Reviews.Author: Cathaca
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed on the 17th floor for two nights. Excellent room with a fantastic view if the city and the Bay Bridge. A real treat. Given how great the hotel is, I found that their floor staff is a bit clueless, people who work there every day barely know where they are themselves ... A bit ov the "I just work here" attitude. This us to be expected in most places but it looks particularly badly in a great place like this hotel. In all, though, we were VERY happy there!

Reviews.Title: “Great stay at a great hotel”
Reviews.Author: arkatz
Reviews.Content: I'm an ex-road warrior who only travels a few times a year now, but have had my life's share of bad hotel stays...happy to say this was not one of them. Stayed 6 nights and was extremely pleased. All staff was very helpful and friendly. Room was quiet, clean and comfortable. Bathroom was huge, shower water pressure OK, but the spout's so high got a rain shower effect more than high pressure blast. Elevators were fast and seemed readily available. Not a lot of dining right out the door as it's in the Financial district which shuts down at nights/weekends, but SF is so small you're not far away from a great restaurant somewhere. Tip: sign up on-line for their Select Guest loyalty program, then link your reservation number to your new account (or call into the hotel as I did and have them link it up). It's free and you get free internet access (vs $9.95/day when I was there), plus a host of other freeby amenities (like 2 free beverages of choice delivered every morning, rapid check-in)...well worth the 3 minutes to sign up. Minor issues: - glass-topped desk not best for optical mouse for laptop - wireless internet got a little congested at times - AC plugs were there (for chargers, etc) but not easily accessible or usable at one time

Reviews.Title: “Simply put, Omni's service is the best.”
Reviews.Author: MikeAndMui
Reviews.Content: I've walked into more beautiful buildings, slept in more comfortable beds, but I have never stayed in a hotel with better service. Over the years I've tried all of the best in San Francisco; Ritz Carlton, Mandarin Oriental, Four Seasons. Now I only stay at Omni and price doesn't have anything to do with it. The doorman, I think his name is Darryl, is amazing. I don't know what the hotel is paying this guy, but it's not enough. The housekeeping staff is top notch. During my last visit the maid came in for a turndown service while I was making love with my wife. It didn't even phase her. She just said, "Excuse me Mr. Miller, I'll come back later." I was impressed she remembered my name.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay - exceptional service at the Omni”
Reviews.Author: ProfFarnsworth
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Omni for three nights and I cannot say enough great things about this property. PROS: Exceptional staff - This is the main selling point - everyone was wonderful (Front desk, housekeeping, valet, bell staff - everyone!) Rooms - very clean, very quiet, very comfortable. Keep in mind these are not the sleek modern rooms you see in some newer "luxury" hotels (ex. W). The Omni has more traditional style rooms but these are still very nice. Location - In the financial district so not too busy (especially on the weekends) but very close to Union Square, Ferry Building, BART, and cable car lines. CONS: Price - This is the only con I can I think of and it was truly time dependent. The rate was on the high side but we certainly got what we paid for and we waited until late to book the rooms. Also there was a large convention in town so I think that inflated the room rates. I am sure you could get a very reasonable rate at another time.

Reviews.Title: “excellent”
Reviews.Author: williamsm
Reviews.Content: Loved the Omni. Easy to get to from the Bart, cable car out front, easy walking distance to Union Square, Ferry Building, Embarcadero Center, shopping on Market. Staff was friendly and helpful. Room was clean and spacious. Don't usually stay at the same hotel in SF since there are so many to choose from but would definitely stay here again and/or recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “World-class service without breaking the bank”
Reviews.Author: whenna
Reviews.Content: What I like about Omni hotels is the fact that their service is consistently good from the moment you check in to the time you leave. We signed for the loyalty program ahead of time and mentioned that we were celebrating our anniversary and when we arrived after a long drive from Napa, a beautiful plate of chocolate-covered strawberries and a chilled bottle of champagne with a personal note from the manager to wish us a happy anniversary were waiting for us. It was a very pleasant surprise! When we checked in, the front desk people were not only pleasant but truly made us feel welcomed along with the doormen who went out of their way to make sure that we were accommodated throughout our entire trip. The room was immaculate and the gym was top-notch --- all of these amenities without having to pay an arm and a leg unlike many other hotels in the area. This was our second stay with Omni hotels and I have to say that we will forever be loyal to this hotel and will ensure that we only stay here. Thanks for an excellent effort in providing top-notch service! You are the standard that all hotels should measure itself to.

Reviews.Title: “Friendliest Staff Ever”
Reviews.Author: CaliforniaLew
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at the Omni in New Orleans but never at this one and decided to give it a try. We were there for our anniversary, so we may have gotten a little better than average room, but the Omni was probably the nicest place I've ever stayed in San Francisco. Our room was great and had a small view of North Beach and the bay. The hotel is more or less surrounded by buildings so we got the best you could hope for there. The staff was so nice and friendly, always saying hello and wishing us a good day/evening. It's close to bus lines and right on a cable car line. After dinner one night we took the cable car back and it dropped us right in front of our hotel. All around, a great stay at a great hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Top notch but good value”
Reviews.Author: RGPW
Reviews.Content: We stayed for two nights and couldn't have been more impressed. The whole hotel is immaculate with the most comfortable beds we have slept in for a long time. The standard rooms are more than big enough, with a writing desk, separate 'sofa' chair and foot stool. Large TV and tea and coffee making facilities. A tip is to simply register in their loyalty programme and you will get complimentary Wifi and tea / coffee / juices delivered each morning. Can't say enough good things and great value for a big city.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great location & great staff”
Reviews.Author: Alcahols
Reviews.Content: Booked this hotel after reading reviews on Trip Advisor and am so glad I did. From the moment we arrived it felt right. The welcome from reception staff (particularly Jake) was wonderful and nothing was too much trouble. The doormen were always so polite and always smiling and unlike many places in San Francisco, I didn't feel they were only being nice just to get a tip out of you. We stayed here for 3 nights initially on floor 5 and had a great view of California Street and the cable cars. The cable cars never disturbed us at all as they stop at a reasonable hour in the evenings and pass by the hotel quickly. Our room was fantastic, large, clean and comfortable and the bathroom had that wow factor with lots of marble and complimentary toiletries & lots of fluffy towels. In the wardrobe (closet), there were luxurious bathrobes to use during your stay, an iron and ironing board (useful as the airport luggage handlers squash your cases so much your clothes have creases where you didn't think they could have creases), plus a safe to keep your valuables in. The beds were soooo comfortable I wanted to take one back home with me - clean crisp sheets, clean crisp duvets and covers and lots of comfy pillows. After spending a few days out of town travelling other states we returned to the same hotel for the last few nights of our stay in San Francisco. This time we were on the top floor (floor 17) where the room was exactly the same layout but being so high you only had little windows and this slightly lost the fun of being on California Street as we couldn't see the street - only the buildings opposite. Being in the financial district had its pros and cons. Cons being there weren't that many places to eat around the hotel however there is a lovely new Irish bar just opened on Sacramento Street (about 2 minutes walk away) plus another restaurant next to it (can't remember the name but recommended by hotel staff). Also, as someone else mentioned, I felt a little out of place in casual wear when most other people were in business suits but this was mostly apparant during the day rather than at night. The pros of this hotel's location is that it's only 3 short blocks from the Montgommery Street BART stop and took us only 10 minutes to walk from the BART to the hotel. Another good point about the hotel being in the financial district is that (unlike every other part we went to - particularly the tourist parts) you didn't get any 'down-and-outs' hassling you for money as the businesses and hotels in the area don't take kindly to the down-and-outs hassling their clients. It all felt very safe around the area. I don't know if it's a sign of the financial downturn at the moment, but be warned if you are out and about in general San Fran - there are a LOT of beggers / down-and-outs / homeless / drunks constantly trying to get money out of you and it gets a bit tiring after a while. If you are going to San Fran, stay here - it's fantastic.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed our stay”
Reviews.Author: roomservice99
Reviews.Content: Our room was spacious, nicely furnished and very clean. They provide free wireless internet to Omni members, as well as complementary morning beverages delivered to the room. The overall service of the hotel was very good. We were at the Omni on a weekend, and obviously it's the business district, so we had some trouble finding a restaurant nearby. The concierge suggested the Wayfare Tavern, which was great. Overall, I recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Superb Luxury Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Canada_One
Reviews.Content: First stop on our 14 day tour of Napa / Sonoma. What a great hotel. The first thing that hits you is that everyone is SO friendly! These people seem genuinely happy to see you and do whatever they can to make your stay the best. I have stayed in luxury hotels all over the world and have to say these folks take the gold star for friendliness. Our room was everything you expect in a luxury hotel - nice high ceilings, very clean, nice sized bathroom with marble and such, soft white bath towels and all the amenities. Even a sewing kit. Even though we faced California street the hotel was ultra quiet, with a great bed and therefore excellent sleeping quarters. No hint that you had neighbors at all !! Inside Tip - join the Omni member thing and you automatically get free coffee and other drink (OJ or AJ) delivered to your room every morning - really cool !! Also, you can buy the 3 or 5 day MUNI passes right at the hotel - what could be better. I don't know. Oh yea - great location, this has it. You are probably 10-15 min walk from Union Square, and of course being on California there is a cable car that run right in front of the hotel. I would not hesitate to go back or recommend to anyone. Great hotel, great people, great stay. And I am a Fairmont President Club member!

Reviews.Title: “San Fran Getaway”
Reviews.Author: Travelmomma007
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for 3 nights. We had registed for their "Select Guest" program, which is complimentary. I would strongly advise anyone who plans to stay at any Omni to do so. With that, we got free wi-fi as well as two free drinks delivered to our room every morning of our stay at our chosen time. There are also other benefits. At check in, the lady at the front desk was very friendly and courteous. It is centrally located. We even got a "stay two nights, get the third night free" from their website so it was quite the bargain! The rooms were very comfortable, there was a fruit bowl in the lobby for us to help ourselves daily. There is also a free city walking tour that starts from the hotel on certain days. We rented a car one day and parking (as with all of San Fran) is quite expensive (Omni was $45 for valet, no self park option) so we parked a 5 minute walk away for less...check around if possible. I have already recommended this hotel to my friends going in October.

Reviews.Title: “lovely hotel, centrally located”
Reviews.Author: Anonymous67
Reviews.Content: I stayed here at the beginning of August 2010 with my wife and 28yr son.We had just flew in from England after a total 20 hr journey. We took the Bart rail system from the airport which stops 3 blocks away and walked to the hotel with our cases which only took a few minutes. On arrival we were tired with the long journey and there was a hiccup with our room as we had booked our room through Hotels.com. I had booked a room with 2 double beds some months earlier . We were told straightaway on arrival at the hotel that when you make such a booking through the internet the spec.of the room cannot be guaranteed. We were shown to a room with just one king bed in and were told a fold away bed would have to be added for my son which we weren't happy about. This was going to be a 4 night stay. The desk manager quickly found a double bed room for us which needed cleaning and were given a complimentary drink in the bar while the room was being cleaned. I tipped the bell hop Marlin to take our bags to the room for us while we were having our drink but after 3 hrs the bags never arrived. I went back downstairs to find Marlin had gone home without delivering my bags and his relief had to deliver my bags without any further tip being given which I felt awkward about but I didn't see why I should have to tip again. After this our stay was problem free and we found this hotel was placed fantasticaly to tour the surrounding area. The trams on Knob Hill are just outside the hotel, Chinatown just a couple of streets away and the fishermans wharf areas are a nice 10 minute stroll away. The hotel itself tends to be occupied by well dressed business type people and at times I felt a bit out of place dressed in shorts/"t" shirt . This hotel is sitauted in the Banking district with very tall high rise office blocks nearby.
