Fresh fruit and a drinks urn containing water with lemons in were available every evening next to the lift. Free wi=fi is available in the reception area. The hotel is spotlessly clean and cannot be faulted. San Francisco was found to be cold most times with the cold Pacific breeze from the sea and we had to wear light fleeces most of the time which I didn't expect in August. We done the normal Alcatraz tour and city bus tour which is a must do. We walked all around the area and despite the high number of homeless tramps in the town we felt safe. Having said that a German female tourist celebrating her silver wedding was accidently shot dead a couple of blocks away as the result of being caught in crossfire from some youths who had fallen out at a nearby disco ! This made us cautious but appears to have been a one off incident. But after our 4 day stay we moved onto Las Vegas and then onto New York. The Hotel Omni turned out to be a really good hotel and if I ever return to San Fran I would have no hesitation in returning to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Elegant Place to Stay in San Francisco”
Reviews.Author: GingerTravellingScot
Reviews.Content: The Omni, San Francisco was the first stop on our honeymoon and after our 11 hour flight to San Francisco it was a joy to be able to check-in in less than 2 minutes. We had one of the Suites on the very top floor of the hotel and on arrival the hotel had left a bottle of champagne and strawberries as a gift for our honeymoon, nice touch! The hotel room was one of the largest we've ever been in with a sitting room (with desk, entertainment cabinet) which led to a large bedroom with a huge double bed and another entertainment cabinet. Being on the top floor we didn't hear any traffic noise and we never heard a sound from the neighbouring rooms. As we had joined their loyalty program the internet was free and we had complimentary drinks delivered to our room each morning. You can also order croissants, muffins, etc with your morning drink which was a great start to the day. We were in San Francisco for sightseeing and a lot of guide books etc tell you to choose between Fishermans Wharf or Union Square as a location for your stay. We're very glad we choose the Omni as we found both Fishermans Wharf and Union Square a bit busy and a bit too touristy. We enjoyed the peace and quiet from the location and everywhere was within easy walking distance from the hotel. The Omni was a great start to our honeymooon, thanks Omni!

Reviews.Title: “Loved This Hotel - Good Location and Good Price”
Reviews.Author: lamist
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a 3 day weekend and had a lovely time. We got this fantastic suite that was very classy looking and had a lot of room. The front desk was always helpful and we asked the concierge some questions as well. We were in town for a baseball game and it is about a 15-20 minute walk to the stadium. It is right by Chinatown and also the Italian part of town. We walked one night to go to dinner and see Beach Blanket Babylon. We never did eat breakfast in the hotel, we went out to a couple of places I found on yelp.

Reviews.Title: “Delightful Stay”
Reviews.Author: LoneCanexpat
Reviews.Content: Excellent staff. Scored a great deal on a room. We were needlessly concerned about location. Trolley stop at the hotel doorstep linked us to all. We would try to stay there on our next visit.

Reviews.Title: “Perfection”
Reviews.Author: pisces411
Reviews.Content: We chose the Omni as our honeymoon hotel after a lot of research, and the previous TripAdvisor reviews did not steer us wrong. Once the bellman, Marlon, found out it was our honeymoon, we returned to champagne, chocolate covered strawberries and a rose petal strewn bed. The concierges were super helpful with any and all recommendations, and every direction was accompanied with the route(s) outlined on a pocket map. The hotel was perfectly located within walking distance of many attractions and several blocks from the BART, MUNI and cable cars. It was obvious that everyone who worked there took pride in their jobs and in their workplace.

Reviews.Title: “PERFECT STAFF LOVELY”
Reviews.Author: UkField
Reviews.Content: We have stayed in OMNI's before we love the hotels they are of a very high standard. We hadnt stayed in this one before, it was absolutely perfect, when arriving the door man, bell man, front desk everyone was fantastic, i have never known a hotel with such lovely staff working there, whenever you returned or left the hotel they always acknowledged you and asked if everything was ok etc, when being so many thousand miles away from home its nice to feel safe and feel if you had any problems they would be there and sort everything out. The room was lovely reminded us very much of the standard of the Waldorf in new York, i can only praise them, thanks. I can advise others to join the Omni hotels group as a Select Guest, its great you get an upgraded room (if available) and each morning you receive drinks to your room (complimentary) by leaving out a little card on your door nob at bed time ticking which drinks you would like, tea, coffee, hot chocolate, coke, orange loads of drinks (FREE). There are other benefits too i would really advise you to join you just fill in the details on the Omni Website (free). We will be staying again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: gcac_10
Reviews.Content: This was our last stop after 2 weeks and 8 hotels. The staff were extremely friendly, professional and helpful. The room was big, spotless and very comfortable. A touch of class. The restaurant was OK, but not top notch, but there are so many other places to eat, it didn't matter. Thoroughly enjoyable stay.

Reviews.Title: “First-class all the way”
Reviews.Author: Diamond_D
Reviews.Content: Friendly and helpful doormen welcome you to a gorgeous lobby. As a "select guest" I was pre-checked-in, I picked up my key and headed up to my room which was spacious and spotless. Select guest amenities like 2 complimentary drinks each morning were a great touch, and every aspect of the stay was pleasant. And with a very reasonable rate for a downtown hotel, it was a great value.

Reviews.Title: “Wouldn't Stay Anywhere Else in San Francisco!”
Reviews.Author: B0ilermaker
Reviews.Content: Just finished 4 days at the Omni and it was outstanding. We had a deluxe king room, which was lovely, well appointed, and very clean. What really makes this hotel outstanding is the staff. From the concierge who gave us excellent restaurant recommendations, travel tips, and directions every morning to the bellmen who chatted with us while we were waiting for our tour bus to the housekeeper who gave me an extra coffee packet when I was desperate for some extra coffee in the morning, the staff of the Omni went above and beyond to make our stay fantastic. It is very well located - in a quiter part of downtown but walking distance to the Embarcadero, AT&T Park, Fisherman's Wharf, and Chinatown. It is right on the cable car line. We had an anniversary dinner at Bob's Steakhouse. Bob's is very expensive but it was probably the best steak I have ever had! Would definitely stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “first class stay, service and location”
Reviews.Author: syph
Reviews.Content: This was one of the best hotel stays I have ever had. The front desk is unbelievably helpful. Rooms are clean and generous in size. Every single person we encountered from front desk to wait staff to valet and bellmen were friendly, happy and eager to help. The location of the hotel is perfect as it is in the financial district and pretty quiet, which we liked. On the other hand it was close to everything, a short walk to chinatown and union square shopping or a short cab ride to everything else. We will return to the Omni next time in san francisco and I highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “An excellent city centre hotel”
Reviews.Author: TonyRedd
Reviews.Content: My family stayed in a double queen room for 3 nights. The hotel is excellent: in a good downtown location but walking distance to the Embarcadero (10 mins) and from there to Fisherman's Wharf etc. Staff were lovely and very helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Stay”
Reviews.Author: WisconsinCubfan
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our stay at the Omni. The staff was very friendly and helpful. The room was very clean and the bed was very comfortable. The morning beverages were a very nice touch. The person at corporate reservations showed me how to save on parking by going with a package and told me about signing up for morning beverages and free wi-fi. I will definitely stay at Omni again in future cities that I visit.

Reviews.Title: “Friendliest hotel i have ever been to”
Reviews.Author: amadeu1
Reviews.Content: Yes, I finally found the hotel with the nicest staff. I am a frequent traveller and this hotel is outstanding in terms of employees. They are super helpful and friendly. They and their management are doing a great job and thats one of the main reasons they are on top of the list in SF at this forum. The rooms are spacious and nice . The location is walking distance to china town but some ways away from Pier 39. The cable car stops right in front of the hotel. Free internet is another plus. Overall i can highly recommend this hotel !

Reviews.Title: “Classy Hotel Execellent Service Friendly atmosphere”
Reviews.Author: smop8ter
Reviews.Content: Went to spend the weekend in the City to celebrate my daughter's 8th birthday. The staff at the hotel provided excellent friendly service. From the doorman to the bellhop to the front desk. You are cheerful greeted and offered some fresh fruit and water. My two girl's received little backpacks filled with toys. When we returned from tooling around the town, the staff left a chocolate birthday cake and chocolate covered strawberries in the room to my daughter's suprise. In the morning, they left complimentary drinks: coffee, hot chocolate, and orange juice. Special thanks to Steven and Marlion.

Reviews.Title: “Wow - what a wonderful hotel”
Reviews.Author: Fieldfamily
Reviews.Content: From the moment we arrived nothing was too much trouble. The staff went out of their way to help. The conciege was a fountain of knowledge, on what to do in such a fabulous city. Had stayed in the Omni Shoreham in Washington, and thought that was good, but San Fransisco was even better. The staff were just so pleasant and helpful. Wished we could have stayed longer. Excellent location with some good restaurants nearby.

Reviews.Title: “great location”
Reviews.Author: jjireland
Reviews.Content: 2stayed here on a business for 3 nights all round excellent hotel, there is a great irish bar around the corner, the IRISH TIMES, excellent fun and food , staff were all from the old country and really took care of me for three nights

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel for the kids”
Reviews.Author: tree888
Reviews.Content: We took adjoining King and twin rooms for our family of 4 and stayed for 4 nights using the 4 for 3 summer offer with one night free. Arriving off a 15 hour heavily delayed flight we were greeted with warm genuine smiles, kids backpacks filled with goodies and, 10 minutes after getting into the room, cookies and milk for the children. A great start. The hotel is very well situated being on the California Street Cable car (much less busy than the other cable car lines) which takes you down to the F line tram (with rolling stock from all round the world) which goes along the quays to the Alcatraz ferry and then on to Fisherman's Wharf. This is a true 5 star hotel with friendly concierge and faultless service. If I were to pick one small point - it would have been great if the breakfast had been a buffet rather than a la carte. Whilst the food was very good the menu is quite limited and one of the waiters was curt, bordering on rude. $80 a day for breakfast gets a little steep after a few days! There are plenty of other places around to get breakfast so not a big issue. The beds are really comfortable, the rooms large, the towels soft and the staff attentive. Would I stay here gain....absolutely. Was it good value for what you get.....yes. Final tip.....eat at Uncle Vito's Pizza, 700 Bush Street, excellent authentic Italian.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding Hotel Perfectly Located”
Reviews.Author: EasternCanada
Reviews.Content: I arrived at the Omni San Francisco Hotel on July 30 and the staff was nice and extremely welcoming. Check-in was quick and friendly and I was given a nice room with a view on California Street and cable cars. The room its self was elegant and clean with upscale decor and larger than some at other comparable hotels. The bathroom was marble and there was ample closet space. The room featured a flat screen TV which I guess is the standard now. Little details made the difference. For instance, in the lobby fresh peaches and prunes were available at the end of the day with iced water in the lobby... Perfect after walking around the city during the day. The location of the hotel is perfect where Nob Hill and the financial district meet. Walk to the Ferry Tower at night to see the Bay Bridge, etc. was easy. The Hotel is close to the main SF attractions, shopping, The Embarcadero, ATT Park, etc. The staff really goes out of its way to make sure your stay is enjoyable. Check-out in August was also quick and friendly and you sort of felt like you were leaving home!! All and all, it was the perfect hotel for a great San Francisco vacation!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel...staff was super friendly”
Reviews.Author: Condiment_King
Reviews.Content: My family recently traveled to San Francisco for a business trip>long weekend of sightseeing, and we couldn't have been happier with the experience we had the Omni. Location was great for walking to the Ferry Building and to North Beach. The Omni had everything we needed in terms of accomodations and services. A special thank you to a young woman at the front desk named Sarah Crown (?), who recommended a wonderful restaurant, Tadich Grille for our first a dinner. One call out is the front desk and doorman staff. They were so friendly, and took time to know our family's name, especially my sons. We were made to feel like VIP's. The staff also provided a kids kit with game and activity books to keep him entertained. Perks like this make us continually stay at Omni properties. The only downside is the cost of parking. Having a rental car was a necessity for work, but it did cost a pretty penny for a several days. The upside was that similar hotels charge for internet access, and Omni does not as long as you are member of their loyalty program. So that was a big plus.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed my Stay - Room for Improvement”
Reviews.Author: cdngrrleh
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Omni this past weekend and don't have one single complaint about the hotel. I truly enjoyed my stay! The location in the Financial district is great - close to Nob Hill and the North Beach neighborhoods and many restaurant options. The staff are courteous, helpful, friendly and not *over eager* for tips. My room was spacious and clean. The King sized bed was quite the treat! Bathroom amenities were excellent as well. The decor is old world but very fitting for the hotel and it's location The hotel doorman can hail you a cab if needed and also had their own drivers and town cars. I used this option for my return to the airport as waiting for a cab can take quite sometime. Room for improvement is needed in two areas: I loved their online check-in feature which boasts that you don't have to wait in line to get your room key but upon arrival, I still had to wait in line. :( As I checked in early, I was not able to score a room with a good view and was placed close to the elevator. It was rather noisy! Also, wi-fi was advertised as free but cost $10 per day. It's only free to people who belong to their reward program or use the wi-fi in the lobby and not their rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel, Great Service and Great Location"”
Reviews.Author: Bob41154
Reviews.Content: This is a top notch Hotel with service to match. Great location within reasonable walking distance to china town and short cab / trolley ride to fisherman's wharf. Would definitely stay here again on next trip to SF!!

Reviews.Title: “Fantasic stay at the Omni”
Reviews.Author: rangerfan58
Reviews.Content: The staff at this hotel could not have been better. The hotel itself is very nice, especially for being in the business district. Rooms were very comfortable and nicely updated bathrooms. Joining the OMNI club gets you free internet and juice/coffee every morning. We made this reservation about 6 months before, the person taking the reservation asked the reason for coming (business/pleasure). I told them it was stopping back in San Francisco for anniversary after being there years ago. The first night they had a bottle of champagne and chocolate dipped strawberries in our room with a card. Parking is expensive both in the hotel and nearby but it is in the financial district.

Reviews.Title: “Everything was great except parking and view”
Reviews.Author: TravelingTimes
Reviews.Content: Stayed one night during mid-week at the U-Suite at this hotel. The staff was wonderful, the room was clean (flowers in the bathroom, nice!), comfortable bed, robes, two TVs which we did not even turn on. In the morning, we asked for coffee to be brought to our room (coffee, newspaper and wifi are included with the room if you join the Omni hotel club - free signup). The hotel sits among office skyscrapers so there really isn't a view of anything except of the the surrounding buildings. Had a very good night's sleep and the drapes are heavy enough to block out early morning light so I could sleep in. The next morning, we enjoyed fresh fruit in the lobby - plums, peaches, apples. We had two cars and parking at the hotel for both would come to $120.00! The overnight parking fee in the nearby garages during the week were not much cheaper so be prepared if you need to bring a car with you. Aside from that, this is an excellent hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic! The staff at this Omni are the best! Beautiful hotel and accomondartions.”
Reviews.Author: BevLar
Reviews.Content: Our stay at the Omni San Francisco was great. I was so impressed with the helpful and knowledgeable front desk staff. Whatever we needed, directions, recommendations, anything, they were more than happy to be of assistance and always with a smile. The room was large and well appointed. I can't say enough about this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Treated like stars, but we were not dressed like stars!!”
Reviews.Author: gvrdman
Reviews.Content: From the moment we pulled up in our dirty mini-van, we knew we found a special hotel. The Doorman acknowledged us immediately. And even though the valet attendant was busy he took care us very fast. We were very tired after having drove over 7 hours down the twisty-turny Northern California rugged coastline, and our clothes showed it. Check-in was a breeze, kids were even given ''loot bags''. Would highly recommend this hotel to young familys' as the sound proofing is fantastic; you can't hear anyone around you which helps you get a great nights sleep. Somewhat pricey, but well worth it considering you step out the front door and onto a cablecar. My only concern is the price of parking, its really too bad that parking is not free.

Reviews.Title: “Love the ammenities!”
Reviews.Author: ArizonaTraveler31323
Reviews.Content: I have traveled on business to S.F. at least quarterly for several years. After trying a few of the top hotels, I discovered The Omni and have stayed there every time for about four years now. What I love the most are the ammenities that are offered at little or no additional cost. Each evening I complete a door-hanger menu, check the time I want service the next morning, and I wake up to fresh coffee, orange juice and an english muffin, along with USA Today. The Hotel keeps my profile and always provides a room on the interior where there is no traffic noise, so I sleep really well. The check-in takes no more than one minute, and the same is true of my check-out. The service is exceptional and friendly. The beds are very comfortable. I also use their fitness center while I'm there. It is a good one The only slight "ding" I would give the hotel is not having HD televisions. But overall I would give The Omni very high marks!

Reviews.Title: “Staff was exceptionally helpful”
Reviews.Author: SWarner_10
Reviews.Content: The staff at the Omni was incredible. Everyone you ran into bent over backwards to make you feel welcome and they were very helpful in places to go/directions. When we arrived we had a rollout bed in our room which took up a lot of space, we called to have it removed and within 2 minutes they were knocking on the door to remove it. The rooms were great and the food at Bob's Chop house was excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful stay”
Reviews.Author: svoluse
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Omni for four nights to celebrate of first wedding anniversary. From the moment we walked in the front door, we knew this was going to be a great experience. The staff is wonderful and very helpful. We were quickly checked in and even given maps and recommendations of places to eat for that evening. The roses on our bed was a very nice touch as I had let the hotel know we were celebrating an anniversary. The location is wonderful. Easy walk to the Ferry Building, Embarkadero, Chinatown and North Beach. If you are up for more exploring on foot Fisherman's Wharf if about 20 minutes from the front door of the hotel. We had a room on the 9th floor facing California Street and had no complaints about the noice at all. The beverages delievered to the door each morning was a nice touch and a wonderful way to start the day. The staff went out of there way to answer any questions we had and helped to make our stay wonderful. We have decided the next time we go back to San Francisco we will definately be staying at the Omni.

Reviews.Title: “I can not say enough about this hotel...”
Reviews.Author: Torcdor
Reviews.Content: I can not say enough about this hotel! The staff are amazingly friendly and helpful. The rooms are large, clean and well appointed. However, what will always leave a lastingimpression with me is how well they handled a problem. My gps went missing from the car that I had parked using the valet service (my stupidity for leaving it in the car). Rather than being made to feel like I was trying to falsly report something they not only handled it professionally and courteously but they are sending me a replacement. They just got not only a customer for life but I would recommend a the omni to anyone who wants exceptional service and a great room.

Reviews.Title: “The Omni San Francisco is the perfect hotel for the business traveler!”
Reviews.Author: MikeNutter
Reviews.Content: I travel to San Francisco on business 3-4 times per year and the Omni San Francisco is my hotel of choice. The service is impeccable each and every time and the location is perfect if you conduct business in the financial district. I highly recommend this hotel to the business traveler.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Service”
Reviews.Author: runner725
Reviews.Content: I did not have reservations and walked right in. I was greeted by a very nice gentleman who was able to assist me in making a reservation for that night. This was also my birthday weekend and I was upgraded to suite. I would highly recommend this hotel to anyone. It is very clean, organized, friendly staff and centrally located.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hospitality during the SF Marathon”
Reviews.Author: xinotx
Reviews.Content: I went to San Francisco for the marathon and stayed two nights at the Omni and 2 nights at another hotel on Nob Hill. Omni was definitely the better of the two hotels and one of the best I've ever stayed at. When we arrived at the hotel, the valet attendant promptly greeted us. He immediately informed us that parking was $48 for that day and $25 for the following day since it was their weekend rate so there were no surprises on our bill upon checking out. Other hotels in the area were charging over $50 up to $67 per night for parking. Omni's seemed to be the cheapest hotel parking we found. The bellman, Darrell, was immediately by our car with a cart and helped with our luggage. (Throughout our stay, Darrell was extremely friendly, and always smiled and said hi whenever we passed him). When we got to the front desk, Darrell presented my 7-year old with an Omni Kids backpack which my son enjoyed. The front desk guy was very friendly.nnThe check in process was very quick and we proceeded to our room on the 16th floor. The room was small but very clean and beautiful. The bathroom was large, had lots of counter space and a large tub. There were more than enough towels for us and 2 bathrobes in the closet. The only things that weren't good about the room was the very small closet and lack of drawers but since we were only there for 2 days, it was not a problem for us. Omni is conveniently located within walking distance of Chinatown, the cable cars, restaurants and shopping. The staff is amazingly friendly and helpful. The hotel is beautiful and very clean. For anyone running a future SF marathon, this hotel is only about 5- 7 (non-hilly) blocks from the start line. I had received an email from Omni for a free weekend night if I paid for one night and the value we received was much greater than what we paid for it. I will only stay at the Omni when visiting SF again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service and location!”
Reviews.Author: gtravels2010
Reviews.Content: The best hotel experience we've had when it comes to service. Every single person on staff was friendly, courteous, and extremely helpful. They never steered us wrong with their recommendations on restaurant and entertainment options. The only negative was the 2:30 AM garbage truck wake-up call, which is obviously not the fault of the hotel. We had a blast in SF, and our teenagers especially appreciated the evening service of milk & cookies!!

Reviews.Title: “Friendly and excellent value”
Reviews.Author: 3DJs_dad
Reviews.Content: We stayed here in late July with our 2 young children. Booked two rooms and requested close proximity. Checked that request again the day prior to arrival and were pleasantly surprised to find that our rooms were adjacent. Worked well for our family of four. Rooms are comfortable and well appointed. Rates competitive. Staff was very friendly throughout. We tried Bob's Steakhouse (the hotel's restaurant) for breakfast once. Wouldn't recommend it with so many excellent breakfast alternatives all around. By contrast, we once ordered in room dining after a long day exploring and found that service to be very good. Location of the hotel is great. Many of the major sites are within walking distance. If you want to explore SF and appreciate your city dweller comforts, this is an excellent choice.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, good price, great location”
Reviews.Author: csfeir
Reviews.Content: I stay at the Omni for 2 days and it was a great experience, I had a beautiful big room (for a goog price) and the hotel is located in a location from which you can walk or take the cable cars to the turistic spots.. Completely recomendable for a SF visit...

Reviews.Title: “Friendliest staff, beautiful lobby & rooms with special touches like a handwritten welcome note from the maid!”
Reviews.Author: pharmgirlcalif
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at the SF Omni several times (I live locally and cherish weekend get-aways with my husband!). Several things set this hotel apart from other nice hotels. They know how to create a great first impression through their great valet parking staff and friendly doorman who greets you with a warm hello. Upon entering the hotel, marbled steps lead you down towards a sunken lobby, canopied by a crystal chandelier. Fresh fruit and lemonade are offered to guests. The desk staff are warm and helpful. Every hotel employee says hello. The first time I stayed at this hotel, I noticed the housekeeping staff greeted us on our way to our room! Not just a "hello," but with a big smile! The spare roll of toilet paper was tied with a satin lacy ribbon. The end of the rolls are folded to make a double point and are embossed with the omni seal! Their toiletries are really nice. A handwritten note from the housekeeper awaits you near the phone, welcoming you to you room! We usually order room service, and the delivery staff are quick and nice. Bob's Steakhouse restaurant selections are available for room service and I have enjoyed lobster tail and perfectly cooked steaks delivered right to my room! I f you get a room on the Chinatown side of the building, the cheerful sounds of Chinese music can be heard from your open window. For outings, we have found the front desk staff helpful and the really go the extra mile to help you. They are even friendly when you check out! It is the special touches and interactions with the staff that set this hotel apart and make it our number one SF place to stay...I just wish I could take the SF Omni with me to every place I travel! They should run seminars for other hotels on hoe to provide first class hospitality!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel, phenomenal staff, great location!”
Reviews.Author: dailycuppa
Reviews.Content: My wife and I traveled to San Francisco so I could run the S.F. Marathon. We are both in our early 40's and are quite active and love to travel. We decided to try out a hotel that was within walking distance to the Ferry Building, which would help getting to the race and also provide lots of sightseeing options. The Omni was the perfect choice and had a great deal going for 2 weekend nights at around $150 a night (which we got from Expedia.) I later read on Omni's website that they will match and beat any published price as long as you first book your stay on their own website. That's pretty cool. Getting back to the important stuff...the hotel is beautiful. It's not huge compared to other high end places around Union Square or the Embarcadero area, but 'just right' in our book. The lobby, elevators and general interior is impeccably clean. The room we stayed in wasn't huge, but it worked just perfectly for the 2 of us. The bed was comfortable and pillows were ample and of the highest quality. Needless to say, we both got great nights sleep during our stay. Probably the most impressive aspect of the hotel is the staff. They are truly wonderful people, very friendly without being overbearing (I can't stand dealing with hotel staff that act snobbish and just go through the motions solely to get that tip). The staff at the Omni are genuinely friendly, and seem to relish in sharing any information they find on new and fun things to do in the city. It was almost as if we were around good friends than your typical hotel staff. Another important thing is to go on the Omni website and sign up for their free 'Select Guest' program, which will automatically allow you to customize your room preferences, free WiFi (great!), complimentary morning beverages (2 per person), complimentary pressing (2 items) and shoe shine, express check in/check out, and an evening turn-down service as well. All that for the grand total of $0.00. Don't forget to sign up! We did not use room service, nor did we eat at the Steak house that is inside the hotel. We were on a bit of a budget, so we chose not to splurge that way. While I didn't run my best marathon this year, I'll certainly be back in 2011, and there is only one place we intend to stay...The Omni.

Reviews.Title: “Best customer service experience - anywhere”
Reviews.Author: MidwestTraveler01
Reviews.Content: The hotel has elegance, comfort and old world charm in a convenient financial district location, but what sets it apart is the staff. They are unparalleled in terms of friendliness, caring and quality service. The trolley runs in front of the hotel, so recommend requesting a room on the quiet side.

Reviews.Title: “Impeccable staff and luxurious stay! Couldn't have asked for more!”
Reviews.Author: FLYJETS101
Reviews.Content: I attended a conference last week at the SFO Omni. We were treated like kings and queens the whole stay. This was my first trip to SFO and what a fabulous first trip it was! The SFO Omni staff, food, conference rooms, location and best of all hospitality were enough to keep me coming back. It was so awesome I can't stop talking about it to my coworkers. SFO is a little on the pricey side but you get exactly what you pay for when you stay at the Omni.

Reviews.Title: “Great service & value”
Reviews.Author: Vacatrip1
Reviews.Content: Got a good weekend rate for a family at the Omni. Definitely a 4 star place. Service was great. Gifts and cookies for the kids! Conveniently located to the CA cable car line and Chinatown. Would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “High-quality service, convenient location, clean rooms. Old-world elegance in a modern setting.”
Reviews.Author: dlehman
Reviews.Content: My family was immediately impressed by the professionalism and warmth of Joey Nubla, concierge extraordinaire! He took us under his wing (we had just endured an awful evening at a hotel from hell on lower Mason St.) and directed us to the best bus tours and restaurants. I highly recommend the Omni for its old-world elegance, impeccable staff (Juan was also wonderful and efficient) and prime location for walking to Chinatown, Union Square and North Beach. Internet access was free. The other hotels we stayed at in Napa and LA charged $10.00 a day. The Hyatt Regency in LA was a lovely place, but lacked the personal touch and classic furnishings of the Omni. I would definitely come back!

Reviews.Title: “ask at the desk!”
Reviews.Author: kateynorth
Reviews.Content: We plagued them with questions and they answered every one with charm, politeness and good advice Great location, easy walk to chinatown and the ferrybuilding and saturday market, lovely rooms, but restaurant and bar both expensive and wouldnt recommend for breakfast, + $5.99 charge for a bottle of water in the room!

Reviews.Title: “A definite highlight of our trip...”
Reviews.Author: WeeScot
Reviews.Content: My family and I stayed in the Omni Hotel for three nights in July. After reading about this hotel on Trip Advisor I signed up in advance for their Select Guest programme which allows guests to enjoy complimentary services such as in room wifi, newspapers, cookies and milk at night for kids and morning drinks delivered to your room or door at a time of your choosing. Upon arrival were we greeted warmly by Mika who kindly changed our room to the quieter side of the hotel on Montgomery Street away from the trams which run late into the evening. Parking is expensive at $48 per day (we decided to return our hire car early as San Francisco is walk able as a city) and chose to eat outside of the hotel for our meals given the large number of restaurants within easy walking distance of the hotel (China town is only a couple of blocks away). The hotel is also a few blocks away from the BART on Market Street which has a regular train service running to San Francisco Airport. Having stayed in seven different hotels during our two week vacation covering Los Angeles, Las Vegas, Yosemite and San Francisco the Omni was the definite highlight of our trip. A great stay and highly recommended!

Reviews.Title: “Good location, friendly staff, old-fashioned interior”
Reviews.Author: fionapm
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Omni for two nights at the beginning and one night at the end of our honeymoon in July. The staff were friendly and welcoming on arrival and gave us maps of San Francisco, suggested places to eat, things to see, where to hire bikes, where to shop, etc etc, which was very helpful as we were jetlagged and exhausted from our wedding. Breakfast the next morning in Bob's Steakhouse was tasty and we were sent a cute little smoothie by the chef as an amuse bouche. On our first stay we had a reasonable sized room on the 5th floor, and on our return a large, light room on the 17th floor with a great view. I would definitely recommend guests request a room as high up as possible. The hotel was very clean and well maintained, however the decor was probably more to my grandparents taste than to mine; quite old-fashioned. We were disappointed that our honeymoon wasn't acknowledged in any way by the hotel - not even a beer at the hotel bar, which was surprising.

Reviews.Title: “Everything We Had Hoped and MORE.....”
Reviews.Author: jeremywregan
Reviews.Content: As I arrived back into LAX I realized the one thing I had left in my experience was how incredibly nice and courteous the people of San Francisco were to us. The highlight and most memorable of this experience of the people of San Francisco was the entire staff of the Omni San Francisco located at 500 California Street. The entire hotel experience was one that I will always place in the top of the heap. Every detail of the hotel carefully and thoughtfully thought out to ensure the guest having an experience that leaves them never wanting or needing anything for more than a few minutes. You walk into the lobby and at that moment you realize you made an excellent choice. From check in to checking out you could not ask for a more comfortable stay. I had the best nights sleep that I have had in a long time. The Omni reminds you why a quality high thread count with your linens are important. I cannot say enough. So just let me finish with telling you that even with a life of traveling and staying at the Omni will always be remembered as that great hotel we stayed while in San Francisco during a very special vacation.

Reviews.Title: “Omni San Francisco Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Canigiani
Reviews.Content: This Hotel is the place to be. It is a good value and a great location. The lobby and rooms are all very nice. The staff is great and helpful. I thing the other reviews kind of say it all. A great choice.

Reviews.Title: “Exactly what service excellance is all about.”
Reviews.Author: fdpamedic
Reviews.Content: Chose Omni because I have stayed at two other locations and this was exactly in the center of the city, close to all sights. Exemplary staff;housekeeping, bell staff, doorman and check-in counter all knowledgeable and helpful at all times. Concierge-Lex - was so pleasant, easy to follow and understood exactly what we wanted (every time we visited him) Great routes to sights, excellent restaurant choices and very informative regarding the city and surrounding area.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing customer service”
Reviews.Author: MNTourist08
Reviews.Content: No complaints. The location, room, bathroom, cleanliness were all fine. The one reason we would definitely stay here again was the service. I felt that each employee went above and beyond to make us feel welcome. We were always greeted at the door, had warm beverages delivered to our room each morning, turndown service at night, our bags carried, maps and directions provided. By far the best customer service we've had at a hotel in a long, long time.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic service, great location, highly recommend.”
Reviews.Author: BobandHannah
Reviews.Content: Flew to San Francisco for 2 nights prior to a hiking/horse riding holiday in the south west (having previously holidayed in SF). We had not stayed in an Omni hotel before and had chosen it chiefly because it appeared to be very reasonable for what we wanted. Upon our arrival we were struck by how friendly and personable the staff were, both on the door and the reception. We were also very impressed by the room. Later, when making enquiries with the concierge about local restaurants, we were pleasantly surprised to be offered a glass of champagne in the lobby. The concierge was extremely helpful and gave us several recommendations within walking distance. We followed his recommendatons on both nights and were very happy with both meals. (The 2nd night we ate at the TADICH GRILL, which is apparently the oldest restaurant in SF and a 2 minute stroll from the hotel. Specialises in sea food and was fantastic). The hotel is walkng distance from the Wharf, China Town, Little Italy and Union Square. Facilities include a very good gym, but should be noted does not have a swimming pool if that is something people require. Had cocktails in the bar, far from cheap, but very good quality and service excellent. Had breakast one morning, nice enough, but fairly expensive. To sum up how we felt about the Omni, having flown to SFas a jump off point for our holiday, our stay at the Omni had us wondering if we should have stayed longer in San Francisco.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Hotel”
Reviews.Author: LA_tao
Reviews.Content: The Omni offered exceptional service and accommodations. Although the location is not as central as those in close proximity to Union Square, the quality of the Omni is definitely superior to some of those hotels. And having signed up for the rewards program, I had a great rate for a weekend.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!”
Reviews.Author: Bikeit
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Omni SF on an anniversary trip to northern CA. The staff and the accommodations were top-notch. Like others have reported, the staff greets you by name every time you enter the hotel. Also as others have reported, they treated us to chocolates, champagne, and other goodies to celebrate our anniversary. My husband joined the guest program so bottled water and internet service were no problem. Our room looked out onto the front entrance, which was fine. We weren't looking for a view, but chose the hotel based on its ratings and location. One of the best things about its location is that it's only a couple of blocks from the Ferry Building, which is food porn central! Luscious fruits, pastries, coffee, cheese, anything you want to eat, it's there. And it's the best of the best. The concierge had terrific suggestions for other meals. I used to be a fan of the Ritz-Carleton chain--love the hot chocolate! But the service there is obsequious to the point of being ridiculous. At the Omni the staff is friendly, knowledgeable, and attentive and the accommodations are comfortable, spic-and-span, and in excellent condition. What more could you ask?

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding Service”
Reviews.Author: KailuaD
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Omni over the 4th of July weekend and the hotel and staff were outstanding. Front desk and doormen were very warm and extremely helpful in making our stay enjoyable. We arrived from an overnight flight and they had our room ready even though it was way before check-in time. This is the place to stay for business or pleasure in the city's Financial District. We were on a leisure trip so we ended up walking to Union Square for shopping and tour pick-ups, it was about a 10 minute walk so if you plan on doing heavy shopping with a lot of bags you may need to take a cab or stay closer to Union Square. Overall, a great hotel with beautiful aesthetics, clean rooms, and an excellent staff.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent stay at the Omni SF”
Reviews.Author: angelo885
Reviews.Content: Hotel and staff are a class act. Friendly staff, clean, well appointed rooms. Comfortable bed. We had previously joined the Select Guest program so had free WiFi and morning coffee, juice and paper. The coffee was excellent, piping hot and strong, just what was needed to get the day of sightseeing going! Several juice selections also. Not mentioned previously by TA members was the room service for breakfast. I had originally looked at the Bob's Steakhouse menu online and thought no way, too costly. There are less expensive alternatives through room service. Bagel and cream cheese was $5 and bacon, egg and cheese sandwich was $8. A few other things too. Obviously you could run out to get those for less but it was nice to have the breakfast delivered with the free beverages and just relax and eat in your pj's. Right on time at the time requested too! The gym was a good size also. Towels, water and earphones available. The lobby has a bowl of fresh fruit and citrus water out in the afternoons which was a nice pick me up after all of our sight seeing. Did a lot of walking! As previously mentioned in other reviews, hotel is in a good location if you are a fit walker. We went to Chinatown, North Beach, Ferry Building and even walked to and from Fisherman's Wharf at least one time each way. We booked their Linger Longer package which was great, pay for two nights get the third for free. I would say the only issue would be that I booked, and was going to pay with a debit card. When you do that, the hotel holds $200 on your account for incidentals and credits it back in a couple of days. That was never mentioned during the booking session. All in all a great stay and I would definitely stay again. One other tip, eat at the Tadich Grill about two blocks away, excellent chioppino!!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Customer Service”
Reviews.Author: UNLVforme
Reviews.Content: Amazing customer service from this hotel - from the minute you walk in the door. Front desk staff was very pleasant and helpful. The rooms/hallways are a bit outdated and need to be renovated. The bathrooms were large which was nice. I was hoping for some restaurants within a close distance of the hotel so that I could venture out for one meal but nothing really in close proximity ... just a Subway from what I could find. I would certainly suggest this hotel as the staff was incredible.

Reviews.Title: “Overall 4 Star rating strictly for Customer Service alone”
Reviews.Author: gvldiva
Reviews.Content: The customer service in this hotel is amazing. From the time you enter the hotel you will experience the best customer service you cold hope for at a hotel. Now for the hotel itself- The lobby is beautiful. The citrus water is a great touch after a long day. However we picked up the keys to our room on the 10th floor and was so disappointed. The room was small as I expected (no different from NYC), but what i wasn't prepared for was the NASTY carpet. This carpet was dirty outside the room in the hall and so nasty on the inside I would not have walked on it without my shoes. The ottoman on the chair was frayed and had dirty spots on it. I went back to the front desk. Received an apology and was given a different room. We went to our room on the 12th floor and it was better but not much. The furniture is cherry wood with nicks on it. The lamps do not have built in electrical plugs so if I want to use my computer while in bed, I have to unplug the clock. The desk has outlets for internet and electricity, but again the lamp on the desk does not have an electrical outlet. The chair and ottoman are in better shape than the room on the 10th floor, but one can tell it could use a good steam cleaning as well. The beds are comfortable. The sheets are clean and white. But the duvet cover does not have the same crisp white look or smell. Nice flat screen TVs and large bathrooms with a pocket door. San Francisico is definitely cooler than the South, but the room goes from stuffy to cool. I cut the temperature to 71 but it still is rather warm. Another thing, I used the iron board and had to run because we were late, but when we returned to the room the iron board was right were we had left it even though the room had been made up. I have never had that happen not even in a Days Inn. One more thing. I signed up for their loyalty program and received free internet. However, I am going to have to remind them at checkout that I shouldn't have to pay for the internet. But get this, I was having trouble getting on the internet and called the internet help line. I got a voicemail and was told to leave my name and number and she would call back. Not good service for the internet. Again, the customer service at this hotel is outstanding from the front desk and other employees. The location is in the financial district so it is away from the touristy Union Square. Also, there is a great restaurant down the street called Tadick Grill. It's the oldest restaurant in San Francisco and the food (especially the seafood) is the best!! Honestly, I received a great rate on this hotel and love the customer service, but I don't think I will stay here again until they make some changes in cleanliness. BTW, the front desk told me they would have the carpeting cleaned by end of July. That doesn't help me much right now.

Reviews.Title: “excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: morgyn
Reviews.Content: what a great place, stayed for 2 nights and enjoyed every minute, staff were great and the hotel is a real 5 star. great location, cable car stop is outside front door, china town only a short walk away, will be back for sure.

Reviews.Title: “Great place in San Fran”
Reviews.Author: EMtravelers
Reviews.Content: We stayed 3 nights at this wonderful hotel! The service was amazing, the rooms clean and well appointed and the price was reasonable for the area. The staff - well lets just say we got a note every day from the woman cleaning our room to say hi and thanks. We got to meet her as we left and she was so sweet- shook our hands and wished us well. Joey at the front desk was wonderful- gave us such amazing service. The location was perfect- except as others have noted there is not much open in the area for breakfast on the weekends. During the week, however, you have the advantage of great places for lunch geared to the workers in the financial district. Chez Carla was a great spot on Pine street. Bob's restaurant is quite pricey- the menu in the room service book are the same prices downstairs. But we did try it one night and found the food good and the staff friendly. They give you free access to print your boarding passes (great idea). We would not want to stay anywhere else in San Francisco- good job to you all!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful time at the Omni!”
Reviews.Author: Rosannejerdon
Reviews.Content: We stayed here last week...it was a wonderful and cozy place to stay. I can not say enough about the staff..they are really nice and make you feel like a family member. Especially, Sarah Crown the Asst, Front Office Manager-she goes above and beyond to make you feel like you are their number one guest! They offer fresh fruit in the lobby and citrus water..which is great after a long day of touring! They also have milk and cookies sent up in the evening for the kids! If you join the Select Guest program, they offer free internet and 2 laundry items to be pressed and you get a free drink (coffee, ice tea) sent to the room in the morning~you choose the time you want it brought up to you...it is really a good thing! My husband needed maint. to help him with his camera tripod (Both Mike & Frank) were a great help to him and very nice. We all loved it there and can't wait to to back...the Omni truly made our vacation a restful and relaxing time! Thanks everyone!

Reviews.Title: “Omni outdistances all the rest!”
Reviews.Author: travelerNevada
Reviews.Content: I can't say enough about how wonderful the Omni SF is!! We started out trying to use our points to stay at one of our 'preferred' chains in SF but were disappointed with the reviews in TA. I decided to check out other hotels even if I had to pay for a room. Boy, am I glad I did!! I looked at the Omni's reviews and then their website. We were celebrating a 20th anniversary and I wanted to see the new Impressionists Exhibit at the DeYoung (DON'T miss it). The Omni had a fabulous package available with room, parking, breakfast & VIP DeYoung tickets at a bargain price, $287...I snapped it up. Then I called as I forgot to put a note in the reservation regarding room preferences. I spoke with Tofique at the front desk and asked about my preference, after some chatting he asked was their any 'special' reason we were coming that weekend. I said 'Yes, it's our 20th anniversary'. He then asked if he could upgrade us as a surprise for my spouse, of course I said Yes, Please!. When we arrived we found ourselves in the Pony Express Suite on the 14th floor, it doesn't give sweeping views of the city but it was lovely and very, very plush AND to make everything even better we had champagne & choc covered strawberries awaiting us!! We had dinner out in the city but had breakfast downstairs in Bob's. Although there was only 1 waiter and he was a bit overwhelmed (staff had called in sick), he made me the best hot choc and rec a wonderful breakfast which was more suitable for two! The food was mouthwatering and we went to the DeYoung thoroughly rested and satisfied! The Omni has moved to the top of my list as my favorite pick in SF to stay. From the time you arrive and are greeted by the doorman until he bids you a good-bye you will feel quite regal! Oh, and don't forget to request the turndown service & have your hot beverage delivered to your room in the morning (all complementary), it will finish your evening and start your day off RIGHT! I did forget a pair of earrings in the room and housekeeping had them safely tucked away and returned to me! Thank you Omni!

Reviews.Title: “Took a chance and won!”
Reviews.Author: Kathymi
Reviews.Content: Not knowing much about SF and where to stay, I checked trip advisor for reviews. I had several different hotels to choose from, but decided on the Omni. We were not disappointed. My husband and I went there for our 45th anniversary. After our check in, we walked around town a bit and when we returned to our room, there was champagne, flowers, and chocolate! Everything about this hotel was great! Great location, friendly staff, and Starbucks in the morning. We didn't eat at the hotel - the prices were too high, but we found plenty of places within walking distance to satisfy us. (After reading comments from aaafoods, I have to say he was writing about another hotel!) The rooms were big and the bed comfortable, and the windows were huge and opened just enough to let in fresh air. We even got the recommendation from the front desk to take BART to the airport on Monday morning instead of the shuttle (more reliable, less stress) and that was the best! We will definitely be booking a return to this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “FANTASTIC HOTEL AT A GREAT PRICE”
Reviews.Author: jgross1
Reviews.Content: Six of us from Seattle, including two teen-age boys and one very picky adult traveler, just spent three nights and four days at the Omni, and our experience was perfect in every way. The rooms were spacious, comfortable, well-maintained and, most importantly, immaculate; the staff was knowledgeable, friendly, and enormously helpful; and we were thrilled with the price (we booked our rooms through Alaska Airlines and received our third night free), having stayed in hotels that cost twice as much and provide far less in the way of comfort, cleanliness, and service. The Omni is centrally located and offers easy access, either on foot or public transportation, to many cultural attractions, interesting neighborhoods, and great cafes and restaurants. Not only would I recommend the Omni to friends and family, but from now on, I will never stay anyplace else in San Francisco. By the way, another highlight of our trip was the San Francisco Movie Tour--a must if you are travelling with teenage movie buffs.

Reviews.Title: “Just what I was looking for, location, trams and atmosphere.”
Reviews.Author: Moonlighter92
Reviews.Content: Daryl made the first good impression at the front entrance and it remained good from there on for three lovely days. Breakfasts were very good, both restaurant choices are great and it is just a brisk walk to the ferry terminal for some more great places. The passing cable cars add to the atmosphere of a bye-gone era and the Wells Fargo Museum across the road is fun to check out.

Reviews.Title: “Another stellar review...”
Reviews.Author: foodists
Reviews.Content: for the Omni-San Francisco. What sells this hotel is the unparalleled service provided by the entire staff. Special recognition to Juan and Jake at the front desk and Sam, the bellhop. When shown our assigned room, the bellhop intuited that we were not happy with the size. He voluntarily (without our prompting) called the front desk to inquire if a larger room was available. As for room size, amenities, and overall hotel luxury, the Omni is a solid 4-star hotel; however, the service more than compensates for that missing 5th star. The service was personable (the valets repeatedly addressed us by name), generous, unpretentious and sincere throughout our stay. The drawbacks of the Omni should be mentioned: (1) there's little to no view from any of the rooms; the hotel is unfortunately surrounded by tall(er) buildings -- so if you're looking for a grand view of the Golden Gate or Bay bridge, this is probably not the hotel for you; (2) we had to pay for bottled water in the room whereas many top hotels provide 2 bottles of free water/day (pet peeve: if a hotel is not going to provide drinkable/filtered tap water, then it shouldn't charge for bottled water); (3) internet access was not free -- we ended up joining the Omni frequent guest program (no charge) just so we could get the free internet. Otherwise, I cannot emphasize how wonderful the Omni staff was. They truly made our vacation more enjoyable. (PS: got a great rate via hotel website that included valet parking and tickets to the de Young museum -- definitely a bargain!)

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Hotel for our needs”
Reviews.Author: MissWhitey
Reviews.Content: This hotel is located in the financial district, but only a short walk from the bars and restaurants of North Beach, and also the shops of Union Square. It suited us perfectly and was right next to a tram stop to get over to Fisherman's wharf. The rooms were big, with a big bathroom, and huge bed. Hairdryer too. I would recommend joining the Omni members club as it's free to join and gave us free wifi in our room. This is normally charged at $10. Reception staff were brilliant and offered to give us recommendations for eating etc. We ate in 'The House' in North Beach which is Asian food and was absolutely gorgeous. Quite pricey but worth it. You must do Alcatraz while you're there, it was the highlight of our stay. We also hired bikes and cycled across the Golden Gate bridge to Saucilito. A great day, but beware of the hills! The tram museum is also worth a visit, as it Lombard Street.

Reviews.Title: “Incredible Customer Service”
Reviews.Author: PNWAdventurers
Reviews.Content: We have stayed in hotels around the world (most of them higher end) and the Omni San Francisco was the very best hotel experience. Not only were the front desk staff attentive and helpful (and always smiling - genuinely happy) but the maids were amazing (one of them saw us with our hands full and came jogging over to help us push the elevator button - totally OTT). Equally impressive were the doormen. Their greetings each morning and evening (as we left and returned) were delightful. The price is right, the hotel is clean and luxuorious, and it was QUIET and peaceful (no listening to other people's televisions, no running water from early morning travellers taking their showers, no door's slamming) Truly a wonderful experience and we will be staying there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Service”
Reviews.Author: blackcornish1964
Reviews.Content: I recently had a week here with my son and daughter. Our room was brilliant although we had booked a two bed room and had been given a double bed. Reception changed this very quickly. It is a lovely hotel although very expensive. It says there are tea making facilities in the room but there are not, only a coffee maker and our chambermaid was a bit stingy giving tea/coffee and sugar in the room. I thought the area was a bit out of the way and would have preferred to stay in Union Square but the hotel is lovely and staff are second to none. We had breakfast elswhere because it was expensive in the hotel, so cannot comment on the food, but we did have room service one night and it was very good. Barney the doorman is just charming and everyone we met was fantastic. I loved San Francisco and the people even if it did rain the whole time. Make sure you sign up to their card scheme before you go, this will give you free internet while you are there and a complimentary tea/coffee or hot chocolate every morning

Reviews.Title: “Superior Service at the Omni San Francisco”
Reviews.Author: TravelerTrish
Reviews.Content: Went for the weekend to SFO for our Aniversary and stayed at the Omni. WOW - from the minute we checked in to the final checkout we experienced nothing but 5 star service. Daryl the Bell Captain took an interest in creating a great night for us and gave us suggestions for a dance venue. Found out it was our Aniversary and advocated for us with the front desk for a better room. Check-in included a champange welcome and a very friendly front desk pro - WOW again. The room was very spacious and the bed was comfy. Furniture was a little outdated but did not impair the stay at all. Bathroom was glistening and fancy. We will be back

Reviews.Title: “I Should Have Listened to Other Reviewers”
Reviews.Author: DavidBlack
Reviews.Content: Pros -Elegant Lobby -Very Friendly Service Cons -TINY TINY rooms. At 250+ a night just ridiculously closet-type small. Hoped for more. -As others noted, the temperature in our room went from stifling hot to freezing cold all night very uncomfortable night sleep. - Restaurant was nutty expensive for a hotel restaurant. We ate there one night because the front desk told us (erroneously) that everything else would be closed at 8:00 on a Sunday night. For two of us it was somewhere around $350. We were looking for dinner, not a â€˜night outâ€™. A brief walk around the hotel and we found like 5 reasonable restaurants all still open. -Ditto on the price of their room service. Just gougingly expensive. As a result we walked around looking for a place to get breakfast wasting an hour of our day. -Located in financial district. Too far to walk to tourist â€˜hotspotsâ€™ we came to seeâ€“and SF is not a walkerâ€™s paradise by any means SUMMARY: We stayed in five hotels on this last trip all comparably appointed. Omni is the only one where we were very unhappy. If youâ€™re flying on a corporate expense account and not there as a tourist great. Otherwise youâ€™ll be happier down by fishermanâ€™s wharf.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely classy”
Reviews.Author: decampanilla
Reviews.Content: I was checked in less than 5 minutes after I handed over my car keys to the valet attendant. The gentleman at the front desk had an English accent and welcomed me to the hotel with a firm and sincere handshake. I felt like I was a VIP. I did not have to wait long for my luggage to be brought up to the room. The valet and bellhop did not seem to be waiting for a tip but I gave them 2 bucks each anyway for the very courteous service. The apples and citrus water in the lobby were charming refreshments after touring the nearby attractions like Union Square.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel! Turned me into an Omni Hotel Fan!”
Reviews.Author: MightyCipher
Reviews.Content: Had such a great time there, I wrote an email to the Front Office Manager at the hotel. I don't like the location as much as some other hotels, but it's still close by. Email below: I believe I've stayed at an Omni hotel (not the SF one) in the past, but definitely not since I became a regular business traveler, as I have been for the past 3.5 years. I usually travel 2 to 8 times per month, and I've stayed at a variety of 4 stars around the country (primarily SF, NYC, Boston, Dallas, Chicago, LA and Seattle). As one of two partners in my firm, I will admit cost is a large driving factor in choosing hotels (since T&E comes straight out of my pocket), so I'm a member of nearly all Hotel reward programs out there. For some reason, however, it's taken until this week before I joined Omni's Select Guest program. I can say with absolute certainty that it is the best hotel rewards program out there for any "chain" hotel. While I've seen one or two of the benefits you offer (free wireless and free water bottles) at other hotels, but the total combination of items that I care about as a business traveler (free clothes pressing, free shoe shine, free beverages in the morning, free water bottle in the evening, and pre-check-in/guaranteed room) make the Select Guest program almost too good to be true. On top of that, the fact that it's only 5 stays or 10 nights to get a free room AND only 6 (I think) nights before I move up to the next tier in your program DOES make it too good to be true. I've already sung praises of your program to 3 people, and I just checked out of the hotel this morning. In addition, another pleasant surprise was a gentlemen at the front desk named Stephen (a caucasian, bald man around 6ft tall), who was not just friendly, but one of the most informative front desk people I have come across. He also clearly remembered me the next morning and was just as helpful. I've never written an email to a hotel manager to praise their hotel, but the combination of the two topics above drove me to do so. It looks like I'll be in San Francisco 1 to 2 nights per week for the next 3 months, and as long as I can make it fit in our budget, I look forward to staying at your hotel. In fact, I booked a night at the Omni in Dallas (even though it was 15 minutes further away than other options) this upcoming Sunday night based solely on my experience at your hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Exceptional in every possible way”
Reviews.Author: classy123
Reviews.Content: This was the nicest hotel I have ever stayed at. Clean rooms, impeccable service, and every inch of the hotel is gorgeous. I honestly don't think it can get any better! I hope I get the chance to stay again!

Reviews.Title: “Heaven!”
Reviews.Author: akmmba
Reviews.Content: The Omni is so beautiful, and we had phenomenal customer service at every touch from the doorman to the front desk to the room service staff. The room was big and spacious with a sitting area and a desk. The king bed was to die for, the best sleep we had on our whole trip. The bathroom was beautiful too. Everyone called us by name and seemed genuinely pleased to make us happy. We broke a bottle of red wine in one of our bags as we arrived on a Sunday. That evening we found a complimentary replacement bottle (and a nicer one at that) and a dish of truffles with a nice note in our room. By 9:00 the next morning (Memorial Day, mind you), the clothes from our bag came back and all of the red wine stains were gone. We walked everywhere - the waterfront, Chinatown, Union Square from this location, and room service delivered the best hamburger I've ever had. I wouldn't want to stay anywhere else!!

Reviews.Title: “Hits the Spot”
Reviews.Author: Mark-choosy-chappy
Reviews.Content: Having just got off the California Zephyr (Amtrak from Chicago) we needed an all boxes ticked hotel and returning for the 2nd time to the Omni in San Fran did not disappoint. Yes, it is corporate but the decor is good, the staff is on the ball, good location and.........if you get the right price.......a great hotel. I paid less than $150 per night, booked well in advance, and for that price one cannot quibble. You can join the Gold level membership on arrival and receive free wireless and complimentary tea/coffee/juice in the morning. I'll be back! PS - ok, not very PC, but The Occidental Cigar Club (it is not private - just a bar you can walk in) is around the corner - one of the best I have ever frequented.

Reviews.Title: “worst 4 star hotel ever”
Reviews.Author: rstyc
Reviews.Content: stayed at omni may 29, 2010... 4 star hotel according to travelocity.com. spent 299 plus tax for 1 night. hallway and room smelled like someone just smoked a cigerette when we got there. requsted non-smoking. Called the front desk and they said they would "ionize my room" but 5 hours later still smelled like an ash tray. offered me a kids room with bunk beds?!?!?!?!lobby is a 4 star, location is a 4 star, staff is a 4 star... rooms area 2 star... dont let their pictures fool you. not a 4 star hotel at all. I have stayed at many hotels in sf.. all have a good location and good staff. this place sucks. I will upload pics fo the room soon. We had a view of a wall. carpet and bed set up looks like 15 years old. faded, and old looking. Do not recommend at all. Web site said free wi-fi. When u get there , only free wi-fi free in lobby, $10 additional charge if you connect from your room.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding hotel”
Reviews.Author: reb2411
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Omni Hotel for 3 nights..was really pleased with the hotel and all of it's facilities and would highly recommend this hotel to anyone visiting San Francisco. Spent ages deliberating over hotels and am so pleased that we chose this one. Omni Hotel is a very elegant and high quality hotel but not in a pretentious way (like some others I could mention on the strip!!), the staff are friendly and very helpful. I was very impressed at the quality of the whole interior, it's very well maintained and very clean. Our room and its facilities were great; maids did any excellent job cleaning our room, offering free turn down and ice service each evening. Omni hotel is in a prime location with excellent transport links (bus & cable car right stops on its doors step). Lots of shops and restaurants on itâ€™s door step also. All key Visitors attractions are within walking distance and/ or easily accessible via the transport links on Omni Hotels door step. Stay here and you won't be disappointed, I'll definitely be staying on my next visit.

Reviews.Title: “Gorgeous Hotel with reasonable weekly rates!”
Reviews.Author: nikkitta21
Reviews.Content: This hotel was truly elegant and luxurious! My husband and I stayed for two nights and enjoyed our room, which was clean and spacious. The staff is great and very helpful. I would recommend becoming a valued guest/member, which is free of charge and gives you benefits immediately, such as complimentary coffee delivered to your room each morning, free wifi in your room (versus paying $10 per day for it), and complimentary bottles of water on your arrival night. The location is great, you can catch the trolley right in front of the hotel. I would definitely stay here again if we were to ever travel to San Fran again! Great hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Great anniversary!”
Reviews.Author: Leshaface
Reviews.Content: My stay here at the Omni was so wonderful!!! My husband and I arrived for a weekend to celebrate our anniversary and must say they fulfilled any needs I had! When we first arrived, we were greeted by several men who welcomed us and told us where to go...Carmen at the front desk was extremely helpful about their hotel restaurant and told me that my request for a king sized bed on a high floor had been all set which was awesome!!! (normally through a third party reservation, you can not specify what type of bed you want, but called a month before and had put in my request!) The rooms were so comfortable yet had some flair to it!! The bathrooms were surprisingly big and had some great toiletries!! My husband pointed out to me that the housekeeping left a handwritten note, welcoming us, which was very thoughtful to hand write! I did have the opportunity to go work out in their gym, which was fully loaded!! Had bottled water, towels, and fruit available (self-serve) for your workout, and their equipment is very new and not withered. Not busy at all and was pretty big for a hotel gym!! I really enjoyed it!!! We were in and out of the hotel the entire weekend, but every time we left or entered, someone was always there to greet us!!! I suggest parking at a self-parking garage, because the valet was like 50 bucks a day! We went to the st. marys parking garage up on California about one block away!! This exceeded all my expectations and would most definitely stay here again!!

Reviews.Title: “The Best”
Reviews.Author: Hokie67
Reviews.Content: We had a pre-paid week-end rate, which made this one of the best values we've had at a major chain hotel in a mjor city. But it wasn't the price value that made our stay so special... nor was it the great location. It was the absolute friendliness of the professional staff. They acted liked they really, really were happy that you were staying with them. And it was everyone... from the doormen, the desk staff, the concierge, the cleaning staff... everyone. The rooms are large, the beds extra comfy and the bathroom well supplied.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect, as always”
Reviews.Author: nitehawk
Reviews.Content: 5th stay at the beautiful Omni for the wife and myself. San Francisco, and the Omni Hotel are like a drug.....we always want more. Sublime and understated, The Omni San Francisco Hotel exemplifies a true luxury business class hotel. Which may not be to everyones liking, but is exactly why we always come back. Staff, at all levels are courteous and helpful, the rooms (we stayed in a California suite, this time), are clean and very comfortable. And at night, the only noise, is the clang-clang of the cable cars running on California St. The sounds of San Francisco, and by no means intrusive

Reviews.Title: “THE BEST HOTEL IN SAN FRANCISCO!!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: SunSandH20
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at this hotel several times now over the years, I ALWAYS LOVE THIS HOTEL!!! The location is great, the staff are the BEST!!! I will be back again soon!!!

Reviews.Title: “ELEGANT HOTEL WITH A VERY FRIENDLY STAFF”
Reviews.Author: jpkar
Reviews.Content: My wife and I found the Omni to be beyond what we had expected. I had gotten a good deal booking on line, pay for two nights-get the third night free.. We found the hotel to be a very classy hotel. The staff was extremely friendly and helpfull. They treated us like we were important to them. From the doormen to the room attendant, all were polite and helpfull.. The hotel is located in the Financila District of SF. Therefore it is pretty quiet at night and on the weekend. Most of the local eateries are closed after business hours. However, the location is great as a central point to travel from, especially on foot. Chinatown, Nob HIll, North Beach, Union Square, Fisherman's Warf and the Ferry Building are all walkable, although you might have to negociate some hills. The California Street Cable Car line stops in front of the hotel. The B.A.R.T. station is a short four blocks away. We really enjoyed our stay!

Reviews.Title: “great for downtown sightseeing”
Reviews.Author: NoVaTripper
Reviews.Content: This hotel is great. The location was perfect for what we wanted to do (see the city, etc.). It's easy to walk to the Ferry Terminal and Embarcadero and the cable cars pick up right out front. The room was outstanding. The bed/shower/towels/etc. were all good. The TV didn't get many channels, but that wasn't what we were there for, so it didn't bother us. The safe wasn't quite big enough for a medium-size laptop but that wasn't a big issue. Internet wasn't free which was a little annoying, but the connection was good once we logged on. The gym was very good as well and had enough equipment that it wasn't overcrowded. They also don't charge extra for the gym, which was a plus. The bar downstairs is nice but somewhat small and was crowded enough with business people on weekdays that we went elsewhere to grab a quick drink. They kept our luggage for us a few hours after we checked out without any trouble so we were able to go out and have fun for a few hours before our flight. The only really annoying thing was that the elevators, while surprisingly quick when you are finally in one, take forever to show up. We were only on the 5th floor and would have gladly taken the stairs...if we could only find them. Certainly wasn't a huge issue, but it became even more annoying on the weekend when the hotel got more crowded.

Reviews.Title: “Great service and location at Omni”
Reviews.Author: MWB65
Reviews.Content: For our first ever trip to San Francisco my wife and I spent 6 days in early May at the Omni and we were very pleased with the hotel. The staff were exceptionally friendly and helpful beyond our expectations and helped us find and book excursions. The hotel was very quiet, clean and well maintained. The location of the Omni is excellent for walking to restaurants, shopping (beyond your imagination) and Chinatown. The cable car right outside the Omni was fun and convenient as was their courtesy shuttle to Pier 39 and area. We highly recommend the Omni.

Reviews.Title: “great location, friendly staff and comfortable rooms”
Reviews.Author: jan48London
Reviews.Content: We were 2 couples staying at the Omni when the volcanic ash disruption prevented our return to UK. We had already been at this hotel for 4 nights and then had to stay another 3 nights. The desk staff were extremely helpful and even gave us a reduced rate for the extra days we had to stay which was very useful. Would recommend this hotel as the location is great and the staff fantastic.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Omni was great”
Reviews.Author: kewlniks
Reviews.Content: This was the first time I was going to US. After a long flight first to UK and then to US I was very tired. We had a prebooking in Hotel Omni. First of all it was very easy to locate the Hotel. Thanks to the SF radio taxis. The Hotel Omni was a great experience. We are welcomed by the staff and they were very cooperative. The rooms were very cosy and luxurious. Ther room service was great. We also had a great time in Swimming pool after the hectic schedule of meetings.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Fantastic Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Jez&Carly
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Omni in San Francisco for 3 nights in late March 2010 as part of our honeymoon across the U.S west coast and Hawaii. Upon arrival, we were treated to a glass of champagne, which we thought was a very nice touch. Imagine our surprise when, after settling into our rooms (which wee upgraded to a suite), we were then served a bottle of champagne and a plate of chocolate strawberries as a congratulations for our honeymoon! The fabulous service at this hotel didn't end there. All of the front desk and concierge staff were wonderfully helpful in every way - they had some great recommendations for places to eat and things to do, and their suggestions were always spot on. Particular mention to Juan on the front desk who went out of his way to make sure that our stay was memorable. This hotel is also very well located, in the financial district but only a 10-20 minute walk down to Fishermans Wharf. We recommend taking the boat to Alcatraz, but you will need to book tickets well in advance (ie. a few weeks) because this is very popular. We also recommend hiring a bike from Fishemans Wharf and cycling over the Golden Gate Bridge down to Sausalito - but be careful handing over your credit card at Fishermans Wharf, there is a fair bit of credit card fraud activity down there and we got pinged. But back to the hotel - it was the highlight accomodation of our honeymoon. Our room was very comfortable and tastefully decorated, the king size beds were comfy, and the bathroom was a decent size. Overall, this hotel gets a big 5 stars from us (espescially for service), and we would most definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Impressive”
Reviews.Author: jonathan443322
