Reviews.Content: Omni was perhaps the best deal I have ever had with a hotel. I am not sure why it didn't cost twice what we paid--perhaps because we were there on a weekend. Great location, great room, perfect service. The only negative is the hig priced food (which we avoided).

Reviews.Title: “What a great place to stay with kids!”
Reviews.Author: emilyfoxy
Reviews.Content: I never would have guessed that the Omni San Francisco would have turned out to be the perfect place to come with our two-year-old daughter. As soon as we arrived, I could tell this was going to be an exceptional visit. The staff was incredibly friendly to our little girl and presented her immediately upon arrival with a backpack full of cute, fun toys. Everyone in the lobby instantly memorized her name and treated her like a welcome guest. They brought milk and cookies for her at turndown service and never failed to greet her, accommodate our every need, and make us feel welcome. Furthermore, they were quick to provide everything we grown-ups needed - even an extra pair of collar stays when my husband realized he'd forgotten his. Room service was prompt and the food was delicious, the wait staff in the dining room graciously accommodated our swelling ranks as various family members wandered in for breakfast over the course of several hours one morning (we were all in town for a wedding), and the doormen treated us like they'd known us forever (and liked us for just as long). The room was graciously appointed, quiet and clean and nicely laid out, with plenty of storage and excellent housekeeping. The concierge gave us enthusiastic recommendations for restaurants and we enjoyed the "lobby apples" in the afternoon. Overall, a great stay. We'll go back.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful experience”
Reviews.Author: dmauney64
Reviews.Content: We have stayed with Omni hotels in the past and were not disappointed. The hotel is located in the financial district, yet perfect walking distance to many attractions and fabulous restaurants. I can't say enough of the wonderful staff! We were well taken care of in every aspect of our stay. The rooms were beauiful, clean and quiet! Even with a cable car line out front. We will certainly stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Omni-reffic!!!”
Reviews.Author: baruranch
Reviews.Content: Spring Break with kids to experience SF. This Hotel had everything. Beautiful room, comfortable beds. Great size bathroom with all the amenities. The staff are all wonderful. My kids knew we were in a 5star hotel that would bring milk & chocolate chip cookies each evening. The cookies were warm and delicious. Omni made our stay feel magical.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect - wouldnt want to stay anywhere else in San Fran”
Reviews.Author: foodfascist
Reviews.Content: honestly the ratings for this hotel are completely justified - its great! Beds are amazing, service was excellent, location couldnt be beat and loved the way it was the perfect combo of history/authenticity and luxury - the doormen, the cable car outside the door - all felt very san fran, but also had the niceties of an international hotel. Defintiely will be back!!

Reviews.Title: “Rude concierge and really weird front desk man”
Reviews.Author: travelingmother
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a weekend trip and decided to try the Omni. Our most recent comparison is the JW Marriott which is, overall, much better than the Omni. I will compare the two properties as we used them for similar purposes, stayed identical amounts of time, and paid about the same. We joined the Omni Select Guest program, which is underwhelming. We got Internet (which only worked on one of the two days we were there), two bottles of water the first night, and the morning beverage delivery (the coffee was really hot- outstanding). On the other hand, we paid about $30 more a night than at the JW, so those Select Guest perks aren't really "free". As for the other "perks", no one offered them to us or took the time to explain the procedures for things like "free pressing" which we could have used since we were headed to the symphony one night. We didn't get, nor were we offered, any type of upgrade as others have mentioned. Every time we have stayed at the JW we were given a slight upgrade to a "view" room. We were not contacted ahead of time, not even by email. Hilton, Marriott and Kimpton all do that, just to see if there is anything they can do to prepare for your arrival. We are not demanding guests, and have never asked for anything special. Still, it is a nice touch to acknowledge your arrival ahead of time. The Omni room was really small, and fairly shabby.(my husband described the style as a "Ritz Wannabee". There were stains on the carpet, and the furniture is dated. There was no real desk chair so it would not be a comfortable place if you had a lot of work to do. There was a coffeemaker, but no place to put it to plug it in other than have it sit on the floor. The bathroom is TINY, a tub/shower combo with only one sink and no storage. I had to to use the luggage stand propped up under the sink for my cosmetic bag. In contrast, the JW Marriott bathrooms are huge, with separate tub/shower and double sinks. Both hotels have opening windows (a big plus as city hotels are often hot). The JW rooms are less shabby, and they have a Herman Miller Aeron chair at the desk. They also have updated furniture. A flat screen can't be viewed well when used inside one of those old-fashioned entertainment centers which is what the Omni still has. The JW location near Union Square is more convenient, but also much noisier for sleeping. The car service is similar at both places, it took a little longer at the Omni than at the JW to get our car. There are of course, way more places in Union Square to eat on the weekends than in the financial district. If you have a Muni pass, the accessibility to the cable car at the Omni is excellent- they should probably offer a Muni pass as part of a package to help compensate for the lack of weekend restaurants in the neighborhood. Both hotels have uneven service, but I would have to say that the Omni really comes up short here. In fact, the poor/ rude service we experienced at the Omni is what prompted this review. We were standing at the concierge desk waiting to buy Muni day passes. Another couple came off the elevator,and the concierge (a middle-aged man) called out to them and encouraged them to come over. He then completely ignored us, didn't even bother to say something like "I will be with you in a minute.". He started into a long-winded conversation about helping them get Giants tickets. We finally left, really put off by how rude he was to ignore guests standing in front of him in deference to people just randomly walking by. Another example of rude/oddness was when I went down to the front desk to get an extra Select Guest "free beverage" cards. No one explained them to us at check-in and I falsely assumed we filled one out for each of us. Turns out you get one card and fill it out for both guests. So, I went downstairs to get another ticket. The guy at the front desk was named Richard- I think. He ignored me, but a friendly and knowledgeable bellman (I think his name was Darrel) immediately offered to help me. I told him I just needed to speak to the man behind the desk. He beckoned the guy ("Richard") behind the front desk, who responded by walking away into a back room. A few seconds later he reappeared, and was on the phone. He looked up to me and said "Richard is on the phone."- referring to himself in the third person like "Jimmy" on Seinfeld. Again, not even a nod, or a "I will be with in just a minute". Fortunately, the gracious bellman went and got a beverage ticket for me. He was a real jewel, as were every single one of the doormen, bellmen, and general staff milling around. This fine group of gentlemen went out of their way to provide continuing gracious service to all guests everytime we were in the lobby. However, the front desk staff we encountered are a genuine liability. In summary, we will not choose the Omni again. It really didn't represent a very good value. Should we stay in the financial district again, we will try the Le Meridian.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel With Friendly Staff”
Reviews.Author: Maryland77
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Omni for four nights in April. The staff was extremely helpful and friendly. Even when we ran into one of the workers in the elevator, he chatted us up and recommended restaurants. The hotel is in a good location for walking and for public transportation. The room was a good size and they delivered chocolate-covered strawberries and champagne the first night, as we were on our honeymoon. Would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Another outstanding stay”
Reviews.Author: marathon1231
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at Omni San Francisco in the past. Our last reservation was off their website and we were treated very well, including an upgrade to a suite. Our most recent stay was a quick get away from Southern California for a weekend. We decided that we were not really picky on where we would stay, we just wanted a 4 star or above off Hotwire. Well, we ended up with our favorite, the Omni. When we checked in we inquired about utilizing our Select Guest privileges for the free internet. Not only did we get the usual Select Guest privileges, but we also got an upgrade. Can't stress it enough, join Select Guest and use it. We were once again impressed with everyone in the hotel we came across starting with the doorman who let us in to the maid as we were leaving. This is a well run hotel. Some people don't like that it is in the Financial District and out of the way of the tourist places. Well, we prefer that. It is quiet and, honestly, a nice walk to the Ferry Building, to Chinatown and Union Square. We like to walk the city and see what we can and do see. And when we are done and ready to sleep, we know that we have a nice quiet room with a great bed. HIghly recommend the Omni San Francisco!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Aneja24
Reviews.Content: Beautiful hotel, perfect location, excellent service. Become an Omni "select guest" member (it's free to join) on the internet prior to your stay and enjoy complementary internet, bottles of water on your arrival, and complementary morning beverages every day (2 per person) among other services. We are celebrating our anniversary in SF and had mentioned this in our reservation. We were happy surprised with chocolate covered strawberries, roses, and a personal note in our room upon our arrival. We also were quite impressed with champagne offered to us upon check-in. The concierge are very helpful with directions and advise. Would definitely recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Treated like royalty at the Omni”
Reviews.Author: Freiert
Reviews.Content: We love the Omni San Francisco! This hotel proved to be a terrific hotel to call home for the week. The rooms were comfortable and pretty big for being downtown, and the lobby was just beautiful, and the hotel is located in the financial district so the location makes it easy to get around. But the best part was the staff. From the time my wife and I checked in till the day we left the staff was friendly, accommodating and overall terrific. We can't wait to get back out to the west coast and treat ourselves here again.

Reviews.Title: “The Best”
Reviews.Author: srabnavy
Reviews.Content: We have stayed all over the world, and we have never had a more pleasant Hotel experience than we had at the Omni-San Francisco. Beautiful room, gracious, friendly, and knowledable staff. They made our vacation to San Francisco a true memory. Will never stay anywhere else, and will now always look for an Omni Hotel when we travel for Business or Pleasure.

Reviews.Title: “Unbeatable hotel and value in SF”
Reviews.Author: MackLaJolla
Reviews.Content: Just spent a quick weekend in SF and was really very, very happy with the Omni SF hotel. The location is great - everything we wanted to do was either a 10 min walk or 10 min cab away. The staff was excellent very friendly - Daryl the doorman is one of the best that I have ever met and he personally was a big positive in our stay. It felt like several of the staff members were really looking out for us during our entire stay and everyone seemed to remember our name which was nice. The recommendations from the staff were all excellent and not once did we get a bum steer from anyone on the staff. The rooms were spacious for such a great downtown location. The bed was very comfortable and both days we overslept due to the comfort of the bed and the room in general. Can not say enough positive things about the hotel and the staff. The only downside we encountered in the entire trip was one night when we arrived back at the hotel late after attending the Wicked play - which we also very much enjoyed - the hotel restaurant was closed and the late night room service menu was extremely limited. We found something we could bear, but we were really wishing we had kept our dinner plans before the theater. It was our fault that caused us to miss our dinner plans before the theater, but we also thought that we would find a more extensive late night menu at the hotel. Overall though, this was a nit compared to the rest of the great weekend at the Omni. Very highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “A+”
Reviews.Author: sailwi
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 2 nights at the beginning of March and everything was perfect. Warm, helpful staff, nice room and good location. Room was good size and extremely clean. Good restaurant recommendations for the front desk, gave us complimentary limo rides to a few places that were a short distance away. Got a 200 a night rate on the Omni website, sign up for their loyalty program and get free WIFI, morning coffee and paper on your first stay. We have stayed at many nice hotels and for the rate this was one of the best.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great staff”
Reviews.Author: clams5
Reviews.Content: Our family really liked this hotel. Good location near Chinatown and the shopping district south of there. The staff and management do a great job with the little details that make a trip memorable. The doorman gets to know everyone and has good ideas about what to do and where to go. The housekeeping staff leave little notes and surprises in the room. At the end of a week of different hotels each night, this is the one we remembered.

Reviews.Title: “Just right...”
Reviews.Author: dynamictravel
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Omni San Francisco for two nights (Friday - Saturday) with a great rate from Travelzoo.com (about $290 for two nights, which was a surprisingly good rate on this hotel). All of the previous reviews I had read about cleanliness, comfort, and friendly service were all true. We were given an excellent room on the 10th floor of the hotel. The bed was really comfortable which made for an excellent nightâ€™s rest. The bathroom was a perfect size, was very clean, and had fantastic water pressure. As in any city there was noise from emergency vehicles, but otherwise it was a very quiet hotel. The location was perfect for us to get to many destinations in the city and to catch public transportation when necessary. The hotel staff and concierge were extremely knowledgeable about the city, gave perfect directions, and were willing to answer any questions or address any concerns. Whether you are staying for business or for leisure travel, I highly recommend the Omni for your trip to San Francisco.

Reviews.Title: “great choice”
Reviews.Author: pjce717
Reviews.Content: Omni SF is a lovely hotel with terrific service. Staff was always pleasant and greeted us warmly. Rooms are well appointed with large bathrooms. There was no noise problem here as noted at many other hotels. We were not disturbed by noise from the street or the weddings taking place there. we would certainly stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic!”
Reviews.Author: cjnabq
Reviews.Content: LOVED the hotel. All staff - from front desk/concierge/valet/housekeeping/doorman - were friendly, polite, extremely helpful. A complementary half-bottle of wine and huge slice of chocolate cake - complete with candle and matches - were delivered to my room on our arrival in honour of my birthday courtesy of Debora Tjandra; it was a very nice touch. Great location, we could walk or take public transportation anywhere we wanted to go. Appreciated the discounted valet rate at the weekend - no other S.F. hotels seem to do that. Very quiet at night - no noise from the street below. There is nothing I can think of that would have made our stay any more perfect. We're looking at where we are going to have our next Omni experience - San Antonio is looking good . . .

Reviews.Title: “Great Value, Great Hotel, Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: TravelFamilyFour
Reviews.Content: My husband and I had the pleasure of staying at the Omni San Francisco during the weekend of March 26-28. I chose the Omni after reading reviews on this forum and we were not disappointed. I have several tips for travelers: (1.) go the Omni site and review their discounted packages before making your reservation; (2.) ask for a free room upgrade before check-in; (3.) if you are staying over a weekend, don't miss the free San Francisco City Guides walking tour that is supported by the hotel. (1.) We got a package from the Omni's website that included parking, breakfast and VIP tickets to the King Tut exhibit at the de Young Museum. At $224/night, this was a bargain. Parking could have cost $40 a night alone and the hotel's breakfast could have cost over $60 per day for the two of us had it not been included. Because we are members of the Omni Select program, we got two beverages each delivered to our room in the mornings, free internet and free bottles of water. Very nice! (2.) At check-in, I requested a complimentary room upgrade and we got a very large room with a sitting area w/flatscreen and a very comfortable king bed (also with a flatscreen in an armoire near the foot of the bed). (3.) Don't miss the complimentary guided walking tours every Saturday at 10 am provided by San Francisco City Guides. Our tour of Chinatown started right in the hotel lobby and featured San Francisco history, architecture, legends and more. Our tour was about two hours long (you don't have to stay for the whole tour though) and was a super easy walk. Although it was hilly, we stopped often and the pace was just right. It was a wonderful experience! One final comment about the SF Omni: My husband and I wanted to get two full days of tours in but had not booked anything. Justin, the assistant front desk manager, took the time -- sharing his expertise and patience -- to help us plan two full days of tours and dining. He called and made reservations at each stop for us, provided maps and directions and even helped us work out the timing to make sure transportation between each stop was smooth. With Justin's help we saw everything we hoped to see (and more) and had a wonderful weekend of tours.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous stay!”
Reviews.Author: 6sturgi
Reviews.Content: My hubby and I stayed here for our anniversary last weekend. We got a great deal online by using our Amex card to book. Our corner suite was VERY romantic. The king bed was super comfy with premium linens, the bathroom had a marble shower big enough for two and they even delivered complimentary champagne and chocolate dipped strawberries after we arrived. The concierge gave us great recommendations for dinner and the friendly doorman remembered us each time we came in. There were lots of little "extras" like apple cider and pears in the lobby. The location was so convenient that we either walked or took the cable car just outside the front door. Friday night was surprisingly quiet, despite being on the corner of California and Montgomery. Saturday, however, was another story with sirens, horns and partiers til after 3 am. Ugh. We never did hear any other guests above, below or next to us. Parking is steep at $40/day and internet access is another $9.95. If you join their Omni Legacy club, they waive the internet fee. And there are plenty of nearby garages with lower daily rates if you don't mind walking a few blocks. We would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “awesome!”
Reviews.Author: mom2colbycate
Reviews.Content: I surprised my husband with a trip here for his 40th Birthday. I had researched this hotel, location, and amenities. The best thing is the professionalism and knowledge of the front desk and concierge staff. They guided us every step of the way and were never wrong in their suggestions or recommendations. They definitely went out of their way from sold out tickets to Alcatraz to planning my husbands 40th birthday dinner at Waterbar. The location is perfect. A cable car, trolley or bus ride to anywhere. Also easily accessible from the BART at San Francisco International Airport. Definitely get the muni pass that includes cable car, trolley and bus service for 3 days for $20. It's worth every penny. Listen to the concierge they know the city backwards and forwards.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay, awesome Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: sandireg
Reviews.Content: We were welcomed into the Omni Hotel with a friendly staff, an apple and some apple cider. We arrived at 11 am to find our room ready! We were checked-in in a flash and into our room in no time! The room was beautiful with two full beds, flat screen TV, coffee set up, mini bar and large and beautiful bathroom. We were on the 16th floor and had a view of the courtyard below. The room was very clean and quiet. They have turn-down service which includes milk and cookies! The service was excellent. Juan, at the concierge desk was so nice and helped us find a reasonable Italian restaurant, called ahead for a table and walked us outside to point us in the right direction for the short walk. The rest of the staff was very friendly and helpful. The Hotel had transportation passes for purchase so we didn't have to spend time finding the few places that sell the passes. We bought a 3-day pass that was good for all the local public transportation. The location is the best! Right on Calif Street and in the center of everything. The cable car and bus stops are right out front as well as taxi service. The Hotel has a 4 star rating but should be a 5 star! We loved our stay at the Omni and will stay there again when we come back to SF.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome service”
Reviews.Author: ProTagalong
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed here for 2 nights, and had a wonderful experience. From the moment we pulled up out the front, the staff at the doors remembered our names and were always polite and helpful, always offering if we needed directions and offering suggestions for places to eat/go. The staff at the front desk were also wonderful, there was always other staff standing around the lobby, ready to offer assistance if we were looking like we needed it. We initially dropped our bags off then left immediately to return a hire car. On our return, our bags weren't in our room but were delivered immediately on calling, then the next day a note was sent from the front desk to apologize for the delay in getting our bags to us. Also, when we first arrived to our room, there was a hand written note from the housekeeper to say welcome and hope we have a nice stay. Nice little touches. The Hotel was very central, close to everything, and if not, the cable car went past the front door. The room we stayed in was quite spacious, and nicely decorated, beautiful bathroom. You had to pay for Wifi in your room, but there was free Wifi in the lobby, which was a nice and relaxed place to sit around and check your emails. There was also a tray of fresh fruit near the elevators, that all guests were welcome to. We had a great experience staying at the Omni, and would highly recommend it to anyone staying in San Fran. We would definately stay here if we pass through there again.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful experience at a beautiful hotel!”
Reviews.Author: WeLove2Travel23
Reviews.Content: The Omni in San Francisco is a dream hotel! The entire staff was helpful and friendly. When you walk into the lobby, which smells like fresh cut flowers, you are surrounded by marble, wood paneling, floral arrangements, and a wonderful staff. The room was clean and quiet, and the beds were comfortable. We received milk and cookies for the kids at bedtime. When we forgot something in our car (parked with the valet), a staff member offered to run to the car and get it for us. When we called housekeeping for something, we received it right away from a cheerful staff member. We never waited more than a minute for anything! The entire staff seemed eager to assist us with whatever we needed. The Omni San Francisco has the best staff I have ever encountered at a hotel. I travel quite a bit and this hotel exceeded all my expectations. It is a perfect place to stay in San Francisco, since the hotel is near Chinatown and Little Italy and a cable car runs right out front. This is truly an exquisite and delightful hotel.

Reviews.Title: “I am already planning our next stay here”
Reviews.Author: PVfirst
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Omni last night for one night. We had a special package including free parking, breakfast, wifi and tickets to the King Tut Exhibit. Great Deal! However, the best deal was the hotel itself. The staff was wonderful from check-in to check-out. Extremely polite, attentive, helpful, nice, funny.... The hotel is beautiful. The room was perfect. Spacious, clean, with nice decor. No view to speak of, but very quiet. The bathroom was lovely, including the bow around the extra roll of toilet paper. Nice toiletries. The king bed was comfy. We became members (free) and enjoyed the complimentary shoeshine and pressing of 2 items of clothing as well as the room service of beverages of your choice in the morning. Wow, we felt so spoiled! :-) The breakfast in the restaurant was very good, the service perfect and the view of an occasional cable car coming by was a nice touch! Well, on our drive home I was thinking what a good reason would be to go back very soon. Yes! There is the Cartier Exhibit. Perfect, we'll stay at the Omni again!

Reviews.Title: “Superb Hotel”
Reviews.Author: mishka414
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Omni Hotel for three nights with my husband, and could not have asked for a better experience!! The hotel is super clean and the lobby has the most wonderful smell. Our room was a good size and very comfortable. The staff was very pleasant and helpful. We had never stayed at an Omni Hotel, and we fell in love with this hotel chain!!

Reviews.Title: “wonderful service, style and location”
Reviews.Author: jwdnewyork
Reviews.Content: We received a special weekend, amex rate and settled on reservations for a weekend stay in San Francisco. We were traveling with our three children 15, 12 and 10. The rooms were spotless and plush. Not much of a view but quiet. Although we were in the center of the business area which can be deadly dull at night, we were only a few blocks from good restaurants and sights. I have to say some glowing things about the concierge service. I do not, regrettably, remember his name, but he was unfailingly helpful. The restaurant recommendations, for casual Chinese, more formal Italian and gealto for later were spot on. Best of all he was able to get us a table without a reservation at a lovely Italian place on a crowded Saturday night. The hotel is close to Chinatown and the cable cars. We will return here for our next visit to San Francisco. Thank you.

Reviews.Title: “Great Service! Quiet location. Only steps from everything SF.”
Reviews.Author: mkwayne
Reviews.Content: I recently returned from the Omni and was impressed with the quality of service they provided. During the course of a crepe run in the morning, a button on my suit jacket fell off. Upon requesting the front desk personnel that it be repaired, and inquiring about the charge associated with such a repair, I was informed they'd be happy to do it at no charge, and would have it done within 30 minutes, as I was going to be heading back out for the day and needed that jacket. Doorman never let me open my own door, or hail my own cab. They also offered umbrellas if rain was expected and you didn't have one in hand. 11th floor room facing California, with a view of Montgomery, was quiet except for a fire truck one night. No other road noise was heard, even though the trolley goes by several times a day. Within just a few blocks is Chinatown, Union Square for shopping, Little Italy, Columbus Ave nightlife, and Embarcadara Plaza.

Reviews.Title: “The Omni has the best location!”
Reviews.Author: BordeauxBaby
Reviews.Content: I just spent three nights at the Omni--this hotel has a great location; it's walking distance to Chinatown, North Beach, The Ferry Building, and so much more! The rooms are a nice size, extremely comfortable and clean. The hotel staff was very professional, helpful and very nice. This was one of the best hotel experiences I have had.

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful stay at the Omni Hotel San Francisco”
Reviews.Author: bnova72
Reviews.Content: This is my first time staying at an Omni Hotel and I must say that I was not disappointed. The staff was extremely friendly, professional, and helpful. I was always acknowledged and greeting by the housecleaning staff whenever I met one of them in the hallway. As for the ambiance, I must share that the hotel is quite elegant without being too pretentious. I was especially happy with the morning beverage service. It was delivered everyday exactly at the time I had requested. In short, this is a wonderful hotel which I plan to stay in again. I've already reserved a couuple more stays in the coming months. Thank you, Omni San Francisco.

Reviews.Title: “Great spot/great location”
Reviews.Author: Malia8
Reviews.Content: We just had a wonderful stay at the Omni San Francisco. It's a beautiful spot -- not large and impersonal like many of the chain hotels. The staff was friendly and professional, the rooms were immaculate (we were in a California Suite, which was quite reasonably priced), and it was a very convenient location for restaurants and shopping. All in all, we would highly recommend it, and would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely no complaints.All around clean, tasteful, and accommodating.”
Reviews.Author: rccgeo
Reviews.Content: I always have a hard time finding a hotel that's near all of the places I want to go, in a safe location, and is a little on the luxury side, yet at an affordable price. This hotel met and exceeded all of those criteria. It is on the edge of both the financial district and Chinatown. I believe it took about 15 minutes to walk down to Union Square where all the shopping is located. Luckily Boudin's Sourdough bread had a location in the lower level of Macy's so I didn't have to deal with all of the craziness of Fisherman's Wharf! Everyone at the hotel was dressed appropriately and behaved with the upmost professionalism. The room was was tastefully decorated and very clean. I especially liked how quite the room was. I didn't notice any loud annoying noises (ie: toilets, neighbors, slamming doors, etc.) All around a very pleasant stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great home base for enjoying the city”
Reviews.Author: travelhealthmaven
Reviews.Content: This was my second stay here. I first stayed 2 years ago with my teen daughter as a mid-week getaway. This time I went with my spouse who had one day of business in SF so we decided to do a long weekend. We checked in on a Thursday and left (reluctantly) Sunday. I love the location -- easy walking distance to Chinatown, North Beach, Union Square, the Ferry building. Also easy to take the cable car back up California Street from Embarcadero. Only caveat is, on the weekend. most of the immediately local sandwich/soup shops are closed, catering as they do to local business lunchers. Our room was very nice, if a little quirky. It was on the top (17th) floor and was a suite with a separate living room. I say quirky only because the windows were all small and very high up so they let in the light but you could not really look out. We didn't care -- to us it was charming and comfortable The bathroom was nicely appointed with marble and an extra large shower and some fresh roses in a vase - a very nice touch. We splurged on a breakfast at Bob's -- the Eggs Benedict were (was?) among the best I've had. Our room service breakfast was very good as well. We are part of the free Omni loyalty program. In 2008 this got you free internet, plus free continental breakfast. This year they cut out the breakfast, giving you only coffee and juice of your choice. Still nice. The lobby is beautiful and the staff always courteous and helpful. I also appreciated the hot cider they have in the afternoons. We used the gym which has a nice view of California Street and the cablecar. It's clean and well-equipped if small, but I will say the treadmill I used (the one on the right as you enter the room) was very noisy and I remembered I used the same one in 2008 and apparently it hadn't been fixed. I would definitely stay at the Omni again - it was a great value for SF and made for a very nice getaway.

Reviews.Title: “Birthday celebration”
Reviews.Author: KKinCali
Reviews.Content: We stayed overnight in San Francisco for my boyfriend's birthday, and the Omni was a great choice. The staff were overwhelmingly friendly, making sure check in was a smooth process, and handing us a glass of bubbly upon arrival. Everything about the hotel is nice - the elevators are fast and quiet, the hallway carpets are thick and soft, the flowers in the elevator lobby are fresh, you get the idea. Our room was pretty large, as was the bathroom and closet. The bed was extremely comfortable, but the pillows were not great for us. Otherwise, it was lovely. The tub was deep - made for a great bubble bath! There are many other little touches provided by the hotel - nice tea/coffee, a jogging map of the area, a desk with built in internet lines, etc. I would definitely look at their other hotels in other cities. Breakfast in the hotel downstairs was included in our package, but I wouldn't eat there if it hadn't been. It was overpriced for the quality - in such a great food town, you can do much better!

Reviews.Title: “The hotel was great!!!”
Reviews.Author: sara_johnson97
Reviews.Content: I work in the hospitality industry, a 4 diamond resort to be exact so I know great service. The Omni San Francisco was amazing! The bell/door staff were top notch! Most of the front desk staff was great, all were very professional not friendly just professional. I did have one encounter with a female manager that I wasn't impressed with. Her tone change towards the negative side once she saw the 19 year old looking girl in front of her with a question ( I really am 28 and am a manager that would rank higher then her). The rooms were VERY well kept and maintained, trust me I did a very in depth inspection. The cute note from the room attendant in the room when we checked in was was a great added touch. The room attendant was great! Very kind, sweet and did a great job (we got lucky and had her everyday). I did get to enjoy room service while I was there and they did an outstanding job, all the food was great and the service was right up there as well. I used the hotel bar once, it was very quiet and kinda stuffy for my tastes but very nice. Over all I think the hotel is amazing and wish I would've received an email survey from them to give them a great score and positive feed back. Hopefully they read these.

Reviews.Title: “Family luxury in the heart of San Francisco”
Reviews.Author: fiveapplekeys
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a King while our kids were in the adjoining Pottery Barn kids room. They loved it ... a kids dream come true! Our King room was clean and well appointed with old time luxury plus modern amenities. The kids had bunk beds plus a fold out couch, table and chairs, bean bags, a good library of books, TV with DVD player, and a mini fridge stocked with emergency snacks. Most importantly, they had cookies and milk delivered to their room every night! The Omni itself is beautiful, nestled between the Financial District and Chinatown, and is right on the California cable car line. Tremendous service that was kind and present, but never overbearing. One of our best hotel experiences ever!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel! Great location and service”
Reviews.Author: megan9927
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Omni San Francisco for 3 days for our 5 year anniversary. The hotel is in a great location in the city, walking distance to many attractions. The room was perfect and the service was outstanding. Reserve in advance on the hotel's web site for the best rates.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel all round”
Reviews.Author: Vonce
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Omni San Francisco for four nights on holiday and was very impressed. Really nice hotel, nice rooms, very clean,very good bed, friendly staff and also in an excellent location.

Reviews.Title: “absolutely best choice...”
Reviews.Author: AMandCD
Reviews.Content: It took me forever to try to figure out which hotel to stay at in San Francisco, since there are so many to choose from, I couldnt have made a better choice..Everyone was so friendly as soon as we arrived. The rooms were very clean and nice, the maid service was on point. We recieved a nice welcoming gift, which was thoughtful for such a big hotel.. We never visited San Fran before so we needed lots of direction and all the staff members made it a million times easier to make it around : ) I highly recommend this hotel to anyone booking a trip to this fun city : )

Reviews.Title: “CA Trip”
Reviews.Author: VenomViper
Reviews.Content: Fantastic Hotel, Close to everything you want to visit, staff extremely helpful, make use of the prepaid parking if you take a vehicle

Reviews.Title: “Great choice for a trip to San Francisco”
Reviews.Author: buenasvacaciones
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 6 nights and from the moment I arrived felt that I'd made the right choice. The location is perfect with both the main shopping district and the waterfront about 10 minutes walk away. My room was large,pleasantly furnished and well equipped. There was also a decent sized bathroom with a bath. The hotel offers complimentary coffee in the bar until 10am and in the afternoon there was fruit or biscuits and a seasonal soft beverage on offer - a nice touch. The hotel website has some good offers so it is possible to experience luxury with good service at an affordable price.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent!”
Reviews.Author: bookworm720
Reviews.Content: My sister and I recently stayed at the Omni SF for two nights this week. We've been to SF many times but decided to spend extra time since we had people to visit in the Bay. We arrived on Sunday night and left her car with valet ($48/night). The man walked around the car with my sister and noted existing scratches and dings before taking the car. Checking in was easy, although there was a problem with our room. We reserved our room through Expedia and requested two beds. Our room had one king bed. I went to the front desk and asked for the room we reserved. Luckily, there was a room available with two beds, but was told that had the hotel been full, they wouldnâ€™t be able to move us. I asked how come the hotel didnâ€™t get my reservation right. He said that sometimes they donâ€™t get all the details because we reserved the room through a third party and they tend to buy rooms in blocks. However, had they known that Iâ€™m a Select Guest member prior to my arrival, they would have gotten everything straighten out. He called our new room a few minutes later to make sure we moved okay. Tip: Sign up for the Select Guest program (Omni loyalty program). Itâ€™s free to sign up. We received free internet access ($9.95/night otherwise I believe), morning newspaper, and breakfast drinks (2 per person). The hotel is in the financial district. There were many ATMs nearby. I had to get some unexpected work done and luckily, FedEx Kinkoâ€™s and the UPS Store were a few blocks away. The hotel is walking distance to Union Square and two blocks from Chinatown. We walked to both. We also walked to the Cable Car Museum (free) and onward to Ghirardelli Square via North Beach and Russian Hill. Ghirardelli Square was a bit far for walking, but we wanted the exercise. We took a cab from Pier 39 back to the hotel ($10) though. Iâ€™ve stayed at many hotels and the Omni SF is definitely top 3. We loved the Omni and would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!”
Reviews.Author: hmayfield
Reviews.Content: The Omni was the icing on the cake to our SF stay. The staff was amazing and helpful. The hotel and room was beautiful. The location was unbeatable. Going to SF? Stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Good Service”
Reviews.Author: sruby
Reviews.Content: After a night of merry making, we returned to the garage only to find that it was closed and locked up for the night. Having to find a room on short notice the Omni Hotel hoked us up with a cheap room for the night. Justin who works at the front desk was very helpful, he gave us all the grooming supplies we needed. The room was clean and comfortable. We will be returning customers.

Reviews.Title: “Perfection”
Reviews.Author: aztecgol4er
Reviews.Content: Planned on going to NYC for GF's birthday, but with weather, that fell thru. Found a good rate at the Omni's site and booked it. In the reservation, I left a little note about the birthday and left it at that. So we arrive to SF early (11am) and go to leave our bags at the front desk assuming we'd not be able to check in. We were not only able to check in, but we were upgraded to the top floor, with a view of the Bay...AMAZING. Additionally, we were given personalized gift bags...relaxation stuff for the misses, and random stuff for myself....major points. So we head out for lunch and come back sometime later when we get a call on the phone. The front desk tried to send up something, but with the privacy sign on the door, couldn't alert us. So we told them to come back up and they delivered a complimentary bottle of wine and homemade truffles. Perfect! All I can say is thank you to the Omni SF. This was the perfect trip and everytime I'm back in the city, this is where I'll be staying.

Reviews.Title: “"A Jewel"”
Reviews.Author: dgraham61
Reviews.Content: This is a beautiful property. First class. Perfect location, walking distance to many attractions. If you are not into walking, there are about 3 different types of public transportaion right outside the Hotel. Extremely safe area. Front desk personnel and door assistants are friendly and very knowledgeable about the area and the history of San Francisco. From the moment you step into the Hotel you feel welcome. Handwritten note from the housekeeping lady was a very special touch. Room service was amazing, try the creme brule' it is amazing. We were upgraded to a suite and it was incredible. Very big room, lots of windows and great views of the city. We loved everything about this property and will definitely go back. Sarah Crown is the Assistant Front Office Manager and she is delightful as well as Barney the doorman who everyone seems to know and love. As far as we are concerned this is the only place to stay in downtown San Francisco!

Reviews.Title: “Christmas Magic, Greeted as if I Were Santa Claus”
Reviews.Author: newyorkscreen
Reviews.Content: This is a return trip to the Omni and from the moment we pulled up in our car and the doorman greeted us by name, to the warm greeting (by name)at the front desk, that made us feel like we were a favorite relative ( and not that our names were being read off of the computer), we have felt most welcome. Another small example of the same superb staff is that when we leave a small tip for the houskeeping staff, we always receive a thank you note in response. The accomodations are delightful, this we have come to expect, but what really makes the Omni as destination to be desired is the staff. We are greeted each morning by the lovely woman who brings our breakfast as if we are the only customers in the world. Do not underestimate the accomodations, the most confortable bed in America. You will leave you heart at the Omni!

Reviews.Title: “Hands down best hotel experience!”
Reviews.Author: ZenBach
Reviews.Content: I stayed twice, in two different rooms. Both were HUGE by any standard, but especially for San Francisco. My room at the Hilton was about 1/3 the size. The bathrooms are AMAZING: large tub, lots of thick towels, and lots of space. The furniture in the room has an antique feel, but in that upper crust Euro way, not in that shabby chic kind of way. The beds are firm but comfortable, and the linens are soft. You can get down pillows or foam. Tons of room and a big picture window, and the place was quiet enough to get a good night's sleep--which is never my experience. During the holidays they gave my sister and I welcome gift bags and had a champagne reception in the lobby, which is also beautiful. But the best thing about the Omni was the service. Everyone was fantastic, from doormen to front desk staff. Helpful, courteous, and friendly. They let me check in early after my all night flight from Japan, gave us directions multiple times, helped us with parking, and kept our stuff for hours after we checked out. I will stay here whenever I'm in SF again. We liked them so much we brought them homemade cookies on our second stay.

Reviews.Title: “Glad we returned”
Reviews.Author: seablu
Reviews.Content: We stayed here over Thanksgiving. We returned to use our tickets to the King Tut exhibit. The hotel is on a one way street. Not uncommon in SF. We pulled curbside to have our suitcases unloaded. In less than 1 minute, the metermaid was behind us. The doorman spoke with her and we avoided a ticket. We were self parking up the street. I pulled away to park after my trunk was closed by the bellman. I thought the luggage had been unloaded! I realized after I parked that only my family was at the hotel, not my bags! When I walked into the hotel, the bellman met me and offered to walk to the parking garage to help carry bags. Our room included the kids ajoined room. Their room was a full sized room with a bunkbed, kid sized robes, games, books, stuffed toys, and various treats. The bathroom had childrens cups and a stool and other goodies. The door even had a kids level peephole. Their refrigerator had cereal, milk, juices, and snacks. There is even a "suitcase" at the front desk filled with goodies. Also in the lobby, fresh fruit, and hot cider. Our room was spacious and clean. Our view, however, was of another office building where you could see people working! We never used our car. We either walked, took the taxi, or used public transport. Everything was close and easy to find. We walked to Union square, the Embarcadero to iceskate, and shop. Wifi and cell service in our room was excellent. The front desk went out of their way to help with everything. Customer service was outstanding. Like everyone says, join their select guest program for added perks. We will return.

Reviews.Title: “Just Do It!”
Reviews.Author: CanadianCelt
Reviews.Content: We selected the Omni based on all the reviews we read on Tripadvisor and we are so happy we did. We stayed there from Dec 19th -23rd and what a great experience. Upon arrival we were greeted by a very friendly concierge, who offered us a glass of champagne and we knew we had made a great choice. The room was perfect with plently of space. Everyone here is so focused on the hotel's mission statement. It's location is excellent, a nice walk from Fishermans Wharf, Union Square and so on, yet it also has the convenience of having the "California Line" cable car outside the front doors. We did not eat in the Restaurant, but we did go down the street 3 blocks to San Francisco's oldest restaurant "Tadich Grill" which is another great reason to stay at the Omni as it's a great restaurant and a nice short walk back to the hotel. To sum up our stay at the Omni, I would say "Just Do It" - you won't go wrong.

Reviews.Title: “Best Omni out there? Might be!”
Reviews.Author: lefty713
Reviews.Content: Fabulous location, a 10 minute walk to North Beach, 5 minutes to Chinatown. Cable car stop across the street. Rooms were great, couldn't get very good cell phone reception inside, but that is the only negative. Good bed, spacious enough room, nice products, excellent shower head pressure. A delightful stay.

Reviews.Title: “INCREDIBLE SERVICE AND LOCATION JUST EXCELLET”
Reviews.Author: YANI55
Reviews.Content: Me and my husband stay 3 days at the Omni Hotel, the services was excellent, the staff was super friendly and always there for anything you may need... The location one of the best in San Francisco..... I highly recommended this hotel to anyone thinking of traveling to San Fco, belive me you will not regreted......... EXCELLENT.....

Reviews.Title: “The best stay we've had in San Francisco”
Reviews.Author: LydiaTibbetts
Reviews.Content: From the moment we arrived the Omni San Francisco outdid its competitors. The front desk was efficient and greeted us warmly, the bellman was helpful and gracious about the tip. For the first time I can remember we had a handwritten note from the housekeeper welcoming us. The hotel had responded to my request for a room on a high floor and , while one might expect them to be cynical since I know people are sometimes dishonest about a special event, a bottle of champagne and chocolate covered strawberries, with another handwritten note from the concierge, was waiting for us on our first night.. We've stayed at five star hotels for years in SF but our knees will no longer climb (or descend) Nob Hill comfortably and the Omni was our choice because of that. We would recommend it to anyone and will seek out Omnis whenever we travel.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Luxury Base”
Reviews.Author: VikingDevon_UK
Reviews.Content: Stayed last week and cannot recommend Omni highly enough. Very helpful and pleasant staff (particularly concierge) and luxurious feel to the hotel as a whole. Despite being in heart of CBD it makes a perfect walkable base to explore waterfront and Union Square areas - Xmas decorations in the city have to be seen to be believed.. "what recession?!" On a practical note take the BART from airport to Montgomery and walk the level 3 short blocks to the hotel. At $8.10 and 20 minute journey it is easy, clean and a bargain compared to pricey slow cab.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Phillister
Reviews.Content: Our stay at the Omni during the week of Thansgiving was outstanding. We went with our 2 young children (5 and 2). Check in was excellent - with back packs containing games for the children. The room was very clean and well maintained each day. Location was excellent - easy to walk around, get on cable cars or travel by taxi. Above all the Omni was a cut above any hotel we have stayed at due to the attitude of the employees. All of them were friendly and looking to help in anyway they could. We had never stayed at an Omni before but will now consider it on every trip where they have a hotel located. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding service”
Reviews.Author: Travelling_Wiz
Reviews.Content: I travel to San Francisco a couple of times each year and have been fairly loyal to the Hilton Financial District which has a great location and wonderful views. I have had drinks in the bar at the Omni and thought it was lovely. This time, I found a terrific weekend price at the Omni and decided to try it. It was a great decision. From the moment I walked in the door, the service was uniformly outstanding. The doorman asks for the name on the reservation - and from there, they hand you off, by name, from staff member to staff member. I was particularly impressed when the next morning, the bellman still referred to me by name - good memory! The room I had was probably not the best location, but I didn't expect their best room for the price I paid! The room itself was lovely, extremely well equipped. It faced inwardly to other rooms of the hotel and a nearby office, but frankly that was wonderful because it was extremely quiet for sleeping. The location of the Omni in the center of town does not lend itself to views in any case. When I checked in, they gave me door tags to hang each night with a requested beverage (coffee, tea, juice, etc) for the morning. What I particularly liked was that on the back, you could also order small breakfast items - muffins, yogurt, etc. for a very reasonable price rather then ordering an expensive breakfast from the room service menu. If you were happy enough with coffee and a muffin for breakfast, it was possible for a very small charge. All in all it was a lovely hotel, I hope I can find another fairly reasonable offering in the future, as I would love to stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastically wonderful!!!”
Reviews.Author: jillery1954
Reviews.Content: Everything about the hotel is lovely! We were celebrating my boyfriend's birthday and when we arrived they told us they'd upgraded us to a suite. It was a corner room and we had windows on both sides, a very nice sitting room, beautiful bathroom and huge bedroom. Everything about the room was first class. It was extremely clean and the bed was very comfortable. When we came back to the room after riding the cable cars around for a few hours there was a big piece of chocolate cake and a split of champagne waiting for us! We had dinner at Bob's, the hotels restaurant, and they gave us one of their intimate, private dining rooms. The food was wonderful! The hotel employees could not have been more helpful, welcoming and courteous. I can't say enough good things about our stay there and will definitely go back. I recommend it without hesitation!! Don't miss it, you'll love it!!!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing service, location and comfort”
Reviews.Author: jogoderic
Reviews.Content: We were totally wowed with the service and comfort of the Omni. We live in the Bay area and go to San Francisco every few weeks for fun in the city. We have stayed at several hotels, and this was by far the best experience we've had. We were given Express check-in, which was amazingly smooth. All of the staff is super friendly and accomodating. We ordered breakfast each morning (very yummy blueberry pancakes) and got coffee and the New York Times promptly at 8 am, as requested. The room was huge, quiet and the beds very comfy. The shower was so luxurious -- my husband is 6'5", so a high, large shower head is something he really appreciates. The workout facility was also very impressive - high-end treadmills, eliptical machines and free weights. The location is unbeatable -- right across from the Bank of America and a few short blocks from Union Square and the Embarcadero. You absolutely can't go wrong with the Omni!

Reviews.Title: “Once again--a wonderful experience at an Omni hotel”
Reviews.Author: outtolunchalot
Reviews.Content: An absolutely beautiful hotel--a retrofitting of an old bank building. The location is perfect I got a great rate when I booked on line thru Omni and when I arrived I was pleasantly surprised to find out I had been upgraded to a one-bedroom suite--I can't say enough about the Select Guest Program at The Omni. A fleet of black Town Cars were waiting in front of the hotel to take you shopping, to restaurants, to the airport. The restaurant and bar are excellent as well. The suite was traditional in styling, and very elegant with a large walk-in marble shower. This is a perfect example of why I always stay at Omni hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel - wish we could of stayed longer”
Reviews.Author: PedroSydney
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Omni for 2 nights in Oct as part of a 2 week trip of the West Coast. We picked the Omni via the good reviews in trip advisor and were not disappointed. From the moment we entered the foyer we knew that the reviews were correct. Check in was quick and friendly, we had asked for a room with harbor views and a high floor and received both these requests. The room was good size with comfortable bed and loverly bathroom. We had room service the first night - which was delivered quickly and was of good quality. The dinner included a birthday cake and red wine for my wife. The cable cars run outside the hotel which is handy for trips to Fisherman's Wharf. Union Sq is about a 10 minute walk. Dinner the second night was in their Chop House restaurant , which is a must, especially for wine lovers as they have been voted as having one of the top 10 wine lists in the world. Steaks and Seafood were of high quality and service excellent. Our last stay was at the Monaco which was also good but at $100 night extra is not as good value as the Omni. We will certainly come back to Omni, next trip to the states.

Reviews.Title: “Great Service”
Reviews.Author: mixip
Reviews.Content: Picked the Omni after reading all of the reviews on TA. All as said before - great service, rooms, etc. In terms of location I didn't find it too far from Union Square, etc - 5-10 minute walk tops. I quite like the fact that it's in the financial district; means that local starbucks, cafe's etc are open nice and early for business (I'm a morning person!) although agree it's a little quieter in the evening once rush hour is over, but it's hardly dead. Walgreens, Mcdonalds, Starbucks and lots of cafe's are all within 100 metres of the hotel so you don't have to go far for anything. Would certainly recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Base in Financial District”
Reviews.Author: BenW
Reviews.Content: This is an outstanding hotel with an excellent staff. The rooms have everything you need with very comfortable beds. The bar is quite pricey downstairs and their breakfast and room service prices are absolutely ridiculously expensive. They would sell a lot more of each of those categories if they didn't charge so much. The location is unbeatable (unless you have the scratch to stay in the Ritz.). Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Elegant hotel in SF”
Reviews.Author: japoinase
Reviews.Content: I like this hotel a lot! Very professional service, great food and good location. Omni is located in financial district on California Ave. You can walk to China Town; catch a cable car or a trolley. Our room was very clean, comfortable, and spacious, room service was always fast. I wish this hotel was part of Starwood or had some kind of reward program since it's not cheap. Another time I stayed in Le Meridien, just a few blocks away and I wish I was in Omni :) This is definitely great and beautiful hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: hodjafrapjort
Reviews.Content: Nice & attentive costumer service in front desk and very funny and attentive bell boy. We had ordered a king deluxe and we got a very big room with extremely good and huge bed and a very nice view. Free wifi and if you become a member of their club, which is free, there is free coffee and such brought to your door in the morning. The location is also very good - i was afraid that we had ordered a room in the financial district because it often means empty and scary neighbourhood after business hours, but it was just on the edge of Union sq. It is a bit on the expensive side compared to us prizes, but we thought the money was well spent... The valet is like 50 bucks or something.

Reviews.Title: “A Warn welcome To California”
Reviews.Author: RogeRowlandson
Reviews.Content: Following a long flight from the UK we arrived to a very warm welcome from the staff at the Omni. Check in was fast and loads of useful info was offered. The room was very comfortable. The bed had a memory foam topper which made it really comfortable. The toiletries were great and everything was spotless. We didn't have breakfast here as there is so much choice nearby, however the bar is a bit pricey for drinks and snacks compared to other bars. Overall a great choice in San Francisco.

Reviews.Title: “A Jewel”
Reviews.Author: Lnrbill
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in financial district on California ave close to cable car, MUNI bus and trolley. The rooms are well appointed , the hotel staff are extremely out going. They know the area well and it's advised to ask for directions and input for dining etc. We enjoyed a relaxing stay and though it was our first experience staying at this hotel chain we cancelled our internary and stayed at Omni of LA,, Just a rubber stamp of what hotels should be and how staff obviously are in tune with helping there guests achieve the most out of there business or leisurely stay.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderfully welcoming, great location, fantastic for our 1 yr old too..”
Reviews.Author: Nudger_9
Reviews.Content: This is a great 4 star hotel that we only used because it was the cheapest in its class on Expedia for the night we wanted. The hotel is in a great location - only 10 minutes walk from the Ferry Building in SF and an easy walk from the rest of the waterfront and loads of cafes and restaurants. The staff were kind and attentive - I know they're paid to be, but they went the extra mile with our little daughter. A kid's toy-pack was handed to her immediately we came through the door, and there were cookies and milk left along with her crib. The room was beautifully kept and equipped and was immaculate. We were very happy with this hotel and would definitely consider staying here again!

Reviews.Title: “Pricey, small rooms, great location.”
Reviews.Author: williate
Reviews.Content: Hotel lobby was nice. Room was small but clean. Bathroom was terrific and clean. Check-in was difficult. Reserved room several months in advance and requested room w/2 beds (traveling w/my adult daughter). Was given room w/1 king bed. Had to wait an hour for room to be reassigned. Was offered a coupon for a free breakfast to compensate for the inconvenience, but it was not offered until we were checking out and leaving for the airport! Consierge was very helpful and knowledgeable. Housing keeping staff were friendly and prompt. Restaurant was very expensive and food was not what was expected for the $$ charged.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Alwayshonest39
Reviews.Content: We stayed here in August for 3 nights and absolutely loved it! Service was excellent...location good (quiet on weekends...) but close to shopping and restaurants. Highly recommend it!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent in every way”
Reviews.Author: eurotraveler032003
Reviews.Content: Attentive service, bordering on being too eager to help. Rooms are good size, with all the amenities. A plus for this hotel is a nicely appointed fitness center which is complimentary for guests. All in all, you will be quite happy here. Tip: Join the Omni Hotel frequent stay club, it entitles you to amenities including free newspapers, water, complimentary hot beverages delivered in the morning. Sign up is free. Another tip: Do not spend $48/night to valet park your car here. Best bet is not to have a car, if you must there are cheaper self-park alternatives (parking at corner of Sutter & Stockton is a municipal garage)

Reviews.Title: “Had High Expectations and Omni Exceeded Them”
Reviews.Author: Annagins
Reviews.Content: I was in San Francisco for a conference and needed a room for 3 nights. I used a third party booker (starts with Price and ends with Line) and got an amazing deal on the Omni. I was very happy, because Omni is one of the highest ranked hotels in San Francisco. Now I know why. The Omni is located in the Financial District, which means itâ€™s a fairly short distance from touristy spots such as Union Square, Embarcadero, Chinatown and Pier 39. It also seems relatively safe. There are plenty of restaurants nearby, both dinner style and â€œgrab something quickâ€� like Jamba Juice and Subway. Upon arrival, I realized Iâ€™d forgotten my phone charger. The front desk clerk, seeing that I was a little upset, offered to check housekeeping for a loaner. Five minute later she came back with a charger and said I could use it for the duration of my stay. Her helpfulness plus the cheery, happy, glad-to-be-at-work vibe given off by the rest of the employees in lovely lobby got my stay off to a good start. I had to wait a half hour for my room, which was no big deal since Iâ€™d arrived earlier than 3. One of the most cheerful porters Iâ€™ve ever encountered took my bags and held them while I ran to get some lunch. When the room was ready, I was surprised at how large it was â€“ especially considering Iâ€™d booked third party. Omni didnâ€™t discriminate and attempt to put me in the broom closet, which to be honest, has happened only once at a different hotel where Iâ€™d booked through the bargain booker. The room had a very long hallway â€“ so long I could run laps back and forth. The bathroom was huge, the bed was big and comfy (as usual for Omni) and the room had a sofa, desk, chest of drawers and two flat screen TVs which could be adjusted so that I could view them from about any point in the room. The room didn't have a lot of light, but it didn't bother me, and the view was of people working in the offices in the building next door, which wasn't scenic, but slightly entertaining. As for the noise level, the only noise I ever heard coming from another room was a shower in a nearby bathroom. Overall, the room was very quiet. So the location was great, service was outstanding and the room exceeded my expectations. Room service prices were very, very expensive, but thatâ€™s to be expected. However, I was able to order from the bar at the restaurant downstairs (Bobâ€™s) and take the food back up to the room. That cut the costs down tremendously and the cobb salad I ordered was excellent. Iâ€™d love to go back to San Francisco for a longer stay at The Omni, and hopefully, with family. I read they have a kidsâ€™ suite with bunk beds attached to a king suite. Final Note: Omni's Internet was free to members. To be a member, you just sign up on their website or when you get to the hotel. It's free and you get free Internet access. The room I was in wasn't wireless, but they provided a cord and I didn't have any major issues getting or staying online.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great service,fabulous breakfast,excellent value!”
Reviews.Author: Bewitched007
Reviews.Content: We stayed at 3 different hotels in San Francisco and this was by far the best value and a nice hotel with a good location. The room was spacious and comfortable. we were given through directions for locations we were seeking and good information on arrival. the price was very good.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice”
Reviews.Author: luvtotravel59
Reviews.Content: Our stay at the San Francisco Omni Hotel was excellent. The exterior of the hotel is very attractive and the interior is tastefully decorated. The rooms were nicely decorated; not too big and not too small. The hotel staff were very friendly and helpful. The location is convenient to many tourist attractions and the trolley.

Reviews.Title: “LOVED IT!”
Reviews.Author: t_castillo
Reviews.Content: From the moment we got to the Omni hotel, eveything was perfect! My husband and I have never been to San Fran and we came with 5 others for fun. On the day we arrived we came in late from the airport and had 30 minutes to get to Pier 33 for the night Alcatraz tour. Thank goodness for Michael at the front desk, he not only checked us in, took all of our bags and had us all whisked away in time to make the tour. That was just the beginning! Every morning Joey at the font desk would greet us and ask whats on the agenda today. Well he made lots of suggestions and was very helpful in teaching us how to take the cable cars to the Piers, which was very easy. It picks you up right in front of the hotel and you take it to Powell street. On Powell you can either take the Hyde Cable car or the Mason. They both take you to the water at the different spots but the Hyde takes you to Lombard Street where you can get off and walk down the famous street and its only a couple of blocks to the Pier. For us taking the cable cars and walking around was the best way to see and experience the life down there. Parking would be crazy, so if your able to walk, that is what I recommend. We also did the Night cruise to Alcatraz. We bought our tickets a month in advance and believe me if we hadn't we would not of been able to go. It is definately worth the price and a great tour! We also top the Hop on Hop off Bus tour over the Golden Gate Bridge. It was ok I was a little disappointed that we got on the wrong bus and didn't get to go to Salsalito. Once your on they do no transfers so your stuck on the bus going where its going. It wasn't bad we went to the Exploratorium, the Presidio, over the bridge and the Pacific Heights Mansions. It was nice but really heard that Salsalito was a great town to go to! Other than that the Bread from Boudini's and the seafood is Awesome! We went to a show in North Beach, Beach Blanket Babylon and thought that it was great! Different, funny with great costumes and the humor was with all the current events that are going on today and Singing. If your up for a funny show you will have to get your tickets ahead of time for this too! Had no problems taking the BART to and from the airport. Hotel was just 5 blocks away. A special thanks to Joey and Michael at the Omni for always helping and going way out of their way to make our stay better! Definately planning a trip to go back with our kids next year and would definately stay at the Omni again! It was nice and quiet for us, the bed very comfortable (needs extra pillows, you can request) and the rooms very comfortable. Hope this helps!

Reviews.Title: “Loud, loud, loud!”
Reviews.Author: lgoodri28
Reviews.Content: The Omni is a beautiful hotel in a great location. My wife and I stayed here as a treat and I thought it would be worth the cost. Unfortunately there was a loud wedding party when we were there. The hotel has an outdoor "party patio" on the third floor in the center of the building which just echoes and creates a terrible amount of noise. We had an early flight the next day and weren't able to sleep. I had to call several times to complain and beg to get moved to another room. Would I stay here again? Not a chance for 300 dollars.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it - and such a deal!”
Reviews.Author: GraceFoster
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Omni for Labor Day weekend and it was terrific. The staff did everything possible to make our stay a pleasant one, with special kudos to Lex, the concierge, who so generously shared his knowledge with us. Our room was clean and very quiet, the bathrooms were large with plenty of amenities, the WIFI in the room acutally worked every time and the location was perfect for walking to the Ferry Building. And - the nightly rate was about half what we would have paid at comparable hotels in the neighborhood! Definitely join the (free) Loyalty program when booking to get a few extras. Note: valet parking is costly ($30 per day on weekends and $48 during the week) but necessary.

Reviews.Title: “Working Vacations”
Reviews.Author: Techrunner
Reviews.Content: This was an exercise in opulence. The room was gorgeous. the facilities were top notch and the hotel itself is centrally located just a stones throw from the financial district, and a great steak house on California Street ( I think it is). I even found a street vender that sld black roses..But that's another story..

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely fabulous”
Reviews.Author: cmsand
Reviews.Content: We found an outstanding price at the Omni San Francisco for Labor Day weekend. It is very centrally located so that we could (and did!) walk almost everywhere. The entire hotel staff from the door men, concierge, front desk, and housekeeping were friendly, helpful, and seemed to really enjoy working there. Our room was clean, cozy, and had a luxurious decor. We were very happy with our experience at the Omni and will definitely be back! We'll probably look for an Omni in other cities we travel too as well.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel and staff! We would definitely stay here again!”
Reviews.Author: LBI0204
Reviews.Content: We stayed here over Labor Day Weekend and everything was fantastic! We called ahead to find out more about the BART system and the concierge, Tara was very helpful. Mass Transit is the way to go in San Fran! Of course you must take advantage of the infamous Trolley cars (NOTE: pick up the trolley in the morning one block down from the hotel. You can buy tickets on-board. Otherwise, you will wait nearly an hour to get on the trolley at Powell Street or at Ghiradelli Square. Don't forget the MUNI. It is great too!! We took the MUNI to Haight/Ashbury and walked to Golden Gate park. The BART is fantastic to go to and from the airport. It cost $16.20 round-trip from SFO to Montgomery Street. The hotel is 5 blocks from the BART station. Don't waste your money on a $50 cab fare one-way! Anyway, we were greeted by Justin who check us in. We did not have any issues with check-in as some other people had indicated in other reviews. Justin was very friendly and cordial. He recommended a restaurant close by (Tadich Grille) so we had a quick dinner. Justin called some tour companies for us as we wanted to see Alcatraz. NOTE: If you plan on seeing Alcatraz PLEASE book your tickets in advance. I had been to SF ten years ago and never had a problem getting tickets to Alcatraz. I was told SF is so popular now that Alcatraz is sometimes booked for 3 weeks! We ended up getting tickets but it was by pure luck!! If you want to book tickets in advance, the Alcatraz ticket agent told me to book on the official Alcatraz website NOT a broker. We saw people turned away because their tickets from a "broker" weren't valid. All of the staff were very friendly and knowledgable at the Omni. We booked a 21-day advance so we got the best rate. Albeit, the rooms were a little small but VERY nice. The bathrooms are very nice with granite countertops and VERY clean as well. The lobby was nice with complimentary coffee. The hotel is a short walk or trolley ride to Chinatown and North Beach (Little Italy). Please check out Calzones in North Beach. It's a great Italian restaurant. It sounds like a pizza place but it's not. They have great food! Albeit, I don't think you can go wrong at any of the Italian restaurants. They all have outdoor cafe style seating. The Omni is in the financial district so there isn't alot of nightlife (which we liked). It was very quiet at night. If you want a hotel closer to bars or entertainment you might want to find something closer to Union Square. Overall, we really enjoyed our stay at the Omni very much and would definitely stay here again!!

Reviews.Title: “Elegant hotel, with impeccable service.”
Reviews.Author: TravelGal3481
Reviews.Content: This hotel far surpassed my expectations for the price. Beautiful lobby and rooms. The staff were extremely friendly and accommodating.

Reviews.Title: “Good but nothing more than you'd expect at the price”
Reviews.Author: vedev
Reviews.Content: We traveled to San Francisco as part of a tour of the Western USA during the summer and stayed for three nights at the Omni. The location is excellent and the valet parking (at a cost) very useful in a city where parking is tough to find. Chinatown is a 5 minute walk and the trams up Nob Hill leave from basically outside the front door. The staff are friendly, courteous and very good at making you feel at home. Food at the in house restaurant is also good - I can highly recommend the breakfast! However, for the price you pay the rooms are small and nothing special (though bathrooms are good) and I just can't bring myself to give somewhere this expensive 5/5 as in reality it's not great value for money. A very pleasant stay nonetheless.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location and good service”
Reviews.Author: cdshoebe
Reviews.Content: We selected the Omni based on TripAdvisors reviews - thanks to all of you who take the time to post your experiences! We loved the location of the hotel which is walking distance to Union Square, the Embarcadero, China Town, etc. It is a business hotel though so don't look out your window and expect a great view of the city. We did have a few little glitches upon arrival, but Sarah, at the front desk, was very very helpful and more than corrected the situations. The staff's restaurant recommendations were very good. Our experience in the hotel's restaurant was not good - so I agree with a previous post that you should eat elsewhere. I have to give Sarah, and the room staff a big thanks. I had left some medication in the refrig and called to see if they had found it. They did and even though they didn't think they could get it out on that Friday, somehow they managed and it arrived at my home the next morning by 10 am. I was so impressed. We will stay at the Omni on our next visit.

Reviews.Title: “Old San Francisco Charmer”
Reviews.Author: Kickedback
Reviews.Content: If you enjoy "old school" service and city elegance, you will love the Omni San Francisco. The decor is elegant and the service friendly and impeccable. From the moment we arrived, everyone on staff bent over backwards to accommodate every request and everyone down to the maintance guy in the hall had a cheerful greeting for you. The concierge, Lex ,was incredibley helpful. The room was well-appointed and the bed with crisp sheets and duvet very comfortable. Sign up for Omni' frequent stay program and enjoy benefits on your first stay including complimentary beverage (you can choose both coffee and juice/bottled water per person) and choice of newspaper delivered each morning at the time you choose. Yes - the bar and restaurant are on the expensive to the OMG side - especially if you dive into the steak menu at dinner ($54 for a veal chop - wow!) but have to say I had a wonderful burger in the bar one night and did not begrudge the $19 price tag because it was so good. Breakfast was also pricey (and not as outstanding) but you can add pastries, fruit and even a breakfast sandwich on to your complimentary breakfast beverage order for not too big a hit so we went that route and enjoyed a more affordable breakfast in our room. As for location, you cannot beat this spot for convenience to the Ferry Building, Union Square, China Town and all other points. Buy a three-day pass ($18) from the front desk and you can ride the trolley (stops right in front of the hotel), the vintage buses and regular buses to your hearts content. Also, if you plan to go to the Tut exhibit, ask the concierge if they have any leftover VIP passes. They cost a few bucks more but you can go whenever you want and bypass the long line by using the VIP line once inside the museum - you just have to promise the concierge that you will be discreet and not a big blowhard about having a VIP pass.....

Reviews.Title: “A Class Act......”
Reviews.Author: Clubu
Reviews.Content: The staff at the Omni is an efficient, attentive, and welcoming group of individuals.
