The check-in took 2 minutes and the woman who checked us in paid attention to the simplest detail. She noticed my dress on a hanger and asked if we were there for a wedding. We casually explained that we were celebrating our wedding with our family on the West Coast. Upon entering our room after a quick jaunt shopping, we found champagne and chocolate covered strawberries with a card in our room. The next day when my husband realized at the last possible moment that he needed his shoes shined, they were shined and returned in ten minutes! Every time we walked in we were greeted with a "Hello" and a smile by at least 3 staff members. If you want to be treated well in San Francisco you will be very happy here. Also, it is located in a great area which is convenient to many attractions, shopping, and restaurants.

Reviews.Title: “an excellent option to visit san francisco”
Reviews.Author: krisBarcelona
Reviews.Content: We spent 3 nights in this hotel, we make a 14 days in advance reservation and we got quite a good price. The location is really good, quite, you can walk to Union Square, Columbus Street and the Italian quarter, etc. You get coffee for free until 11 am but THEY CHARGE QUITE A LOT FOR INTERNET! This is something they should change and at least offer some minutes of cortesy if you are a guest in the hotel... Our room was really nice, big and SUPER CLEAN! Perhaps it's true that at the beginning we perceived a funny smell but we opened the windows and it was over after some hours..... If we visit San Francisco again, this hotel will be one of our first options for sure...

Reviews.Title: “Excellent!”
Reviews.Author: MCOELHO
Reviews.Content: We were so pleased with our room and the staff were outstanding. Would come again. Very quiet and clean. Bed was so comfortable. They charge for internet.

Reviews.Title: “not impressed”
Reviews.Author: thg4
Reviews.Content: didn't like the hotel. lots of problems. room very small,carpets stained and worn out ,room service slow and forgetfull, noisy room, could hear everything from the next room. unfortunately I mean everything!!! Going back to the Le meridien

Reviews.Title: “All the positive reviews are right on. A great stay!”
Reviews.Author: barney50590
Reviews.Content: Booked the stay with my husband for one night to celebrate our anniversary - largely based on the great reviews I read here. I have to say - we agreed! Friendly and helpful staff. Clean and well-appointed rooms. Great location. Quiet. We had a wonderful visit and will definitely return.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location and Exceptional Service!”
Reviews.Author: FunTravel94303
Reviews.Content: Location - Perfect! Close to China Town, Fisherman's Wharf, Union Square, etc. Service - Exceptional! Entire staff was remarkable! Room - Very clean and comfortable!

Reviews.Title: “This was even better than i expected!!!!”
Reviews.Author: charibear09
Reviews.Content: My husband and i stayed here for our two year anniversary, i chose this hotel because of all the wonderful reviews on trip advisor. Let me tell you, we were not dissapointed!!! from the minute we stepped out of our taxi we had doormen opening the doors, helping us with our bags and greeting us so warmly! Thecheck-in process was so quick i could have blinked and missed it! there were fresh flowers all over the lobby and it was so beautiful with all the marble an the crystal chandeliers. As we made our way up to the 16th floor(i had called beforehand and requested a view, our room viewed part of the building next to us but also a good view of the bay, we could see Alcatraz island from our room!) i noticed that even the elvator was nice, and i dont like elevators! When we got to our room, i was very excited becuase after looking at the hotel photos online i had seen a room decor that i really liked better than the others,an we were in that exact room! White sheets and comforter with gold accents in the room, beautiful! there was a bottle of champagne and chocolate covered strawberries waiting for us, along witha card congradulating us on our anniversary. Even the beds exceeded my exepectations, i didnt think they would be so comfortable but i fell asleep so quickly and i didnt want to get up in the morning! we signed up for select guest, so we had coffee and tea delivered to our room each morning, and the coffee was really good! I would suggest getting breakfast at the little bagel shop right next door, they make really good breakfast sandwiches, but they were not open on sunday. We loved our stay here and we will definitely be back!!!

Reviews.Title: “Marvellous hotel in a marvellous location”
Reviews.Author: Alan1Esher_Surrey
Reviews.Content: Have just returned from the Omni San Francisco hotel, San Francisco. Selected it because of the previous excellent reviews on TripAdvisor, and this one will simply add to that list. This is a marvellous hotel in a marvellous location. Staff uniformly polite, helpful and knowledgeable (particularly the concierge staff). Rooms spacious, clean and very comfortable. Restaurants excellent, with plenty of outside alternatives nearby. Great location, with east access to cable cars, Fisherman's Wharf, China Town and North Beach (Little Italy). Only minor negative comment is the lack of a business centre (only a tiny room with 2 PCs that charge at $5 per 15 minutes) - but hardly a major issue. Highly recommended!

Reviews.Title: “Nice old style hotel near Chinatown”
Reviews.Author: Ligers
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel for 2 nights at the end of a week long California trip. The hotel was very nicely furnished - lots of tassles and oriental carpeting. The room was ok in size, but we did not have a great view (looked out onto an office building). I was glad that we were 2 blocks from Chinatown, but I didn't like the downtown office location (no one really walking around at night). It is right across from the Bank of America building where you can go up to the top floor for drinks and a nice view of the city on a clear night. We had room service, which the kids really enjoyed. Food arrived quickly and was still hot when it came. We were going to have breakfast in the hotel dining room, but the $25 charge for 2 eggs and bacon changed our mind. This is a nice hotel - accomodating to families. I'm sure there are better bargains out there. Valet parking was $48/day.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay!!!”
Reviews.Author: vigilanteviajero
Reviews.Content: Great hotel, wonderful staff, well located, great food, well maintained...what else can one ask for?!! 3 nights here and I had a wonderful time. Would come back here any time. I was pleasantly surprised with this hotel. Will certainly recommend it. You have to have a meal at their main restaurant. It was a great experience. I had dinner on my first night and the service, food, wine, ambiance.....great!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “a bit oppressive?”
Reviews.Author: LentonFamily
Reviews.Content: we stayed in the omni for just one night at the end of a long holiday , there's no denying the rooms were spotless, the hotel beautiful and the staff super attentive. For us however it was almost too attentive to be comfortable . Our double queen room was pretty small ( smaller than the room we'd had in the francis drake at the start of our holiday) and at the end of a long corridor through a closed door which my daughter found 'spooky , large dark heavy furniture and heavy drapes ( including around the bath) didn't help'. The location though close to chinatown is very quiet for walking from in the evening. I am sure it's a perfect hotel for many but as a family who like convenience as well as comfort it wasn't right for us. If you like to travel by taxi, want to be looked after and don't mind paying the very high prices for 'extras' it's a great deal .

Reviews.Title: “Watch your car.”
Reviews.Author: InedS
Reviews.Content: Because it was a last-minute trip, we booked with the Omni instead of our usual stop (The Ritz). Price was excellent compared to the Ritz and most of the employees were very friendly, especially the front desk and the doormen. But since this is a review to help us all travelers, here's our experience. When we first arrived there was no bellman or doorman. Only one valet person (we arrived at 6pm), who was "forced" to handle our bags. He didn't look too happy to have had to take care of our luggage when nobody answered his call (into his sleeve) for a bellman. We thought he could have at least hidden his displeasure of doing this. Location was right smack dab in the middle of downtown/financial district and they didn't have their own driveway. Since they are located in the corner, if there were a lot of cars in front of the hotel, you would be basically blocking traffic with your car. One last thing are the valet guys who would get our cars. Although there were great ones, there were also the occasional valet who would peel out of their garage (which was across the street) with our vehicle and make a very sharp and FAST u-turn with it in order to get to the front door of the hotel. Did not think that was professional and maybe management can have a reminder meeting with the valet about this. Mind you, we were right in front watching them drive our car recklessly.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel with superb staff and great location”
Reviews.Author: emmet1
Reviews.Content: We have just returned back from a trip to california for two and a half weeks.We chose the Omni SF for a three night stopover to savour the delights of San Francisco. Our choice of the Omni was based both on the wonderful experience we had last year in its sister the omni berkshire in new York and the excellent reviews kindly posted by other visitors to this hotel on trip advisor. And wow we were not dissapointed-from beginning to end the omni SF was excellent in every way . Astoundingly central location- walked everywhere ,to chinatown in five mins ,union square not much more,little italy in ten ,city lights book store and vesuvius bar in same.Brilliant and all safe to walk with no threat . The staff could only be described as superb and a credit to the Omni hotel .Welcoming ,accomodating ,helpful in every way and just generally cheerful and desiring to make our stay with them superb. From the concierge to the check in staff to the doormen and bell men they were outstanding. Our room was smart ,elegant and had everything we could ask for . Great downstairs bar too and lovely treats available for the kids to join us . It oozes class but not in an in your face way .Made our 19,17 and 13 year old kids feel comfortable without at all being ostentatious . This hotel has it in every way . Suffice to say two thinkgs. 1...I would not hesitate to come back to this hotel or recommend it to anyone. and 2...it was so good that we will not stay anywhere but an omni whenever we visit the states again . If anyone from the Omni SF is reading this -take a bow -you were brilliant and made our holiday and stay in sf supreme A thousand thanks from a happy irish family . well done

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service and personal attention”
Reviews.Author: TallTaste
Reviews.Content: We traveled there on the last week of July on our first trip to San Francisco and were extremely pleased. The hotel lacks some amenities; but they make up for it with outstanding service and location. Would definitely visit again.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed our Stay”
Reviews.Author: kayhawk
Reviews.Content: Our stay at the Omni SF was great, we enjoyed the hospitable service and the location. Having the Cable Car right outside the door is definitely convenient and the Concierge recommended getting the 3-day pass ($18) which allowed us to ride the cable car/street car/bus system anywhere in the city. Our room was a bit noisy with the elevator adjacent, but we became accustomed to the humming sound. The room was large with a king-sized bed and a sofa sleeper for our pre-teen. We found the turn-down service inconsistent and our son only received his "milk and cookies" one night of the 4 we stayed. Maybe you had to be in the room when the housekeeper came by? Room Service and housekeeping service were very prompt and courteous when called upon.

Reviews.Title: “lovely elegant hotel excellent service”
Reviews.Author: briendy2000
Reviews.Content: beautiful hotel very helpful staff clean room very elegant would definitely stay again

Reviews.Title: “Great city hotel”
Reviews.Author: DSB25
Reviews.Content: Courteous staff Elegant rooms and lobby Perfect housekeeping - the room was spotless (and I am very fussy!) Quiet and peaceful Good location near China Town and North Beach A faultless experience - the most professional, friendly staff we encountered on our trip to the USA

Reviews.Title: “Deserves its high ranking for SF!”
Reviews.Author: buttery
Reviews.Content: In spite of the fact that we were staying over a very busy weekend (the front-desk staff mentioned that the hotel was completely booked), everyone, from doormen to cleaning staff we happened to pass in the hall, was friendly, professional, and efficient. Our room met every expectation: it was exceptionally clean, spacious (for a hotel in the city), tastefully decorated, and had thoughtful little touches here and there â€“ like the glass jar in the bathroom with sealed packets of cotton swabs and cotton balls, in case youâ€™d forgotten to pack your own. And even though the hotel was full, the room was exactly of the kind Iâ€™d requested in my Select Guest profile. The room was also well soundproofed; once in a while weâ€™d hear a door opening or closing in the hallway, but mostly there was silence, broken only by the occasional, lovely sound of the cable car bell as it passed up California St. The hotel is near the Financial District, which means that the area is quieter at night and on weekends. So if youâ€™re looking for something at the center of the cityâ€™s action, then this is probably not for you. However, it was only a short distance away from the hubbub of the high-density tourist areas: about 10 minutes walking to Union Square & shopping, around 20-30 minutes to the SFMOMA and Asian Art Museums, and also has easy access to streetcars, buses, and the BART subway system. Hopefully theyâ€™ll equip all rooms with wifi at some point. For now, itâ€™s only available on a few floors (with higher-priced rooms), and upon arrival we had some inconvenient fumbling with cables and such before we got the internet running. But even with this little exception, Iâ€™d love to stay here on my next visit to San Francisco!

Reviews.Title: “Gorgeous, Great Location, Excellent Staff, Great Rate, but Expensive Extras”
Reviews.Author: CarpeDiem0626
Reviews.Content: I would recommend this hotel for overall quality, downtown location, excellent staff, and amazingly comfortable bed. But calculate your "extras" ahead of time. $48/night to park your car; $20 for two scoops of ice cream, $26pp for American breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: regggit
Reviews.Content: My husband and I spent 3 nights there. This hotel is in a great location. It was a two minute walk to Chinatown or North Beach. We found that the staff was extremely friendly and the conceirge was exxtremely knowledgable and offered up some great restuarants for dinner. I highly reccommend joining the perks program for free. You won't then be charged for the internet and will get complimentary juice and coffee brought to your room in the morning with the newspaper. At night, they bring you cookies and milk. The room itself was on the smaller side, but it was clean and comfortable. It was not noisy at all. This is a great hotel and we would definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!!”
Reviews.Author: lisaud
Reviews.Content: The service at all levels was superb and the room was comfortable and clean and rather elegant. We paid $207 per night (AAA rate) and it was well worth it. In fact, if it was a "view hotel" (it overlooks downtown), it would have undoubtedly been half again as much if not more. Nothing is perfect but given what we paid and the fact that its a four-star (not five) hotel, I really have no complaints whatsoever and would stay there again in a heart beat. Definitely sign up for the Select Guest Loyalty Program; you can get a number of complimentary items that would otherwise incur a charge and there's nothing to lose by doing it.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Stay”
Reviews.Author: Phantom8
Reviews.Content: My sisters and I spent three nights here.Â  I have to say that it is the first time that we've had a flawless trip.Â  The hotel, and all of the staff, were certainly well above what we expected.Â  From the moment we arrived, we felt like we were royalty.Â  The doormen, bell staff, front desk staff, and restaurant staff, were all very friendly and helpful.Â  The room was nice and clean.Â  The beds were very comfortable, and we hardly heard any noise.Â  Housekeeping was very attentive, and did a fantastic job. The hotel restaurant was very nice and the food great. The hotel is located in the Financial District, and very convenient to San Francisco attractions.Â  I highly recommend!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: citydetective
Reviews.Content: Stayed 5 nights in July at the Omni. Our room on the 17th floor was well appointed and very comfortable. Staff were extremely helpful, very knowledgable and nothing was too much effort for them. The hotel is ideally situated for exploring the city on foot or by bus. I am very fussy and could find no issue with this establishment. If booking a trip to Alcatraz Island do as we did and book well in advance from home to ensure you secure the dates you want.

Reviews.Title: “Elegant, Comfortable, Excellent Staff, Wonderful Stay”
Reviews.Author: travelinlady1660
Reviews.Content: It is always important to do research about a hotel before you stay there. We (my husband, daughter and I) just spent a week at the Omni San Francisco Hotel. Having never been to SF, I wanted to stay in a nice luxury hotel with knowledgeable staff and we were not disappointed. The Hotel is located in the Financial District a short distance from the more chaotic tourist areas but easily accessible to world class shopping, eating, Fishermans Wharf , Chinatown and other scenic areas by walking, cable car, taxi, bus or rail. From the doorman, check in staff, bellman, concierge, housekeeping and restaurant, everyone warmly greeted us upon coming and going and always thanked us for staying with them. They went out of their way to be helpful with really good attitudes. We joined the select guest program for free (on their website) and this entitled us to FREE In-Room Internet Service, coffee/beverages of choice every morning, with a choice of 1 of 4 newspapers along with delivery of ice and turn down service in the evening. Upon making the reservation I mentioned that we were celebrating a birthday and when we arrived in our room, there was a card, birthday desert and bottle of chilled champagne waiting. We were in a regular room but I did request the top floor away from the elevator and got exactly what I asked for. The room was very clean - something I'm very picky about, beds were extremely comfortable and housekeeping service replaced our towels and promptly cleaned our room and bathroom every day when we left to go sightseeing. A concierge was usually available to make dinner reservations or tour arrangements, transportation and help with directions, areas to avoid, etc. They were always busy but always polite and willing to help. We ordered room service one evening and also ate in the hotel lounge. Delicious food and again great service. Bob's Chophouse, the main restaurant in the Hotel was very pricey so we chose to eat at more moderately priced meals in the different city districts. OTHER: Be prepared to tip. No pool. Nice fitness room. Good conference hotel. Family friendly. Parking is $48 per night, but if you have to have a car, there are a few less expensive garages nearby to park. No gift shop in the hotel but there is a little store next door you can buy drinks or get a snack, batteries, etc. Many of the little coffee shops are closed on the weekend in the financial district.

Reviews.Title: “What a great stay - Fabulous service, lovely rooms, quiet”
Reviews.Author: Mijama38
Reviews.Content: I am delighted with our stay at the Omni Hotel. We felt looked after - like it was home. We had 4 nights there only 1 week ago. From the moment we pulled up and were greeted by Darrell the doorman, who was warm and humourous to my son, to the time we checked out, I give this hotel top marks. It was easily 4 star+. The service was excellent - the doormen, the front desk, the conceirges, the bellman. Nothing is too much trouble. There are complimentary drinks & fruit in the late afternoons in the front lobby which we had when we checked in. It was the most welcoming check-in I think I have ever had. My son got milk & cookies brought to our room as well. Our room was beautiful, with 2 queen beds and a marble bathroom. As we had one 11 year old child, it was big enough for the 3 of us, (we hadn't found that in some of our other accomodation whilst in the US.) It was quiet & had dark enough curtains so we slept really well. It had great beds & linen, free internet, complimentary tea and coffee and a mini bar. We got great advice when we asked for transport assistance or places to eat. The location of this hotel is great for catching cable cars & getting to Union Square. It is in the financial district but that is one of the reasons it is classy and quiet after hours. (As opposed to Fishermans Wharf which was insanely noisy.) Even when we checked out, I had to wait in the lobby for 2 hours due to delays with our car rental. My luggage was supervised, I was checked on, I got the use of the phone at the conceige desk & was even entertained. I wholeheartedly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Staff, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: panter
Reviews.Content: Like everyone else, we loved San Francisco and can't wait to go back. I can only echo the other raves about the Omni San Francisco. The rooms are lovely, the staff goes above and beyond to make your stay enjoyable, problem-free, and comfortable. The location is fantastic. We didn't have room service but did have a steak in the restaurant, which was quite good and equal to most NY steak houses (except Peter Lugers for you steak lovers out there).

Reviews.Title: “beautiful, relaxing, catering and great location”
Reviews.Author: Maryandfamily
Reviews.Content: My teenaged daughter and I stayed at the Omni for one evening before proceeding onto Palo Alto. This was our second stay at this Omni. From the moment you arrive, staff is outstanding and catering. They don't just talk service, they walk service! Fragrant flowers and a beautiful lobby greet guests. Our room was beautiful and quite clean. I would have given a five star (excellent) rating had it not been our room location, immediately off the elevators and on the Montgomery side. Guest noise from the elevators, a quite vocal and inebriated local shouting at the top of his lungs from midnight until 1am on the the Montgomery side and early morning (9am) vacuuming right outside our door (despite a privacy please sign), left us with a less than rest-filled evening. But, the location of this hotel (on the California trolley line), a short walk from the F line for quick access to the Wharf or, if you are inclined as were we, a longer scenic walk to the Wharf and onto Ghiradelli's, plus the hotel's catering staff and beautiful ambiance would lead me to it's doors yet again when I am in the San Francisco area. Also just a block away is a Walgreen's and, our favorite, Jamba Juice! A $50 per night parking fee (for your car) seems high but is likely the going rate.

Reviews.Title: “An excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: ElhamValleyMan
Reviews.Content: Along with many other reviewers we thoroughly enjoyed our 4 day stay at both this hotel and in SFO itself. The service was excellent and everyone was most attentive at all times. We just had standard rooms but that means they were by no means ordinary and well up to 4 or even 5 star standards. The concierge was most helpful and made several reservations for us. The hotel has an excellent steak restaurant by all accounts but we did not go there but if you do want a tip for a quite magnificent steak then go to The Harris Restaurant. It's a short taxi ride but well worth the trip and the food is quite magnificent. I can heartily recommend the 49 steak if you have a good appetite. I have no hesitation in recommending this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing stay and incredible service”
Reviews.Author: mandlinsocal
Reviews.Content: I agree with most of the previous reviews. We stayed 2 nights and did decide to go for the signature room which was beautiful. We were greeted at the curb upon arrival by friendly staff who we found helpful throughout the entire stay. They freely offered us suggestions, all of which we took. The guy who brought our bags up suggested a good breakfast place within walking distance and a place within easy walking distance where we could go for drinks at sunset before dinner that had a romantic panoramic view. The hotel is also right around the corner from Chinatown and the weather was nice so we were able to walk there and do some shopping. We had dinner (Filet and Sea Bass, both very good) at Bob's Steak & Chop House at the hotel which I recommend if you're not on a budget. Room service was also good. The only thing we didn't like about this hotel was the parking charge.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Experience at the Omni”
Reviews.Author: 123DFW
Reviews.Content: The Omni is an amazing hotel. While the hotel itself is very luxurious, the staff, especially Sarah at the front desk, really set the Omni apart. They are unfailingly polite, helpful, smiling and enthusiastic to serve. Do yourself a favor and stay here. Everything works and the staff are really intent on making your stay at the Omni and in San Francisco something you will always remember.

Reviews.Title: “Best Service in the City”
Reviews.Author: ServiceMinded
Reviews.Content: This is our second visit to the Omni - the first time we were singularly impressed but thought perhaps we just got lucky. On this second visit, it was confirmed this is one of the best hotels in the City! The staff is dedicated, well-trained, genuinely friendly and helpful. They seemed sincerely interested in attending to your every need. The rooms were sparkling clean and well-appointed. The service, however, is what sets the Omni head and shoulders apart from other San Francisco hotels - much better than we received at The Palace, for example. We only stayed one night this second time, but this will be our hotel of choice on our next visit, and we are also so pleased that we are hoping to hold our next corporate retreat at the Omni.

Reviews.Title: “If I Could Rate This Hotel More Than 5 Stars I Would!”
Reviews.Author: SantaCruzDani
Reviews.Content: I have been to San Francisco several times and have stayed in various hotels in the Union Square / Financial District area. We purchased this hotel through Priceline for the 3rd & 4th of July for $100.00 per night. We were upgraded to a top floor room with bay view at no extra cost. Unbelievable seeing as we had booked the room at such a discount. I signed up for the Omni Club prior to our arrival so we were able to get a pot of coffee and juice at no charge to our room each morning of our stay. Our room was huge with a comfortable king bed & 2 flat screen TV's. You can save approximately $20.00 per day by parking your car in the St. Mary's Square Parking Garage (about a 2 minute walk from the hotel) rather than using the valet parking. The location was perfect. 5 minutes to China Town, 10 to Union Square and 15 to the Ferry Building. I highly recommend this hotel!!!

Reviews.Title: “Nice "grown up" hotel...but great for kids too!”
Reviews.Author: Bruin97
Reviews.Content: I am often surprised by how the nicer hotels make children feel unwelcome. I know some kids are noisy and unruly, but for the most part well disciplined children shouldn't be made to feel like they don't belong. The Omni was the exact opposite. Upon our arrival, we were greeted at the door by a friendly lady who presented little goodie bags to my two boys. Nothing fancy, but one of the toys in there kept my 6 year old son busy for much of our trip. It was a very nice touch. Also the cookies and milk left in our room the first night was very sweet. The hotel is beautiful, nice clean rooms and has a great staff. I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Trust the Trip Advisor Rating--Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: Maria35
Reviews.Content: Half of the time I donâ€™t trust a ranking on Trip Advisor. Everyone has a different opinion on what is important: free breakfast, spa services, pool, and parking. But we got a good rate at this hotel for a long weekend and I must say it deserves itâ€™s high ranking. The rooms were very clean. The staff is excellent(I swear they were so polite and sorry when their cleaning carts were in the hall) front desk, bellmen, and front door people helping with the cars. The beds were comfortable, sheets and towels first rate. Big quiet room, except for the trolley car that runs outsideâ€”but once the noise was identified did not keep us awake. The other things that were high lights--- NO fluorescent bulbs, an actually 3-way regular light bulb so you could see to read. NO annoying cards asking you to save the planet and the hotel money by not washing your sheets and towels. A small spray starch bottle that came with a charge but it was appreciated. Not having to sign for coffee service. My husband is a member of the Omni club, and it is easy to join and you get some freebiesâ€”like newspapers and coffee. The only thing I can complain about is that the room didnâ€™t have wifiâ€”so only one laptop could be used with the modem in the desk.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful”
Reviews.Author: MaggieMaySc
Reviews.Content: Just want I expect from the Omni! Great service, super location, first class room. A real value for the price I paid.

Reviews.Title: “Great Experience”
Reviews.Author: ohkay-123
Reviews.Content: From the warm greeting when we walked in to the helpfulness of the staff when we left, I felt that this truly is a 4 star hotel. The location is in the business district, 4 blocks from the BART line which we took in from the airport. It is close to cable cars, street cars and buses. We were there to visit the art academy so it was very convenient for that and not far from the Ferry building, China town and some great restaurants. It is very quiet on weekends also, due to office buildings being closed and felt very safe. Our room was spacious, modern and clean, well appointed and nicely decorated. The room temp can be controlled with your own thermostat and the bathroom was modern and spacious. They offered free coffee and newspapers in the bar every morning and fresh fruit and fruit water every afternoon in the lobby. (Also free jelly candies next to the bar). We went to the bar to have drinks and left, thought the drinks were a little pricey ($15 martinis) and went up the street to the Vesuvio, next to the City Lights bookstore. We checked out at 10 and they offered to store our bags since our flight was later in the evening. I would definitely stay here again and would recommend it to my friends.

Reviews.Title: “The best place to stay in one of the best places to visit.”
Reviews.Author: GC_USA
Reviews.Content: A great hotel in a great location: itâ€™s only a five minute walk to Chinatown, a five minute walk to the shopping district and about 15 minutes to the ferry building (next to Pier 1). If youâ€™re going further afield there is a tram stop directly outside the hotel and the regular bus service stops can be found within a block. The lobby and reception area of the Omni were modern and tastefully appointed, a theme which was followed through to the bar and restaurant areas. The hotel room itself was spacious, clean and fairly well appointed with nice decor, a modern flat screen LCD TV and cordless phone. The only negative point was that the housekeeping service seemed a little off the pace with drinking glasses not being replaced with clean items and in-room tea & coffee making facilities that were never fully replenished - I lost count how many calls I made downstairs in order to resolve these little niggles. Apart from that, the service given by the rest of the Omniâ€™s staff was first class. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “The Omni has it all.”
Reviews.Author: HazelEyesFromTN
Reviews.Content: I recently got back from a trip through California with my mom. At the end of our trip we stayed 3 nights at the Omni. It was the BEST of all the hotels we stayed at and I feel I booked some nice hotels. There was always a doorman and Darryl is the best of ALL. They were polite and would say welcome back. Darryl would even ask how your outing was. The front desk always said hello to me and my mom as we descended the stairs in the lobby. The room was clean and comfortable. The bath was very nice indeed. The room service was excellent in taste and value. My mom liked the tea they used so much I had to go online to order some for her. I personally loved the blueberry muffins with honey. Some people might say $4 plus tax and gratuity is expensive but go try to buy one at another establishment. It would cost about the same and is not near the quality or quantity. I have traveled coast to coast about 45 times and abroad twice, some was business and some pleasure. Some of the hotel/motels cost $40 a night and some $500. In those stays I have NEVER encountered the service as I did at the Omni San Francisco. I even took mom inside 3 big name hotels at the Wharf to compare our value and we knew we had made the right decision immediately. None of the hotels had a doorman available, the concierge was either aloof or rude (and yes I asked for 'directions'), and no one said hello as we entered. Also, when we left, I noticed there was no one to call a cab. I will say that we got spoiled on a refrigerator to store goodies in along our trip - as the Omni has items stored in theirs to buy, but it is overall TRIVIAL and I can't see myself staying anywhere else the next time I visit San Francisco. Lastly, yYou must try Bob's Chop House in the hotel. My mom had the Halibut which she said was better than a leading restaurant we ate at the night before. I had the crab cakes. They were excellent and I must say that the scallop potatoes with onions and peppercorn gravy served with a huge glazed carrot was superb. Thanks for a wonderful stay. My mom said it was her highlight hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful, start to finish!”
Reviews.Author: MissyWAlbuquerque_NM
Reviews.Content: Check-in was quick and friendly. Great staff-doormen, front desk,housekeeping etc.The concierge went "above and beyond" to make arrangements for us to tour the city in a helicopter. The room (California Suite) #720 was great. Corner room with floor to ceiling windows. Bed and linens were way above average quality. Room safe simple to use. Most anything you might need was in the room.Robes,even an umbrella, but thankfully it did not rain. Did not eat here, so I can't comment on the food. Small business center available for printing boarding passes etc. Overall a top rate, first class hotel. Can't imagine ever staying anywhere else in San Francisco!

Reviews.Title: “fantastic”
Reviews.Author: lauriehart
Reviews.Content: got great Inet room rate. stay room 1525: great view. join select guest program: free delicious decaf coffee and papers. large room. larger bathroom. close to Chinatown and North Beach, 5 minute walk to Market St.or Ferry bldg. try Culinary Institute Fri night Buffet 6-8 pm or Yank Sing AM for very expensive delicious dim sum. J & C on Jackson between Kearney and Grant for much cheaper non-tourist experience dim sum. Noe Valley: eat at Savor, shop at the Chocolate shop next block. Buy 3 day Muni pass for $18, worth it. Great front desk help.

Reviews.Title: “One of the Best experiences ever.”
Reviews.Author: macdog67
Reviews.Content: Thanks so much to the entire team at the Omni. We celebrated our anniversary at this hotel and what an experience. The hotel was beautiful and the customer service was perfect. I would recommend to anyone traveling and wanting to be treated like family.. we have always stayed at the Hyatt or Marriott. We will be back.. Thanks again....

Reviews.Title: “Ideal location if you have young children”
Reviews.Author: michala
Reviews.Content: this hotel is comfortable, very clean, and well located in san francisco. We have three young children and our room had two double beds and a double sofa bed which meant we all slept comfortably with lots of room. We had two tvs/desk/safe/mini bar etc and an amazing bathroom with marble fittings. This hotel is quiet at night at the weekend and the financial area is clean and well maintained. Yet the cable car runs infront of the hotel/china town begins behind the hotel/union square is a 15min walk to the right and the ferry building/coit tower steps and the piers are roughly a 15min walk to the left. Seven minutes exactly straight on takes you to Market St and lots more Muni bus/Bart options. I have read on the forum that this location is not favourable but i totally disagree. Union Square was so noisy and with a tramp on almost every corner was not for young children. Fishermans Wharf was great if you like a Blackpool type area - we were glad we didnt stay there. If you like to be close but not too close to the main areas this is for you. Extra children's goodies included backpack with goodies in and first night cookies and milk. Tips negotiate a parking deal for around $30pn or park opposite sat/sun till 4am only for $7 per day. Join select guests to get free internet and coffee/juice in the morning. Could be improved by milk cookies every night for kids see their disappointed face when you get in on the second night and its not there - cruel. Cheaper parking automatically when you book why should you have to bargain for it!

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice, Clean and a Great Location”
Reviews.Author: lorilou88
Reviews.Content: We were in San Francisco May 21-26, 2009. The Omni Hotel, San Francisco was a great choice of hotel for us as this was our firt trip to San Francisco. We found it to be conveniently located, nicely decorated, polite and professional staff - and most import - clean, well maintained and really comfortable beds in the rooms! Staff was very helpful, and went out of their way to make sure that they were of assistance to us. You can walk to many of the city's attractions from this hotel (the hills are a killer!!) and the California Line trolley is right outside the door, walking distance to BART (which we took from the airport for $5.35 per person without any problem) and nearby to China Town and Union Square. One small drawback - the steakhouse- Bob's was very pricey and while we expected that to be the case, the food was really not quite up to the prices they charged. It was very good, the wait staff was wonderful. I would say the food, while the quality of it was above average, but certainly not outstanding and worth the price of the meal we had there. But, all in all, it was a very nice stay and I would most certainly stay at the Omni again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Potential, But Has Issues”
Reviews.Author: TravelerOne234
Reviews.Content: I have always liked this hotel, upscale atmosphere, great location, very good initial service, the door men are first class, and have stayed here previously, but during this visit things have gone tremendously DOWN HILL. First day, an interruptive knock on the door from a supervisory male housekeeping member to issue two packets of coffee to the room (oh please...obviously don't entrust the maids?) Should I now be concerned about theft of my own belongings? Second day, I return to the room to see ONLY a white sheet on my bed with the comforter on the floor and pillows and duvet stacked on my chair (thought the maids were not done yet). Not the appealing grand entrance you want to make in a four-star hotel room you expect to relax in...thought I was back at my college dorm. Complained to the desk, but find out this is the daily policy...and they falsely claimed it was the "turn down service" and I was the first of the day (at 3pm???)...caught them in a lie because the bed is never made up once you check in...their turn down service simply folds the corner of your sheet over....and no chocolate mints or anything typical of virtually every other hotel chain. The comforter stays on the floor during your entire visit. So, you will have to move all the pillows and duvet off the chair so you have a place to sit down (likely throwing them on the floor due to the small rooms. So, don't bring visitors to your room....is really a poor first impression. I also notice there are LOTS of long black hairs all over the bathroom (shower tub, walls, floor)...likely from the maids. Thought it was a fluke, but the trend continued throughout the stay. Next day, I notice that they are not replenishing my shampoo in the bathroom...an embarrassment for an upscale hotel and I feel like they are skimping on me to save money. I'm too embarrassed for them to make an issue of it and fortunately I had some stashed away deep in my travel bag. Now feeling that I am in a two or three star hotel. If you stay here, join the Select Guest club, as you'll receive complimentary internet service in your room and beverage room service every morning. Just an FYI...there are no exhaust fans in the bathrooms (probably due to the age of the building). I won't be returning, as there are better options for the money.

Reviews.Title: “Service”
Reviews.Author: Slobunny
Reviews.Content: The Omni staff is professional. They have courtesy down to a science. Our stay was too short. We have found our favorite hotel in San Francisco.

Reviews.Title: “Could Not Have Picked a Better Hotel”
Reviews.Author: NIBPIB
Reviews.Content: The hotel has the feel of a grand hotel. Its location is perfect. We got the kids suite after reading about it on this site. Its an adjoining suite with bunk beds and a puppet theater and kids sized robes and bathroom. MY KIDS LOVED IT and so did we. The charge for parking is ridiculous- but if you park across the street at St. Mary's it was only $7.00. Everyone in the hotel is super friendly and really professional.

Reviews.Title: “One of the Better Hotels in SF”
Reviews.Author: kwongsangwho
Reviews.Content: I love this hotel. I come to San Francisco several times a year for work. I either stay at the Hilton, Financial District or Omni. My preference is the Omni. The view at the Hilton is better, but the Omni is more QUIET, clean and friendly. The service is far better than the Hilton. The rooms at the Omni do not have a modern feel, but the beds are extremely comfortable, and the bathrooms are extremely clean. The lobby is very impressive. However, I do have two complaints. The parking at the hotel is $50. If you do not need a car, do not drive to this hotel. Besides, the cable cars are right outside the hotel, or you can walk to many sights. The other complaint is that there is no shopping around the hotel. Everytime I come to San Francisco, I have a long shopping list from friends and family. After working all day, I don't want to travel too far to buy gifts. My wife is a chocolate and wine freak, and I have to walk over to Kearny and Jackson Street to buy Napa wines from this California shop.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful old hotel in the financial district”
Reviews.Author: NYC304
Reviews.Content: The Omni is an 'old world' style hotel in the heart of the financial district. The building is lovely and the staff is absolutely fantastic. I found my room to be fairly large and the bathroom was hugh. All of it was well-appointed though the decor could use a bit of an update as it looks a little old or stale. Overall, I would definitely stay here again though perhaps not on a weekend as the area is pretty quiet outside of business hours.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!”
Reviews.Author: dvg_loves_cali
Reviews.Content: I spent a week at the Omni in SF and loved every minute of it. Worst part was the wedding party that got a little rowdy in the elevators, but my room was peaceful the entire time. Location was convenient to the Financial District. Breakfast was placed in front of my door every morning so that I could eat it when I wished but was not woken up by room service if I needed more sleep. Fitness center was all mine every day. Parking was a problem as there is none. I had to use a public lot. Room was smallish but elegant. I understand this hotel charges a lot more $$$ than it used to. For under $250/night it is a steal. Over that, I might consider somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service”
Reviews.Author: Familytripper32
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 4 nights in April and had a fantasttic time. The front desk staff were very friendly and helpful. The doormen (particularly Barney) were very helpful - more like a concierge service. Bar and restaurant were a bit pricey but the food was very good and we really did not get the carrot thing! If we ever visit SF again we will be back.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel and location”
Reviews.Author: carabrooklyn
Reviews.Content: Just got back from San Fran. with husband and two children. Omni staff was helpful and very nice. Our room although on the small size (but expected that w/ a hotel) was very clean and the bathroom was spotless and large enough for our family. The location suited us just fine..no big hills to deal with when grabbing a quick bite for breakfast and easy enough with the baby in stroller. The complimentary starbucks coffee in the morning was a plus. We were close to everything and it was easy to get everywhere..we toured the whole city (mostly by foot..we live in NYC so are used to walking!) Again, the staff was extremely helpful especially when we rented a car and they helped us lug our car seat and stroller to the car. We were very very happy with our stay at the Omni!

Reviews.Title: “Best Hotel experience in years!”
Reviews.Author: KeithTorontoOntario
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel beased on Trip Advisor rating and joined OMNI Express on advance of you stay-concierge John was fantastic; room was impeccable, comfortable and quiet; every one at the hotel is friendly- Daryl the bell captain also very helpful. Every recommendation a winner! We recommend joining Omni Express for the amazing amenities including morning cofee and orange juice as well as paper delivered to your room. San Francisco is a great tourist destination-Omni is in the heart of everything important and it 's hospitality makes San Francisco even better!

Reviews.Title: “Home Away From Home (or better)”
Reviews.Author: rhonda409
Reviews.Content: Everything about the Omni is elegant. The lobby, the elevators, the hallways are, to me, much like coming home to an elegant townhouse. The staff is excellent, the rooms are heaven. I don't often write reviews, but as I sit here in my room I just felt compelled to do so.

Reviews.Title: “Nice, nice, nice”
Reviews.Author: rrruby
Reviews.Content: I got in very, very, late due to a late flight. Even though it was late, staff was there to help me with my suitcase and with the door. Very, very good staff, and staff involved in the event were top shelf. Event catering was great, and the food was good! Great room with a great bed. Turndown service is standard, and staff leaves little notes on the stationary (using my name) wishing me a good day. In-room internet is free if you sign up for the loyalty program. If you're going to stay in San Francisco, stay here!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, service and room in San Francisco”
Reviews.Author: gwizz
Reviews.Content: We stayed at htis hotel for the 2nd time and it was as outstanding as our first visit. The location is great, within walking distance of everything and right on the cable car line. We booked a king room adjoining a kids fantasy suite. The kids room was outfitted by Pottery Barn. It had a set of twin bunk beds with kids bedding, blankets, quilts, etc. Bean bags, a comfy chair, a small couch, books, stuffed animals, small table and chairs, mini fridge with kid amenities all reasonably priced, stools for bathroom counters and mini robes. The doormen, Barney & Hugo, are very kind and helpful. The service at this hotel is very attentive. Rooms is sapcious and clean. If you stay in a room that does not face California street it is really quiet. Omni select member program provides dailey beverage and paper each morning, They also have a small breakfast selection that can be delivered with your beverage and it is less money and good quality for room service. Upon check in kids can receive fun bags. This is mostly a business hotel but has some amenities for families and is accomodating yet not over run with kids everywhere. You can walk three blocks to Chinatown, we walked all the way up and down Columbus to the Pier and visited parks along the way. Union square is about a seven block walk. I would recommend the California Academy of Sciences as a 1/2 day event. It is the new aquarium, rainforest, museum, planetarium and living rooftop exhibit. Great restaurants in the area: Hang An for chinese food on Clay, NorthBeach pizza delivers to the hotel, there is now a Cheesecake Factory in Union square, and many great Italian Places in North Beach to eat. Tried Tadich Grill, recommended as local spot near hotel....server was snooty, food was just average, prices very high. The steak was good but not worth the price.

Reviews.Title: “Perfection!”
Reviews.Author: moobaby214
Reviews.Content: I just completed a 3 night stay at the Omni hotel for a business conference. I have to say with being on the road some 150+ nights a year, I was very impressed with this hotel. Check inn was very fast and friendly. The room was spotless with arguably one of the most comfortable beds I have ever slept in. The bathroom was nice with a tall shower, good water pressure and just hot enough. The internet for now is a LAN cable however they are upgrading to wireless and should be done soon. Our conference was on the 3rd floor and the staff were great. In fact every employee I ran into said something to me Hi, Good morning, Good afternoon while using my last name. The bellman out front were always opening the door for you and helpful for any information you may need. I would like to point out that parking valet is expensive at $50.00 per day. You really do not need a car with this hotel's location. China town is steps away or if you prefer other places to eat several are around the hotel and very good. Checkout was smooth at 615AM with the bellman very friendly. Hot coffee was being served in the lobby. Overall I highly suggest this hotel. As I stated above, I am a road warrior and was very happy with my stay at the Omni San Francisco!

Reviews.Title: “Valentine's Day San Francisco Treat”
Reviews.Author: realeyes
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I had a wonderful Valentine's Day at the Omni San Francisco! We stayed in a gorgeous and spacious deluxe King room with City views. The room was beautifully appointed, and the bed was plush and comfortable! I loved the personalized welcome note from Marina the housekeeper. The door and bell staff, especially Sam, were all attentive and helpful. Taufique and Justin at the front desk were funny, friendly, and professional. They both made sure that a special request I had made to surprise my boyfriend was handled perfectly! The location of the hotel is perfect, walking distance to North Beach and Chinatown. And the recommendation for brunch at Cafe de La Presse was wonderful! Thank you for a memorable Valentine's Day weekend!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel!!”
Reviews.Author: StuMcBill
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Omni San Francisco in July / August 2008 after being in Berkeley for a few days. Since my girlfriend was on a conference in Berkeley, I travelled into San Francisco on BART one day and found my bearings and the Omni. We were planning on arriving before the advertised check-in time, so I thought I would inform the hotel and see if there was anything they could do for us? I was promptly informed that it would not be a problem and a note would be put on our booking giving us priority. When we actually made it to San Francisco we were greeted by a very friendly and courteous porter who took our bags and directed us to the check in desk. Check in was swift and as requested, our room was ready early. As the porter took us up in the lift he gave us some local information, this was much appreciated. Upon showing us the room, we were very impressed by the size and comfort. The room (standard) was quiet, serviced regularly (with evening turn-down) and very comfortable. Hotel staff were very friendly and helpful with everything from local information to cinema listings and restaurant reservations (The Cheesecake Factory). Never ate breakfast or any meals at the hotel restaurant as we wanted to explore and try local cafes and restaurants. Location was not a problem (in the financial district - a bit away from main shopping area), as we quite enjoyed navigating the hills / tram cars / grid system and exploring the city as we went! Would definitely recommend as a top hotel in San Francisco - can't wait for next time!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent as Usual”
Reviews.Author: samsara3
Reviews.Content: This was the 3rd time we have stayed att his hotel and the service has been superb each time. My daughter, who is 8, loved the kid friendly attitude of the staff. The location cannot be beat because it is close enough to Union Square, Chinatown, and North Beach without being too far from Ferry Building and Market Street Malls. Also, it is very reasonably priced if you compare to other similar properties.

Reviews.Title: “A very welcoming place”
Reviews.Author: bcbuddy
Reviews.Content: We had a wonderful 3 nights at the Omni. Perhaps what stands out most is the fact that the staff were always friendly and very professional. Kids are well looked after at this hotel - ours received Omni backpacks on arrival. They loved, among other things in the pack, the tweezers which make jelly beans glow. There is a kids menu available to order from on room service. A note about the french fries for kids: ask for un-seasoned fries if your kids don't like them flavoured with herbs. But the hotel itself was just right in every way - understatedly elegant, with clean, comfortable, spacious rooms and bathrooms. Street noise was not much of a problem, though police car sirens kept me awake one night. The Omni is in the financial district and there is not much buzz around the hotel. However, it is not a long walk to either the Union Square or Chinatown/North Beach areas. As to be expected in San Francisco, it is an uphill walk from Union Square to the Omni and an even steeper climb from the Omni to Chinatown. Trams stop just outside the hotel - these trams are good for those with a day pass (or longer), but individual trips can be expensive at about $5 per person per trip. Cabs are definitely the quickest and possibly cheapest way of getting around.

Reviews.Title: “Best New Year Getaway!!”
Reviews.Author: michelle0110
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the California Suite New Year's Eve and it was WonderFUL!! They were very kind and courteous. The staff was very attentive and helped made suggestions for dinner. Overall, it was the best new year ever!!! Thank you

Reviews.Title: “Typical Four-Star Hotel!!”
Reviews.Author: michbren
Reviews.Content: My husband and I frequently travel to San Francisco and usually stay in different hotels of the same chain but in different parts of the city. This time we wanted to try another chain and based on so many rave reviews the Omni received booked there. Usually I agree with Trip Advisor's contributors for the most part but not this time. This is what you should expect and what you pay for in a four-star hotel. If you like "old elegance" this is the place for you. The location is great and the area around the hotel is very clean. We booked a sigature room based on the reservations agent description of it. It was not worth the extra money. It was on the sixteenth floor and overlooked Montgomery St but was so high you couldn't see the street, just old rooftops. There was no advantage in being so high up but the major disadvantage was the long waits for elevators. We found the staff to be very nice. Housekeeping was OK- skipped our room once so we didn't have our room done until after we left for the evening. Some days we recceived the number of towels we should have and other days we didn't. We received the fresh fruit and bottled water two of the four days. There were not many hotel guests while we were there. When I booked our room I inquired about the "in-room" safe size and was told my 15.4" laptop would fit in it. This was not the case and everytime we went out we had to take it to the front desk to be locked in security and then wait again to retrieve it upon return - a major inconvenience. When we first discovered this upon checking in we spoke to the on-duty manager who said they were in the process of renovating the rooms and the renovated rooms will receive larger safes. He did not offer to move us to a renovated room nor compensate us with a complementary breakfast or the like for our inconvenience. The on-site restaurant is so over-priced it is comical. We had breakfast there twice and each time there was a major problem. We finally switched to room service - something we never do. . After we got home I checked our credit card bill and found some odd charge. I called the hotel and it was a mini bar charge, which we didn't use. Although it was immediately removed it was it was just another hassle. All in all we had a great trip but the hotel was a disappointment.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to Stay in Heart of San Francisco”
Reviews.Author: ksgirl8
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a weekend in San Francisco. When we were there (fall 2008), quite a bit of rennovation was still going on in the lobby area so things like the restaurant and lounge were not totally available. However, despite that we really enjoyed our stay here. It seemed to be more of a place for business people. During the weekend we barely saw another person, but once Sunday night rolled around, it was crowded. We had a renovated room, which was stylish and comfortable. We had no complaints at all. Our view from the window was not good, but this didn't bother us. We were there during an unusually warm time and I felt the air conditioner could have worked better. It wasn't bad or unacceptable, but it was really the only non-stellar part of the stay. Since it was in the upper 80s, I doubt this would very often be any kind of issue. One great thing about the room besides the typical hotel amenities was that it had plenty of outlets so we could easily charge all our various electronics. The best thing about this hotel is the location. It is totally convenient to the trolley cars and also some bus lines. We didn't have a car at all except our last day and had no issues getting around. This hotel does have somewhat high fees. The wifi was somewhat expensive (maybe $12) and the parking was very expensive ($20+ a day) so I would keep that in mind, but we would definitely recommend this hotel to anyone desiring a comfortable and stylish base for their San Francisco trip.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing kid friendly hotel in SFO”
Reviews.Author: gizmoguru
Reviews.Content: I wanted to share our amazing experience of staying for 4 nights at the Omni in downtown SFO. We stayed at the Pottery Barn Suite and the kids absolutely loved it. A big King suite for the adults and a connecting kids suite all with bunk beds, plush toys, duckies in the bathroom, kids furniture, cookies, milk, cereal.... I can go on and on. Amazing service from the staff with great attention to detail - this was easily the best hotel we have stayed at in the USA. Truly a home away from home :-).

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Omni...well it was pretty good anyway”
Reviews.Author: Ricardodesantaalbana
Reviews.Content: I booked through a conference website for $160/night including tax. The location is good, near to Union Square, China Town and the Coit Tower and on a tram line. I was initially not impressed since everything seemed expensive (e.g. $6 bottle of water in the room - I used the tap). Also I didn't bother with breakfast at $20 for continental and $26 for cooked (perfectly good Chinese deli next door). You just need to join "Select Guests" and not only do you get free internet access (not Wi-fi yet though) but you are also treated to a free 2 morning drinks (e.g. posh tea and grapefruit juice) and a "turndown" service (which I'd never heard of): you come home to find relaxing music on and ice in the wine cooler and a chocolate mint! Any problems I had were dealt with well (free internet help line) and overall a positive experience. I don't usually like these rather souless posh city hotels, but this was pretty good after early reservations.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel in a good location!”
Reviews.Author: arisis212
Reviews.Content: This is nice hotel in a good location. Reasonably priced within financial district and short walk to Chinatown. Short distance to public transportation and cab rides are a short distance to tourist attraction. Rooms are clean and staff is friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely staff”
Reviews.Author: KingJohnUk
Reviews.Content: We are a little late with this review, we stayed during September 2008 We travel quite a lot for leisure and always try to find good value, we donâ€™t expect quality to be compromised by the price, and this hotel did not fail in any way. We would have no hesitation is returning to this hotel and would recommend it to anyone. We felt this hotel was quite special; we booked directly with the hotel and got a special rate. The hotel in a good location in the financial area, the cable cars pass the front door but it is only a short walk to most things. From the moment we pulled up at the front door we were made to feel welcome. The person on the door was friendly and helpful, looked after our luggage and introduced us to reception staff. In general we found all the door staff to be really nice. (Every time we entered or left the hotel there was a warm welcome,) Some hotels can be impersonal and cold, the Omni, however, was friendly and welcoming and although this was a reasonably large hotel we almost made to feel part of the family. Reception staff were lovely, as were all the staff throughout the hotel. The lady that serviced our room was cheerful, friendly, and professional in every way, The rooms were of a good size and were clean and tidy and well maintained, the bed was very comfortable, we had fantastic nights sleep, the rooms air conditioning was good and there were plenty of fluffy towels. The water in the bathroom was piping hot and the shower had plenty of pressure. All in all there are no complaints about this hotel but for us the staff made it an extra special place. We really want to thank for staff for their great work that made us feel so at home.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel in SF”
Reviews.Author: lennybendo
Reviews.Content: Very friendly and knowledgeable staff (from the operator for directions to the bell staff for restaurant recommendations). Room was spacious and beds were incredibly comfortable. Flat screen TVs were a nice luxury. Valet parking was incredibly quick. Lobby entrance was filled with dramatic Christmas decorations by the end of our stay. Will definitely be back.

Reviews.Title: “The Omni is beautiful with great accomidations.”
Reviews.Author: ChadB70
Reviews.Content: I would say the front desk staff was very helpful getting us there over the phone. Check-in and check-out was very smooth. Overall they were very helpful and accomidating. Valet was great and they were very prompt both taking and bringing our car. We stayed in a really nicely furnished Suite. The internet was fast and had no problems the entire stay. Two flat screen tvs and a very nice compact stereo. The Room was spotless and the house keeping staff did a great job keeping the room up and helping us with special requests. I will definitly stay at this property again. My compliments to the Management and staff.

Reviews.Title: “Above & Beyond All Expectations”
Reviews.Author: ckdjr60301
Reviews.Content: My partner and I stayed at the Omni San Francisco for 8 nights. I knew about this hotel from when I lived in San Francisco and worked in the Financial District. We booked an entire vacation on Hotwire and paid a little more to stay at the Omni only because I'd always wanted to stay there. Little did I know what an experience we were in for. We checked in on Saturday night. Crystal at the front desk immediately upgraded us to a concierge floor room. She was genuinely friendly, professional and outgoing. Check-in was quick and easy. The room was elegantly furnished. The only drawback was that it seemed small. We were there for eight nights and we found that it lacked storage for all of our clothes. I think for a shorter stay, the room would've been absolutely perfect. From the bellman to the front desk attendants to the valets to the doormen to the room service people, the service was nothing less than spectacular. Everyone remembered our names, what room we were in, had our car waiting for us in a timely manner. We had breakfast at Bob's Steak House one morning. The french toast is to die for and the portions are big. Though the food seemed expensive, the portion size made up for the price. The room was appointed with a plasma TV, king size bed with down comforter. We had turn down service nightly with water and fresh fruit waiting for us when we returned from the day out. We had drinks of our choice and newpapers waiting at our door every morning. The hotel was originally a bank that was gutted and rebuilt in early 2000's. It was beautiful on the inside and out. It didn't seem overcrowded at all. As a matter of fact, it seemed nearly empty most of the time we were there. It is located on California Street @ Montgomery, on the California Street Cable Car Line and in the heart of the Financial District. I liked this location because it was out of the way of all of the tourist traps and it was nice to come home at night to a quiet, much more relaxed environment. Though we are planning to move back to San Francisco in the coming year, I do believe that I will stay at the Omni again before we move and I will definitely, definitely suggest it to anyone coming for a visit.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: marbellany
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Omni for 4 days and we had an excellent experience. Room was fantastic as well as service. Great location, I would definetely recommend it!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: bax52
Reviews.Content: After a very poor experience at another SanFran Hotel it was a pleasure to check into the Omni. Great hotel and great staff. Service was impeccable throughout and that is the hotels strength. Genuinely warm and helpful staff make a big difference. It could do with decorating I think as its a bit dated now. Its not worn or anything, just could do with bringing up to date. Excellent location, excellent rooms. Bobs Chop House downstairs is great and Town car to airport a blessing.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Omni - so friendly!”
Reviews.Author: LondonHolidayQueen
Reviews.Content: Had a great stay at the Omni. Everyone was so friendly and remembered our names:o) Check in was a breeze. Lovely, spotless hotel room. 2 nice beds and nice size bathroom. Greeted with a bottle of champagne and strawberries dipped in chocolate as it was a birthday celebration - great touch! Housekeeping were never seen but left the room clean and tidy every day and left chocolates by the bed in the evening with the TV on a chill channel. Lex and the staff were always on hand for information, directions / hints and tips. Debora was also a star performer. Darryl the doorman was great - always took an interest in what we were doing and where we had been. Made suggestions of places to go to and places to avoid. Always very friendly and made us feel special. It made the hotel a welcome sight after being out all day. The hotel was in a great location - close to everything, walk to Union Square, Ferry Building, we walked to Pier 39 and Ghiradelli Square, cable cars run past the front door etc. I wasn't too keen on the Pier 39 location - good to visit and see the sealions and found there were a lot of homeless people around Union Square area so this suited us just fine. Can't comment on the food in the hotel as we never ate there. Noah's do a great bagel in the morning - just along from the cable car turnaround. If I return to San Francisco - I'd stay here again like a flash!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: kk_2008
Reviews.Content: Stayed 3 nights on last leg of our honeymoon from Hawaii. Hotel was clean, comforatable, central location & 24 hr room service. All staff are very friendly...from the front desk to housekeeping leaving personal thank you notes from the tip we left in the room for her. Lex, the concierge is very knowledgable and helpful. They even gave us a late check out to 5pm no charge because we had a late flight. Its not a huge hotel with all the ammenities such as pool/spa, but its everything we needed. Bob's steak house which is attached to the hotel was very good...expensive, but good. We dined at both the restaurant as well as the bar. I signed up on Omni's website to be a member...well worth it...we received free coffee, juice, and newspaper every morning. Cable car is out front of the hotel and easy to get anywhere from this location. We would definetly stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Omni, Great Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: CynthiaBG
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Omni from October 24th to October 29th. We arrived very late on the 24th and were thrilled at the quick and easy way the whole check-in process was handled. Everyone we came in contact with were very happy and willing to help you in any way they could. Need to make a reservation for dinner, day trip, tour? All you had to do was ask the people at the front desk and they were very happy to provide all the information you might want and and make the arrangements for you. Had a partial bay view room, very nice size, perfect size bathroom didn't have any complaints about that at all. The hotel is in walking distance to the ferries that will take you over to Sausalito. Union Square, and Chinatown are within walking distance too. If you needed to catch a cab all you had to do was ask one of the doormen and you had one in a flash. There are always town cars out front too if you prefer a little more plush ride somewhere, not much more expensive than a cab and a lot nicer. I have to say I don't know what anyone would have to complain about when staying at this hotel. Would certainly stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect”
Reviews.Author: contesia
Reviews.Content: Very nice hotel with all the amenities. Staff is excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Love this place!”
Reviews.Author: JMdigital
Reviews.Content: This place has quickly become my hotel of choice in San Francisco. It's a wonderful location, and the staff is exceptional, top to bottom. From the start of your stay and your dealings with the front desk, through check-out and having the door man hail a cab, all in all you're treated with great care and attention to detail. Highly recommended!

Reviews.Title: “A touch of class in everything”
Reviews.Author: Roccox
Reviews.Content: Top class hotel with excellent location. Elegance and personal touch make this hotel the best choice in San Francisco

Reviews.Title: “OMG!!!! It was just perfect”
Reviews.Author: MissyLZIllinois
Reviews.Content: Service, service, service!!! It was phenomenal. Everyone was so friendly and helpful. It was so very nice to be treated to such wonderful service. Another wonderful recommendation from previous Trip Advisor guests and one that I will highly recommend to others. We were celebrating our 20th wedding anniversary and when we got to the hotel, our room had been upgraded and I was handed a long stem red rose. Later on that night we received complimentary champagne and chocolate covered strawberries that were left in our room. The concierge new perfect spots for us to try in our afternoon travel on foot. We were close enough to walk down to the warf and enjoy the open air market Tons to see and do we enjoyed every minute!

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant Stay”
Reviews.Author: MooeyWirral
Reviews.Content: The Omni was where we stayed for the first few nights of our honeymoon and it was lovely- but it wasn't take your breath away stuff. The lobby is beautiful, with free starbucks coffee in the morning and the concierge is very helpful. The rooms- i think we had a deluxe- are nice but a bit dated in style and small. The bathrobes they give you are amazing however. They gave us chocolate dipped strawberries and champagne to greet us which was nice. The location is good aswell, particularly if you like chinese food and want to be near china town. I couldn't really fault the Omni- but as you can probably tell from the tone of my review- i'm not overly excited about it either!

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Fine - but not didn't set the world on fire”
Reviews.Author: quirky76
Reviews.Content: Lovely hotel that is period USA - well situated in downtown San Fran, all staff without exception were excellent and very helpful. Gym facilities good and clean. The hotel has 1 bar which is more like a small TV longe and a steak resturant that is like a traditional old style steak house. Meat was of an excellent quality and cut but the Chef did a weird thing with a 8 inch whole carrot that was stuck in the middle of the plate........???? Really not sure what was going on there ! This place is absolutely fine and ideal for down town shopping location, im quite suprised it makes the top 6 in the trailfinders list but hey ho !

Reviews.Title: “More like Oh my”
Reviews.Author: SSpade
Reviews.Content: Booked Omni on Trip Advisor recommendation during busy/expensive period in San Fran. Yes, clean, quiet,comfortable,convenient for Union Square. But bland. Creepy handwritten messages from Faye in housekeeping everyday, assumed angling for tip but maybe management think this is being welcoming? Concierge helpful but a bit like a robot on speed (no doubt having to say the same things day in and out) Strange check in lady did not listen that we wanted to split the bill ; intolerable male check out desk guy lectured us when we complained that Omni had deducted whole amount from my card BEFORE we had checked out. Told us that in 30yrs of the hospitality industry he had never heard of guests paying when checking out. Funny that, the 4 Seasons in Vegas we stayed at afterwards, had no problem! (nor the many hotels we stay in internationally) We stayed in the Orchard a few days later; definitely prefer for service.

Reviews.Title: “Omni is very nice....”
Reviews.Author: Frankie-and-Emma
Reviews.Content: We spent 10 nights at the Omni in September and had a fantastic time. The hotel is convenietly located in the Financial district within walking distance of Union Square, Fishermans Warf etc. Our room on the 5th floor did not have a great view but was very quiet and well worth sacrificing the view for. The rooms are in excellent condition, and the maid service is first class. The staff are very helpul and courteous at all times, ensuring our stay went without a hitch. The only small complaint we have is that the one and only bar in the hotel (Bobs bar) is very small and gets very crowded from approx 5pm onwards, and getting a seat was almost impossible around those times. However it is no reason not to stay here. When we first arrived after our lengthy journey from Scotland, we were informed that our room (booked and paid for 8 months previousley) had been cancelled by Octopus travel who we had booked the room through. The hotel staff could not have been more helpful in rectifying the situation. San Francisco is well worth a visit and has plenty to offer for all. We would recommend visiting Alcatraz and taking the coach tour of the city, however book your Alcatraz tickets online as far in advance as possible to ensure you get the dates you require. We also hired bikes from Blazing Saddles and rode over the Golden Gate bridge to Tiburon via Sausilto. This is a fantastic way to see the bridge and surrounding area (weather allowing). Sausilto is a must see when you are there and can be accessed by Ferry if you prefer not to bike it, dining is recommeded at Angelino's while you are there. We also took a wine tour to Napa valley etc and would recommend this trip, with plenty of samples included in the day ensuring the hoilday spirit was flowing. Union square is packed with all the usual big name shops, but visit the hippy district at upper Haight street for some of the funkiest shops available. We visited the zoo but found it to be dated and shabby with many of the animals not available to view. Of course you must take a ride on a tram while you are there, we would advise getting a day pass for 11 bucks, which allows you to hop on and off all day at your leisure. Finally Lombard St aka the most crookidest street in the world is worth a look with camera in hand. We had 2 days of cloud followed by 8 days of glorious sunshine while we we there. Book it up, you will enjoy!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Omni Very Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: miabailey
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Omni for 3 nights at the end of our Alaskan cruise. First impressions were great door men and bell boys and reception very helpful check in was quick and easy, and although we arrived early our room was ready. The lobby is very grand with a classy feel, we ate in the restaurant once for breakfast which was nicely presented although where service is concerned they seemed to focus more time on the business people than the people on vacation we didn't get as much attention as the business people. Our room was nice although we had a few problems phone would not stop beeping and was very loud and annoying,safe was broken and so was the plug in the sink. We reported these faults to the front desk straight away and these faults were dealt with immediatey. When I expressed my disspointment with the faults in our room Richard on the front desk was very apologetic but was unable to move us as the hotel was full due to the Oracle convention being in town but that he would report our concerns to his manager. That evening when we got back to our room there was a letter of apology and a free breakfast voucher which was a nice touch. Our room was spacious with a large flat screen t.v and large comfortable bed the bathroom was again very spacious and very clean. Its the small touches in this hotel that make your stay memorable the turn down service is exellent along with the usual chocolates ou also get a small card informing you what the weather will be like the following day.
