A first-class hotel would never have suggested downgrading a paying customer, regardless of how or how much they paid. But then, Omni isnâ€™t a first-class hotel. Once I had checked into my Signature accommodations, everything was fine except for one minor detail. On Monday morning, September 3, while entering the bathroom in my suite, I stepped on a carpet nail that was protruding upward out of the carpet in front of the bathroom door. I didnâ€™t think I needed to be concerned about walking barefoot in my own room, not in a first-class hotel. I wasnâ€™t as angry about being injured by Omniâ€™s negligence as I was by their response. When I contacted the front desk and explained that a nail had punctured my toe and that I was bleeding profusely, their staff offered me a band-aid. Given the fact that I was in pain and limping, given the fact that I now had to contact my doctor to find out when I last had a tetanus shot, given the fact that I now had to worry about catching some horrible disease from the last person who impaled themselves on their carpet nail - I would have expected a first-class hotel to be more consolatory than to offer me a band-aid. After I returned to my room, the Omni staff sent me a note stating that they were unable to find the nail that had injured me. They insisted that I point out the nail to their building engineer, which I did. As their building engineer was pounded the offending nail back into the floor, he stated that he discovered 2 more nails protruding upward out of the carpet in the same general area. I wasnâ€™t aware that I was entering a â€œmine fieldâ€� when I checked into the Omni hotel. But the final straw occurred as I was checking out of the hotel. The desk clerk inquired as to my stay. I explained the whole sordid tale, the nail, the blood, the limping, everything. I then asked what was the best way to get to the Oakland Airport. To add insult to injury, she suggested that I walk 4 blocks to the BART station. Once I returned home, I contacted the Omni management to complain. The hotel manager promised to send me a voucher for several free nights stay. This never happened. A first-class hotel manager would have been a man of his word. But then, Omni isnâ€™t a first-class hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, Annoying fees”
Reviews.Author: StraightScoopDC
Reviews.Content: I stayed here overnight on a quick business trip to San Francisco. The room and service were quite good. For tourists paying their own way, however, the extra fees are excessive. The business center is deficient, and the fees for using the computer and fax machine are high. Mini bar charges are also excessive. Breakfast at the hotel restaurant was good but also overpriced -- $25 for a basic eggs, toast etc. As is usual with high-end hotels, the extra costs are excessive and annoying.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Fantastic Stay”
Reviews.Author: Seattlecarol
Reviews.Content: We checked in for a one night stay - the Front Desk staff was extremely accommodating and allowed us early check in (and late check out). The room was lovely and very comfortable. The Concierge was great! He recommended wonderful restaurants in the area for our lunch that day. We had an evening performance 6 blocks away (all up hill) and he arrranged a complimentary towncar ride to the event. The Omni has a computer room and allowed us to do electronic flight checkin and print our boarding pass at no charge. Our breakfast in the Hotel restaurant (Bob's Steak House) was fantastic with the service rated above a 10. An early dinner in the Bar prior to leaving for the airport was equally marvelous. Best steak I have ever had (albiet quite pricey). Worth every cent. I'd stay there again in a heartbeat and, in fact, may plan a trip back in the spring and will definietly stay at the Omni.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful/Quiet”
Reviews.Author: hthr1
Reviews.Content: The Omni Hotel is beautiful and quiet. Now this isn't the Four Seasons, but it is still along the same lines. Rooms were spacious and elegant and very comftoable and inviting. They even have turn down service in the evening, which is an added bonus. The best thing about this place was the gym. All I can say is awesome!!!! The lighting is great, the equipment was top notch, well taken care of by staff, stocked with towls, headphones, water, etc. AWESOME! Only drawback is that it is a little pricey to say the least. Items in room are a plenty, but it will cost you. My suggestion is to leave those kinds of things alone. LoL I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “First Class Hotel”
Reviews.Author: mvsteve
Reviews.Content: My wife and I got to escape our lives and children for one night thanks to Grandma. We decided to stay at tripadvisor's #1 pick. We agree. The Omni is truly remarkable. The hotel itself is beautiful. Our room was spectacular. The shower had two heads plus two coming off the wall. The bed was incredibly comfortable and the place was super clean. We got the California Suite / Sweet deal. They brought us amazing chocolates while we were napping. Then we showered and went out for dinner. When we came back, the bed was made and our used towels had already been replaced. They left even more chocolates by the bedside. I've never been treated so well and we stay at a lot of nice places. This place is top notch!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel”
Reviews.Author: WinnieJK
Reviews.Content: The Omni is a lovely hotel with exceptional service. We loved everything, down to the bath products, which I have been special ordering since our visit. The location is convenient- close to trolley lines and Chinatown, plus cabs are easily available in front of the hotel. At check in we were treated with kind attention and our 5 year old son appreciated the special kid's gift packet, full of goodies and activities. We also thought is was a nice touch to have milk and cookies brought to our room every afternoon (although a bit close to dinner time). Our only complaint is the lack of a pool, which nearly led us to another location. We chose to book at the Omni anyway, since it was the site of the meeting we were attending. Overall, it's a great hotel and they do their best to welcome young children.

Reviews.Title: “Very Good”
Reviews.Author: Brian-SK
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for two nights in Jan 08 on the way home from a business trip. The reception was excellent, rooms and bahrooms are very good indeed and all the staff set out to please. Its a bit away from the main tourist areas (Union Square and the Wharf) but thats no bad thing. Its a 10 min walk to Union Square, and approx a 30 minute walk to Fishermans Wharf through North Beach. Its also about 10 mins walk to the Ferry Builiding where you can pick up the F Line tram. The California line cable car stops outside the door so transport is not a problem if you don't want to walk. I booked through the hotel web site directly as this offered the best deal ($169 per night) I also ate at Bobs Steak and Chop House (the hotel restaurant) on the first night. Very good but not a cheap option (approx $70-$80 a head for two courses and a couple of drinks). San Francisco is a great city and I would certainly stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place, the Omni San Fransisco.”
Reviews.Author: seagullrob
Reviews.Content: We did a 4 week tour of the USA over December/January 2007, with 3 older children (girl, 22, boy, 19 and boy, 18), going to San Francisco [Omni Hotel], Miami (South Beach) [Beacon Hotel], Orlando (Disneyworld, Pop Century Resort), Chicago [Drake Hotel], New York (for Christmas) [Beacon Hotel - unrelated to the Beacon in Miami], Boston [Omni Hotel], New York (again) [Roosevelt Hotel] (including New Yearâ€™s Eve at the Renaissance Hotel overlooking Times Square), and a day trip to Niagara Falls. It was sometimes very cosy - sometimes downright stressful - with the kids. Anyway, here are my accommodation reviews. Iâ€™ll mention side trips and tours too. Sometimes the accommodation was arranged through a travel agent, but on a couple of occasions I organised it direct. The Omni was arranged through a travel agent in Brisbane, though as usual I had checked with Trip Advisor, and then asked the travel agent to book it when I was satisfied. He got me better rates than going to the hotel direct, too. We were also staying at an Omni in Boston, and as I'd joined the Omni's Select Guest program (free, via the internet), there were advantages to be had. Plus, we'd previously stayed at the Omni in Washington and it was spectacular (my favourite of the 3 Omnis I've stayed in whilst in the USA), so we thought it would be good. We weren't disappointed. Fairly large rooms (we had a double and a triple, though the kids weren't particularly happy at 2 of them having to share a double bed - but then, they're not paying!); interconnecting which was useful. Free internet (I had a laptop) for Select Guest members (if you stay at the Omni, the Select Guest program is recommended - free juice/coffee and newspaper delivered every morning). Very reasonably sized bathroom. In all, very comfortable. It's a grand building with an impressive foyer. We received a lovely sincere welcome from the bell captain on arriving. The hotel is not all the conveniently located, but we were happy to walk and find our way around. Finding cheap restaurants (try feeding 5, including 2 big boys, for 4 weeks straight - you won't be eating at the hotel restaurants very much!) was a bit of a task, but not impossible. Speaking of meals, we fell over Francis Ford Coppola's Italian cafe in Kearney Street on the way back from climbing the Coit tower - it was great. Google it if you are interested. I brought some of the wine back to Australia. We decided to eat there purely on the basis of the menu and the look of the place, then found out who the famous owner was. Recommended purely on the Italian food and the venue, if nothing else. We did a tour of the city (booked through the travel agent), which was absolutely worthwhile. Stopped at good views of the city (from a high lookout), and another spot for views of the Golden Gate Bridge (which the bus drove over). It also included a harbour cruise from Pier 39 at Fisherman's Wharf, which went under the Golden Gate Bridge and circled Alcatraz Island. It's a good way to see the highlights. Our time at the Omni in San Francisco was good - nice rooms and ambience, but not budget accommodation.

Reviews.Title: “I Love This Hotel!!”
Reviews.Author: liylu
Reviews.Content: This hotel & its' staff gives hotels a good name. It is why i love hotels; the staff is friendly/helpful/courteous/kind (& probably thrifty, brave, etc) from the desk staff to the concierge, bellmen, doormen & maids. The lobby IS like walking into the Titanic (as noted in another review). There are milk & EXCELLENT choc chip cookies left in your room each afternoon plus cider & cookies in the lobby. The rooms are beautiful (in contrast to the Madonna Inn where we had just stayed for a night), the beds are comfy & warm. The parking is EXPENSIVE, ($45/day, i think) but i got a deal on Expedia that INCLUDED parking for ~$10/day. The parking is a block or 2 away but only had to wait 5-10 minutes for the car to be brought around. The area has expensive restaurants (Tadich grill, cafe tiramisu) and less expensive ones (House of Nanking); a terrific place for breakfast is Cafe de la Presse a couple of blocks away--reminds me of Paris. You can walk to everything. I want to go again!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel in a Wonderful City”
Reviews.Author: Tackle
Reviews.Content: Reservations: made through Hotels.com Check-in: fast and friendly. Room: Spacious quiet well-furnished and exceptionally clean. VERY comfortable bed, nice Television, but no refrigerator in the room. Huge beautiful bathroom. Internet: free in lobby, expensive in the room. Check-out: fast and accurate. Complaint: there is NO self parking and valet parking was $45.00 per night, which is rather expensive even for SF!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding value - impeccable and great location”
Reviews.Author: agoura
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Omni for 2 nights (Fri and Sat), taking advantage of the weekend rates. The Omni was a very pleasnt surprise as it is a short few blocks from Union square across from the Bank of America tower. We were able to walk to North Beach for dinner. The rooms are spacious and well appointed with marble countertops and shower. Decorated with great taste throughout. The staff was attentive to details and housekeeping keeps the room absolutely impeccable. I highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay at the Omni”
Reviews.Author: AjasTravels
Reviews.Content: My fiance and I stayed at the Omni for 1 night. I found the cheapest rates on the Omni Hotel's website. Unfortunately nothing else was cheap. $45/night for parking with unlimited in and out privileges. $70 for a steak. $34 for 3 cocktails. $70 for 3 mediocre martinis and 2 appetizers. The onion rings were pretty bad. There is free wi-fi in the lobby, but $10 for an internet connection in your room. The hotel was beautifully decorated for the holidays. All of the staff were very nice and courteous when we arrived. Security was very helpful when my fiance got locked in the stairwell (you can get into the stairwell, but you need a key to get onto the floors). There was complimentary hot cider and cookies for the guests in the lobby. I especially liked the gingerbread men. The rooms were very nice and spacious (for SF) with marble countertops and high thread count bedding. I loved their bathrobes. When we went back to our room at the end of the night the maid wrote a welcome note and left mint chocolates on the nightstand. The hotel is located in the Financial district so lots of people go to the lobby bar after work. It's a few blocks from Union Square so we took a cab to get around town. I would have given the Omni 5 stars but some of the rates for food were ridiculous and the maids knocked on our door 4 times to clean the room.

Reviews.Title: “A great choice, whether you're there for business or for romance”
Reviews.Author: OperaOnTheTurnpike
Reviews.Content: It may sound a bit strange, but I think it's true. Perfect for business and for romance too (not so for singles, partiers, families with kids and so on). Elegant, quiet, perfectly located in a very good part of town ... I think the Omni really has it all. It's obsviously not an inexpensive choice, but their rates are very reasonable for what you get. The lobby is beautiful and the rooms extremely clean, quite large and very comfortable, with incredible beds and bathrooms wonderfully appointed with marble and green and black granite. Room service was very good and front desk staff was efficient. One of the definite pluses of the hotel is the express check-out. So efficient, as you bypass the usual check-out procedures (unless you disagree with the price to pay). You gave them your credit card when checking-in, so finding your final bill in an envelope at your door room the final morning and simply leaving is always a great thing. The restaurant is average and quite overpriced, but I guess this is somewhat usual in this kind of properties. It was definitely what I like the least. You don't need to pay such prices for breakfast or dinner, especially considering you will find plenty of fantastic places to eat at reasonable prices in nearby North Beach and all over the city. The location is the very best I could personally ask for. I understand that those who visit San Francisco for the first time usually prefer to stay in Union Square (which, by the way, is within walking distance) or in Fisherman's Wharf (which I would never recommend), but, for me, the area around the Omni is the very best. for the following reasons: a) The area is very nice and you're within walking distance to places such as Union Square, North Beach, Chinatown, the Embarcadero, the cable car turntable, and so on. b) It is very quiet, as it is located at the edge of the financial district. So, when I have enough budget for it, the Omni is, for all those reasons and more, my personal choice in San Francisco, my very favourite city.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel for an anniversary stay”
Reviews.Author: Spook55
Reviews.Content: My husband and I decided to splurge on a nice hotel for our third wedding anniversary. We live only an hour from San Francisco, but wanted to eat a nice dinner there, plus we had tickets for a football game the next afternoon. We got a decent price for a one-night stay, and we got more than our money's worth at this very luxurious hotel! The staff was incredibly friendly, the standard room was very comfortable, and it's an overall beautiful place. I liked the complimentary bath robes, and the toiletries in the bathroom smelled wonderful! The bar/lounge is nice, although the bartender on shift at the time was a little stiff. Check-in was quick, although we checked in online ahead of time and they didn't have our folio ready. Loved the warm apple cider and cookies they had available for guests downstairs! The hotel is in a great location near Union Square, although we didn't do any sight-seeing since we just had dinner and the football game in mind for our stay. I can't speak to the restaurant (we had breakfast at Starbucks a couple of blocks away) or the business traveler amenities, but I'm sure they're quite nice. NOTE: Parking is a MAJOR expense at San Francisco hotels, and this one is no exception! We did our homework and found a 24-hour city lot one block up the street to park our car - St. George's Square lot, I believe. We only paid $7 for the night (although I think the cashier made an error...it still would have been cheaper than the $45 the hotel would have charged us for valet).

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel in a Great City”
Reviews.Author: EssEffMD
Reviews.Content: My partner and I stayed at the Omni for a long weekend, we are former residents of San Francisco and are well acquainted with The City and all it has to offer. The Omni is ideally located, within walking distance to Union Square (great shopping), Belden Place (great dining) and the Cable Car stops right outside the front door of the hotel. We found the staff to be friendly, accommodating and quite professional, the hotel itself has the feel of a smaller boutique hotel and is an excellent choice for lodging. Definitely plan to stay here again in the near future.

Reviews.Title: “Top San Francisco Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Poshexpert
Reviews.Content: Two nights on business. Second time at this excellent hotel. Consider this one of the best chain hotels I've stayed in and one of the best in Sand Francisco. All requests made during reservations are met by the Omni. On the way to airport left cell phone in limo and Lex Doherty, the excellent concierge, arranged for the phone to be sent by FED EX to my home the following morning. Hotel has added touches such as a creative way of giving you a semi-complimentary continental breakfast... coffee and juice are free... with minimal charges for extras. CB is delivered to your room with newspapers without all the formality of room service. They leave at door so you don't have to answer immediately early in the AM. Excellent location and very convient and friendly staff.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel A+”
Reviews.Author: cm2race
Reviews.Content: The hotel is beautiful and the location could not be more perfect! However it is the staff at the Omni that makes this hotel above the rest. Upon our arrival the front desk assisted my daughter and myself to plan tours, directions and transportation for our stay. Joey "suggested" not pushed on several choices based on our interests. As we were in the first few minutes of unpacking in our room, Joey sent complimentary refreshments via roomservice. The extra attention the entire staff including the housekeeping service was beyond our expectations. Rooms are nice, clean and comfortable. Chinatown and Union Square are within walking distance. Other transportation we purchased the 3 day muni pass and rode the trolley and cable cars to every destination on our list. The suggested tours of Muir Woods and Napa Wine Country were awesome. Tower Tours picked us up from the hotel front door, they were well worth every cent. The tour guide named Will was outstanding. It is recommended 100%. We will certainly return to the Omni for our next visit to this fantastic city and would not even consider another hotel. Although we did not dine at Bob's, I regret not having done so. It will be on the list the next visit!

Reviews.Title: “bland & boring”
Reviews.Author: digger2
Reviews.Content: we had great expectations regarding our stay at this hotel after reading all the reviews on tripadvisor. We were also able to book 3 nights at a very good rate through omni's website. There was nothing wrong with this hotel except that it was exceptionally bland. It was comfortable (but so are courtyard hotels) & clean (as you would expect) but it had no zing. Not that we were looking for nightlife but, like much of america, it was so processed it was boring. The front desk staff where ok but lacked any connection with their guests (this is, I admit, very common in the states - "have a happy day"!) When we arrived to the room both my wife & I were glad that we had only paid $135USD not the usual $250-$400, as that was what it was worth. We had just come from the Signature MGM in Las Vegas which knocked us out!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: cleolily
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Omni in San Francisco 11/10/07 for 1 night. I have been to San Francisco many, many times and this rates as one of the best hotels I've stayed at. They have a great location, the rooms were above average, and they have a restaurant that is definitely better than most hotel restaurants. (Bob's Chophouse) What prompted me to stay at this Omni for the first time in San Francisco was a free upgrade room pass I received for my horrible stay at the Omni in Austin, TX. I swore after that experience that I wouldn't stay again at an Omni, but wanted to use the upgrade and liked this location. Well, the upgrade (and what I was told I'd receive when I made the reservation) would have been an upgraded courtyard view. That didn't happen...we were given the inferior room anyway with an alley view so they didn't even utilize the upgrade or give us the room promised. If that hadn't occurred my experience would have been rated as "excellent".

Reviews.Title: “Overall a great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Debs582
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Omni Hotel a family of 4 including 2 small children, for 2 nights. On arrival my children were given a backpacks with gifts from the hotel which they were delighted with, checkin was also very quick and staff friendly. Our room was a deluxe room it was very comfortable, classically decorated and very nicely finished. The lobby area of the hotel is also very grand with beautiful chandliers and staircase. The hotel is a very short walk from china town where we enjoyed a meal one night, the only downside to the hotel was the valet parking, A call had to be made to request your car 20 minutes prior, we did this 4 times during our stay and twice had to wait another 10 minutes also. Parking rates are expensive at 50 dollars a night. This aside the hotel and our room were lovely and all dealings we had with the staff , we found them to be helpful and friendly.

Reviews.Title: “excellent”
Reviews.Author: Librarianone
Reviews.Content: The staff and hotel were superb. Customer service from every staff member was amazing - recommendations for dining and attractions were right on - never too busy to help. The location of the hotel was terrific for walking to many of the prime tourist areas - safe and secure. Our room on the 5th floor was opulent.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service”
Reviews.Author: Empathology
Reviews.Content: This is an excellent quality hotel right in the heart of SF. The service from all staff was superb, location good, bar & restaurant great and so on!! This was just a quick one night stay before flying back to Europe. I was intrigued by the "most romantic hotel in SF" label when searching as we were at the end of our Honeymoon. Truth is it's a chain hotel that pretends not to seek out the corporate clients even though there were plenty of them. However, unlike so many other big name chains, the Omni seems to treat it's private guests very specially going that little step further for customer service. (Too often I find the chains trying to get the corporate money and just neglect those of us that want a nice hotel). Lots of nice little touches too numerous to mention here means I shall return here (and to any other Omni). And was it romantic? - Well this is not a boutique hotel - it's a large-ish city centre hotel. But given those constraints - surprisngly yes!

Reviews.Title: “Top Notch!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: ChiTownSteve
Reviews.Content: The hotel was top notch all the way. From express check in upon late evening arrival, to complimentary coffee, juice and paper delivered every morning to the room. The room was elegant and the bed comfortable. The bathroom was fantastic with wonderful toiletries. The workout room was private, just the right size and had complimentary water and fruit at all times. To top it all off, upon checkout they offered to take us via their Lincoln Town Car to our car rental agency in lieu of us taking a taxi. Would definetely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Horrible Experience with the Management”
Reviews.Author: jke79
Reviews.Content: My stay at the Omni San Francisco started out poorly when I requested a double room (with two double beds) but received a queen room (with one queen). I asked for a rollaway bed, and ages later received a ridiculous inflatable bed not suitable for a comfortable nightâ€™s sleep. I managed, but it was very uncomfortable. The worst part, however, came after my stay when I had a $300 charge on my credit card. I called to inquire about the charge and they proceeded to tell me it was for room damage. I had no idea what they were talking about and after further investigation, they told me there was a hole in the wall of the room we stayed in. I of course asked for the manager to call me, and was extremely taken aback at how I was treated. He was pompous and rude and immediately accused me of putting the hole in the wall. He assured me there was no way his staff would have missed the hole and rented out a room in such a state. I told him that they did, and that my friend (who I immediately phoned afterwards) actually saw the hole â€“ but forgot to mention it to me (it was at the bottom of the wall near the baseboard in the hallway near the door, making it easy to miss). After I relayed this to the manager, he made a snide remark about how guests of his hotel are high-class and would call and complain if they received a room with a hole in the wall. Having no idea of the consequences of not reporting the hole, my friend didn't feel he needed to say anything and thus I never knew about it. The manager was horribly condescending and from his last remark implied that I was not a high-class guest and â€˜didnâ€™t belongâ€™ at his hotel. I again assured him that the hole was not from me and he had no proof. He again insisted that his staff does not make mistakes and would never rent out a room with a hole in the wall. I was not going to budge and insisted that he reverse the charge. After going back and forth for awhile, he finally succumbed and reversed the charge. However, I was left with a bad taste in my mouth. I should not have had to defend my honor, and I knew he thought I was lying even after he reversed the charge. Even though I got the charge reversed, I still didnâ€™t feel like I won. This hotel should not be four-star, as four-star hotels would never treat their guests like this. The Omni San Francisco is a third-rate hotel with mediocre customer service and horrible management. Yes, it was bad luck that I got that room, but my experience with the management was enough to make me write this review and encourage travelers to stay somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Service”
Reviews.Author: Oyster4
Reviews.Content: I have to say I am probably one of the most pickiest individuals with food and service. I will say the Omni surpassed my expectations. The rooms are nice enough (the beds, furniture, and TV) could be updated with more modern furnishings, but after that, the hotel is not only in a great location but their staff is extremely customer oriented and surpasses what you would get at any other hotel. I had one small problem with a smoker being in the room before me and the staff bent over backwards to get the problem corrected and comped a breakfast (with me asking) for the hassle. The check in was very easy and the food and drink in the bar was very good. I was very pleased and would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great staff, great location”
Reviews.Author: SLCD
Reviews.Content: Location - - just a few blocks from Nob Hill (Cable Car Museum, Grace Cathedral and fabulous views), China Town and Union Square! The cable car stops at the corner just outside the hotel. The architecture in the Financial district is also gorgeous. That said, it is the Financial district and there is not much open on the weekend. (even Starbucks is closed on Sat and Sun!) You'll need to walk a few blocks for a coffee on the weekend. Staff - - The front desk staff is pleasant and very helpful. The door staff is fantastic. They give stellar directions, hail cabs in driving rain and even secured us a ride in an 'off duty' limo. Housekeeping is quick and thorough and very nice.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel in quiet location”
Reviews.Author: Work2TravelUk
Reviews.Content: Hotel lived up to the Omni reputation from check in through to check out. Room was clean and standard high - toiletries were top notch!! Location is in the financial district so not too much on the doorstep but all within easy distance and trolley right outside the door. No panhandlers outside which for SF is a blessing! Restaurant looked good and is recommended in guides but we didn't eat there as it is very pricy. The bar was expensive too but cosy and relaxing. Staff were very helpful and you could even buy a MUNI pass (highly recommend for value and convenience) at the desk. We were celebrating our 10th anniversary and at check in I was given a red rose and in our room was complimentary champagne and chocolate covered strawberries. Beautiful touch and greatly appreciated after a long flight.

Reviews.Title: “Solid Four Star Property”
Reviews.Author: rodjune
Reviews.Content: Great location on California Street, centrally located to the financial district, Chinatown, and Union Square. It's right across the street from the Bank of America building, which helps you find the hotel if you're not familiar with San Francisco streets. Check in was very professional and courteous. I was able to secure an early check in at 10:00 am. It's a mid-sized property, compact, yet business smart and understated luxurious. Getting from your room to one of the conference rooms takes only a couple of minutes at most. Elevators are fast. Rooms are average sized, very comfortable, with nice bedding. Lighting is excellent for in-room working. Bathroom was upscale with granite counters, marble floor, large mirror, nice lighting, make up mirror, scale, and a roomy bathtub. Upscale bath amenities are provided. The banquet food was excellent and well-prepared. Did not try room service or restaurants. Express checkout made my departure smooth and quick.

Reviews.Title: “Good value”
Reviews.Author: thmaesbe
Reviews.Content: Nice, clean rooms. Very efficient and friendly check-in and check-out. Excellent value. The steaks at Bob's downstairs are indeed terrific, and so are the views from the top floor of the Bank of America building opposite.

Reviews.Title: “Four stars feels like five...”
Reviews.Author: abb311
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Omni for our first anniversary and loved it! The staff was SO nice from the moment we walked in the door. They were happy to help and full of information. The location is perfect. It's an easy walk to China Town and Little Italy. It's also about a 10 minute walk to Embarcadero shopping. The rooms were great. We had a small suite, and the toilettries were upscale products that I've only seen in Neiman Marcus. The rooms are very clean and the bed was really comfortable. The hotel restaurant is Bob's Steak and Chop House. There is no wireless internet available - in the room or in the lobby. I would absolutely recommend the Omni to anyone interested in a fairly luxurious hotel experience.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: tlpetrillo
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed for 3 nights at the Omni in San Francisco and we were so impressed with this hotel, we were compelled to write about it. The price is so affordable that you really don't expect to be 'wowed' by the hotel. But our expectations were far exceeded. The service of every staff member we came in contact with was exemplary. The Front Desk personnel were so helpful in recommending restaurants, transportation, etc. They even booked a (future) dinner for us at a restaurant in Napa Valley, which was the next leg of our vacation. The Front Desk personnel, Bellboys, the Doormen, the Housekeeping staff---every single person treated us like royalty. Our room was perfectly clean when we arrived, the front desk staff went out of their way to see that we had a room with a view, and they always followed up by phone to make sure we received whatever service we had requested. Additionally, the location of the Omni is ABSOLUTELY excellent. We walked EVERYWHERE. To the Ferry Building every day, to Pier 39, Fisherman's Wharf, to Ghiaradelli Square, to Lombard Street, to dinner each night. We never had to take a taxi or other type of transportation. Granted, some of the walks were steep uphill climbs, but that was part of the inate charm of the city. What a fantastic, albeit short time we had in San Francisco. And many thanks to the Omni for making our stay so thoroughly enjoyable. Steve and Tammy Lunn, Laytonsville, Maryland

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: noelmal
Reviews.Content: The hotel had a great location - we walked to North Beach, China Town, the Ferry building and shopping in downtown and felt safe in the area. They switched out their room service menus 1/2 way through our stay and the prices went from reasonable to pretty expensive. R/S was always on time and they were friendly. Our room was small with two double beds, one chair and a desk but it was well kept and housekeeping was very good. Our room was by an elevator on the 8th floor so I was a bit worried that it would be noisy but it was very quite. Service was good in the hotel but sometimes the door staff was a bit too casual. We ate one night in the bar off of the lobby and the food was good as was the service. We also ate at the Market Bar down by the Ferry building twice - once for lunch and once for brunch. It was great and had inside and outside seating available. The Ferry building also had some great gourmet food stores and retail shops. We had dinner at Home in the Lower Haight area and it was very good. It had simple food and a nice atmosphere. Overall the hotel was a great jumping off location to most points in the city and it was a hassle free stay in a safe location.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Service at the Omni”
Reviews.Author: cosmic_charlie
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Omni San Francisco for 3 nights at the Labour Day weekend. It was the last stop of our honeymoon to the US and we couldn't have made a better choice. We were upgraded to a Bay View Room on the top floor (17th floor). My wife was given a rose at check in, they brought us a bottle of champaign and chocolate-coated strawberries and had arranged our bathrobes with another rose the first evening. Room service was simply outstanding. I highly recommend joining the free OMNI Select Guest programme which entitles you to complimentary WIFI, beverage and newsparer service. Staff was charming, attentive and helpful with the exception of one gruffy bellman. Dined once at Bob's Steakhouse (belonging to the hotel), waiters so so, but great food, had a perfect filet mignon. Cable Car line runs just in front of the house. The only minor drawbacks: - WIFI service doesn't work on the 17th floor which they "somehow forgot" to mention at check-in (however, as Select guest you can use the cable internet free of charge) - walls are quite thin (the same old story everywhere...) - parking: as usual in SF, street parking is a mess and the hotel charges a hefty 40$ valet fee for 24 hours + 6$ city tax. Hotel is within walking distance of Ferry Building, Embaracadero, Coit Tower, Market Street, Chinatown and SOMA. Would highly recommend and always return there.

Reviews.Title: “Travel Agent's review”
Reviews.Author: tequila2000
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just returned from a wonderful 4 nights at the Omni, and have nothing but good things to say about the hotel. Arrival - we opted for public transportation, taking the BART from SFO airport to Montgomery st and walked up the street to the hotel (maybe a 10 minute walk) It cost us $5.15 per person rather than $42 for a taxi from the airport, and it took about 40 minutes. Check in/out - I had notified the hotel that we would be arriving early (10am) and we received our room right away. We were also permitted to check out late, at 1pm. Staff - were fantastic, very friendly and helpful. I had notified the hotel that it was my husband's birthday, and they sent up a bottle of wine (which was pretty good), a fruit and cheese platter and a birthday card. We had nightly turndown service and were given a weather report for the next day, and chocolates. Room - beautifully decorated room, comfortable king size bed, nice ammenities in the bathroom. There was a desk and an armchair with an ottoman - perfect for relaxing and putting your feet up after a long day of walking! Location - in the financial district, but within walking distance to all the sights (if you like to walk!) The hotel is very close to North Beach (Little Italy) and China town, where we enjoyed a few meals. The ferry building/market was a short 10 minute walk, and pier 39 & Fisherman's Wharf were about a 25-30 minute walk away. We walked everywehre, and never found anywhere too far or more of a 1/2 hour walk. Concierge gave us maps and directions to all the places that we wanted to visit. There were also a few good nightclubs and pubs just around the corner from us. * Sign up for the free Signature guest program - you get juice and a paper every morning and nightly turndown service with a chocolate! Sights / recommendations * Alcatraz - we did the night tour (booked in advance), it was cool, and kinda spooky to be there at night. * Pier 39 - the sealions were one of our highlights, you could watch them play / fight for hours! We ate at Bubba Gump's (just for the novelty of it) but the food was lousy and overpriced. * Fisherman's Wharf - nice to walk around, lots of souvenir shops and fresh seafood stands. * Giradelli Square - go for the sundaes, they are worth the $8! * Lombard St - worth the walk up this hill / crooked street * Tonga Room - just up the street (hill) from the hotel (at the Fairmont Hotel) we went for the $8 happy hour buffet, well worth a visit for an early dinner, and the atmosphere is pretty cool, especially when it "rains." * AT & T park - saw a Giants game (bought tickets there), what a nice park, with beautiful views of the bay (if you get the right seats - we were on club level) * Ferry Building / Market - there was always some kind of street performance going on there. We'd definately return to the Omni!

Reviews.Title: “Omni is heaven”
Reviews.Author: worldtravler_7
Reviews.Content: The Omni was great! The room was clean, comfortable and the service at the hotel was second to none. We loved the coffee/juice and paper deliverey to the room each morning. The evening turn down service was perfect at the end of a long day! I very much recommend the Omni and we will definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel”
Reviews.Author: chiquita2007
Reviews.Content: I booked the Omni based on the reviews here on Tripadvisor and the Hotel was even more amazing than all of the reviews would have you believe. The rooms are beautiful, the staff is friendly, attentive and helpful and the room service was fantastic. It's also extremely convenient to the cable car and Chinatown. I would definitely return to the Omni San Fran.

Reviews.Title: “Downtown Hotel But with a little more soul than most”
Reviews.Author: drabs
Reviews.Content: This could be just a standard downtown hotel, but it's better than average. The staff is friendly, the housekeeping staff leaves you cute notes, they gave us a rose because we were celebrating our wedding anniversary... The location is very central. The cable cars stop outside and it's only five blocks to the Ferry Terminal Building. It exceeded my expectations.

Reviews.Title: “The Omni is fantastic”
Reviews.Author: purkskis
Reviews.Content: What a great stay. We had signed up for the Select Guest membership and received complimentary beverages in the morning and evening turndown service. We got to check in early - like 9 am - and were always given great directions and advice for siteseeing. Our room was in great condition - really clean. The location was great too, as it was within walking distance of transportation, shopping, dining, etc. I would definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel and location.”
Reviews.Author: yankeedoodledandee
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a great location, on a cable car line, near to china town and opposite a great restaurant in the bank of america builing. Our room was of good quality fixtures and fittings, staff were very helpful, with a nice bar area looking onto the street. Hotel is about a 10 minute waalk to union square for shopping, 15 minute walk to the nearest pier area and bay bridge. Fishermans wharf is a cab or bus ride. Book alcatraz prison tour before you arrive in san fran. Open top otur bus of city worth doing as well. No free parking at hotel, have to use car parks opposite, which are not cheap.

Reviews.Title: “Elegant hotel and amazing steak restaurant!”
Reviews.Author: MrsGWolverhampton_Uk
Reviews.Content: We stopped here for three nights as part of our honeymoon. The hotel looks very elegant and the front desk staff are extremely welcoming. They are very happy to offer you advice about 'the sights' and will make every effort to make you feel a valued customer. The price, which is not excessive, was justified in the quality. I'd told them that it was our honeymoon when I booked the room. When we arrived we had been upgraded to a beautiful room on the 16th (out of 17) floor. When we got to the room we were greeted with huge strawberries dipped in dark chocolate, chilled sparkling wine, red wine, fresh fruit, mineral water all dressed with orchid heads and a hand written note congratulating us. It was really wonderful. The room was a very good size, bathroom fantastic - Molton Brown products. Bed was extremely comfortable with very good quality linen. The whole hotel was very clean and the housekeeping staff clearly took pride in their work. There was even a note welcoming us to the hotel from the member of staff responsible for our room- very nice touch. We had breakfast and dinner in Bob's Steakhouse. The breakfast was nice but nothing outstanding. Service on both occasions was good. The steak however was simply the best either of us have ever tasted! We both had the fillet mignon, it was cooked perfectly to our request. Fabulous. I would definitely recommend this hotel and I will happily book hotels within this chain again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Stay”
Reviews.Author: maverickdog
Reviews.Content: The Omni San Francisco really was absolutely wonderful. We got a great deal on their website, and we were really thrilled with the room, the lobby, the bar, and the location. The hotel is just a short cable car ride to almost all the tourist attractions, while also in a very safe area. We were very impressed and would definitely recommend it. As an added bonus, I accidentally left my wedding band on the nightstand the morning of our checkout, I finally noticed it when we were driving down the coast on the Pacific Coast Highway...I called the front desk, they connected me to housekeeping, and housekeeping overnighted it to our next hotel in Monterey that very day. Exceptional service.

Reviews.Title: “If only other hotels can learn from this Omni”
Reviews.Author: astr0travel
Reviews.Content: Our family of four stayed at the Omni San Francisco for a too short 4-day weekend. We have stayed at a number of other hotels (including the Ritz-Carlton) over the years and can honestly say that this was the absolute best experience we have ever had. Everyone on staff was incredible and made us feel that we were the only guests there even though the hotel was sold out! This is the only hotel to be in San Francisco!

Reviews.Title: “NIce Stay, Absolutely Beautiful”
Reviews.Author: Travler322111
Reviews.Content: This hotel was and absolutely exquisite place... The Lobby was beautiful, and the Hotel Restaurants were GREAT!!! Recommended even for families with children! Also, it was in a great part of San Fransisco!!!

Reviews.Title: “Lots of Class”
Reviews.Author: MineralKing
Reviews.Content: From the minute you step into the lobby and the eager (but not overly) front desk staff greet you, you know you're in for a great stay. The lobby is beautiful with seating areas for cocktails or dining... all sparkling and impressive. Great steakhouse and bar located in the hotel too... Right on California Street on the Nob Hill cable car line, you can close the double glazed windows and not hear a thing, or slide em up a little for some ambient SF street noise... it's great. The room I had was a king bedded room in front of the hotel on the 11th floor with a view of the Bank of America building. Great pillows! Firm but comfortable bed. The bathroom was marble and antiqued. The amenities were awesome (Pecksniffs) and just everything about the room was classy. It is a very smart choice in SF compared to some of the other long standing Nob Hill establishments who have seemed to take a turn for the worse in recent years (Stanford Court, Fairmont, Huntington). A great business or adult getaway hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic !!!”
Reviews.Author: nancycel
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a long weekend visit to San Francisco celebrating our 36th wedding anniversary and stayed at the Omni. The room was beautiful and impeccably clean. The service and accommodations were wonderful. The bed was incredibly comfortable. Since it was our anniversary, the maid had arranged towels in the shape of a heart with a nice little heart shaped note beside it. Our concierge Vida Lau at check-in congratulated us on our anniversary and said that something would be sent up to us later. Well, upon our return after a little walk in China Town there was a small bottle of champagne "chilled" with glasses along with some chocolate covered strawberries. And Vida had sent along a little note. Whenever we wanted to take a tour or ask about transportation either the doorman or the concierge were so very helpful. We had our breakfasts and one dinner at Bob's restaurant there and the meals were wonderful and so was the service. My husbnad and I agree that this by far was not only one of our favorite vacations but these were the best accommodations and service that we have EVER had at a hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Omni”
Reviews.Author: Traveljunkie080
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Omni only 2 nights and have never been to San Francisco. The hotel is very plush and well designed. The only problem is the walls are not thick enough to drown out noise from other rooms. We heard our neighbors come in at 1 am and they were quite noisey. The location is in the middle of many attractions so we were able to walk to most everything - although it's quite hilly! Dorian was a major attribute to our wonderful stay. He is a bell guy who was cheerful, wonderful to be around and gave us lots of useful information about a city we hadn't been to before. You've got to meet him! Overall, this is a hotel worth staying at!

Reviews.Title: “Completely exceeded our high expectations”
Reviews.Author: LoriMu
Reviews.Content: We just returned after spending several days at the Omni. We booked the hotel based on in part the reviews we read here. The hotel is quite beautiful, as we expected, but what we didn't expect was the service. We've stayed in many beautiful hotels, but no one has ever treated us as well as we were treated here. The staff went out of their way to help us, giving us hints that we didn't think to ask about, planning tips that we didn't know about and overall treated us as if we were the only guests instead of one of many. Aside from the great service, the restaurant was delicious and location was perfect. What a great stay!

Reviews.Title: “1st Omni stay - Great!”
Reviews.Author: JB_and_SB
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Omni for our wedding anniversary. Beautiful hotel in the financial district, because of that the weekends are fairly "quiet" because the businesses are not working. Chinatown is a quick walk and not too far down to the piers. We would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great price”
Reviews.Author: JennyNav82
Reviews.Content: The location was pretty good, the rooms were very nice, but the view was "so-so". We had a view of another building located behind the Omni. I can't complain though cause we got it for an awesome rate off travelzoo.com. I would stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Flawless”
Reviews.Author: wpack99
Reviews.Content: Booked a room using Priceline and was lucky enough to get the Omni San Francisco. The hotel pays attention to every detail, and I mean EVERY detail. Upon arrrival at the centrally located hotel, we were greeted by the doorman and others willing to help with baggage. There was a bit of a line at the check in desk and one of the bellmen quickly realized the need for additional resources. After advising those waiting he would secure additional help, he did just that. Soon the line was gone and everyone checked in quickly. The reservation was under my name but they allowed my wife to check in while I parked the car, simply asking that I return to the desk with my ID and credit card at some point durign our stay. Now that is service. When we arrived at the well appointed room, there was a hand written note from the housekeeper welcoming us. That is a first ever! That evening the room was turned down, chocolates were left and the television was tuned to a station that was entirely soothing music and beautiful scenes. Again, what an amazing touch. When we returned to the hotel on day 2, another hand written note from the housekeeper indicating she hoped we had a wonderful day, this time the note was personalized to us (vs. Dear Guest). We visited the bar as well and while the drinks were quite pricey ($15 for a martini) the atmosphere and service were perfect. I would highly recommend the Omni. Many others before me have given high ratings and I completely concurr. Excellent, absolutely excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Best Hotel in SF ”
Reviews.Author: Noodlesz
Reviews.Content: Best hotel I've stayed in for a long while. Suberb professional service (though I wish there was a doorman opening the door each time I walked through.) Spotless modern class. Easy check in and out and no problems w/ the hotel at all. Location was alright, not that close to Union Sq though. Room size i estimate 300 sq ft. A little narrower than I would've liked but the beds were super comfy. you won't be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Stay”
Reviews.Author: Love2travel888
Reviews.Content: We have just return from our stay in Omni. Hotel was beautiful. Service was unbelievable. Bathrobe and slippers were provided. Everyone was extremely friendly. Very convenient location, in front of the cable car line, but very quiet on the weekend. We walked to Chinatown, the Coit Tower, Pier 39, Fisherman's Wharf. You can also take a bus to all the tourist attractions. Great shower in the bathroom. Loved our stay.

Reviews.Title: “The Omni...beautiful and convenient”
Reviews.Author: OHTrip
Reviews.Content: The Omni suited my family of four. The room and hotel were beautiful. The level of service given by every employee was unsurpassed. We found the location to be very convenient. Many restaurants were in the area including the resaurants in the foot -traffic -only alley a couple of blocks away. Union Square was within easy walking distance for my husband, me, and daughters, 18 and 20. We took the Powell cable car to Fisherman's Wharf. We took a bus to the Japanese tea garden from Union Square.. We also visited Haight-Asbury from the same location. The Market, Montgomery St. BART station is a few blocks from the hotel and is very convenient for getting to and from the airport. It may be a bit more difficult to get around from this location with small children in tow, but for us, it was perfect!

Reviews.Title: “Great choice if you can get a great rate, otherwise maybe not”
Reviews.Author: Chrisderfer
Reviews.Content: Found a great deal for Memorial Day weekend....spent five nights here for $139/night (plus taxes). At this rate it was great and well worth my money, otherwise I don't think I'd come here again when rates reach $350+ Lobby is fantastic, but as other reviews say, the glamour stops here. That doesn't mean the rest of the hotel is bad. Rooms: Standard rooms are small, but do include a nice size desk. Views from the room are just city block views, nothing exciting. Bathroom was very nice, with marble countertop and shower surround. Room staff left little well-wishing notes and Ghiradelli chocolate squares on the bed each night, a nice touch. Staff: Front desk staff was very helpful. Food: stay away from the breakfast...overpriced like most hotels of this type ($22 for continental breakfast? not for me.) I ordered room service from Bob's Chop House, which is apparently well known in SF as a good steak house. It was pretty good! Location: Easy walk to Ferry Building/Chinatown/Union Square. Beware, there's very little in the way of eating/shopping around the hotel since it's in the financial district....so if you find yourself in the mood for a quick eat, then you'll have to walk somewhere else or eat in the hotel. My next trip I'll probably stay in Union Square instead.

Reviews.Title: “A great hotel, provided you get it at the right price.”
Reviews.Author: OwenFenby
Reviews.Content: My wife and I celebrated out tenth anniversary with a four night stay at the Omni, and were extremely pleased with the service we received. The staff we encountered, from front desk to maid service, were extremely cordial. We returned from our first day's explorations to find a bottle of champagne and dipped strawberries waiting in our room, compliments of the hotel staff. It's rare to see this sort of courtesy across the board, even at a luxury hotel, and it's that kind of attention to detail that leads to the almost unanimous raves you see at Trip Advisor. In addition to the excellent service, the location is great for exploration. We walked to the theatre, some great restaurants in North Beach, and shopping. Cab rides were readily available to anywhere else. I'd definitely pay extra for a Signature rooms on the 16th floor, as the little touches, like a high thread-count sheets, are definitely worth it. The bed is EXTREMELY comfortable. I'd also advise you to sign up for the Omni Club prior to check-in, as membership has some nice freebies, like complimentary beverages and newspapers brought to your room each morning. Free wireless access, too. That said, the decor and furnishings at the Omni are nothing special, rather bland and corporate. Our Signature Room was a bit on the small side, the hallway noise is noticeable, especially in the morning, and the TVs are showing their age, so I would hesitate to pay full rate card here. We booked a $189 Memorial Day Special through Travel Zoo, which is a steep discount from their regular rate. At that price, this place is an incredible bargain, and I wouldn't hesitate to stay here again for business or pleasure.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful & Comfortable- I loved it!”
Reviews.Author: LoloSF
Reviews.Content: I loved the Omni Hotel. My boyfirend and I decided to vacation in our own city and treat ourselves to a luxury hotel for a couple nights. The Omni was fabulous. The staff was so friendly and helpful, the rooms comfortable and very clean, th bathrooms all marble. It is located in the Financial district which is a bit dead on the weekends but it is a 4 block walk to the Embarcadero and a quick cab ride to Union Square. I will definitely stay at the Omni again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: gardaconvert
Reviews.Content: Picked Omni from previous reviews... Some may say being on edge of financial district is quiet, well No! We experienced a Thursday, Friday and Saturday. Saturday was very quiet to get going as most local deli's etc within 10 min walk either do not open on Saturday or open later, say 10am which is fine. It is only 10 min walk from Ferry Building which has many cafes etc and markets at the weekend. Or just hop on cable car that goes past hotel and get off further up California Street to jump on cable car down to Union Square, 15 mins tops. Loads of places to eat there. The cable cars are great, get a $11 dollar all day ticket from hotal reception, valid for the cars and buses. Rooms are lovely, nice and big and great bathrooms, all marble, rooms have air con big TV , video games etc. We used as base to explore, Lombard street, G Gate bridge, Fishermans Wharf, Italian quarter, Coit Tower. Most is easily walkable but those hills can be pretty steep so the cable cars really do make it easy. One tip though.... it can be better to go the end of the line/terminus to get a car and join the queue as some are very busy and nobody gets off, hence you can wait at a stop and not get on at all. Busiest route is from the Market to Fishermansd Wharf via Hyde Street. This one passes over Lombard Street just by the 'crooked street' bit. Great fun standing on the side and leaning out.... which you are not supposed to do of course. We did have one evening meal in the Bob's Steakhouse, attached to hotel and one brealfast. Very good quality although a bit more expensive. Very very busy during the week with business people etc. The bar gets very crowded and noisy but in a nice happy, people enjoying themseleves sort of way. All the staff were very polite and extremely helpful, whatever the question is.

Reviews.Title: “First Class hotel”
Reviews.Author: anjybaby
Reviews.Content: After a work conference in Monterey (avoid the Hyatt Monterey - yuck) my husband and I checked into the Omni for the weekend on the advice from two business traveler friends. We LOVED it! From the moment we pulled up front (valet quickly greeted us, as parking was part of our $175/night rate) we experienced a very high level of service. When I approached the front desk, I was warmly greeted and notified that we were already pre-checked in; handed our room key; and offered some afternoon hot chocolate and fresh fruit in the lobby. The room was spacious and smelled beautiful - can't ever remember a hotel room smelling SO floral....but not overwhelming. Turndown service at night was nice (Ghiradelli chocolate on the pillow, fresh ice, robes laid out), and the doormen and valets were extremely helpful with restaurant suggestions and directions. We were also offered (for free) a ride in the hotel's town car to any restaurant/bar/shopping in the near vicinity - nice touch! Keep up the great service Omni!! Will stay again at the Omni - anywhere in the U.S.!!!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent customer service and beautiful hotel”
Reviews.Author: m3greg
Reviews.Content: Planned a last minute getaway to San Francisco last weekend. After reading customer reviews on TA, I decided to select the Omni Hotel. The hotel was awesome! Customer service impeccable. Cleanliness was excellent. Front desk clerks and doormen learned our names quickly and called us by name for the duration of the trip. I would strongly recommend the omni to visitors. Staff very knowledgable on what's going on in town and recommended the best ways to get around. Great location in that it was in the downtown area but a couple of blocks away from all of the hustle and bustle on traffic and people. Would definitely stay there again. A great place to eat Chinese food is the R & G lounge on Kearny Street (two blocks behind the Omni) food was excellent and very affordable.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Service, Great Customer Followup!”
Reviews.Author: Doraemon79
Reviews.Content: I stayed in the Omni in March 2007. Booked thru priceline and I was looking forward for this stay since all the reviews are wonderful! Unfortunately, my case is slightly different. There were service issues during my stay so I had to move the rooms several times throughout the stay (Bad luck, maybe?). Most of the front desk staffs are very professional and kind. I like the fact the room service is prompt and the bed is very comfortable. Evening turn-down, personal notes and next day's forecast is thoughtful. As previous reviewers described, this hotel has NO view (I stayed at the Hilton FD last time, the views are GEORGIOUS, check my previous post for pictures). There are few types of the rooms and they do have different amenities in the room but the bathrobes are standard feature in every room and nice marble bathroom (except in the accessible rooms you get showers only). There are few restaurants nearby (Tadich Grill is a must go!) few blocks walk to the bart station. Its not that bad of the area at night to walk around with but however it is a very boring area if nightlife is what you are looking for. Chinatown is nearby but still a bit of walk. The parking situation is bad, you will need to get a parking package or else you are looking to pay $40ish/night for parking. The gym on the 3rd floor is very nicely eqipped as well but I really think that they should add a swim pool / jacuzzi in the hotel. Make sure to join Omni select guest program, thats the way to receive the most perks such as 1. Free morning drinks, 2. discounted morning breakfast ( limited selection, but GREAT price & quality/quantity for room service). 2. Free intenet access for select guest member. 3. Possible room upgrade. Also, Sat morning city walk program is nice experience! you will get to know the history of this area!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Hotel, Excellent Service”
Reviews.Author: bobbinuk
Reviews.Content: From the moment we arrived from the UK to the moment we left the staff went out of their way to please us. Walking into the grand lobby everything had an air of professionalism and efficiency. Our room was on the 17th floor with a wonderful view out across to the bay. With this standard of hotel you can expect to find the usual bathrobes and nice arrangement of toiletries, turn down service was provided each night along with the next dayâ€™s weather report, which was a nice idea. The extra touches made you feel that this was a hotel that really cared for their guests. Within a short walk from the hotel were a number of restaurants, shops and cafes around Union square. We enjoyed staying just outside of the main tourist areas however being close enough to easily walk around to places. We will definitely stay again when we visit San Francisco in the future.

Reviews.Title: “As great as everyone says it is”
Reviews.Author: LiaDav
Reviews.Content: We booked the Omni after reading a lot of reviews online. It definitely lived up to all the great reviews. The service is incredible, the hotel is clean and the location is great. The front desk manager went out of her way to accomodate our special needs, calling us on her day off. It was all very much appreciated. We didn't eat in the restaurant except for dessert one night and the chocolate cake could feed 4 people! It was delicious. The restuarant recommendations were wonderful from the staff. We walked to Union Square and the hotel is on the California cable car line. If we are to return to San Francisco, we'll definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel Staff”
Reviews.Author: pdinvestigator
Reviews.Content: From the desk clerks to the maids and doormen you can tell that the managementâ€™s priority is service. Friendliest hotel I've stayed at, ever.

Reviews.Title: “Overrated -- Clean, Nice but definitely not outstanding.”
Reviews.Author: NLProductn
Reviews.Content: I am a little amazed at some of the reviews I have read here. Don't get me wrong this is a nice hotel but it doesn't warrant rave reviews, there are some problems. No wireless internet, I can't believe a hotel in the financial district doesn't have wireless internet. The front desk said we needed to "pay 50 bucks" to upgrade to a room with wireless internet. Huh? You have to be kidding me. The doormen (as all the reviews state here) were not (a) very friendly or (b) very helpful. I would suggest hospitality training. Don't be fooled by the candid pics above you probably won't get the room that shows a duvet (that isn't the room we got), this hotel still uses bedspreads -- very unsanitary (anytime you get a room with a bedspread throw it in the corner immediately) they're a haven for bacteria. Otherwise, the bed was clean and comfortable. The bath, amenities, and towels were adequate though not luxurious. This is not a 5 star hotel or comparative to the Four Seasons though it did remind me of a Ritz Carlton. Our first room smelled like smoke but we were relocated quickly, our bill was overcharged for a mini bar item but was corrected and our room service order was wrong but also was corrected after a call. Park at St. Mary's if you are staying on the weekend it 's 1/5 the price of the $45 parking rate and catty corner to the hotel. Plan on paying for parking, it is San Francisco. We probably would not do a car if we stayed in the city again, it's too hard with the steep slopes and we are used to driving a lot. The hotel was clean and the location is off the beaten path a bit although still relatively close to everything. The rooms were really clean and the young man at check in was nice and helpful. We got a great price for the weekend so the hotel was well worth our price it but I sure wouldn't want to pay full price for my stay. I would defintely move up to higher end. hotel if I were paying listed rates. There is no view, it was of another building but that is to be expected in the city. Here are some other tips: We had a cheap great lunch at the mexican restaurant communal dining Mijita at the Ferry Building and parking was only $5 with validation, we enjoyed walking around the Ferry Building marketplace but skipped the touristy Fisherman's Wharf. We took the ferry to Sausalito and that was great. We walked from the hotel to the Fodor reccommended L'Osteria del Forno for dinner - it's less than a mile, go late or go early there is often a line but it is cash only, tiny but casual and we enjoyed the food. Great for the price.

Reviews.Title: “The Omni is awesome!”
Reviews.Author: FJOP
Reviews.Content: Great location, great room, great stay. The hotel is central to all the tourist activity. The room had a large comfortable bed with a nice desk and large bathroom. The staff was there to help with anything from the moment we walked into the hotel. I highly recommend this hotel for couples looking for a romantic weekend.

Reviews.Title: “A great hotel”
Reviews.Author: GalvestonJT
Reviews.Content: We recently spent four nights in this lovely hotel. The service is "happy to see you" wonderful. The doorman and desk clerk were friendly and helpful. Our room was clean and quiet. One morning, we ate in their small restaurant and the breakfast was teriffic. I recommend this hotel without reservation!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel, Service, and Location”
Reviews.Author: TripManSaltLakeCity
Reviews.Content: I had a overnight flight from Hawaii and arrived at the hotel at 09:00 AM. I had a coupon from the Select Guest Program that enabled me to pay half price on a weekend and get an upgrade. The front desk representitave, Joey Nubla, checked my reservation and saw that my birthday was coming up. He then graciously upgraded me to a suite that was available and later sent a bottle of wine. The suite was large and first class with all the amenties that I have come to expect from Omni. I have stayed in many of there properties, almost always got a complimentary upgrade, and have been very satsified with the accomodations and service. Sincerely, Brent V. Marrott

Reviews.Title: “Not bad at all”
Reviews.Author: HammockDweller
Reviews.Content: I spent 8 nights at the Omni when attending a conference in San Francisco. The hotel's location is fantastic, bang in the middle of town without some of the grime associated with Union Square. The public areas and reception are clean and smart. The room was comfortable and quiet (courtyard rooms are quiet but with a view of the neighbouring office block), but very plain - nothing in there to denote it as special in any way. The service, however, was very good indeed - bright and attentive staff at every level from housekeeping to management. Room service food was fantastic, although for the most part I got take-aways from neighbouring Chinatown. I'll certainly use the Omni again.

Reviews.Title: “Dont be put off by it not being on Market St or in Union Square”
Reviews.Author: DonnieDarker
Reviews.Content: A lot of reviews of this fabulous hotel say its in a quiet part of town (financial district) and coming from London you imagine this means that you'll need a taxi to get anwhere and the area will be quite eerie. WRONG. If you have a pair of legs and can walk you can be on Market St/Union Square in 5-10 minutes. I'm used to big busy cities and there is nothing worse than staying in the throbbing throng with all the tourists. For this reason the location of the Omni is a real bonus. Far from the madding crowd but no so far to be any kind of inconvenience. It is true that most of the guests seem to be there on business but its no problem. Dont eat there if you dont want to hear suits talk turkey. Go out and enjoy the many fanatsic restaurants in San Fran instead. TIPS: Join the SelectGuest programme (a kind of clubcard membership) for free in adavnce and then you get a free paper and drink delivered to your room every morning at a time you specify. You also get the option of ordering light breakfast items at an extremely reasonbale rate. (cream cheese toatsted bage was about $3 or Â£1.50). The gym is stocked with complimentary water and fresh(ish) fruit. 'Nuff said on that one! Free internet service in the lobby. If noise bothers you stay as high up as possible. (on the 5th you can hear the tram bells, on the 13th you can hear nothing). You can buy your MUNI passes from the fornt desk at their face value. If travelling without too much luggage do yourself a favour at SFO and use the BART rather than pay for a taxi. A jounrey on the BART is only $5.15 and the walk from Montgomery Station is less than 10 minutes. The BART was very safe and clean. ROOMS: Look nicer than they appear in the photos. They're quite dark which is why the photos dont do them justice. It's all very faux-Georgian but tastefully done. Bathrooms are classy too. Not enormous amounts of storage but enough. Avoid the mini-bar. SERVICE: Front-desk and doormen were superb. Extremely friendly and helpful. Nothing was too much trouble. Room service was extremely punctual with the selectguest drinks delivery. (you book a 15 minute slot and they there on the button every time). A Maitre D at Bobs steakhouse (attached to the Omni) was a bit stuffy but thats not their problem. Remember its mainly business people eating or using the bar there so I would avoid. LOCATION: You're in the business district but this does mean the area is well served by espresso bars, jamba juice and diners for workers. Also, a tram stops outide the hotel which is handy. You can walk most places very easily or use your MUNI pass for the transport.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location for Family vist to Chinese New Year”
Reviews.Author: Gemma'smum
Reviews.Content: We were thoroughly pleased with our stay at the Omni. We had adjoining rooms (a King and a double) and were assistd at every turn by Omnii staff. We have stayed in more than a dozen hotels in S.F. (St. Francis, the Palace, the Milano, Hyatts, Mariott, Sir Francis Drake, Kensington Park etc.) over the years and this was definately among the best. Many hotels will have nice lobbies, but have very ordinary rooms . The Omni had beautifully furnished luxurious rooms with every imaginable amenitiy. I would recommend it to anyone. As San Francisco is developing more and more to the east of Union Square, restaurants, shopping and attractions are near the Financial District location of the Omni. Plus, the California Cable Car line is right outside. We were in S.F. for the Chinese New Year Parade (a block away), Prom Dress Shopping, (5 min walk) and to attend an event at MoMA (10 minute walk). Nearby Belden Place offers some of San Franciscos best restaurants and a truly european bistro experience, that is entirely family friendly. We had dinner at Brindisi. Make reservations for weekends at any S.F. restaurant.. The hotel valet parking is $45 , high even for San Francisco. However, around the corner on Kearny is a 24 hour city parking lot with security. A bargain. If you join the Omni's "club" before your stay, you also get real pampering including morning coffee delivered to your door with the paper and free internet. We loved it!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, good location”
Reviews.Author: Jezza1
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Omni for three nights in February. A very high quality hotel, located 5-10 mins cab ride from Union Square. Although its in the business district, and so the local area is really quiet / closed at the weekend, there are some really nice restaurants about 2 mins walk away - just ask at reception for recommendations. Rooms are lovely - very clean, spacious, big bed, very quiet etc.. Some great touches like free internet access in Business Centre, free hot chocolate by the lifts - the mark of a really customer orientated hotel. The only downside is the poor choice of healthy meals in the bar - but as there are some nice restaurants nearby not really a major problem. Much better value for a weekend stay than the hotels in the tourist traps at Fisherman's Wharf. Another TripAdvisor winner!

Reviews.Title: “Heart of San Francisco”
Reviews.Author: PAtravelers
Reviews.Content: Our family of 3 adults stayed at the Omni for a long weekend last summer. The room was a good size for us with great amenities. As noted by other reviewers, the staff was very helpful. If returning to San Francisco, we would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Lvv2trvl
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at this hotel before, and there was a reason I returned. This time the valet guys weren't as attentive, and one of the guys actually slammed the door on me to help another guest, a total over sight on his part, but nonetheless, a little annoying since my roller bag got caught in the door, and I almost fell. But as soon as I entered the hotel, again your breath is taken away by the gorgeous, ornate lobby....really quite exquisite. The rooms are always quiet, clean and beautifully appointed. Only thing is if you stay during the weekend, there are not a lot of places walking distance to eat. Everything is closed on weekends since it is in the business district. However, we did find some, If you want a real unique lunch, definitely try out the over 150 yr old establishment called the Tadich Grill...great food, and all the waiters are all men over 45/50 yrs. who wear white coats, and who are very entertaining. For lunch they have a $11 minimum per person. Another top restaurant is Aqua, walking distance, but make reservations early, and you are looking at a $75/pp prefixe menu, but this place is a rage right now.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful, luxury, no complaints”
Reviews.Author: m0thily
Reviews.Content: What a beautiful hotel... It was in the perfect location (4 blocks from BART, short walk from Union Square and Westfield/SF Centre), but reasonably quiet and not crowded with the usual tourist throngs. The check-in process was seamless and cheerful, and the door staff was pleasant and helpful. If you're thoughtless enough to have brought a car, as I did, be warned that valet parking is expensive (we were charged $45/day plus city tax) and the nearby garages were full on a weekday afternoon. To their credit, the staffers were upfront about the price and didn't charge us extra, even though we left the car there for more than 24 hours. The room was well-appointed and luxurious, with a nice, clean bathroom, bathrobes and linens. One minor complaint we had was the quality of the bedding... my mattress was sagging on one side, and my friend's pillows were very "lumpy." The mattresses and pillows seemed to be in need of replacement, in general. But it wasn't bad enough for us to switch rooms or ask for new pillows. We might've been upset if we had to pay a lot (say $250+/night) for our stay, but we got a deal, so... just something to keep in mind if you're expecting pure perfection and paying rack rates. In all, we were very happy with the hotel and would definitely recommend it and stay here again if the price is right next time.

Reviews.Title: “Magnificent and Wonderful ...”
Reviews.Author: Unbiased&FairAdvisor
Reviews.Content: An absolute gem! 4-Star, 1st Class Wonderful Hotel !! Superb staff with friendly royal welcome and greetings, each and every time we entered or exited hotel ...and we were not even royalty !! The service was world class, in very well-appointed rooms. Rooms were of classic decor...spotless and pristine, with comfortable bed, robes, in-room safe, nice toiletries, and ample lighting. The location is quiet at nite, given near financial district, but still very convenient via walk, cab, or even famous cable-car right in front, to anywhere in SF !!! All requests made with the hotel were met without hesitation and perfection by the obviously well-trained, friendly staff. Must stay here when in town !!!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful experience at the Omni”
Reviews.Author: RD13
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a two night weekend stay at the Omni. We stayed there based upon TripAdvisor reviews and couldn't have been happier. Everything was as expected and more. From the attentive, friendly service of the staff to the comfortable, clean room, it was all perfect. We signed up for the Select Guest program when we arrived and had free coffee and newspaper delivered to our room at the time we requested. This was a really nice extra touch. The hotel is in a great location to walk to most of the main attractions in downtown San Francisco. We will definitely stay at the Omni again when we return to San Francisco.
