Reviews.Title: “Great Time at Omni in San Francisco”
Reviews.Author: pantherfan1
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Omni in San Fran on 12/25 and 12/31 (spent time in wine country in between), and we had a lovely time. We purchased the Wrap Yourself in Luxury package which included free valet parking, 2 glasses of champagne at the bar, and a discount coupon for Macy's. We also used an upgrade coupon that we received for being Select Guests, so we upgraded to a bay view room on the very top floor. We have always found the Select Guest program to be very beneficial. As we were getting ready to go out for New Years Eve, there was a knock at the door. The Omni had sent us a bottle of champagne on ice, accompanied by 6 large chocolate-covered strawberries. What a nice surprise. My husband and I haved stayed in several Omni hotels, for both business and personal travel and we've never been disappointed by the accommodations or staff. We will definitely stay at the Omni in San Francisco again. Great hotel, attentive staff, and convenient location.

Reviews.Title: “Omni style and service!”
Reviews.Author: 101travelers
Reviews.Content: We spent two nights at the Omni after Christmas. Having stayed at the Omni San Diego, I was curious to see if the San Francisco hotel was deserving of its #1 rating by TripAdvisor reviewers. I booked directly through the Omni website and the $199 Park and Play offer included parking and a superior room. Having paid approximately $48 a night for parking at a hotel in the Union Square area, this seemed a great deal. As a Select Guest, registration info is on file and so you basically walk up to the desk and receive your room card. I had requested and received a front-facing (California St) room on a high floor. The lobby area was beautifully decorated and complimentary hot cider and cookies were available. The bed was extremely comfortable, as was the large armchair with ottoman. The room is tastefully decorated with a large work desk, many lamps, Bose radio and armoire with television/coffee service/mini-bar and large drawers for clothing. The large closet has a safe and bathrobes. The bathroom was large with a huge shower/tub with great water pressure. Large make-up mirror, too. As mentioned, Select Guest program will get you beverages and a newspaper, delivered at the time you designate. Some breakfast items offered to SGs at $2-4 such as bagels, muffins or breakfast burrito. Great prices! More extensive menu available through room service. This is one of the few hotels that delivers a large carafe of coffee if that is your selected beverage. Bagels come toasted, wrapped in a cloth napkin and with cream cheese and an assortment of fruit preserves. The steakhouse restaurant has very good food- a variety of soups, salads and sandwiches were on lunch menu. Prices a bit high but not out of line for SF restaurants. Staff very attentive. Hotel very quiet but the city, and Financial District in particular, have a low occupancy rate during the holiday period. This hotel is an excellent choice for business travellers.

Reviews.Title: “The Omni Gets It Right”
Reviews.Author: Daisy Larchmont
Reviews.Content: My 3-day New Year's getaway at the Omni SF reconfirmed my committment to this luxury hotel chain. I booked a 2-night stay via Expedia at an incredible rate, about $120 per night. I normally opt for affordablility over luxury, but sometimes you just want to be pampered and are willing to pay a little bit more. For those occasions, you can't go wrong with Omni. They understand the what a true luxury hotel experience is all about. At Omni, the customer is always right, and the customer's needs always come first. Case in point- my room key did not work upon check-in (they had given me a room that was still occupied, oops), and when I returned to the front desk, they upgraded me to a 2-room corner suite for my trouble, apologizing all the while. This was followed up with a personal note of apology from the front desk manager the next morning - and a fresh fruit basket in the afternoon, again gratis. The suite (room 920) was gorgeous, with a sitting room, 2 flat-screen TVs, and a DVD player. One of the nice things about staying in the Financial District is that it's very quiet at night - no sirens, ambulances, etc. I joined the Select Guest program several years ago. As others have noted, I highly recommended joining for the free perks. I enjoyed the complimentary beverages (choice of 2 - try the coffee and hot chocolate together!) and morning paper, and was pleasantly suprised to find that this Omni also offered Select Guests a range of reduced-price breakfast items along with the complimentary morning beverages. For $3.75 each, we ordered the breakfast burritos, which were hefty and delicious, served with fresh salsa. Imagine - a delicious room-service breakfast in SF for under $5! I stll can't quite understand how this place made money off my stay....I guess it all averages out in their favor. Stay here, you'll be glad you did.

Reviews.Title: “good choice”
Reviews.Author: Colorobo
Reviews.Content: Omni was a solid choice. Clean relatively spacious room. Upgraded to a "signature" room. Price was right for San Fran over new years. Wlaking distance to Chinatown, North Beach/Little Italy. A cable car runs in front of hotel up to Van Ness where there is a good movie theatre. Highlight of trip was walking tour of San Fran from Chinatown Alleyway Tours. They have a website and you book online. Also, if you like bookstores, City Lights is a must along with the new Cody's bookstore by Market St. Back to the hotel, a good choice/location, but nothing "fancy". Note: Cab from SFO airport should be about $35 to $40. Avoid the SuperShuttle unless you want to visit all the hotels in Union Sq.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay at the Omni”
Reviews.Author: BoulderMary
Reviews.Content: My family (4 of us including 2 teenagers) just spent 3 nights at the Omni. We really enjoyed the location--not among the throngs of tourists in Union Square or Fisherman's Wharf--between Chinatown and North Beach and minutes from the Ferry Building and all that it has to offer. The service at the Omni was extraordinary. Everyone was extremely helpful and kind. The room was nice--but not exceptional in anyway. I would definately stay here again based on the location and service.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel - Highly Recommended”
Reviews.Author: Marte8580
Reviews.Content: As usual, I left everything to the last minute and booked this hotel the day before I was due to stay. I got a really good deal on it (about Â£100 per night), I was a bit worried about the quality of the hotel, but it was the only decent one available. I was 100% pleased with this hotel. The rooms are very spacious and decorated very neutrally, really nice and relaxing. I booked a twin room with 2 queen sized beds. Staff are really nice, very willing to help. The hotel is on California street, only 10ish minute walk to union square and only a couple of blocks away from China Town. The Tram line runs directly out the front of the building so you can hop on and go to Fisherman's Wharf. Every evening when we returned to the hotel, room service turned down our beds, put relaxing music on the television and put a little Chocolate on our pillows that said "each day must end with a reward" (something along those lines). I couldnâ€™t have had a better stay in San Francisco and I couldnâ€™t recommend this hotel enough. I stayed in the Marriott for a few nights and the Omni beats it hands down.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Stay At The Omni”
Reviews.Author: Alpinestar
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Omni San Francisco over the Thanks Giving Holiday Weekend period and had a fabulous time. The service was faultless from our initial registration to the end of our stay. We were fortunate enough to receive an upgrade through the Select Guest Membership Scheme from a Deluxe Room to a Mini Suite which was fantastic. The staff were very friendly and helpful and the housekeeping was exceptional, I would highly recommend a stay at this hotel and as an aside, it is well worth taking the time to join the Select Guest Membership Programme.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Experience”
Reviews.Author: Boyrmyarmstired
Reviews.Content: From the moment we arrived in front of the building it was a perfect stay. Extremely friendly and welcoming lobby and quick check in service. I had called ahead and mentioned it was our honeymoon and waiting for us in the room was champagne and chocalate covered strawberries.....and let me tell you those were the best strawberries I ever tasted. The bed was super comfortable. The free internet hook-up worked great. Being a "Select Guest" (which is free) is key to get the newspaper and coffee delivered every morning at the time of your choosing. And for $4 we got the breakfast burritto both mornings. This is exactly how I like my hotel stays......its was the best. We did the Marriott San Fran later in our stay, which was nice but no where near as accomadating, comfortable, and personable.

Reviews.Title: “Ritz-like Hotel at Hilton Prices!!”
Reviews.Author: veroni2413
Reviews.Content: All I can say is WOW!!! We booked a one night stay at this hotel because we were going to be attending a wedding a few blocks away, and I am SO glad we did. I have never stayed at a hotel in that price range (we paid $189 for a Saturday night with our Entertainment discount), that treats their guests so incredibly well. It was true luxury.....robes in the room, evening turndown service (they made the bed while we went to the wedding and left mints on the pillow), morning newspaper, etc. The customer service was amazing, everyone in that hotel is ready to help you, and help you with a smile. I wasn't expecting much, as I said, because of the price we paid, so I was really floored. The location was great too, we were able to walk to Union Square China Town, and the Embarcadero....with Fisherman's Wharf being only a short cab ride away! We have stayed in our share of hotels in SF (Francis Drake, Hyatt, etc), but I will never stay in another hotel again when I visit SF!

Reviews.Title: “Can't wait to return”
Reviews.Author: Crookie
Reviews.Content: Fabulous hotel. After staying at this hotel I can't imagine staying anywhere else in SF. Rooms luxurious and despite the size of the hotel you would think you were alone.No noise from other hotel users. Enjoy.

Reviews.Title: “I used to love the Omni - but that's all over now!”
Reviews.Author: evening
Reviews.Content: If I hadnt stayed at the Omni San Francisco in the past, or had such wonderful service at the Marriott Baltimore Waterfront last week, maybe I'd feel differently about my recent stay at the Omni, but I will now find a new hotel for future visits to San Francisco. Yes, incidents are usually isolated, but I had a problem with the doormen upon arrival and departure (different guys), so feel comfortable stating that the service has deteriorated greatly. Not to mention - the pillows sucked! The so called feather pillow must have been stuffed with ping pong balls! I am not some princessy woman, but it is ridiculous that a woman travelling alone should be expected to remove her own huge bag from the back of a cab when arriving at a hotel of the caliber of the Omni. Especially while the doorman stands there commenting how the driver isnt a nice guy for not removing the bag. Then the bellman standing at the bottom of the steps watches you carry your bags down them instead of asking to help (or pointing out that the ramp to nowhere does eventually lead to the lobby). But the worst - was when I asked the doorman to call a cab for my return trip to the airport and he suggested I take the house car "for a couple of dollars more." Trusting the doorman at an Omni wouldnt scam me, I jumped in the house car. As soon as the driver told me the fee, I had to have him bring me back to the hotel! The cab from/to the airport was $27. The house car is $45. How would I justify that to my company??? I have to state the maid - Tina - was wonderful. I used to stay ONLY at Omnis when traveling to cities that had them - until 2004 when the receptionist at the New Orleans Omni made an innapropriate political comment when she transfered my call to voicemail. This return trip to the San Francisco Omni was probation. They failed miserably and I am done with the Omni.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful!”
Reviews.Author: Irien
Reviews.Content: Great location, beautiful building, fantastic service. Staff was effortlessly friendly and accommodating. Our room (the Marshall suite) was tasteful, comfortable, and large enough to comfortably entertain four of our friends who stopped by. My only advice for future guests is to try to get a room on one of the higher floors. We were on the 8th floor, but the street noise outside was still loud and clear. Bring a pair of earplugs, and your stay will be flawless.

Reviews.Title: “I left my heart in San Francisco”
Reviews.Author: Lola09
Reviews.Content: We loved the Omni Hotel, it was a clean, friendly hotel. The rooms where spacious and very well decorated. I have read reviews from others saying the rooms where shabby and had dirty carpets, all I can say is that we sore no evidence of this, some people are never happy, what more can I say!!!!!. Staff where friendly and helpful and never once pushed for a tip. The steaks are great in the Steak house within the hotel, but a little pricey, so I would shop around, there are loads a places to eat. The only thing I was'nt happy with was the bar area at night, because it was alwaysfull of people who worked in the Financial District who had finished work, and then gone into the hotel for a drink, leaving no room for paying guests from the hotel, we felt this should be addressed by the hotel. San Francisco is a lovely friendly city, and I have some great memorys that I will never ever forget, I would advice anyone to visit once in there lives, they would'nt regret it.

Reviews.Title: “A Fantastic Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Mad_Man_U_Fan
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for 5 nights as part of a two centre holiday. The service was excellent throughout. The room was large and airy and the bathroom was very spacious. The in room films were excellent and many have yet to come out in the cinema's in the UK. We recieved an upgraded room as I had registered to be a Select Guest on the hotel website the day before we travelled - I simply passed the email confirmation to the receptionist and we recieved all the benefits - well worth doing. The hotel is on the edge of Chinatown and a short work to Union Square. Highly recommeded!!! We will definately return.

Reviews.Title: “A lovely place to stay”
Reviews.Author: gary_martin5
Reviews.Content: Spent two weeks at the Omni and had a great time. The staff were always friendly and helpful especially Joey and Lucinda on the front desk. The hotel is in the financial district which can be quiet over the weekend but the easy access to the cable car and easy walking to Chinatown or Fishermans wharf outweigh this. There is a daily maid and turn down service and the only reason we have marked down was because they was no butter when we ordered room service for breakfast one day. Plus the hotel will only change $100 traveller's cheque per day. We were not impressed by the service offered by United Airlines. The flight attendants seemed more intent on making sure they got their sleep and disappeared for large chunks of the flight. As you are no longer allowed to take fluid on flights the amount of drinks offered was poor. I would have quite happily paid for a tea or coffee or even a water. I really got the impression that we were not going to be allowed to forget we were travelling economy class. I don't think we will be flying with them anymore and have donated our air miles to the American Red Cross.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel ,perfect location”
Reviews.Author: Gibso
Reviews.Content: I've just returned from a 5 night stay at the Omni and really if you want an excellent hotel in a great location this has to be your choice. The rooms are of a good size with large bathrooms and a walk in shower, i had a premier room which was an upgrade from a deluxe room which i paid for ,to recieve this uprade sign up to Omni Hotels signature program and you will recieve this for free as well as other benefits such as late check out. As all the other reviews state the staff are excellent, i travelled with my 2 year old daughter and all the staff made a fuss of her. As far as location goes to me this is in the best location in the city union square shopping is 10 mins walk in one direction and fishermans walf 20 mins in the other and north beach and chinatown on your doorstep, although there are plenty of buses ,cable cars and taxis if you want to take it easy. I booked with hotel connect a uk website which were Â£400 cheaper on my booking than any other website. Room service is expensive but breakfast in you room is nice, go on treat yourself ,your on holiday.

Reviews.Title: “Great beds!”
Reviews.Author: AlanSanDiego
Reviews.Content: Best beds I've ever had in a hotel. Very friendly staff; free Internet access in lobby; but $4.50 for a Coke from the room frig.

Reviews.Title: “If you have kids, don't stay anywhere else.”
Reviews.Author: lanh
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 4 days over the Labor Day holiday weekend, and we had an excellent experience. I booked directly through the hotel website so that I could make a special request for a crib, as well as give them my Select Guest number. When we arrived, the crib was already set up and waiting in our room for us, together with a handwritten note addressing us by name and welcoming us to the Omni. There were a few baby toiletries tucked away into the crib, as well. I do recommend applying for a Select Guest number (you can do this online) beforehand, as it entitles you to a few amenities including late checkout. If you do it well ahead of time, I think they might send you a 50% off coupon and free room upgrade, too -- this happens either a few weeks after you apply or else a little after your first stay. (I'm not sure which, as we registered and made our booking at the last minute.) You can also buy these coupons on ebay, and they're fully transferable. (It says so on the coupon.) This might be very worth your while if you're staying for several days. If we had known about the Omni ahead of time, we would have planned ahead to get this. You also get free morning beverages in your room for all the people staying -- 2 beverages per person. We had 2 adults and our two children (ages 3 and 1) and got coffee for 4 and orange juice for 4 every morning, for example. You need to remember to put the little Select Guest hang tag, which they give you with your key, on your door ahead of time to receive this. You will also get a morning paper (you choose which paper), as well as a scone-like cookies and milk every evening with your turndown service. The room is fairly standard for a hotel room but quite comfortable. The bed linens are good quality, and the bathrooms are very roomy and marble. Everything is spotless. I was surprised the towels were not softer -- they're thin and not very comfortable, but they're serviceable and clean. We did request a room upgrade if they were available, and I was disappointed not to be upgraded for free (they said I could pay an extra $100 for a suite), but I certainly wasn't entitled to this so that's fine. That is the only disappointment of our Omni experience, and it is extremely minor. We had two small children with us, and the Omni is fantastic for families with children. The kids got a great goodie bag with crayons, activity books, playing cards, and even a small digital clock that they could hang from their coats or suitcases. My 3 year old was delighted with the bag, and she can be a tough customer! You can also request a "Kids' Suitcase" from the front desk, and this is literally a small rolling suitcase full of things like an Etch a Sketch, electronic games device, card games like Go Fish and Old Maid, and several classic books (Goodnight Moon, some kids' chapter books). We had a babysitter coming in one night (not associated with the hotel) and found this suitcase extremely handy for the night we were away from the kids. You also are given free kids' straw cups that you can take down to the restaurant to have filled for free. We filled up with milk for the kids every morning and night, and they were fast and gracious about it even though we weren't staying for dinner or breakfast or anything. All the service people were wonderful (with the exception of one woman who was just a bit brusque working the front desk at night. She wasn't rude though, just minimally helpful). The doormen were great. Bell service was instantaneous when we called for it. I had to ask for housekeeping to clean up a spill once, and they came to the room within minutes. The doormen refused our tips. Oh -- and I was wary because I had read that the parking fee was $45 a day. When we pulled up, the valets asked us whether we preferred the $45 hotel parking or wanted to park ourselves at the garage a half-block away, for $7. There was no pressure at all, and they were not at all condescending. You can park at St Mary's Garage at the intersection of California and Kearny for $7 per in/out on holidays and weekends. It's very convenient, and the hotel told us about it themselves.

Reviews.Title: “I love this hotel!”
Reviews.Author: sista_mills
Reviews.Content: Just got back from a stay at the Omni. The rooms are so comfortable and clean. I stayed here for business 3 years ago, and the hotel is still just as beautiful as I remember it. Sometimes hotels seem to age quickly (dirtier carpets, dingier furniture on a subsequent visit), but the Omni was as nice as I remembered it. Food service was pleasantly delicious. It's a business hotel, so I think that rates go down on the weekend. Our rate was $189 for a standard room - a definite steal for a hotel that could be considered luxurious. [I've stayed at 5-star hotels, so this is not quite there, but a 4+]. We can't wait to go back!

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel I've stayed in.”
Reviews.Author: Jinty_C
Reviews.Content: Absolutely excellent hotel. We booked it having seen the good reviews on Tripadvisor and I was not at all disappointed. The location is great. Short walk to Chinatown and easily walkable to Union Square. With it being in the Financial District, there are is a huge choice of good places to eat - Belden Street being a fantastic tip by one of the staff at the hotel with a number of really good restaurants. Rooms were comfortable and large. Really nice little touches such as fluffy robes, turndown service with soothing scenery played on the tv, free internet service. Some street noise audible if you listened really hard - we were in a top floor room. Every single member of staff we talked to was extremely helpful and pleasant. They had all the information that we could possibly need available on request. They even sent on a full drawer full of clothes which we left behind. In summary, fantastic.

Reviews.Title: “Fab But A Bit Noisy”
Reviews.Author: Kebablover
Reviews.Content: The Omni lives up to all expectations. The majority of the visitors are business people and as such, expect a high standard of effficiency. The hotel is pure class. We booked a California suite and it was stunning. The only gripe is the traffic noise at night. The suites are positioned at the corner of the hotel on California St. The noise is generated by car tyres crossing the tram track. My wife is a light sleeper and on the second day of our visit we invested in some earplugs! I have to say that this would not deter us from staying again.

Reviews.Title: “Just Perfect.......”
Reviews.Author: TheresaPA
Reviews.Content: Location, Location, Location. We found this hotel quite lovely and extremely well kept. Check in staff, doorman, housekeeping were geniunely nice. This hotel is mere steps from Chinatown and just close enough to Union Square. Our trip was lovely...this hotel made it perfect.

Reviews.Title: “well above expectations”
Reviews.Author: wahine010
Reviews.Content: my husband booked this hotel at the end of our holiday on a company discount. it wasn't where i wanted to be but.... we were treated very well. although a buisness hotel it is only a few blocks away from union square and the shops. just far away enough from the tramps who spoil that district from evening onwards. it does not have the easy accesibility to restaurants that the waterfront hotels have but it does have class and for the children the hotel provided goody bags and milk and cookies every night. the cookies were lovely. it also has a wonderful restaurant, understated but fab steak, mash (smash) and creamed corn.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Fabulous Fabulous!”
Reviews.Author: misschriss
Reviews.Content: I have been to SF many times and recently stayed at the OMNI on a girls shopping weekend. Staff was exceptionally curteous, helpful, and always smiling! A true 5 Star experience. It was my mother's birthday weekend and on our first night we were greeted by complimentary champagne and chocolates! Very comfy beds! Lovely marble bathrooms and lots of mirrors throughout. Great home base for city exploration. Safe place for women traveling. Staff has great suggestions for breakfast lunch and dinner spots. Quiet on the weekends because it's in the financial district, but an easy trolley, cab ride or 5-10 minute walk to dining, shopping, and sites. Trolley does run in front of the OMNI however the actual trolley stop is down a couple blocks (small blocks). Keep in mind that SF is not a particularly large city (area wise) and cab fare is very reasonable. Cabs are plentiful day and late night. We opted for cabs often rather that waiting at trolley stops only to be passed by because they were full of passengers. We will DEFINATELY stay at the Omni again. I tipped the bell hops and other appropriate staff but never felt obligated to do so.

Reviews.Title: “faultless service with a smile”
Reviews.Author: philipellis
Reviews.Content: my wife and I stayed at the SF Omni for 4 nights early august. on arrival, we were a little deflated because we had travelled from one of the uber-casino-hotels in vegas, but (back on planet earth after vegas!) the omni quickly won us over with its always pleasant staff, its cleanliness and (in our opinion and not withstanding other comments) its location. our room was on the 17th floor, with OK views. the room itself was fairly standard, of average size with an acceptable ensuite. the main factor in any room is its cleanliness, and here the omni was perfect: clean bedding, towels and surfaces made us warm to the hotel immediately. check in staff were pleasant and efficient, and full of tips about where to go and how to get there. its only a 7 buck taxi down to the piers, and a quick cable car ride to union square. its also possible to walk back to the hotel from union square because much of the walk is downhill; its an arduous journey the other way! china town is literally on the hotel doorstep; step out, turn right, walk one block and you're there. san francisco is great and a visit to alcatraz a must - although you have to pre-book - don't wait 'til you arrive. we got a town car from the hotel back to the airport - the same price as the taxi on the inward leg but much comfier and a nicer drive. maybe the hotel could send a car to the airport to pick you up - its certainly worth enquiring 'cos some of the SF cab drivers are not the best we've ever met! 10/10 for the omni - it deserves its high standing on trip advisor.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Frosty53
Reviews.Content: Thanks for the great ideas I got from your site - we had a brilliant holiday in the U.S. I've travelled extensively over the past 35 years and lived in 6 countries - the Omni in Frisco is my new favourite hotel- it was worth every penny - they got the little things so right and were charming and helpful hosts - the room was spotless and well appointed and the location is good. Really - I was so impressed I wouldn't dream of staying anywhere else (and it's not just for oldies my teenage daughter was also impressed)

Reviews.Title: “Clean, comfortable, well maintained and well appointed”
Reviews.Author: sunsetreview
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Omni SF and found the hotel to be extremly well ran. We plan to take future trips to SF so we stopped at other hotels to compare and contrast. In general we found that the Omni was much better maintained and cleaner than most both in the common ares as well as the rooms. The Omni has a modest gym with no pool. The hotel does'nt have alot to do there, Its not the type of hotel or resort where you check in and never leave till it's time to leave. Across the street is the B of A building at the top some 60/70 floors up at the very top is the Carnelian Room a bar and resteraunt. I recommend it for drinks only. The view of the Bay is most impressive (Bring a Camera). The drinks and service is on the weak side. If you're doing business in the Financal area looking for a hotel that's near the many sites, you'll find this hotel to be a good choice. Go without a rental car and take the public transportation or a taxi, all in front and easy to axis. Complements to the bus and cable car drivers. There very imformatiive and egar to help.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful but not a good location”
Reviews.Author: kd2006
Reviews.Content: The reviews on here were so good, I had to see for myself. It really is as great as everyone says! The beds are so comfortable and the rooms are decorated beautifully. The bathroom is large and they even give you an iron, a scale, q-tips, and cotton swabs! The maid even leaves a little note welcoming you. It was so wonderful having a scone with milk sitting there waiting for us before we went to bed. The service is wonderful. However, there is a downside - the location. The Omni is located in the Financial District and it is very difficult to find places to eat (unless you want Chinese food). It was Sunday night at 7PM and we walked around for at least an hour looking for a place to eat. We searched and even the nearby McDonald's was closed. We finally asked the person at the front desk who showed us where somewhere to eat was but it was closed. The Omni is also not close to many of the sights but the Cable Car stops right in front of the hotel. The food at Bob's had big, bland, and overpriced portions (in my opinion). Four shrimps with the shrimp cocktail for $15. Parking is $45 a night but you can come and go as you please.

Reviews.Title: “Great Staff”
Reviews.Author: T-bar
Reviews.Content: Here's just an example of Omni's service: Two of us stayed at the Omni to end a weeklong trip in northern CA. We arrived in a rental car on a busy, rainy Friday afternoon. Our plan was to check in, then drop the car at the airport and return on the train. Bags were unloaded and check-in was smooth and painless. On the way to the airport we realized that neither of us told the bell staff our names or what room we were staying in -- we both thought the other had done it. Our bags were on a cart in the lobby. I figured a 1-star hotel would leave the bags where they were, a 3-star hotel would put them aside somewhere and leave us to get them when we returned (this would have been fine in my book), and a 5-star hotel would check the bag tags, check with the front desk for our names, and have them in the room by the time we returned. Of course the bags were waiting for us in the room, and it was a great worry-free start to a wonderful weekend at the Omni.

Reviews.Title: “Good, but something... was... hmmm....”
Reviews.Author: Leesf
Reviews.Content: I have to admit, I had a great rate for my stay at the Omni and I wonder if that is the reason for my experience. Great front desk staff, maid service was good, but my room... I walked in the room and the first thing I noticed were stains on the carpet. Normally, this doesn't bother me at all, so I ignored them. Then I noticed another larger stain in front of my window, as if someone had spilled something and it settled into the carpet. Again, I ignored it, thinking I was just being picky. Later that night, I tripped a little bit on a piece of carpet that had been pulled up as I was walking into the bathroom. I know this sounds silly, but by this time I was thinking... what is going on here? I would come back to stay at the Omni, but I have a feeling that it will need some upgrades to the rooms, soon.

Reviews.Title: “Excelent experience”
Reviews.Author: indianavisitor
Reviews.Content: Well desrving of its four-star rating. Excellent accommodations and service, friendly staff. My only quibble is the lack of grab bars for the disabled in the bathroom and the lack of a bathroom night light. Yes, you can hear the cable cars from your room, but that's part of SF's "charm."

Reviews.Title: “The Omni is superb!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Our family of four stayed 3 nights at this lovely hotel on our return from Hawaii earlier this week. I must say the hotel's location is excellent, as we had easy access to outstanding shopping, china town & fisherman's wharf. Our purpose was to visit wine country and felt the Omni's location gave us great access not only to a quick trip to wine country but to some great San Francisco sights. The service was superb, as all were very friendly & accomodating. Our room was beautiful and very comfortable. I would highly recommend this hotel to anyone and look forward to another stay at this first class OMNI!

Reviews.Title: “reasonable for a conference”
Reviews.Author: lasfloras
Reviews.Content: I stayed here 2 summers ago, and while it was a good location, near chinatown, on a trolley stop, not far from other stuff, I found that the Grand Hyatt on Stockton, where I stayed last month was a much more hip and fun location at Union Square.

Reviews.Title: “Unbelievable Service!!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My husband and I (and our four month old baby) just stayed here at the Omni June 25-27. We were absolutely amazed at the level of service here - from every single employee. They all seem to be happy, they all seem to love their jobs! (I mean, TELLING employees to act this way is one thing, but how many places can boast that every single employee does it? Not even Disney can say that.) They even remembered us by name! The bellmen are top notch. The food in the restaurant is wonderful, and the atmosphere is rich. The hotel rooms are spacious and sumptuous, with every possible creature comfort taken care of. The ONLY criticism my husband and I had were the mattresses...... they seemed to slant up at the feet, making sleep a bit uncomfortable. But, like I said - we have a four month old, so what do we know about sleep? The hotel is wonderfully situated, close to everything - but not too close. We highly, highly recomment this hotel to anyone looking to be pampered. We couldn't possibly come back quickly enough. (I especially loved the attention paid to our baby...)

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: rtpac
Reviews.Content: Wow! What an awesome hotel! The good reviews are true! We booked this hotel for four nights after reading all of the great reviews on this site. All were right on! Where do I start? Check in was a breeze. We had joined Select Guest and received coupons in the mail for an upgrade and 50% off our weekend days....all of which were honored. We stayed in a Premier room on the 17th (top) floor. We had floor to ceiling windows with a great view of the bay. The room was very clean, bed very comfortable and even a note from the housekeeper! The bathroom was a good size with a large enough (and clean enough!) tub to take a bath. They include bath salts in the amenities which was a treat. With Select Guest membership we also received coffee and choice of a second beverage every morning. You pick the time and they leave it at your door or bring it in and set it up if you want. Hot coffee at our door every morning right when we wanted it was a real treat. The staff there are all excellent. Everyone made us feel at home and anticipated our needs. There was always a staff member near the elevator to answer questions on your way out the door. A doorman was always present and even got us a car service back to the airport at a great price. Location was very close to Chinatown and an easy (no hills....15 min) walk to the Moscone convetion center. Probably 10 mins to Union Square. Many thanks to all the staff of the SF Omni.....we will stay there, without question, when in SF again!

Reviews.Title: “Best Hotel Ever!!!”
Reviews.Author: westcoastd
Reviews.Content: We stayed from June 6th through the 10th. We arrived early, our Signature Room was not ready, but the front desk person (Carmen) quickly found us another room that was available. We attempted to tip Carmen for her efforts, but she declined. Adam escorted us and our bags to the room. The room (1623) was very clean, and quite beautiful. On our second day we received a voice mail message from Anna (General Managers Office) inviting us to attend the Select Guest reception. At the reception we met the General Manager, Bob Graney, we enjoyed talking with him, and if you are a Select Guest with Omni Hotels we recommend attending this reception. We were amazed that he (Bob) know his staff by name, and knows them personally. Speaking of the staff we would like to say that others who deserve recognition include: Sandra/Room Service, Martha/Room Service, Hugo, and Barney at the front door, and there were also several valets that were wonderful as well. The are many wonderful services that should be mentioned are free WiFi in your room, and free Fitness Room access (24 hours) we also loved the fruit, and water that was refreshed in our room daily. Once again we would return to the hotel in a heartbeat!!!

Reviews.Title: “A most comfortable stay”
Reviews.Author: Fleetcat
Reviews.Content: After flying from the UK we selected the Omni for 5 nights to recover from jet lag and enjoy San Francisco. Can only reiterate what everybody else says - excellent. Room service burger was second to none and staff could not do enough for us. Being picky did not eat at the restaurant as it was a bit lacking in atmosphere compared to the competition - however concierge recommendations were first class and within a 5 minute walk. Most important thing however was a supremely comfortable bed !!

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Faboulous!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My frien And me stayed in the Omni for a long weekend and we had the time of our lives. The staff and managers couldn't be more helpfull . One of the managers even show us the hotel . The room was spotless and the maids were always taking care off anything we needed. I highly recomend this hotel to anyone. And I'm sure I will be back there soon.

Reviews.Title: “Just the best hotel in San Francisco!”
Reviews.Author: Denver-Rosie
Reviews.Content: For the last three years, I have stayed at the Omni on business at least 3 or 4 times a year. The Omni just keeps getting better. The Service is amazing, room service is always excellent, newspapers at the door, internet service reliable and fast, the hotel staff from the front desk to the waiter to the cleaning staff - are cheerful reliable and extremely well trained. Friends tell me about "new" hotels in San Francisco and I'm ashamed to say that I have strayed once or twice - NEVER again. The Omni is by far simply the best hotel in San Francisco.

Reviews.Title: “AMAZING”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This hotel is simply amazing. It is so beautiful and the employees were not only helpful but genuinely nice. The bar and restaurant are first rate. You must try the spinach salad, it's phenomenal. The rooms are spacious and elegantly appointed. This is a very posh hotel, but everyone is very down to earth so don't feel intimidated. I would HIGHLY recommend this and would defintely stay here again. 5 stars!

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Omni”
Reviews.Author: delaine
Reviews.Content: Hi, my husband and I stayed at the Omni overnight in mid-May. Our room was lovely and clean. I am a real stickler for cleanliness and was more than happy with their housekeeping. There were plenty of towels and the bathroom was huge. Will most definitely stay there on our next visit to beautiful San Franciso. We were there on a Saturday evening, and unlike another reviewer, we did not even notice that the vicinity surrounding the Omni was particularly quiet. We are in our late 50's and walked all through Chinatown to North Beach for dinnner and back again, returning after 11pm. Area felt very safe and we enjoyed the walk after our dinner. All of the staff we dealt with, front desk, doormen and parking valets were very courteous and efficient. The parking charge for your vehicle could make you weep though. We know better than to take a car into San Francisco but were forced to do so by circumstances. We were given a late check-out with absolutely no hesitation and the bellman kept our luggage for a few hours after that. We were so very pleased with our stay at the Omni. I will add that this was our fourth time in San Francisco and I think we enjoyed it even more this time.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The Omni in San Francisco is awesome. The people were really great as soon as we walked in the door. We arrived early thinking that we would have to ask them to hold our bags until the room was ready, but instead, the room was ready and they even took the time to move us to a more desirable floor with a view of California street. The room was very clean with everything we would have wanted. I won't stay anywhere else when I'm in San Francisco.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Omni for 6 nights. The staff were extremely friendly and helpful. The room was clean and bright with a really nice marble bathroom. The hotel is located a few blocks from Unions Square in the Financial District which is busy during working hours but ghostly quiet at night. All the immediate shops close after 6pm and at weekends. We registered for the Select Guest programme on the Omni hotels website, this entilted you to a free beverage in the morning with your newspaper and also late checkout, which was great!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Customer Service”
Reviews.Author: rakawa
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Omni April 19-25. The customer service was exemplary. The hotel is within walking distance of most things, many good restaurants, etc. Complimentary morning beverage service and choice of USA Today, Wall Street Journal and/or local newspaper each morning was awesome.

Reviews.Title: “Childrens fantasy suite was excellent”
Reviews.Author: Tony_No
Reviews.Content: Spent 4 nights here with wife and 2 small children. It was delightful. We stayed in the "kids fantasy suite". This suite (only 1 in the hotel) is not bookable on the internet, only by phone and consists of 2 adjoining bedrooms one of which has had all adult furniture removed and replaced with kids furniture.. bunk beds, soft toys, games, bean bags, posters etc. It was the perfect place to be after 11 hour flight from London. The children loved it. The adult room was very nicely decorated and comfortable. The staff also provided goodie bags for the children on arrival which was a nice touch. We found the hotel to be very quiet and the soundproofing excellent. Front desk staff were very helpful. The location was good also. 10 minutes walk from downtown shopping areas, 5 minutes from Chinatown and convenient for all the trams. One tip; it is worth joining the Omni frequent guest program before you reserve; it entitles you to a later check out and free breakfast drink and newspaper delivered to your room. I'd thoroughly recommend it

Reviews.Title: “loved the omni”
Reviews.Author: coasttocoast
Reviews.Content: stayed at the omni for our spring break trip. beautiful hotel, comfortable room, great customer service. they couldn't do enough for you from the front desk to the maid service to the doormen. only disappointment was our dinner sunday night at bob's steakhouse. i've had better steaks at a chain restaurant for a lot less.

Reviews.Title: “A Grand Hotel in the San Francisco Tradition!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I booked a room at the Omni through Hotwire for two nights last month. Staff was helpful and friendly, the room was big for SF, and the bathroom tops! Everything you'd expect in a five star hotel. Great place to unwind before a ten day cruise, quiet enough so that with the windows closed I couldn't hear traffic or cable car bells' clanging. Some top restaurants within walking distance; be adventurous! Formerly a bank's corporate hq., the building was gutted down to the girders inside, and the outside restored to its original classic look.

Reviews.Title: “World Class hotel”
Reviews.Author: jenagar
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Omni for the weekend and left very happy...Location is great since Union square is four blocks south, chinatown is one block away, better than being smack in the middle of touristy Union square. The building is newly built with larger than average rooms for San Francisco. All rooms and public areas are clean and perfectly maintained. The lobby is gorgeous with beautiful flower arrangements and the staff are very attentive and helpful. In-room movie viewing is pricey, though; $10 to watch movies they have at blockbuster! Will be back again.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic!!!!”
Reviews.Author: islandgrrrl
Reviews.Content: The Omni was incredible, we had a fabulous time! The service was superior, the room was excellent and the location right next to China town was wonderful! The OMNI SF is a MUST!!!! Can't wait to go back!

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Beautiful Room”
Reviews.Author: Phunky
Reviews.Content: I stayed at The San Francisco Omni in January during a business trip. I had heard that this chain was good, but my expectations were not high enough. This place was very nice, and because I was a Select Guest (SG) they upgraded my room to a bigger one. Very nice! Positives: Location right on California Street provides a short trolley ride up to Chinatown. Actually, you can walk to just about anywhere in SF, so ride the $5 trolley only if you have to. The room was great, and the bed was incredibly comfortable. The bathroom was huge (upgraded room), and they had free high-speed internet. Negatives: The staff was a bit pretentious. I work in IT and at the time I didn't have to wear a suit and tie like most of the business travellers there. The bellmen would open the door for anyone walking up, but they would just look me up and down like I didn't belong. I learned to take the side entrance on Montgomery so I could skip that whole uncomfortable feeling. The onsite steakhouse is average at best. The glazed carrot that they serve with every steak oozed it's glazing onto my steak. Not the best taste combo. For weekend travel you might find a better place to stay. The Omni is in the Financial District, so a lot of stuff is closed during the weekend. However, you can walk anywhere, even, but it might take a little bit longer to get to the other parts of the city. I really enjoyed my stay at The San Francisco Omni, and I would stay there again. It was a terrific room.

Reviews.Title: “A Quiet Oasis”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Even though we live in the East Bay, we like to play tourist in San Francisco. Discovered The Omni while participating in the annual "Dine About Town" this past January. From the moment we walked in the door, we were transported to another era. Loved walking EVERYWHERE...Ferry Building (and the Saturday Farmer's Market), Red's Java Hut, a walk to SBC Park, SOMA, The Irish Bank, ending a full day at Bimbo's 365 Club for a fabulous concert, and of course a walk back "home". Have and will continue to recommend The Omni to everyone!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel remote location unless in town on business...”
Reviews.Author: Nalrud
Reviews.Content: Omni Hotel in San Fran... is beautiful however it is a bit remote if you are not in town for business. During weekdays you are in a bustling business district full of places to eat, have coffee or people watch however during evening hours and especially on weekends the area is quite empty. On Sunday morning we stopped by 3 different starbucks stores that are located in the 2 blocks radius of the hotel until we found one (4th) that was open and that one obviously had a line outside... The staff at the hotel is very accommodating. The hotel lobby is stunning and the room was lovely, a walk-in closet was a plus. No complains about large windows or spaciousness of the room however the bath while quite nice and clean, lacked a hand shower or a flexible enough top shower where you can point it to the wall when needed. A squeaky pocket door separating the room from the bath was not the best either but that is an easy fix (call the staff resolved in minutes)... Overall, very nice hotel however if you are in San Fran... for pleasure pick a different area...

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, good location”
Reviews.Author: DnKCumbria_England
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from San Francisco and we spent 3 of our nights in the Omni. It is an excellent hotel, very clean and with very helpful staff. The location is also very good, within the financial district and right outside is the California Street tramline. This line did not appear to be used as much as the Powell/Hyde and Powell/Mason lines which made jumping on and off very easy. Our only minor gripe is the bar, we thought it was little pricey, $14 for a glass of wine. But, all in all we had a great stay here and would definately return.It's easy to see why it is number 3 on the rankings.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulos Luxury Resort”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I had an excelent stay at the Omni. The room was on the thirteenth floor and was actually named. My only complaint was the rooms were to yellow.The rooms were spatious and warm and the TV shows a lot of great channels. The only thing is they don't have many channels.Again I say I had a great experience at the Omni.

Reviews.Title: “Abosultely Excellent”
Reviews.Author: Becky139
Reviews.Content: This hotel exceeded my expectations. It has a great location. We could walk to Chinatown, the shopping district, and many other places. They have a wonderful lobby and the doormen are excellent. The concierge was amazing and went out of their way to help us. The room was also great. It was spacious and the bathroom was great. I would reconmend this hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Exceeded my expectations”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This hotel was excellent. The location was great! You literally are right in between Chinatown and fishermanâ€™s wharf! There is a trolley stop right in front of the hotel and a subway across the street. The service was wonderful and the rooms overwhelmingly exceeded my expectations. There room service is ok, but like any hotel they way overcharge you for food and water. There is a Walgreenâ€™s a block down Montgomery street and you can get a six pack of water or one large water for about 1/3 the price. The concierge was excellent and very helpful. Defiantly buy the Muni pass they offer it WILL save you a lot of money! My husband and I are just average people and we thought that since this was the Omni that maybe we would be treated poorly but not at all. We received excellent treatment. When my husband and I return to SF we will defiantly stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Omni is the BEST”
Reviews.Author: RealtiyCheck
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Omni on Dec. 22-24 with hubby and two small kids. Service was great from the get go. My kids were delighted on receiving goody bags filled with toys and candies upon arrival. We were there on our anniversary and noted that on our reservation. When we arrived in our room, we had champagne and chocolate covered stawberries (and lots of it) waiting for us. Very, very nice. They really went out of their way to make our stay enjoyable. This was truly the best hotel experience I or my husband have ever had. I did not have a single complaint during my entire stay. I will definitely stay there again next time I'm in SF.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent stay at the Omni!”
Reviews.Author: Chicamundo
Reviews.Content: What a great hotel! I booked this hotel for one night using Priceline. I asked for a four star hotel for 75.00, and it was confirmed within minutes! The hotel website shows their rack rate rooms at 245.00 a night. Beautiful room, with bathrobes in the closet, Huge bathroom and the most heavenly beds! I would recommend this hotel to anyone wanting a luxury room at a very low price!!!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: JJQuick
Reviews.Content: We've had great experiences at Omni Hotels. Why change when we've always had great experiences in different cities. This hotel had what I expected. A beautiful room, it was nicely furnished and was a good size. We arrived at the hotel before check in time and the staff offered to hold our luggage so we could begin exploring San Fran. We were able to check in later on. We were within a 5 minute walk to Chinatown and the cable cars went directly in front of the Omni. Top notch hotel. Highly recommended. We would stay here again if we visited again.

Reviews.Title: “great service”
Reviews.Author: pants8
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I ran away from Christmas this year and stayed at the omni for 4 nights. we stayed at the W when we were in San Francisco in October and even though the Omni isn't as stylish the service is better by far. Every thing with our room was great until the 3rd night when we got new neighbours, it was an adjoining suite so the sound and the cigarettes escaped over to our side. We still aren't sure if they were supposed to be smoking in there or not...anyhow the staff were great, they moved us to another room, no problem, and even sent us a little bottle of wine with our room service christmas dinner. Christmas dinner room service was burgers and beer which were delicious. My only service complaint actually happened that same day - after wandering around in the rain all day we stopped in the bar for a cocktail before going up to our room, but we never did get served, not even a hello or "i'll be right with you", nothing. That was quite surprising given the service throughout the rest of the hotel. Anyhow, we had a great getaway in San Francisco!!

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely WORTH every cent! the very best hotel EVER!”
Reviews.Author: Psboston7
Reviews.Content: We made reservations for this hotel through priceline but I must say after our stay I think I will never stay at any OTHER hotel when I am in San Francisco. Being that my background is hospitality and hotels in particular, (used to work for and open Marriott Hotels, Starwoods, Sheratons and Forte) when I say this it the VERY BEST HOTEL that I have stayed in EVER that is saying a lot. Customer service was ABOVE AND BEYOND Fantastic. To clarify yes the valet is $45.00 (in line with city parking) however we parked at the Chinese Catholic Center on Jackson st & it was $24 not far from the hotel either. The location is close to Chinatown & North Beach, although it sits in the heart of the Financial District the cable car stop is right outside your door so really no need to rent a car unless you have to also the Front Desk sells all day muni passes for $11 which is a really good buy if you will be traveling the city it is good for the cable cars as well as the buses. The rooms are spacious, nicely appointed the amenities are luxurious, linens are DIVINE, housekeeping associates were friendly and consistently available. Room service was expensive but the late night menu was delicious and they even allowed us to order desserts from the regular menu (although it was pass the cut-off time) Front desk associates were attentive & VERY, VERY helpful (Carmen in particular) complimentary in room wireless internet, complimentary business center with internet access, do yourself a favor & do as a reviewer before me recommended & sign up for the omni hotel frequent guest program the check out is at 5:00pm & every morning they bring up complimentary newspapers and beverages of your choice they do this also in the evening with milk & cookies (although I think this was done becuase we traveled with teenagers) Saying all this I was very impressed with the Omni Hotel and think that perhaps there is hope for our Hospitality industry in the Customer Service department since the past 6 years I have seen a decline this hotel has renewed my inspiration for our Industry. WELL DONE! Respectfully Reviewed

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel that's just a little out of the way”
Reviews.Author: tdandmd
Reviews.Content: This is a great "smaller" hotel that is in the Financial District and therefore quite a bit quieter than the usual Union Square, Fisherman Wharf, etc. locations yet super close to all that and more. The hotel is a converted/refurbished old business building and you would expect it to be dark and cramped but the common areas were beautiful and the room was decent size and very clean and modern. The bathroom was nice with great soaps and things. The room also came with robes, a safe and umbrella. As I noted, after about 6:00 the Financial District is pretty much deserted, but you are only about two blocks from China Town, four blocks from Union Square (by way of some great shopping streets in and of themselves), a couple blocks from Fisherman's Wharf, a couple blocks to North Beach, a couple blocks to the Metreon, a couple blocks to the new Ferry Building. Plus, you have a great bar/restaurant right in your own hotel and the Carnelian Room (for the view) across the street in the Bank of America Building. And on top of all that, the cable car goes right by the front door so you can hop on and be on Nob Hill in no time without hiking up the hills yourself. The only negative that we have to say is that the parking was $45, which is just ridiculous. If we hadn't been so pressed for time when we arrived late, we would have parked it ourselves up the street at the St. Mary's garage for $20 (which is what you know the hotel is probably doing.) Of course, the good part was that we got this through Priceline (I had a good idea this was the hotel I was bidding on so I went for it) for $75 for a Saturday night at Christmas shopping time.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel in San Francisco”
Reviews.Author: SLOJJ
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just returned from a Saturday night stay at the Omni with our two year old and were extremely pleased with the hotel. We have stayed in several hotels in San Francisco and our room at the Omni was by far the largest. We used Priceline and got a rate of $80, then upgraded at check-in for another $25 to a very spacious room that worked well for the three of us. I was really surprised to get such a reasonable rate in the middle of the holiday season in the city. We followed the advice of a reviewer and skipped the $53 valet parking fee by parking one block up at the St. Mary's Square garage (on Kearney) for $6.50 for 24 hours. Hard to believe you can park anywhere in San Francisco for $6.50, but parking on the weekend in the Financial District was a great tip. The other tip we used was to enroll in Omni's preferred guest program on their website before we checked in. Not only did it get us complementary beverages and a paper in the morning, but it allowed us to check out anytime before 5 p.m. the next day. We were able to do some shopping (and eat dim sum in Chinatown) on Sunday morning, then return to our hotel room and let our toddler take a nap before leaving town. The staff were very friendly and gave our little one a welcome bag of goodies when we checked in, and we were pleased to see other children at the hotel, although the rooms were very quiet. The Omni is ideally located within walking distance of Chinatown, Union Square, and the Ferry Building. We'll definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “We had high expectations, and we were not disappointed”
Reviews.Author: TP1234
Reviews.Content: My family spent five nights at the Omni San Francisco during the Thanksgiving week, and we had a wonderful time. I have been in many hotels in San Francisco before but never at the Omni. Iâ€™ve heard great things about it from my colleagues and have read consistent, good reviews on the web. I decided to give a try for our family vacation, considering someone in the family is usually picky about hotels. The room was very clean and well equipped with everything, including bathrobes. The marble bathtub was sparkling and the bed was very comfy. The entire staff was very nice. The room was serviced twice a day, and a complimentary beverage was delivered in the morning - with our choice of beverages and delivery time. There were two computers in a small room at the hotel lobby for guests to use the Internet though the guest rooms also have free high-speed Internet. Overall, I had better experience at the Omni than I had in other 5 or 4-star hotels Iâ€™ve stayed in SF, thanks to its personalized service. All the good things you read from the reviews are true. Besides service, another reason we picked the Omni is its location. It is in the middle of everything and right on the cable car line. It is two blocks from Chinatown â€“ very convenient for getting fresh Chinese pastries in the mornings. A few advices if you decide to stay at the Omni: (1) Sign up for the Select Guest program before you make the reservation. You can read the benefits on omnihotels.com. (2) Take public transportation (BART/MUNI) instead of renting a car. If you have to rent a car, rent it in the city and try to return on the same day, since overnight parking can be pricy. I like the MUNI Passport (for 1, 3 or 7 days), it is convenient if you ride cable cars a lot (we had to do that to make our 3-yr-old happy). (3) The hotel is big on great guest services, not on impressive architecture (like the Atrium of the Hyatt Regency) or in-house amenities/activities (such as a swimming pool) which is not a problem since it is close to many attractions anyway. Want be treated well on your next SF trip? Try the Omni San Francisco.

Reviews.Title: “parking was outrageous”
Reviews.Author: janet_and_rex
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with a friend the weekend after Thanksgiving, in order to shop in the area. The rooms were very nice, and the Fitness room was very clean and modern. I also found the service to be top notch, very friendly and personable. However, the $53 a day fee to park your car was really obsene. I was pretty upset about it, and there really wasn't any place nearby to park your car yourself. This fee should have been told to us when we made our reservation, as it adds a hefty fee to your bill.

Reviews.Title: “A piece of heaven...”
Reviews.Author: RWHannaway
Reviews.Content: This is a classic beautiful hotel with a wonderful location near the base of Nob Hill. Step out the timeless entry and onto a cable car or take a walk in nearly any direction to find delicious restaurants. Less than a five minute walk to incredible dinning and shopping. The Hotel itself is fantastic with large luxurious rooms and truly impressive customer service. Each and every staff member down to the housekeepers was friendly, professional and fun. Within minutes we felt as though the Omni was our hotel and that we had stayed there many times (despite this being our first trip). Should anyone decide to take a trip to San Francisco and want a wonderful hotel to stay in, I give the Omni my highest recommendation possible!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Friendly Hotel”
Reviews.Author: ChucknJoany
Reviews.Content: Hi, Spent two nights at the Omni San Francisco at the start of our holiday (see Hilton Hawaiian Village, Waikiki(fab) and Holiday Inn Express, Hollywood (not so fab) reviews. Booked the holiday through Lastminute but ended up booking most of the components myself after reading the reviews of the hotels here on Tripadvisor they planned to book me into. The Omni was a top notch hotel, very elegant,comfortable, welcoming and fantastically friendly staff. They even arranged their driver to drive us to the airport in their limo when we asked for a taxi (paid the same as the taxi fare but were much more comfortable). The cable cars run outside so you can use them and tick it off of the list of things you must do there. We had a late flight and asked if they could store our cases so we could do a bit of shopping but they insisted that we keep our room on until it was time to go at no extra charge. Will Smith was filming outside the hotel for the three days we were there so that also made our visit a little special. We are from Glasgow so we are used to the cold but even to us hardy souls San Fran was bitterly cold, considering it was the middle of September. Unseasonably so by all accounts ten degrees lower than normal. So hap up well if you are planning a visit. Took in some tours using allsanfranciscotours couldn't fault them. Alcatraz was excellent especially using the audio tour. Wee funny here - I phoned home from 'the rock' and with the time difference missed my son who had gone to work but managed to wake my niece who in her sleepy state picked me up wrong and told her mother I was phoning from jail, big panic all round!!!

Reviews.Title: “Loved It!!”
Reviews.Author: Cubbies
Reviews.Content: This is simply one of the best City hotels we have ever stayed at. The location was superb right in the heart of the financial district and within walking distance of everything. The staff were courteous and friendly and the free internet access was a nice touch and always accessible. It was all the nice touches that made you want to stay night after night including the turndown service,mints and lovely bathroom products. This was our first stop as part of a west coast tour and it started off our vacation. We WILL definitely be staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel, excellent location”
Reviews.Author: beejerry
Reviews.Content: We spent our first night at the Omni and second at the Hyatt Regency. Omni is at all levels, including service, decor and location, beats the Hyatt. Room is small but adequate and the bathroom is luxurious. They even provide bathrobes and morning newspaper. Service are great, people working there always carry a smile. It is a couple of blocks from the Union Square and Chinatown. The only complaint was that guests across the hall was noisy! Would go back and stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Loved our stay at the Omni”
Reviews.Author: zuberry
Reviews.Content: My husband and I plus 12 year old daughter stayed for three nights at the Omni and had a lovely stay. The hotel is entrance is extremely impressive with lovely marble floors and lots of wood etc. The staff were very welcoming and extremely helpful with all our requests - Joey on the front desk was particuarly charming and remembered my name with no problem at all. Our room was extremely comfortable, at the end of a corridor with a welcoming note and fresh fruit and chocs left each night. Location is not bad either. Just over a block to walk into China town, Union Square 20 mins or so, and a good walk to Fisherman's Wharf - about 25 mins (this was no problem as we enjoy walking when we have the time!) Cable car does stop outside but we did not really try to catch as preferred to walk each day. Having tried to stay at the Argonaut down at Fisherman Wharf (fully booked and on seeing the hotel during our visit) I am really glad we chose to stay at the Omni. The hotel is extremely comfortable and offers a quiet and distinctly elegant stay. Whilst in San Fran we had an excellent meal in China Town at the Empress of China (recommended by the front desk) and also at the Stinking Rose (Garlic Restuarant) which I think was in Little Italy. Also breakfast at Mamas was well worth the queue outside. One tip is if you want to go to Alcratraz book on line prior to arriving in San Fran as this was totally booked up when we arrived which meant we could not go on the trip. Also had a fabulous tour with Mr Toad's tours in a 1920's wooden open bus and the trip over by Ferry to Solsalido was fab.

Reviews.Title: “Most enjoyable stay”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the hotel for four nights in early August, having made the booking based on the recommendations of this site. The hotel and staff were extremely welcoming, polite and efficient. Our room was of the highest standard in terms of furnishings, facilities and cleanliness - and quiet! The location was reasonably central for most attractions and was a short walk from Union Square and Chinatown - cable cars traverse the street in front of the hotel. We did not use the restaurant in the hotel as we prefer to eat outside for a broader experience and there were many eating and drinking establishments nearby to choose from. We hired a car for part of the stay and found a car park across the street at a reasonable rate. The local transport systems are also adjacent to the hotel and offer a good range of services. We thoroughly enjoyed our stay at this hotel and would have no hesitation in recommending it to other travellers.

Reviews.Title: “My home away from home when in San Francisco”
Reviews.Author: Highway1Star
Reviews.Content: The first time I walked into my room at the Omni with my family we all gasped because the place was so beautiful. The room was tastefully decorated, the beds were so comfortable and the bathroom was stunning. Plus we had nice views and we were right on the cable car line that runs up California Street to Nob Hill. The people at the front desk were nice. The lobby was elegant and inviting. Be warned that valet parking will set you back nearly sixty dollars a day so leave the car at home. I have returned to the Omni with my family and we all just love it. You are going to like this place.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Excellent service and beautiful rooms. Also enjoyed the fitness center.

Reviews.Title: “great location + Great rooms...”
Reviews.Author: neversummer
Reviews.Content: I was planning a 2 night stay in SF, and using tripadvisor...Omni turned out to be the best bang for the buck. So, i want to return the favor and put in my 2 cents since i was able to save a lot of $$$. First off, if you want to do a weekend getaway... I would suggest Sat, Sun and check out Mon..instead of Fri-Sun... the biggest money drain is the parking...$45/night...if you park at St. Mary's parking...it is $30/nite..M-F...but only $6.50 during weekends! So...by going on Sat, Sun..you save quite a bit. Ok..the good: Very nice, clean, and classy hotel...service and attitude were top notch...doormen were friendly and eager to help... ladies on the desk were knowledgable and efficient. The room is average size, but the bathroom was very classy. No motel quality here...the shower is tiled natural stone...(marble or granite)...sink was nice granite, and huge framed vanity mirror...fancy shower curtains and nice tiled floor. I hate cheap crappy plastic bathrooms... The bed was a double queen...it was pretty good as well...ive slept in better beds but this will do. Overall the room was very clean and well appointed. Signing up for the Omni select guest is worth it...you should do it well in advance so you get the additional coupons for upgrades and discounts. You must do this in advance to activate them... Location wise...it is very ideal...next to chinatown 2 blocks, 4 blocks to Union square and 4 blocks to Embarcadero center and 3 blocks to columbus ave bars.. china town is up the hill but if you can make it to st. mary's parking lot...you can make it to chinatown. Honestly though, I think getting a hotel by fishermans wharf wouldve been a better location...but then, you'd get a Motel quality place for a Hotel price tag... i chose the hotel...If you have a baby or kids... fisherman's wharf would be a better fit. But if you like bars..i think Omni would be great since Columbus ave bars is just next door...very cool place. Awesome chinese food (dimsum also) at Harbor village in the embarcadero. (order the nobleman's chicken $80..a day in advance. Its called Beggar's chicken in Hong Kong...absolutely amazing) RG lounge is also good chinese food that's walking distance... peking duck is good...but Harbor village takes all the awards. If you like steaks...and not afraid to drop $50+...Bob's chop house is awesome. I loooove steak... breakfasts/lunch is more reasonable.... but they have all the best cuts at night. Defintely worth going to. The BAD.. No swimming pool or spa... after walking up hills and blocks of concrete pavement... you'd want a spa to relax in. None. Bummer for kids. Hotel was sold out...so my select guest coupons and discounts were useless for upgrades...so call in advance. Parking is highway robbery.. they should have discounts for guests.. Overall... it is still a good experience. its no resort...its a business hotel, and maybe not a good pick if you have kids...but if you want a good place to sleep with your wife or girlfriend...close by to bars and great food. And without all the other complaints of moldy bathrooms, smelly beds, and crappy A/C... a nice respectable hotel like this is worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Pefect!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Omni on Aug 12-14. We were starting a ten day tour of the California coast and celebrating our five year anniversary. Our stay at the Omni was a perfect way to start this very special vacation! I had researched several B&Bs and hotels through Trip Advisor and decided on the Omni. We got our room for $135 for night one and $140 for night two - woo hoo! I had concerns of hearing outside noise in our room, the location being far away from things we'd want to see (we had never been to San Francisco), and the price of the mini bar. Here is what we found: We never heard any outside noise in our room. I am a very light sleeper, and no outside noise could be heard. The location was excellent! We could get to the Wharf in 20 minutes walking. The front desk will tell you how to avoid the hills. We only rode the cable cars once to say that we did it. We also rode the bus once to Haight Ashbury (Golden Gate Park) which was a very interesting trip. Our favorite section was the Italian District, lots of great places to eat and cool little bars! A very easy walk to/from the Omni. Don't hesitate to ask the front desk how to get places. They are very helpful! The Omni is located in the Financial District, so on the weekends the sidewalks aren't crowded. Finally, we never even opened the mini bar because of some of the reviews that we had read. There is a Trader Joe's close by where we purchased some wine and snacks. From reading a past review I joined (free) the Select Guest Program. This is a must! Just go to --- and fill out a quick form. We signed up just days before our trip. Because I signed up late, I emailed the Omni our guest number just to make sure that they had it on file. This is an unbelievable program - for free! All of our requests were granted! You'll have to go to the site to check this program out...and sign up! We had a perfect stay at the Omni and would return again!

Reviews.Title: “I left my heart at the Omni San Francisco!”
Reviews.Author: Paradegirl_nyc
Reviews.Content: We ended up at the Omni from a deal another travel site. WOW! 5-star service all the way. The hotel is beautiful and the service is definitely 5-star. We had a king room on the 14th floor and it was perfect! Beautiful marble bathroom with great toiletries. Compliementry robes and fluffy towels! The housekeeping staff leaves notes each day for you and provides turndown service each night with fresh towels (our favorite!). As a select guest, they offer complimentry morning beverages and a cheaper in-room bfast menu. We had cheeseburgers from room service one night and they were very fast and ver good. We had bfast one day in the restaurant - which is very expensieve (but so is the normal Omni rate, so we understood). The business center is free 24-hours a day in the looby. The front desk/conceirge is fantastic and helped us get around on the trolley, the cable car (which runs outside) and the even use their town car! They also booked us a city tour which was great! VERY HIGHLY Recommended!!

Reviews.Title: “Our new #1 choice in San Francisco”
Reviews.Author: thehups
Reviews.Content: We've been happy with Omni properties previously and with the "Phenomenal Fridays" rate that we got, couldn't pass up trying this one. Our biggest regret is that we didnâ€™t extend our weekend another day for more time here! From the time we arrived, the service was very personable and great. Check in took less than two minutes and upon arriving in our room, found a welcome note on the bed. The hotel was clean and even the smallest request was granted without asking. One example was when going out for our anniversary dinner, it was obvious we were dressed up for a special occasion. Instead of hailing us a cab as requested, he had a town car brought over to take us to dinner, complimentary. A very nice touch! My two recommendations to anyone staying here would be to sign up for "Select Guest" so at the very least you will bet a free juice and paper in the AM (and a big discount on a bagel/muffin). The other would be to verify your room size at check in. Traditionally, we have found corner rooms at the Omni to be of larger size so we try and request those. Here, it was an odd configuration (and a bit smaller) with part of a wall impeding the entry. Not a big deal since we probably only spent 4-5 hours in our room outside of sleeping but thought I would pass that along if. If you want a snack, there is a Subway across the street, a Mrs. Fields on the next block and a convenience store just around the corner. We bought drinks there and put them in the ice bucket; ready to drink when we got back from the day. They even added fresh ice when both when cleaning the room and at turndown. Location couldn't be better as we walked to Pier 39, Union Square and a very small hill (more of a grade) up to Grant Street and Chinatown. The bar was perfect for what we were looking for at the end of a long day, not a major party scene and not completely empty. We could carry on a conversation, hear the cable car as it went by and just enjoy the evening. Service was quick and the drinks were actually priced good for a hotel bar. Once again, very friendly and accommodating. I'll also have to second the Italian restaurant that the concierge recommended as it was perfect for a not too expensive dinner and was a walk of only 2-3 minutes. I'll also have to second the Italian restaurant that the concierge recommended as it was perfect for a not too expensive dinner and was a walk of only 2-3 minutes.
